name: Yoga for Fighters,  Dancers and Everybody
description_book: Yoga for all levels! Bring mat or towel for the floor & strap, scarf, or strip of cloth for class if you can; some loaner gear available.
description_web:
Yoga for all levels! Bring mat or towel for the floor & strap, scarf, or strip of cloth for class if you can; some loaner mats and straps will be available. If you have blocks, please bring them if you can! This class is geared for folks who have never done yoga through seasoned practitioners. Amendments for poses will be offered as we go, and each class will build upon the one before, however, anyone can jump in at anytime. 
Class will begin with a few minutes of breath work followed by approximately 45 minutes of yoga.

name: Yoga for Anyone and Everyone
description_book: All-level friendly, basic *vinyasa* class, open to complete beginners & seasoned yogis. Bring your own mat, towel & water, prepare to work and relax.

description_book: Yoga for all levels! Bring mat or towel for the floor & strap, scarf, or strip of cloth for class if you can; some loaner gear available.

Yoga for all levels! Bring mat or towel for the floor & strap, scarf, or strip of cloth for class if you can; some loaner mats and straps will be available. name: Archery Range Set-Up
description_book: Many hands make light work. Come out to help set up the Archery Range. You do **not** need to be a marshal to help; we welcome one and all.
description_web: Many hands make light work. Come out to help set up the Archery Range. You do **not** need to be a marshal to help; we welcome one and all. There will be an Orientation for Marshals and MITs after setup ends, weather permitting.

instructor: Aule og Amon Amarth The Wizard
name: Class Casanova
description_book: Designed to give you the tools necessary to develop the skill set to approach anyone in social settings, i.e., not come off as a creep. **18+**
description_web:
This class is designed to give you the tools necessary to develop the skill set to approach anyone in social settings. How to show the best version of yourself, conversation, pick up body language and how to handle social rejection with grace and still leave you in good standing. 
Along with the class will be a practical class participation to help ease your nervousness and help you find your confidence. 
About the instructor: The Wizard has taught several classes on social dynamics, testing the theory in practice across several countries and cultures. Knowledge is power and the more perspectives you have will only help. **Age limit 18+.**

name: Thrown Weapons Range Set-Up
description_book: Do you participate in thrown weapons? Come help us set up the range for all to enjoy!

name: The Wild Hunt
description_book: The Wild Hunt is a folk myth with many variations involving interaction between humans and a group of supernatural, other-world riders.
description_web: The Wild Hunt is a folk myth with many variations involving interaction between humans and a group of supernatural riders. Sometimes *fae*, sometimes dead, sometimes associated with leaders from Odin to Mother Holle. We'll explore many aspects of this phenomenon.
fee_itemization: optional $5 booklet

name: Paint the European Dance Floor
description_book: Come and help paint the European Dance Floor. Supplies are provided. Modern clothes are acceptable (you do not have to ruin garb)
description_web: Come and help paint the European Dance Floor. Supplies are provided. Modern clothes are acceptable (you do not have to ruin garb)  (actually 2 hours)

name: *Janissary* Music Class
description_book: Three traditional Ottoman marches will be taught for brass horns, reed *zurnas, davul* and *nakara* drums, cymbals, and voice.
description_web: Three traditional Ottoman marches will be taught for brass horns, reed *zurnas, davul* and *nakara* drums, cymbals, and voice. The songs to be taught are *Ceddin Deden, Genc Osman*, and *Hucum* march. Perfect for those who have marching band experience and want to make a big noise.

name: Known World Adventurers Guild: **Walk Day**
description_book: Teen explorers (and youth 10+) will gather information via supervised Pennsic site walks. All activities begin and end at Family Point. KWAGuild.com.
description_web:
**WANTED**: Teen adventurers (and youth 10+) with a thirst for exploration, cultural exchange, and making friends within the SCA. Guildmistress Marian of Heatherdale invites you to join KWAG (the Known World Adventurers Guild) here at Pennsic 50. Her noble company of young explorers will gather information through supervised in-person walks around the Pennsic site. Who knows who you'll meet... Visiting royalty? One of the SCA's Founders? Someone from the esteemed Cooper Family? Come and find out. KWAG activities run throughout both weeks, and alternate between KWAG Walk Days and KWAG Social Days. All activities begin and end at Family Point. Everyone is welcome! Please note: this is an active class. The group will be walking to various public locations on the Pennsic site (no private camps). All participants should wear sturdy shoes, a hat and sunscreen, and bring water. More info at KWAGuild.com.
     **INFO FOR PARENTS/CAREGIVERS:**  KWAG classes are designed for teens and older children (10+). All activities will be supervised by a warranted and background-checked youth officer plus at least one other responsible adult. All abilities are happily welcomed. Please email heather@heatherdale.com if we can help provide any special accommodations in advance. Parents and caregivers are very welcome to join the walks, and are encouraged to accompany their kids if any special needs might affect the child's enjoyment of the classes.

name: *Game of the Goose*
description_book: Period game in the style of *Chutes and Ladders*. Suitable for children, but also a popular tavern game for adults.
description_web: Period game in the style of *Chutes and Ladders*. The game is purely deterministic/dice-based so it is suitable for children. It was also known from its tavern version which required gambling and/or drinking. We will review the rules and then play through a game.

name: Archery Marshal and MIT Orientation
description_book: All Archery Marshals are required to attend **ONE** orientation meeting. This meeting is to explain Pennsic specific rules, the ranges, and scoring.
description_web: All Archery Marshals are required to attend **ONE** orientation meeting. This meeting is to explain Pennsic specific rules, the ranges, and scoring. You're welcome to bring MITs and attend as often as you want. We want you to learn the scoring system to make getting the totals faster, easier and more accurate.

name: African Coiled Pot
description_book: Over the course of two weeks we will make, decorate and fire a clay water jug.
description_web: Class meets once per day for the first week to work/check on the pots. The scheduled class will last 2 hours but the rest of the classes will last an hour or less depending on what the student wants/needs to do to their pot. Each student is given a piece of clay and taught how to coil it into a pot. Thursday of Week Two (8/10) a bonfire will be made and maintained until the firing of the pots is complete Those who have made a pot are expected to bring their pot to the fire at 9 am-10 am. **POTS NOT BROUGHT TO THE FIRE WILL NOT BE FIRED.** Please expect to spend 45 minutes sometime during the day to tend the fire, but you **DO NOT** have to spend the whole day. Pots **SHOULD** be ready by noon 8/11.
fee_itemization: 5 for clay

name: Period Card Games: *Tarot*
description_book: Learn to play an old trick taking card game using the 78-card *tarot* deck.

name: Early Medieval Glassblowing Demo (Furnace Glass)
description_book: A fully narrated, live, 2000-degree glassblowing demonstration! Learn about the materials, the techniques, and how glass usage changed over time!
description_web: Come and watch a fully narrated, live, 2000-degree glassblowing demonstration! See how we can take this fascinating material and turn it into a never-ending variety of items! Learn about the materials we use, and how glass making techniques, its uses, and value varied throughout time and culture! For this demo, see items from the 5th -11th centuries from Europe and the Middle East! Family-friendly, all ages welcome, open Q&A to follow.

name: Palmistry
description_book: Palmistry was practiced throughout period. You can learn to read palms well enough in one hour to start immediately.
description_web: From the Egyptians throughout SCA period, palm reading has been practiced in most cultures. Although years of study add more details, you can quickly learn enough of the basic skills to read (well enough that you'll probably be mobbed with requests). We'll cover a bit of history, but mostly this is "hands-on" learning about hand reading.
fee_itemization: handout optional, free further reading sheet

location: Denys the Decadent's Camo  (EO7 off great Eastern Hiughway, Look for 12 Steppe Sign)
name: 12-Step Meeting
description_book: An open meeting for those in recovery or any 12-step programs.
description_web: A daily 12-step meeting I hold in my Camp E07 off Great Eastern Highway. Look for the sign. Held at 4:00 PM, **OPEN MEETING .** Holding a meeting here since 1997.

name: Italian Renaissance Glass Demo (Furnace Glass)
description_book: A fully narrated, live, 2000-degree glassblowing demonstration! Learn about the materials, the techniques, and how glass usage changed over time!
description_web: Come and watch a fully narrated, live, 2000-degree glassblowing demonstration! See how we can take this fascinating material and turn it into a never-ending variety of items! Learn about the materials we use, and how glass making techniques, its uses, and value varied throughout time and culture! For this demo see items from the 14th-16th centuries in the Italian style! Family-friendly, all ages welcome, open Q&A to follow.

name: Ukrainian Folk Song Workshop
description_book: Learn to sing four Ukrainian folk songs, including lyrics, pronunciation, melodies, and harmonies. No knowledge of Ukrainian is necessary.
description_web: The instructor will teach up to four Ukrainian folk songs, depending on how quickly things progress. You will learn the pronunciation and translation of the lyrics, the melodies, and the harmonies. The intention is to be able to perform these songs at Pennsic. No knowledge of Ukrainian is necessary. Hard copies of lyrics will be available at no charge.

name: How to Write for The Pennsic Independent
description_book: How you can create content for publication in Pennsic’s newspaper!
description_web:
The Pennsic Independent is the recorded history of the War. That history depends upon reporters, photographers, and anyone who has a story to tell. 
This class will teach you the basics of writing for PI. It will include an overview of staff reporting, how to submit unsolicited stories, submitting stories and other material for the Web Edition, and so much more!
Discover the benefits of being a part of your favorite daily newspaper!

name: Yoga for Anyone and Everyone
description_book: All-level friendly, basic *vinyasa* class, open to complete beginners & seasoned yogis. Bring your own mat, towel & water, prepare to work and relax.

name: Bedtime Stories for Children
description_book: Nightly telling of stories for children. This year's theme will be The Brothers Grimm!
description_web: Stories and fables for children, 7 pm nightly. This year's theme will be The Brothers Grimm. All are welcome to attend; children must have adult escort.

instructor: Aule og Amon Amarth The Wizard
name: The Virgin Mixer
description_book: Church of Debauchery presents social mixer for new people to the event and veterans. With drinks focused around mixers, mocktails and virgin drinks.
description_web: A social mixer for new people to the event and veterans. With drinks focused around mixers, mocktails and virgin drinks. If you want the alcoholic versions of these drinks, come to The Next Degeneration.

name: Intermediate Archery Class
description_book: Designed to improve your skills beyond basic archery. Class will concentrate on range shoots and War Point shooting.
description_web: Archers must bring their own equipment to the range.
fee_itemization: None

name: Yoga for Fighters,  Dancers and Everybody
description_book: Yoga for all levels! Bring mat or towel for the floor & strap, scarf, or strip of cloth for class if you can; some loaner gear available.
description_web:
Yoga for all levels! Bring mat or towel for the floor & strap, scarf, or strip of cloth for class if you can; some loaner mats and straps will be available. If you have blocks, please bring them if you can! This class is geared for folks who have never done yoga through seasoned practitioners. Amendments for poses will be offered as we go, and each class will build upon the one before, however, anyone can jump in at anytime. 
Class will begin with a few minutes of breath work followed by approximately 45 minutes of yoga.

name: Coffee with Friends of Bill and Dr Bob
description_book: Open agnostic 12-Step meetings.
description_web: Open agnostic 12-Step meetings. From 8:00 am-9:00 am.

name: *Études* 2 and 3 for Single Sword (Fencing)
description_book: These drill sequences will focus on form, balance, movement, and coordination. For beginners, intermediates, and teachers alike.
description_web: For beginner and intermediate fencers and those who teach them. These drills will focus on form, balance, movement and coordination. *Étude* 2 is thrust centric. *Étude* 2 adds diversity of cuts. Emphasis will be on learning the *études* for home drill, as well as taking elements out of the drill for more focused work in groups.

name: Goldleafing Made Easy
description_book: Learn how to gold leaf the simple way, using leaf and garlic! You get booklet, 1 sheet gold leaf; other supplies are provided.
description_web: Learn how to gold leaf, using the "period" simple way by using leaf and garlic! You get a booklet, 1 sheet of gold leaf; other supplies are provided.
fee_itemization:
Printed how to booklet: $13.00
Gold leaf sheet: $2.00
other supplies: $1.00

name: Beginning Hand-Stitching
description_book: Learn 5 basic hand-stitch methods for a truly period look in garb.
description_web: Sewing is an ancient skill. While we have electric-powered sewing machines, there are some of us who want to experience the methods used by past sewers in the making of our garb. There are five basic stitches that, when used, will make a period gown shine above the rest.
fee_itemization: Bag, thread, needle threader, needles, bees wax.

name: Baltic Weaving Basics
description_book: Baltic weaving technique on an inkle loom or weaving frame. Bring your loom or frame.
description_web:
Bring your loom or frame. Baltic Weaving or Pick-up style is generally referred to as Northern Europe, Baltic region, Eastern Europe, and Ural Mountains region types of bands/cloths with geometric patterns, where, for the pattern, there were thicker threads used than for the base. According to the research of fellow weavers, belts, and trims completed in the same technique were found in South America (Chile). 

I will be showing you how to use your inkle loom of weaving board to make your own trim in this style.
fee_itemization: n/a

name: Modern Gaming: Peace Week
description_book: A place, with power, to play modern games from 9 am to 10:30 pm every day.

name: Safely Foraging Local Mushrooms
description_book: Wild mushroom foraging is sexy these days. Gastrointestinal distress is not. Learn from a Pennsylvania-approved mushroomer how to stay safe! **18+.**
description_web: I will give you the tools you need to forage safely. We will discuss about 10 beginner mushrooms that grow locally. The last half hour of class will include a wild mushroom petting zoo. Mostly dried samples, unless the weather gods are good to us. **Absolutely no one may attend under the age of 18. Not even with parent.**
fee_itemization:
Alys: In descrip, deleted "Come" to add in age limit.
Alys: It's back. In WD, bold type for age.

name: Welcome to War Craft Time
description_book: Family Point is open for a variety of crafts in our first session of War! Decorate your medallion, string some Viking beads, and meet new friends.

name: Intro to "Medieval-Like" Woodworking, Part A
description_book: Intro to woodworking with only hand tools. Includes modern SOPs and safe practices for building medieval-style furniture. **Age limit. See web.**
description_web: **THIS CLASS IS 2 HALF DAYS**, Tuesday and Wednesday; an overview of hand woodwork, with an opportunity to try things out. We will start on Tuesday morning with a chunk of a log and by noon we should have some boards or other furniture parts using wedges, axes, froes, drawknives, spokeshaves, and wood planes. On Wednesday we will look at making joints, boring, and maybe a bit of carving. Covers saws, chisels, and planes. Extensive instructions on the selection, use and maintenance of all these tools will be covered. The class will be taught both first week and again second week. Students who cannot attend the whole class are encouraged to drop in or out at their convenience. **Youths may attend if accompanied by a parent.**

location: The Camp of the Three Bears (N17 along Battle Road)
name: Building a Camp Bread Oven
description_book: Join us in building our camp's beehive bread oven.
description_web: A hands-on lesson in one method of constructing a temporary beehive bread oven, one that's been built at Pennsic for two decades.

name: Thrown Weapons Range Set-Up
description_book: Do you participate in thrown weapons? Come help us set up the range for all to enjoy!

name: *Qigong* and *Taiji* Flow
description_book: *Qigong* exercises have been used for health and well-being in China for many centuries. Come and wake up with some morning movement.
description_web: *Qigong* and *Tai Chi* exercises have been used for health and well-being in China for many centuries. This class will include many ancient moves that will help you get ready for your day at Pennsic, whether it’s going to war, performing, shopping, or just relaxing in camp. This is a follow-along *Qigong*-style set to music. No experience or special abilities required; just come and enjoy the movement.

name: Paint the European Dance Floor
description_book: Come and help paint the European Dance Floor. Supplies are provided. Modern clothes are acceptable (you do not have to ruin garb)
description_web: Come and help paint the European Dance Floor. Supplies are provided. Modern clothes are acceptable (you do not have to ruin garb)  (actually 2 hours)

location: East Kingdom Royal (E06, corner of Low Road and Berwick Road, a block south of troll.)
name: East Kingdom Royal Set-up
description_book: Setting up the East Kingdom Royal camp. Come meet people from other parts of the kingdom as we create a common space for the entire kingdom.
description_web: Setting up the East Kingdom Royal camp. Come meet people from other parts of the kingdom as we create a common space for the entire kingdom. Gloves or a mallet can be useful for the sheet wall crew.

name: Instrumental Music in 15th-Century Florence
description_book: A survey and discussion of instrumental music in a 15th-century *chansonnier* from Florence.
description_web: A survey and discussion of the musical culture that led to the instrumental music in a 15th-century *chansonnier* from Florence. A discussion of sources and composers.
fee_itemization: $2 fee for handout with bibliography,  20 handouts available. $10 for copy of paper.

name: *Janissary* Music Class
description_book: Three traditional Ottoman marches will be taught for brass horns, reed *zurnas, davul* and *nakara* drums, cymbals, and voice.
description_web: Three traditional Ottoman marches will be taught for brass horns, reed *zurnas, davul* and *nakara* drums, cymbals, and voice. The songs to be taught are *Ceddin Deden, Genc Osman*, and *Hucum* march. Perfect for those who have marching band experience and want to make a big noise.

name: Weed Walk
description_book: Wild plant identification. Wear walking shoes and hat; leave from Univ. Point. Different teachers on different days; walk with us more than once!
description_web: Cooper's Lake abounds with medicinal and food plants that were used by various primitive and medieval cultures. Learn to identify them during a walk around the campsite. The walk will take place rain or shine. Please wear sturdy shoes and a hat. Meet at University Point for the start of the class. We have multiple teachers, so if you attend more than one walk, you will likely learn different things!

name: Known World Adventurers Guild: **Social Day**
description_book: Informal meetup for teen explorers (and youth 10+). Social Days alternate with Walk Days (see separate class info) - KWAGuild.com
description_web: All teens (and youth 10+) are welcome at these informal meetups for the Known World Adventurers Guild. Our Social Days alternate with KWAG Walk Days. See separate class info.

name: Very Basic Illumination
description_book: Practice the art of illumination and learn some basic techniques.

name: Shooting a Crossbow: Archery
description_book: Come learn about shooting a crossbow.
description_web: Come learn about shooting a crossbow at the Archery Field.

name: Ancient to Early Medieval Decorative Stitching
description_book: Ancient to early medieval basic decorative stitches and how they can be used on clothing: an overview of global decorative stitch techniques.
description_web: An overview of global decorative stitch techniques from the 6th century BCE through the 12th century CE. The class covers historical examples available, materials used, stitch techniques, and design elements. Hands-on practice will be available for those unfamiliar with basic embroidery stitches. PDF of handout can be sent to attendees as needed.
fee_itemization: Full-color handout

name: Short Veils and Square Chitons: Carthaginian Dress
description_book: A concise overview of Punic dress and dress accessories. Includes patterns/ instructions, and information on fibers, weaves, dyes, and stitches.
description_web: A concise overview of Punic dress and dress accessories. Includes patterns, instructions, and information on fibers, weaves, dyes, and stitches. Handouts will also be available online.

name: Pit and Stone Games
description_book: Pit and Stone games are an ancient family of games that includes *mancala*. We will learn several variations, including *Wari*, and play some games.
description_web: Pit and Stone games are an ancient family of games that includes *mancala*. They are played by moving stones (or sowing seeds) into pits with a goal of capturing the most stones (or seeds). These games have been played since at least 1000 BC, and there are hundreds of both traditional and modern versions. We will learn several variations, including *Wari*, and we'll play some games.

name: Arabic Hip Movements
description_book: A study of various shimmies, slides and circles from a Syrian Classic Oriental dance perspective. A beginning knowledge of ME Dance is appreciated.
description_web: A study of various shimmies, slides and circles from a Syrian Classic Oriental dance perspective, taught by Baroness Simone. A beginning knowledge of Middle Eastern dance is appreciated.

name: Chinese Diapering: Carved Lacquer of Ming Dynasty
description_book: You'll never lack for scroll ideas when you take inspiration from Ming Dynasty lacquer! Learn how in this hands-on scribal class.

name: Conversational American Sign Language: Beginner
description_book: Learn some common words and conversational phrases in American Sign Language. You do not need to know ASL to take this class.
description_web: Learn some common words and conversational phrases in American Sign Language. You do not need to know ASL to take this class.

name: Henry VIII: Victim or Tyrant?
description_book: Was Henry VIII a victim of genetics, circumstance, and repetitive injury, or simply a tyrant? Let's discuss.

name: Pilgrimage History and Songs
description_book: An overview of the practice of pilgrimage in history and the vocal music that came about to accompany it.
description_web: An overview of the practice of pilgrimage in history and the extant vocal music that came about to accompany it. We will specifically look at the *Llibre Vermell de Montserrat* and the *Cantigas de Santa Maria*, and themes throughout the *Cantigas*.

name: The Assassin Pennsic Game Get-Together
description_book: Are you playing in the Assassins Game? We would like all players to meet up with the Referee and go through all the rules and concepts of the game.
description_web: Are you playing in the Assassins Game? The Chartered Assassins Guilds of the East and Æthelmearc would like to meet up with the people participating and go through all the rules and concepts of the game during either of two scheduled times during the first week. On August 10th, we'll have a check-in just in case anyone has any complaints, suggestions, or wants to ask questions about where things were.

name: Beginner 15th-Century English Dances
description_book: Different versions of the fun 15th-C English dances *Oringe* & *Grene Gynger*. All footwork taught; suited for all levels!
description_web: Different versions of the fun 15th-century English dances *Oringe* & *Grene Gynger*. All footwork taught; suited for all levels!

name: Cloudwork: Lacquer Deco. of the W. Han Dynasty
description_book: A Han-ds on exploration of Han Dynasty decorative motifs and their practical application to SCA scrolls.

name: The Pennsic Mightier: Improv Workshop
description_book: Improv workshop for experienced performers: address higher level improv skills, create character, build scenes leading to a performance. **Age limit**
description_web: This improv workshop is designed to address intermediate and advanced level improv skills focused on creating unique characters, building relationships, committing to a scene, and exploring long-form improv. Long-form improv is a building block for work in *commedia* and sketch comedy. The character and scene work will improve your overall acting skills as well as building confidence in everyday life. This workshop will culminate in a performance on Friday 8/5 in the Performing Arts Tent; however, the performance is optional if you would prefer to attend the workshops without performing live. You must have prior improv experience (modern experience or prior Pennsic classes, etc.) and be familiar with the basics of “Yes, and” to participate in this class. Those without experience may be allowed at the instructor’s discretion. You do not have to attend every workshop; however, different skills will be addressed each day and attendance at all is beneficial. The Friday workshop is mandatory if you would like to perform in the show. **This class is for ages 18 and up; however, younger students may be allowed with both parental and instructor permission.** Please attend the first workshop (with a parent, for those under 18) or contact the instructor in advance to participate.

name: Archaeology of Caesarea: Crusaders and Templars
description_book: Archaeologists have uncovered Crusader features plus artifacts along the coast of the Mediterranean. See a face reconstructed by Jen Clark.
description_web: Archaeologists have uncovered features (gates, towers, walls, burials, etc.) and artifacts (coins, pottery, lamps, etc.) left by the Crusaders along the coast of the Mediterranean. See a face of a burial that may have been a Templar Knight reconstructed by Jen Clark (Baroness Amani Ahmad ibn Masha’al al-Sabti al-Dulaymi). Some historical discussion, but more archaeology.
fee_itemization: photocopy handout of artifact drawings

name: The *Hortus Conclusus*
description_book: The *Hortus Conclusus*: the medieval walled garden in art and allegory.
fee_itemization: Color copying

name: Beaded Flowers 1: Rose
description_book: Make a miniature rose in the style of beaded flowers of 16th-century Venice. If you have needle-nose pliers/wire cutters, bring them to class.
description_web: Make a miniature rose in the style of beaded flowers of 16th-century Venice. If you have needle-nosed pliers/wire cutters, please bring them to class. Not recommended for youth.
fee_itemization: beads, wire, yarn

name: The Pilgrimage Project
description_book: Learn the songs of our Pennsic Pilgrimage! Open to all! Take up your staff and join us. Music provided.
description_web: For lo, these many years at Pennsic we have gone on Pilgrimage one afternoon of War Week, singing songs from the *Llibre Vermell de Montserrat* and the *Cantigas de Santa Maria*. Come learn the songs and consider joining us this year! All are welcome! Music provided. Pilgrimage will happen on the Tuesday afternoon of War Week; meeting at University Point, time TBD.

name: Early Islamic-Influenced Beauty
description_book: The beauty standards within the pre-1650 Islamic-ruled world; including cosmetics, hygiene, and haircare. **Age 18+.**
description_web: This class will explore the beauty standards within the pre-1650 Islamic-ruled world, specifically with a focus on cosmetics, hygiene, and haircare. Reviewing beauty standards from the late 7th- to the mid-17th century over a wide-geographical area, we see patterns emerge. In addition to learning similarities in beauty standards, we will discuss how women engaged with both personal hygiene and beautification. We will also explore specific formulas for beauty products, their desired results, and potential consequences associated with their prolonged use. Instructor will bring samples of both foundation and eye makeup for students to test. **Age 18+.**

name: Seed Beads: Hair Nets and Necklaces with Netting
description_book: Hair nets and necklaces with a netting technique from the seed beads.
description_web:
Do you know what's amazing? Collars. And hairnets, bracelets, and clothes decorations. Do you know what is even better? This an easy technique that will help you to do it all yourselves! I will teach you how to make period pieces so that you can introduce your garb. Any level is welcome! The class will be recorded (using my own camera). Please, bring your own material and tools if you want (then the class is free). The material (tools will be provided for a class as well) will be available for a fee charge.

No children (small material and sharp small needles can damage their digestive system).
fee_itemization: seed beads 10/0, 11/0 in different colors, thread, needle, pearls

name: A Flirty Foursome: *Legiadra*
description_book: This elegant dance for four allows lots of opportunities to interact with both your partner and your opposite! Intermediate/advanced.

name: Secret Codes and Hidden Messages
description_book: Have you ever wanted to send a secret message to a friend? Learn about secret codes and hidden messages that were used in medieval times.
description_web: Students will learn how to code and de-code secret messages using various encryption tools like Caesar's ciphers and *scytales* (wrapping the message around a rod). Students will make and can keep their own decoding tools.

name: *Origami* for Experienced Beginners
description_book: Make a couple of creations to learn the folds needed to make a Wings of Fire Dragon. Warning: dragons are hard and require patience but are doable.
description_web: We will make a couple of creations to learn the folds needed to make a Wings of Fire Dragon. Warning: dragons are hard and require patience but definitely doable. Class for youth taught by youth.

name: "Viking Chess" and Other *Tafl* Games
description_book: Learn the history and play of *Tafl* games.
description_web: *Tafl* games were a popular family of board games across Northern Europe through the Viking age. In this class I will discuss the history of *Tafl* games, some notable finds involving probable *tafl* sets, and teach you the basic rules of play.

name: Late Medieval Glassblowing Demo (Furnace Glass)
description_book: A fully narrated, live, 2000-degree glassblowing demonstration! Learn about the materials, the techniques, and how glass usage changed over time!
description_web: Come and watch a fully narrated, live, 2000-degree glassblowing demonstration! See how we can take this fascinating material and turn it into a never-ending variety of items! Learn about the materials we use, and how glass making techniques, its uses, and value varied throughout time and culture! For this demo you'll see items from Europe to the Middle East from the 11th - 14th centuries! Family-friendly, all ages welcome, open Q&A to follow.

name: Owain Phyfe's Music: The Songs that Inspired Him
description_book: Sing and play some of the music that inspired Owain Phyfe. Instrumentalists and vocalists welcome.
description_web: Owain Phyfe was a well-known Pennsic performer, and he roamed the country entertaining at many Renaissance Festivals. He would find medieval and Renaissance songs and make them his own. In this class we will discover the originals (or as best we can find them) that inspired his performances. We will listen to some recordings and sight read some of the songs. Bring your voice and/or instruments and your mug for toasting!
fee_itemization: Printed Music

location: the old Cafe Marhaba location or what ever coffee shop is taking that place (South-West of the Pennsic Market store. (Coffee shop that is South West of the Food Court Near Barn)
name: Pre-16th-Century Musical Modal Improvisation
description_book: This is a practical application class for musicians to learn improvisational skills that were practiced in the Middle Ages. **College level.**
description_web: Musician class for acoustic instruments to learn medieval modal improvisation that will teach the student to create melodies on the spot for both free form and structured rhythmic forms. Students are required to be very familiar with their instruments. Reading music is not required but really helps, especially your major and natural minor scales. **College level.**

name: Getting Started in Scribal: Nothing to Fear
description_book: A class oriented to all those that have not started working on award scrolls out of fear, stress or any other reason. Fear not, it can be done.
description_web: A class oriented to all those that have not started working on award scrolls out of fear, stress or any other reason. Fear not, it can be done.

name: Archaeology of the Vikings
description_book: Discussion of history and archaeology of the Vikings.
description_web: Viking Long Ships... of course, but what about all of the other arts and crafts (metal, textile, bone carving, etc.)? Plus, a debate on when did the Viking Age end. Get the perspective of a professional archaeologist who has seen lots!
fee_itemization: fee covers photocopies of Viking artifacts.

name: *Romani*: An Introduction to "Gypsy" Persona
description_book: Want a *Romani* persona, but don't know how/where to start? Learn about the *Rom*, their history, and the fun of this fascinating persona.
description_web: Want a *Romani* persona, but don't know how/where to start? Learn about the *Rom*, their history, common pitfalls, and the fun of this fascinating persona. We will be covering their history, migration routes, clothing, and how to portray this persona within the SCA.

name: Newcomers 101
description_book: Titles and customs across the Known World. Camping and what to bring with you to events. How to get along in the SCA.
description_web: Handouts showing the common titles and responsibilities. Discussion about all things SCA. Camping, names, bylaws about bullying. Anything they want to know that I can answer or direct them to another person or class.

location: Atlantian Royal (Fiber Arts Pavilion) (N40, front edge of the Atlantian Royal Encampment, in the Artisans Easement)
name: Retting Flax at Pennsic
description_book: We will be putting a bundle of flax to rett in the creek near the Fiber Arts Pavilion.
description_web: Flax is one of the oldest fibers used by man to create thread for weaving, but how do they get the fibers *out* of the flax plants? Retting is the term used for the process of "rotting" the plant fiber enough to release the bast fibers within the plants so they can be separated from the other plant material and used for spinning and weaving. We will be putting a bundle of flax to rett in the creek near the Fiber Arts Pavilion.

name: Beginner English Country Dance by the Numbers
description_book: We will go through the basics of English Country Dance and learn dances based on the number of participants.
description_web: We will go through the basics of English Country Dance and learn dances based on the number of participants (multiples of 4: *Hearts Ease* and *Rufty Tufty*; multiples of 6: *Black Nag, Upon a Summer's Day*). Can also teach a variant of *Jenny Pluck Pears* that works for 6+.

name: Build Your Own Catapult and Target
description_book: Use various provided materials to construct your own model catapult and target, and test how well your model will launch cotton balls.
description_web: Have you ever wanted to build your own catapult? Observe and discuss the function of different models of catapults, then use various materials (straws, spoons, Popsicle sticks, rubber bands, tape, cups, etc.) to construct your own catapult and target, and finally test the distance your catapult will launch cotton balls. You can keep your catapult and target!

name: Reading Notarial Latin Documents
description_book: Learn about the ways everyday scribes wrote Latin (in all its messy abbreviated glory) and practice reading sample medieval documents in class!
description_web:
We all know the intricate and beautiful work of the Scribes in their scrolls evoking the glorious illuminated manuscripts of the Middle Ages. But those documents were extremely expensive to produce, and very few medieval people read or even saw them. This class will teach about the everyday medieval documents of the notaries, about the culture surrounding this form of writing, and about the techniques they used in writing so that they could save space and time. We will learn some of the most common abbreviation techniques and practice on several 13th/14th-century notarial documents from the Crown of Aragon. 
Those with a working knowledge of the Latin language will benefit the most from this workshop, but anyone interested in scribal notation is welcome!

name: Make Your Own Medallion Cord
description_book: Why wear a plain white string? Learn *Slung*, cord-making described as juggling with strings! Children welcome with adult. OK to be late.
description_web: Why wear a plain white string? Learn *Slung*, a method for cord-making that can best be described as juggling with strings! Children welcome with adult. *Slung* is also known as Viking whip-cording. It is not only useful but a lot of fun for all ages. Can be done as a children's activity or at demos. Bring a friend! People will be taking turns on a limited number of set-ups. Showing up late is perfectly fine.

name: Cheese Making 101
description_book: Learn the basics of cheesemaking using historic techniques with guaranteed results. Use milk from any grocery store. Can be made lactose-free!
description_web: Learn how to make cheese from a historic recipe with readily available grocery store milk. This cheese can be made in under an hour to produce a soft, spreadable cheese, similar to ricotta. Lactose-free cow's milk can be used to make this lactose-free cheese! The resulting cheese can be used in a variety of recipes, both sweet and savory!
fee_itemization: request $1.00 for printed recipe

name: Early Medieval Nubia
description_book: Survey of the culture of pre-1000 Nubian kingdoms of East Africa. They had strong ties to the Byzantines and were a major trade route for spices.
description_web: This survey class covers many aspects of Nubian culture before the year 1000 C.E. The artifacts of this fascinating culture were largely lost with the building of the Aswan dam. However, between 400-1000 the Nubian Kingdoms were a major trade route and had treaties with the Byzantines and the Muslim countries to their north. They were not finally conquered until the middle of the 15th century.

name: So You Want to Be an Apothecary in the SCA
description_book: How to develop an apothecary character, including accoutrements, A&S project ideas, and other suggestions.

location: Atlantian Royal Encampment (Block N40, Fibre Arts Pavilion)
name: Weavers' Meet-and-Greet
description_book: Social get together and inspiration session for weavers of historical fabric.
description_web: A social get-together for weavers of historical fabrics. Do you use a floor loom, jack, counterbalance, countermarch or rigid heddle loom to create historical, or inspired fabric? Bring your samples and a beverage and we'll do a show-and -tell, share tips and tricks and get inspired together to see what sort of cloth we can create at home. Trade hints and get your questions answered by others who have gone through many of the same problems!

name: Beginner Dance: Burgundian
description_book: Come learn slow, simple and elegant dances from the Court of the Dukes of Burgundy! Beginners welcome, all ages welcome.
description_web: Come learn slow, simple and elegant dances from the Court of the Dukes of Burgundy! Beginners welcome, all ages welcome. We will be doing *Danse de Cleves* and *Franchoise Nouvelle*.

location: Denys the Decadent's Camo  (EO7 off great Eastern Hiughway, Look for 12 Steppe Sign)
name: 12-Step Meeting
description_book: An open meeting for those in recovery or any 12-step programs.
description_web: A daily 12-step meeting I hold in my Camp E07 off Great Eastern Highway. Look for the sign. Held at 4:00 PM, **OPEN MEETING .** Holding a meeting here since 1997.

name: Scroll Painting for the Very Young
description_book: We have scroll blanks and water colors! You have a 2- to 7-year-old who wants to paint! Let's combine them, and everyone will win.

name: Domos Draconum (DnD): In Search of the Unknown
description_book: Vintage 1970s Dungeons & Dragons adventure for ages 10+. No experience necessary. Limit: 8

name: *Alquerques*
description_book: A checkers-style period game from the Middle East. We will review the rules and then play through some games to learn the basic strategies.
description_web: A checkers-style period game from the Middle East. We will review the rules and then play through some games to learn the basic strategies.

name: German Renaissance Glass Demo (Furnace Glass)
description_book: A fully narrated, live, 2000-degree glassblowing demonstration! Learn about the materials, the techniques, and how glass usage changed over time!
description_web: Come and watch a fully narrated, live, 2000-degree glassblowing demonstration! See how we can take this fascinating material and turn it into a never-ending variety of items! Learn about the materials we use, and how glass making techniques, its uses, and value varied throughout time and culture! For this demo, see items from the 14th -16th centuries in the Dutch German style! Family-friendly, all ages welcome, open Q&A to follow.

name: Very Basic Belly Dancing
description_book: We will be working on the very basics of belly dancing, no previous experience needed.

name: Period Card Games: *Laugh and Lie Down*
description_book: Do you like to play cards? Come learn to play this simple late-period card game.
description_web: Looking for something to pass the time at events? Do you like to play cards? Come learn to play this simple late-period card game.

name: Yoga for Anyone and Everyone
description_book: All-level friendly, basic *vinyasa* class, open to complete beginners & seasoned yogis. Bring your own mat, towel & water, prepare to work and relax.

name: Pennsic Glass Challenge
description_book:
Looking for beadmaking enthusiasts of all skill levels! Each session will have a different surprise challenge!
Visit tinyurl.com/glassapprentice.
description_web:
Looking for beadmaking enthusiasts of all skill levels! If you can work at a beadmaking torch, safely, without direct supervision, join us! 
This is a fun challenge meant to push individuals along their own learning paths, to try something new and find new horizons in their creativity and technical skill. This is **not** a competition.
Back again, by popular demand at Pennsic 50!

Visit tinyurl.com/glassapprentice for more information.
fee_itemization: All equipment, materials, and tools will be provided for each daily challenge. If you have your own favourite glass-rated safety glasses (didymium), please bring them along.

name: Bedtime Stories for Children
description_book: Nightly telling of stories for children. This year's theme will be The Brothers Grimm!
description_web: Stories and fables for children, 7 pm nightly. This year's theme will be The Brothers Grimm. All are welcome to attend; children must have adult escort.

name: Anglo-Saxon Magick
description_book: Covers the spells, chants, amulets, runes, and other techniques used by Anglo-Saxons as they changed over the six centuries of AS England.
description_web: The Anglo-Saxons used spells, chants, amulets, runes, and other sorts of magickal techniques well after they were nominally converted to Christianity. This workshop gives an overview of the material that has survived, as what was acceptable changed from year to year and place to place in the first millennium as well as in the second.

name: Intermediate Target Archery
description_book: Focus is on teaching TA skills with specific emphasis on clout, speed, and overall TA competency.
description_web: Focus is on those skills required of a target archer to improve within the SCA environment. In addition to those SCA unique skills, form and overall archery skills will be addressed as well as how to continue improving throughout an archer's career. Archers must bring their own equipment.

name: Intermediate Target Archery
description_book: The focus is on teaching TA skills with specific emphasis on clout, speed, and overall TA competency.
description_web: This class will focus on those skills required of a target archer to improve within the SCA environment. In addition to those SCA unique skills, form and overall archery skills will be addressed as well as how to continue improving throughout an archer's career. Archers must bring their own equipment.

name: Yoga for Fighters,  Dancers and Everybody
description_book: Yoga for all levels! Bring mat or towel for the floor & strap, scarf, or strip of cloth for class if you can; some loaner gear available.
description_web:
Yoga for all levels! Bring mat or towel for the floor & strap, scarf, or strip of cloth for class if you can; some loaner mats and straps will be available. If you have blocks, please bring them if you can! This class is geared for folks who have never done yoga through seasoned practitioners. Amendments for poses will be offered as we go, and each class will build upon the one before, however, anyone can jump in at anytime. 
Class will begin with a few minutes of breath work followed by approximately 45 minutes of yoga.

name: Coffee with Friends of Bill and Dr Bob
description_book: Open agnostic 12-Step meetings.
description_web: Open agnostic 12-Step meetings. From 8:00 am-9:00 am.

name: *Études* 2 and 3 for Single Sword (Fencing)
description_book: These drill sequences will focus on form, balance, movement, and coordination. For beginners, intermediates, and teachers alike.
description_web: For beginner and intermediate fencers and those who teach them. These drills will focus on form, balance, movement and coordination. *Étude* 2 is thrust centric. *Étude* 2 adds diversity of cuts. Emphasis will be on learning the *études* for home drill, as well as taking elements out of the drill for more focused work in groups.

location: Æ Battlefield pavillion (White tent with red, next to EK Circus Tent.)
name: How to Feed an Army
description_book: The proper care and feeding of SCA combatants at Pennsic and beyond. Everything you ever wanted to know about waterbearing and martial events.

name: Chinese Calligraphy Brush Painting
description_book: Grinding ink and the brush writing of ancient Chinese characters from oracle bone to cursive scripts. **Adults only.**
description_web: A brief history of Chinese calligraphy: Brush painting Chinese characters that were developed over 3000 years ago and that are still used today. Explore a variety of Chinese scripts from oracle bone pictographs to the more modern scripts of the Han Dynasty (200 BC to 200 AD). We will explore the 4 treasures and create beautiful characters. This class is intended for beginners, but students at any level may benefit. We will be grinding  our own ink and writing ancient Chinese characters. There will be supplies for 6 people to use, but others can observe. **Adults only.**

name: Beginning Bobbin Lace
description_book: Three-day class for a total of 9 hours. Learn the basic movements and make three basic projects. Start a period pattern.
description_web: This is a three-day class for a total of 9 hours of bobbin lace! First Day: Students will learn the basic movements of bobbin lace and begin a project. Second Day: Students will finish the project and learn some simple grounds. Third Day: Students will begin a period pattern from the *Nüw Modelbuch*.
fee_itemization: $30 – One-time fee for all three days. Includes pillow with cover, bobbin holder, 10 pair of bobbins, pins, handout, patterns

name: Beginning Hand-Stitching
description_book: Learn 5 basic hand-stitch methods for a truly period look in garb.
description_web: Sewing is an ancient skill. While we have electric-powered sewing machines, there are some of us who want to experience the methods used by past sewers in the making of our garb. There are five basic stitches that, when used, will make a period gown shine above the rest.
fee_itemization: Bag, thread, needle threader, needles, bees wax.

name: Applied Decorative Stitching: Needlebook
description_book: Applying the skills of ancient to early medieval embroidery to create a needlebook.
description_web: Applying the skills of ancient to early medieval embroidery to create a needlebook. Materials provided will be wool or wool-blend felt and cotton embroidery thread.
fee_itemization: Wool or wool-blend felt pieces, wool felt, cotton DMC thread, embroidery needle

name: Lucet Cord for Beginners
description_book: A square lucet cord that dates back to the Viking period can be quickly made for lacing, bag closure or belt hanging.
description_web: Lucet cord has been dated back to the Viking age and throughout the medieval periods. This two-pronged tool is easy to use and makes a quick cord that is not limited in length. This class is an introduction to lucetting and we will make a single color square cord.
fee_itemization:
Lucet $20
Cord and bobbins $5

name: History of Food and Eating
description_book: The shocking secret history of food and eating. A radical feast of information for anyone with a mouth!

name: Modern Gaming: Peace Week
description_book: A place, with power, to play modern games from 9 am to 10:30 pm every day.

name: To Etch into Iron or Steel
description_book: An overview of my results using period methods and materials to decorate steel using acid etching.
fee_itemization: N/A

name: Introduction to *Kumihimo*
description_book: Learn the ancient Japanese art of *kumihimo*. This is a hands-on beginner class and each kit contains all you need to complete a *kumihimo* cord.
description_web: Learn the Japanese art of weaving/braiding. Kit includes all you need to make a *kumihimo* cord, instructions, and a brief history of *kumihimo*.
fee_itemization:
Foam disk
Craft yarn
Counter weight
Kumihimo history
Kumihimo instruction
Instructions on various patterns
Basic plastic embroidery floss bobbins

name: Designing a Period Sundial
description_book: We'll go through the process of laying out the curves needed for either a vertical or horizontal sundial using period graphical techniques.
description_web: We'll go through the process of laying out the curves needed for either a vertical or horizontal sundial. We will use graphical methods so no math is required. The technique is period and relatively easy to learn. While you do not need to actually draw a dial in the class, I will be going through the steps required and will assist anyone who wants to try. In order to draw the curves. You will need a pencil, paper tablet, a compass, a straight edge (ruler), and a protractor.

name: Herbalism and Botanical References
description_book: Come find out about period texts on herbalism, horticulture, botany, and agriculture, from Early Egypt to 1600.
description_web: Come find out about period texts on herbalism, horticulture, botany, and agriculture, from the ~1800 BCE to 1600 CE. We will discuss texts, cultures, and the evolution of data within SCA period. There will be no handout this year; instead expect a QR code.  I will have handouts on loan to help those without devices follow along.

name: Pennsic Homes, The Tour Around Runestone
description_book: Will meet at showers at bottom of Runestone Hill, tour a few homes there. Cancel if raining hard. **Lots** of walking.
description_web: A tour of just a few of the different types of wagon homes. Purpose is to show ideas, and introduce you to homeowners so you know what people to ask questions. A range of expense levels, as well as Pennsic Homes vs. take-it-to-events wagons. **Lots** of walking. This tour will start at the bottom of Runestone Hill, and see the homes there. Will be cancelled if it is a Pouring, rainy day, but not if it is quick, light showers.

name: Introduction to Central Asian Archery/Thumb Ring
description_book: Learn how to shoot like a Mongol, Turk, etc. Requires a horse bow and arrows at least 4" longer than your finger draw. **Age limit 18+.**
description_web: Learn to shoot the way Mongols and other steppes and horse archers did. Naran Numuchi, Noyon of Ponte Alto, Order of the Laurel for Mongol and Turkish Archery, OP, Companion of the Order of the Yew Bow (Atlantia), has been shooting thumb ring since 1998 and, since then, has focused on the use and history of static-eared recurve bows. Naran Noyon will have some thumb rings to try, but you must bring your own bows and arrows, preferably with no shelf or pistol grip, and arrows should be sufficiently long to accommodate the 2-4" extra of thumb draw. **Age limit 18+.**

name: *RúnValdr*
description_book: In period, runes were very rarely used for divination, but there are many examples of runes being used for magic. A modern system for rune magic.
description_web: In period, runes were very rarely used for divination, but there are many examples of runes being used for magic. This is a system that shows, for example, how to use Norse or Anglo-Saxon runes to hear even at distance, or to awaken inanimate objects. This is a system of energy manipulation using runes and another set of symbols. This workshop introduces the symbols and what each of them is used for, and includes the attunement. It does *not* include introduction to runes. You may take this workshop without knowing the runes, but you will need to learn them to be able to use this system. You will be able to use this technique immediately.
fee_itemization: There's a free handout, and a bigger optional "manual" available.

name: Medieval Game Make-and-Take
description_book: Learn about some medieval games. Then, create your own fabric game board and pieces to keep.

name: Intro to "Medieval-Like" Woodworking, Part B
description_book: Intro to woodworking with only hand tools. Includes modern SOPs and safe practices for building medieval-style furniture. **See Web for age limit.**
description_web: **THIS CLASS IS THE SECOND HALF OF A 2-DAY CLASS**, Tuesday and Wednesday mornings; an overview of hand woodwork, with an opportunity to try things out. We will start on Tuesday morning with a chunk of a log and by noon we should have some boards or other furniture parts using wedges, axes, froes, drawknives, spokeshaves and wood planes. On Wednesday we will look at making joints, boring, and maybe a bit of carving. Covers saws, chisels, and planes. Extensive instructions on the selection, use and maintenance of all these tools will be covered. The class will be taught both first week and again second week. Students who cannot attend the whole class are encouraged to drop in or out at their convenience. **Youths may attend if accompanied by a parent.**

name: Youth Rapier Activities
description_book: There will be a variety of youth rapier activities each day including drills, games and one-on-one instruction. Some loaner gear will be available.
description_web: There will be a variety of youth rapier activities each day including drills, games and one-on-one instruction. Some days may include special additional activities. Some loaner gear will be available. Participants do not have to be authorized. Children age 6 and up may participate. Please bring your parent/guardian the first day you attend to learn more about the youth rapier program.

name: Open Scribal Time
description_book: Take advantage of our clean, well-lit space to work on existing projects or to try your hand at calligraphy and/or illumination.

name: Introduction to A&S Documentation
description_book: We'll focus on approaches to documentation for projects in the SCA.
description_web: Whether you are creating an item for a competition, a gift, or simply a step in developing a skill or craft, it's generally a good idea to write down a few notes on your ideas, thoughts and lessons learned - all of which creates the seed to become documentation. Documentation need not be a "one size fits all" situation. This class will include a discussion of the essential elements, customizing your documentation, and when to start this process.

name: Beginning Silk Banners
description_book: Learn some history and make a simple banner using permanent dyes. **Age 18+**
fee_itemization: For the silk fabric, dyes

name: Slaves and Freedpersons in Ancient Rome
description_book: Enslavement was a fact of life in ancient Rome, so what might a Roman persona be expected to know about it?
description_web: Enslavement was a fact of life in ancient Rome, so what might a Roman persona be expected to know about it? Join us as we dispel the myths, face the facts and gain an understanding of how Roman people interacted with this challenging tradition. Q&A will be during the last half hour.

name: Growing a Feast
description_book: Encouraging folks to grow or raise items to contribute to a feast; sharing my experiences in doing so.
description_web: This class is intended to encourage our agriculturally-minded folks to grow or raise items to contribute to a feast. That said, cooks are welcome too! I’ll go over basic garden/soil requirements, the ever important timing of sowing and harvesting, short term preservation (until the feast), medieval variety seed sources, and selection of plants that are right for a feast. I will also give a brief account of my own experience of “growing a feast”.

name: Anglo-Saxon Ring Pouch
description_book: Create the only pouch an Anglo-Saxon woman would ever want or need, using period supplies and sewing techniques. Masking required.
fee_itemization: All of the supplies and materials needed to make a ring pouch.

name: Beads Embroidery with Cabochons
description_book: Making a jewelry piece with cabochons and beading embroidery.
description_web:
Back then, people made fantastic ornaments and applications using beads, pearls, and, most importantly, stones on their clothes, shoes, and hats. I will show you the method to help you make replicas of your garb. Also, you will be able to make jewelry and medallions for recreation. At the end of this class, you will have a Byzantine ring replica and skills to help you improve your art! Every level is welcome! 

No children (small material and small sharp needles can damage their digestive system).
fee_itemization: seed beads 11/0, 15/0 in silver and gold covers, semi-precious cabochon, thread, needle, ring base, felt, leather

name: Herbalism/Plant Use Safety
description_book: Safety procedures when using plants: proper identification, research, risk prevention, emergency procedures, and biochemical horror stories.
description_web: Plants are used in a variety of SCA activities: cooking, brewing, herbalism, cosmetics, and other fields. Medieval practices often involve plants that modern people are unfamiliar with. To encourage the safest practices possible, this class will cover proper identification of plants, how to research safety concerns, risk prevention, emergency procedures, and biochemical horror stories.
fee_itemization: Printing costs.

location: Courtesan College (Strawberry Fields B06 (off eLeri Lane between  Ankara and Visby Vale))
name: A Little Nosey: Poems of Catullus - CCt
description_book: Catullus' poetry: love, insults, and obscenities collide in a fiery explosion of rhyme and reason. It's like Shakespeare, but more F-bombs. **18+**
description_web: In this class, we'll explore the passionate and often controversial poetry of the Roman poet Catullus, whose words have left a lasting impression on the literary world. Whether he's penning love letters to his mistress, unleashing vicious insults on his enemies, or simply expressing his disdain for bad poetry, Catullus always has something witty and cutting to say. So grab your toga, put on your best poetic voice, and get ready to unleash your inner Catullus in this wild and irreverent romp through ancient literature! **18+ only**

name: Paint the European Dance Floor
description_book: Come and help paint the European Dance Floor. Supplies are provided. Modern clothes are acceptable (you do not have to ruin garb)
description_web: Come and help paint the European Dance Floor. Supplies are provided. Modern clothes are acceptable (you do not have to ruin garb)  (actually 2 hours)

name: Beginner Sewing: Make A Ball
description_book: Learn sewing basics and create a small felt ball to keep.

name: Beginner Sewing for Tweens: Dragon Stuffies
description_book: Learn sewing basics and create your own personal dragon (ages 9-14).

name: Storytelling Academy
description_book: Explore genres, tools, styles, and uses of storytelling. Cultural and medieval approaches, applications, performance coaching. New topics each day.
description_web: During this academy, students will gain knowledge about the history and techniques for storytelling both in the SCA and the modern world. Students may attend individual sessions or all of the academy. There may be guest teachers and will be time for students to practice and receive feedback. The academy may culminate in a student performance. No classes are repeated. The focus is on developing comfort, nurturing, and honing skills within the students’ capabilities. All levels are welcome. Students may view a class outline at the academy space, Minerva’s Spindle 158, where classes will also be listed on the message board. Seating is limited; feel free to bring your own chair. Student Performance, date, time, and location will be announced.

name: Playing 15th-Century Florentine Instrumental Music
description_book: Read music from the 15th-century Florentine *Chansonnier*.  Intermediate to advanced instrumental skills needed. Bring instrument and stand.
description_web: Let's read some music from the 15th-century Florentine *Chansonnier*. Intermediate to advanced instrumental skills needed. Wind or string instruments are best suited to this, but not limited to these. Please bring your own instrument and stand.
fee_itemization: $3 for copies of the music

name: Pre-School  Playgroup
description_book: Let our preschoolers tire each other out! Let the parents and guardians make friends! Meets at Toddler Lounge Shade by playground

name: Being a Better Pell
description_book: A practical, pedagogically focussed class on how to evolve a drill in a way that is beneficial to both the teacher and student.
description_web: A practical, pedagogically focussed class on how to evolve a drill in a way that is beneficial to both the teacher and student.

name: *Janissary* Music Class
description_book: Three traditional Ottoman marches will be taught for brass horns, reed *zurnas, davul* and *nakara* drums, cymbals, and voice.
description_web: Three traditional Ottoman marches will be taught for brass horns, reed *zurnas, davul* and *nakara* drums, cymbals, and voice. The songs to be taught are *Ceddin Deden, Genc Osman*, and *Hucum* march. Perfect for those who have marching band experience and want to make a big noise.

name: Weed Walk
description_book: Wild plant identification. Wear walking shoes and hat; leave from Univ. Point. Different teachers on different days; walk with us more than once!
description_web: Cooper's Lake abounds with medicinal and food plants that were used by various primitive and medieval cultures. Learn to identify them during a walk around the campsite. The walk will take place rain or shine. Please wear sturdy shoes and a hat. Meet at University Point for the start of the class. We have multiple teachers, so if you attend more than one walk, you will likely learn different things!

name: Youth Heavy List Skills, Games, and Drills
description_book: Daily morning regular practices to be run from 8:30 till 11 am on the Pennsic Battlefield Youth List. Youth aged 6-17. Loaner gear will be available.
description_web: Daily morning regular practices to be run from 8:30 till 11 am on the Pennsic Battlefield Youth List. Youth aged 6-17, all levels of experience on three different list fields. Loaner gear will be available.

location: Heralds Point (Herald's Point, behind the playground. )
name: Heralds' Mentoring Meet-Up at Heralds' Point
description_book: A heraldic staff member will discuss your mentoring needs (armory or names). We will find you someone to shadow.
description_web: A heraldic staff member will discuss your mentoring needs (armory or names). We will find you someone to shadow.

name: Known World Adventurers Guild: **Walk Day**
description_book: Teen explorers (and youth 10+) will gather information via supervised Pennsic site walks. All activities begin and end at Family Point. KWAGuild.com.
description_web:
**WANTED**: Teen adventurers (and youth 10+) with a thirst for exploration, cultural exchange, and making friends within the SCA. Guildmistress Marian of Heatherdale invites you to join KWAG (the Known World Adventurers Guild) here at Pennsic 50. Her noble company of young explorers will gather information through supervised in-person walks around the Pennsic site. Who knows who you'll meet... Visiting royalty? One of the SCA's Founders? Someone from the esteemed Cooper Family? Come and find out. KWAG activities run throughout both weeks, and alternate between KWAG Walk Days and KWAG Social Days. All activities begin and end at Family Point. Everyone is welcome! Please note: this is an active class. The group will be walking to various public locations on the Pennsic site (no private camps). All participants should wear sturdy shoes, a hat and sunscreen, and bring water. More info at KWAGuild.com.
     **INFO FOR PARENTS/CAREGIVERS:**  KWAG classes are designed for teens and older children (10+). All activities will be supervised by a warranted and background-checked youth officer plus at least one other responsible adult. All abilities are happily welcomed. Please email heather@heatherdale.com if we can help provide any special accommodations in advance. Parents and caregivers are very welcome to join the walks, and are encouraged to accompany their kids if any special needs might affect the child's enjoyment of the classes.

name: Ask a Scribe
description_book: These drop-in classes are ideal for scribes of all levels to speak one-on-one with an experienced scribe for help and advice.
description_web: These are informal drop-in classes for any scribe who's looking for advice, guidance, or help with any aspect of calligraphy and/or illumination. Several different experienced scribes will be hosting these sessions during Peace Week and War Week.

name: How to Be Heard: Vocal Techniques to get **LOUD**
description_book: Modern theatrical vocal techniques to be heard loudly and distinctly on the field or in Court. Drop-in, take one session or multiple.
description_web: Modern theatrical vocal techniques for the Creative Anachronist to help you be heard loudly and distinctly on the field or in Court. We will learn and practice a vocal warm-up designed to enhance breath, resonance, and diction. Class is led by a professional actor and teaching artist. Attend any or all sessions, you do **NOT** need to be at all classes to fully participate.

name: Peace Week Archery Practice
description_book: Warm up, practice shoot, and have fun on the Archery Range. Peace Week, Wednesday through Friday
description_web: Warm up, practice shoot, and have fun on the Archery Range. Ranges will be open depending upon marshal availability. Peace Week, Wednesday through Friday.

name: Archery Marshal and MIT Orientation
description_book: All Archery Marshals are required to attend **ONE** orientation meeting. This meeting is to explain Pennsic specific rules, the ranges, and scoring.
description_web: All Archery Marshals are required to attend **ONE** orientation meeting. This meeting is to explain Pennsic specific rules, the ranges, and scoring. You're welcome to bring MITs and attend as often as you want. We want you to learn the scoring system to make getting the totals faster, easier and more accurate.

name: Beaded Veil Edges
description_book: This class, originally offered at Pennsic in 2006, examines historical examples of beading on veils through the SCA period and ways to recreate them.
description_web: Beads add weight and beauty to your veils. In addition to being pretty, it is a practical way to keep your veils from blowing about in the breeze. This is a hands-on class using tiny needles and tiny beads. Youths 12 and older welcome with an adult. You will learn several techniques and leave with a sampler of beaded edges. Some hand-sewing knowledge is helpful. Please bring reading glasses and thread snips if you have them.
fee_itemization: Handout, kit containing beads, needle, veil edge/sampler material, thread, etc.

name: The *Tain Bo Cuailnge*: The Irish Epic Cycle
description_book: The stories both about the *Tain* and in it. It will be presented from the perspective of the teacher's persona and that of Fergus Mac Roy.
description_web: The stories both about the *Tain* and in it. It will be presented from the perspective of the teacher's persona and that of Fergus Mac Roy, one of central figures in the epic. In order to find out what really happened, the bards of Ireland had to talk Fergus while he was raised from the dead.

name: Nalbinding: How to Make Mittens/Handwarmers
description_book: Students need to be familiar with at least one basic stitch; we will learn how to start the mittens and how to add a thumb.
description_web: Attending students need to be familiar with at least one basic stitch in order to attend this class. We will discuss and practice how to start mittens with either a round or a flat start. Secondly, we will discuss and practice how to add a thumb to the mittens. Bring your own wool and needle; material will not be supplied by the teacher.

name: Africans in Tudor England
description_book: This class is about the history of people of African descent in Tudor England.
description_web: Often we don’t picture people of African descent in Renaissance England, but they were there. This class will cover the ways that people of African descent arrived in England, their roles and occupations once there, and how they were treated by a society that was entering the slave trade. We’ll also look at period representations of Africans in art and literature.
fee_itemization: $1 covers the cost of photocopying the handout.

name: Sharing Stories from the Past and Present
description_book: Join Master Johann from Calontir for story-time. Tales of the Gods of Asgard are likely, but also some short/silly stories from around the world.
description_web: Join Master Johann from Calontir as he shares some stories for the young and the young-at-heart! Tales of the Gods of Asgard are likely, but so too are some short and silly stories from around the world. What story is next? Who knows? Let's find out together!

name: Youth Sewing Basics
description_book: In this class we will learn basic stitches. We'll create a sampler, then practice by sewing a simple pouch. Students may also bring own project.
description_web: In this class we will learn basic, period appropriate stitches. We will first create a simple sampler, then practice our stitches by sewing a simple pouch. Students may also bring a project of their own to work on, if they wish.
fee_itemization: Materials - 5

name: Multiplayer Medieval Backgammon
description_book: Learn variations of *Tables* (*Nard*, Backgammon) for 4 or 7 players.
description_web: Learn variations of *Tables* (*Nard*, Backgammon) for 4 or 7 players.

name: Turkish Split Finger Drumming Technique
description_book: Intermediate to advanced. This exciting *Darbuka* style will elevate your playing and open up a world of different sounds and drum possibilities

name: Crimson Certificates: *Joseon* Royal Cert Format
description_book: Add both text & context to your Asian-inspired scrolls. Learn the structure of *Joseon* court documents & hands-on techniques to improve your scrolls.

name: Copying a Period Calligraphic Hand
description_book: You can use any manuscript as your calligraphic source! Come learn the techniques for mimicking any period hand.
description_web: Working from a *ductus* is fine, but you can also use any manuscript as your calligraphic source! Come learn the techniques for mimicking any period hand.

name: Monsters and Mayhem: A Medieval Guide to Cryptids
description_book: Uncover the mystery of medieval monsters and mythical creatures in this class about cryptids. From dragons to unicorns, discover the lore and legend.
description_web: Delve into the fantastic world of medieval cryptids, the strange and mysterious creatures that populated the imaginations of people in the Middle Ages. We will explore the folklore and mythology surrounding creatures such as dragons, unicorns, griffins, and more. We'll examine the historical and cultural contexts in which these creatures emerged, and explore their symbolism and meaning in medieval art, literature, and popular culture.

name: The Dark Art of Memory
description_book: The art and science of memory from Ancient Greek Goddess to modern neuroscience.

name: How to Make a Quilt from Your Pennsic T-shirts
description_book: How-to repurpose your Pennsic t-shirts into a quilt. Mine is Calif King-size, and  is now hanging in The Watch.
description_web: I started trying to save my favorite Pennsic 25 t-shirt and, over 6 years, figured out how to make my Pennsic t-shirt collection into a quilt. Let me save you the 'learning experience' I had, as I will share with you the tips to do this in a fairly easy way. The Calif King -size quilt starts with Pennsic 9, and I have saved a corner for a Pennsic 50 shirt. Pennsic Staff is planning on hanging it in the Watch so everyone can see it. There is another smaller one that I will have with me for class.

name: Macramé
description_book: The history of macramé, how to tie the basic knots and combine them into patterns. Ages 12 and up.
description_web: Come learn about the history of macramé long before the tacky plant hangers of the 1970s. This class will teach you the two basic macramé knots and how to put them together to form a multitude of patterns. You will leave with a macramé coaster to take home with you. Ages 12 and up.

name: Alchemy in Period
description_book: What, where, when and who of alchemy in history.
description_web: An overview of what transmutational alchemy (both metallurgical and medicinal) was within antiquity, the medieval period and the Renaissance. The course surveys what alchemy was and wasn't, where it was practiced, who its most prominent practitioners were, and what they achieved.

name: Medieval Africa South of the Maghreb
description_book: An introductory overview of aspects of African medieval material culture, primarily from archaeological sources in East and West Africa.
description_web: An introductory overview of aspects of African medieval material culture, primarily from archaeological sources in East and West Africa, with the goal of helping people interested in portraying personas or recreating arts in the spirit of respectful scholarship. A handout and online resource will be provided, and students are encouraged to share their knowledge and resources as well.

name: Roman Rag Doll Make-and-Take
description_book: Make and take a Roman rag doll based on extant item in the British Museum collection. Animal-free kit provided to make and clothe one doll, no cost.
description_web: Make and take a Roman rag doll based on an extant item in the collection of the British Museum. Kit provided at no cost to make and clothe one doll per participant. Accessibility: needles will be pre-threaded, and dolls can be made completely by hand from scratch or from a pre-sewn body that only needs stuffing. Kit will contain no animal products/fibers. Participants are welcome to drop in and out during the class period. No cost.

name: A Silly Skirmish for Five: *Verceppe*
description_book: Learn this fun dance, an original danced battle between the sexes from the 15th century. For intermediate/advanced dancers, or adventuresome ones.
description_web: Come learn this fun dance, an original danced battle between the sexes from the 15th century. For intermediate/advanced dancers, or adventuresome ones.

name: Renaissance Fritters
description_book: Fritters of apples, dried grapes, and pine nuts.  Fritters of carrots. Lenten leaven fritters.
description_web: Fritters made with apples, dried grapes, and pine nuts.  Made with flour, sugar, apples, raisins, pine nuts, candied citron, sweet wine, olive oil, and saffron. Cooked in olive oil and garnished with honey and sugar. Carrot fritters made with carrots, flour, raisins, saffron, sweet wine, water. Cooked in olive oil and garnished with honey and sugar. Lenten leaven fritters are made with flour, yeast, oil, sugar, rose water, water, and saffron. Cooked in olive oil and garnished with sugar.

name: Here. Play This. Now.
description_book: Sight-read with us! Bring your recorder, or a C or F instrument. Bring a music stand and a sense of humor.
description_web: Sight-reading class for recorders or other C and F instruments. Bring a music stand, or use one of our loaners. Safe space for honing your sight-reading skills.
fee_itemization: Printed Music

name: *Ka-Kha-Ga-Gha*
description_book: Written forms and pronunciations of *Devanagari* script used by Sanskrit, Hindi, and other Indic languages. 1st hour basic; 2nd more details.
description_web:
Written forms, pronunciations, and usage of *Devanagari* script used by Hindi and other North Indian languages.
