While the focus of this class is on Hindi usage, the characters and pronunciation are applicable to others. There will be examples in Hindi and comparisons to spoken English. Students may learn to transliterate their names.
1st hour: Basic characters and pronunciation.
2nd hour: Vowels and half-letters; more if time and student interest allow.

name: The Pennsic Mightier: Improv Workshop
description_book: Improv workshop for experienced performers: address higher level improv skills, create character, build scenes leading to a performance. **Age limit**
description_web: This improv workshop is designed to address intermediate and advanced level improv skills focused on creating unique characters, building relationships, committing to a scene, and exploring long-form improv. Long-form improv is a building block for work in *commedia* and sketch comedy. The character and scene work will improve your overall acting skills as well as building confidence in everyday life. This workshop will culminate in a performance on Friday 8/5 in the Performing Arts Tent; however, the performance is optional if you would prefer to attend the workshops without performing live. You must have prior improv experience (modern experience or prior Pennsic classes, etc.) and be familiar with the basics of “Yes, and” to participate in this class. Those without experience may be allowed at the instructor’s discretion. You do not have to attend every workshop; however, different skills will be addressed each day and attendance at all is beneficial. The Friday workshop is mandatory if you would like to perform in the show. **This class is for ages 18 and up; however, younger students may be allowed with both parental and instructor permission.** Please attend the first workshop (with a parent, for those under 18) or contact the instructor in advance to participate.

name: Beginning Inkle Weaving
description_book: Learn to read inkle patterns, loom setup, weaves. Bring loom and shuttle, or borrow both. Yarn, all equipment will be provided.
description_web: Learn to create beautiful trim for your garb. We will cover how to read an inkle pattern, how to set up and weave efficiently on the inkle loom. Bring your own loom and shuttle, or borrow one/both. Supplies provided: #10 cotton crochet thread/equivalent, in two colors; scissors; paper and pencil for notes. If you prefer, you may bring your own cotton yarn.
fee_itemization:
handout, 
thread, 2 colors.  approximately 70 yards total per student.
Use of equipment

name: Being Your Persona
description_book: How to maintain the illusion at an event that you are a period person interacting with other period people.
description_web: How to maintain the illusion at an event that you are a period person interacting with other period people.

name: You Are What You Eat: Humoural Doctrine
description_book: An overview of the theory of balancing the human condition thru food.
description_web: An overview of the theory of balancing the human condition thru food.

name: Wicked Welsh: the Poetry of Gwerful Mechain
description_book: Come dig into the delightfully bawdy works of Gwerful Mechain, the best known of the female Welsh medieval poets. (Coarse language and sexual topics.)

name: Open Knitting Circle
description_book: Stuck on a project? Need help understanding a pattern or just want to knit and chat with others? Come and join a knitter's circle.
description_web: Stuck on a project? Need help understanding a pattern or just want to knit and chat with others? Come and join a knitter's circle.

name: With These Knots I Bind My Camp
description_book: You will learn to master a very few knots that will meet almost every need you may have in camp - or double your money back!
description_web: Before cordless drills and screws, before plentiful cheap nails, even before glue, there was knotted cord holding our lives together. Sadly, most of us barely know how to tie even two or three knots. My guarantee: You will learn to master a small handful of knots that will meet almost every need you may have in camp - or double your money back!

name: Beginning Knitting
description_book: Learn to knit and make a simple pouch. Needles and yarn provided, or bring your favorite color of worsted weight yarn.

name: Card Weaving 101:How to Not Be Afraid of Your Loom
description_book: A hands-on class on the basics of card weaving, including helpful tips, tricks, and tools I have found to make it easier.
description_web: Card weaving can be daunting if you've never done it before. Let me help you get over your fears! This will be a hands-on class on the basics of card weaving, including helpful tips, tricks, and tools I have found to make it easier. Bring your projects and your questions if you'd like, or we can just talk about what to do to get your project started!

name: More Time or Money: Kitting Out New Fighters
description_book: A class on economic armor for a new fighter. Bring a notebook as I am a Luddite.

name: Beginning Irish Language for SCAdians
description_book: The Irish language: pronunciation, basic grammar, introductions, counting, ask and answer questions, how to be polite.
description_web: A basic introduction to the Irish language (modern, not ancient). Learn pronunciation and grammar, pronouns and SCA-related vocabulary, how to introduce yourself and tell someone where you are from, how to count, how to ask and answer simple questions, and some easy conversations.
fee_itemization: $2 for handouts

location: Courtesan College (Strawberry Fields B06 ((off eLeri Lane between Ankara and Visby Vale))
name: Early Islamic-Influenced Beauty - CCt
description_book: The beauty standards within the pre-1650 Islamic-ruled world, including cosmetics, hygiene, and haircare. **Age 18+.**
description_web: This class will explore the beauty standards within the pre-1650 Islamic-ruled world, specifically with a focus on cosmetics, hygiene, and haircare. Reviewing beauty standards from the late 7th- to the mid-17th century over a wide-geographical area, we see patterns emerge. In addition to learning similarities in beauty standards, we will discuss how women engaged with both personal hygiene and beautification. We will also explore specific formulas for beauty products, their desired results, and potential consequences associated with their prolonged use. Instructor will bring samples of both foundation and eye makeup for students to test. **Age 18+.**

name: Life-Sized Castle Building
description_book: Children will discuss castles throughout history, and then as a group build one or more kid-sized castles using cardboard boxes.
description_web: Children will use a handout to discuss castles throughout history and their features, and then as a group build one or more kid-sized castles using cardboard boxes.

name: Constellations and Crafts
description_book: Learn the constellations by hearing their legends and recreating their patterns in crafts.
description_web: Learn the constellations by hearing their legends and recreating their patterns in crafts.

name: Chess on Different Boards
description_book: Chess had several variations during its history, including round and rectangular boards.
description_web: Chess had several variations during its history, including round and rectangular boards. We'll discuss Byzantine chess (circular board), oblong chess (16x4 board), and courier chess (12x8 with extra pieces).

name: Introduction to *Pysanky*
description_book: Learn about the rich history of Ukrainian embellished eggs, and try your hand at this "Queen of Folk Arts". Lecture, discussion, and make-and-take.
description_web: *Pysanky* are highly embellished eggs used for centuries in Easter and Vernal Equinox celebrations in many Slavic nations, including modern Ukraine, Poland, and Romania. Come learn about the history, symbolism, and significance of this "Queen of Folk Arts," and make your own *pysanka* to take with you. All materials and tools will be provided. The dyes are permanent, so wear old garb!
fee_itemization: for the tools and materials to make the pysanky

name: Roman Glassblowing Demo (Furnace Glass)
description_book: A fully narrated, live, 2000-degree glassblowing demonstration! Learn about the materials, the techniques, and how glass usage changed over time!
description_web: Come and watch a fully narrated, live, 2000-degree glassblowing demonstration! See how we can take this fascinating material and turn it into a never-ending variety of items! Learn about the materials we use, and how glass-making techniques, its uses, and value varied throughout time and culture! For this demo see items from the 1st to the 5th centuries, from across the Roman Empire! Family-friendly, all ages welcome, open Q&A to follow.

name: Iron Age to Renaissance: History of the Recorder
description_book: Follow the development of the recorder, from Iron Age flutes made of bone to Henry VIII’s famous collection of wooden recorders.
description_web: Follow the development of the recorder, from Iron Age flutes made of bone to Henry VIII’s famous collection of wooden recorders. Spoiler alert: the recorder did not always have its characteristic thumb hole. Various sizes of recorders and other related instruments will be available for viewing.
fee_itemization: Fee covers cost of photocopying class handout.

name: Loom-Woven Pouch
description_book: Create a tabby-woven pouch on a one-piece loom. Class limited to 10 looms.
description_web: Create a tabby-woven pouch on a one-piece loom. Class limited to 10 looms.
fee_itemization: loom, string, & instructions

location: the old Cafe Marhaba location or what ever coffee shop is taking that place (South-West of the Pennsic Market store. (Coffee shop that is South West of the Food Court Near Barn)
name: Pre-16th-Century Musical Modal Improvisation
description_book: This is a practical application class for musicians to learn improvisational skills that were practiced in the Middle Ages. **College level.**
description_web: Musician class for acoustic instruments to learn medieval modal improvisation that will teach the student to create melodies on the spot for both free form and structured rhythmic forms. Students are required to be very familiar with their instruments. Reading music is not required but really helps, especially your major and natural minor scales. **College level.**

name: Bronze Age Meet-Up
description_book: Part meetup, part roundtable, part interactive display. Meet others focused on ancient research, share resources/projects, try writing on clay, etc.
description_web: Part meet-up, part roundtable, part interactive display. Meet and chat with other folks focused on ancient research, share resources and projects, try making and writing on clay tablets, etc. Bring your WiPs! Please contact Suphunibal (suphunibal @ gmail.com) for more information or to arrange an activity or reserve display space.

name: History and Symbolism of the Unicorn Tapestries
description_book: An examination of "The Hunt for the Unicorn", 15th-century Flemish tapestries (the green ones). **Age 18+.**
description_web: An examination of "The Hunt for the Unicorn", 15th-century Flemish tapestries widely regarded as the best examples of tapestries of the age. Why does the unicorn lack ears in one tapestry? What happened to the pieces of the fifth tapestry? Where are they now? All these and more will be answered. Handout includes full color images including line drawings and plant keys for each tapestry. **Age 18+.**
fee_itemization: Full color, line drawing and plant key copies of all the tapestries with corresponding plants highlighted.

name: Teen Ancient Cryptography
description_book: Learn how ancient and medieval people encoded secret messages. Practice with your friends.

name: Persian Gardens
description_book: This class examines Persian gardens in reality, art, poetry, and religion.
fee_itemization: Color copying - 20 pages

name: Zoom Bardic Meet-up and Roundtable Discussion
description_book: Meet-up and roundtable discussion about online bardic circles.
description_web: Meetup in person with people from online bardic circles and join a roundtable discussion about online bardics.

name: How to Build a Germanic Lyre
description_book: A description of how to build an early period musical instrument.

name: Newcomers 101
description_book: Titles and customs across the Known World. Camping and what to bring with you to events. How to get along in the SCA.
description_web: Handouts showing the common titles and responsibilities. Discussion about all things SCA. Camping, names, bylaws about bullying. Anything they want to know that I can answer or direct them to another person or class.

name: Beginner Dance: English Country Plus
description_book: Suitable for beginners, we will have fun while learning *Maltese Bransle, Rufty Tufty*, and *Black Nag*.
description_web: Suitable for beginners, we will have fun while learning the *Maltese Bransle, Rufty Tufty*, and *Black Nag*.

name: Weaving
description_book: Learn basic weaving and make a bracelet or bookmark

name: Kid Garb Swap Meet
description_book: Kids grow too fast! Come to family point to donate or swap your kids' old garb, and swap or receive new garb that fits. All items must leave at end.

name: Sharpening Everything for Woodworking
description_book: How to sharpen all of your stuff that needs sharpening!
description_web: How to sharpen everything! This class is an extension of my woodworking class. Thus, I will focus on sharpening woodworking tools, but the principles are the same for all cutting implements. We will cover several concepts and methods but my focus will be on how I do it... without expensive jigs and other do-hickies. We will review, then sharpen, anything you bring - and all of my tools.

name: My Ukulele Is a Guitar
description_book: The history of the Renaissance 4-course guitar and its direct descendant the baritone ukulele, and its surviving music.
description_web: The history of the Renaissance 4-course guitar and its direct descendant the baritone ukulele. The story of the lute's much lesser-known cousin, its surviving music, and its general disreputation.

name: Toddler Playgroup
description_book: Let our toddlers tire each other out! Let the parents and guardians make friends! Meets at Toddler Lounge Shade by playground

name: Beginner Thrown Weapons
description_book: Learn axe throwing, basic care of your weapons, and basic rules. A hands-on session is included. Limit of 25 participants; no experience necessary.
description_web: Learn axe throwing, basic care of your weapons, and basic rules. A hands-on session is included. Limit of 25 participants; no experience necessary.

name: Make Beautiful Scrolls Using Micography
description_book: Learn about micography and how it was used in manuscripts. We'll work on plotting out designs and practice what we have learned.
description_web:
First we will learn about micography and how it was used in manuscripts. Then we will work on plotting out designs and practice what we have learned to create some art. Will not have handouts available past 10 gentles, but the handout is also online. 
If you have lightboards, pencils, and dip pens with a crow nib (or C-6), bringing them would be appreciated, but not necessary. Instructor will have some, but may not be able to cover all participants.
fee_itemization: $1 - for handout.

name: Bardic Coaching
description_book: Participants perform 3 to 5 minutes of material, any performance art, and receive feedback and coaching from the instructor.
description_web: Participants perform 3 to 5 minutes of material, any performance art, and receive feedback and coaching from the instructor.

name: Clout Shooting Practice: Archery
description_book: Practicing 50-100 yards to increase accuracy. All are welcome.
description_web: Practicing 50-100 yards to increase accuracy. All are welcome. This will be on the clout range (white flags).

name: The Irish Brehon Laws
description_book: The ancient Irish developed a complex, logical system of law based on compensation and honor that lasted centuries.
description_web: The ancient Irish developed a complex, logical system of law based on compensation and honor that lasted centuries. The class focuses on the different levels of qualifications to become a Brehon or Bard, as well as the methods of adjudication and application.
fee_itemization: Copy costs

name: *Contrafacta*: Yes, Filking is Period
description_book: We will discuss the history and impact of *contrafacta* (period filks), and give some tips on how to write them.
description_web:
*Musica Contrafacta* means reworked or recycled music. In French, it is *contrefait*, which is the root of our word counterfeit. In other words, you make new music by copying a popular tune, to which you set new lyrics. A *contrafactum* (Latin singular; *contrafacta* is plural) is a period filk. 
 
Lady Melanie de la Tour will discuss the history and impact of *contrafacta*/filks, and gives some tips on how to write them. Active participation is encouraged.

name: Make Your Own Medallion Cord
description_book: Why wear a plain white string? Learn *Slung*, cord-making described as juggling with strings! Children welcome with adult. OK to be late.
description_web: Why wear a plain white string? Learn *Slung*, a method for cord-making that can best be described as juggling with strings! Children welcome with adult. *Slung* is also known as Viking whip-cording. It is not only useful but a lot of fun for all ages. Can be done as a children's activity or at demos. Bring a friend! People will be taking turns on a limited number of set-ups. Showing up late is perfectly fine.

name: Painting Your Period Canvas Tent
description_book: Want to paint your tent? Have you painted it already and want to commiserate with others? Come talk tent decoration and share your experiences!
description_web: Want to paint your tent? Have you painted it already and want to commiserate with others? Come talk tent decoration and share your experiences! The instructor has suffered through the joy of painting three period tents and will share all her trials and tribulations so you can avoid her mistakes!

name: 9000 Years of Edged Weapons
description_book: A display and discussion of the history, fabrication and development of edged weapons including many original historical examples.
description_web: A display and discussion of the history, fabrication and development of edged weapons including many original examples from the Neolithic through the Bronze Age, into the Iron Age, and Middle Ages of SCA period, on into later eras and present. See which designs have lasted longest or have repeated. Photos and video welcome; limited hands-on permitted.

name: 14th-Century Open-work Shoe Workshop
description_book: Make a pair of 14th-century open-work shoes suitable for fancy-dress occasions. Patterns are derived from archaeological finds in The Netherlands.
description_web: In this make-and-take class, you will learn how to put together a pair of lightweight shoes like those worn by 14th-century Europeans. You will measure your feet, cut out leather for soles and uppers, design a pattern (or use a historical template) and cut it out. Then you will assemble the shoes by sewing the pieces together.
fee_itemization: Leather, needles, thread, and handout.

name: So You Want to Be an Assassin in the SCA
description_book: An introduction to having a persona that is nefarious and doesn't get into trouble; includes accoutrements, A&S ideas, and other suggestions.

location: Courtesan College (Strawberry Fields B06 (off eLeri Lane between Ankara and Visby Vale))
name: Introduction to the 64 *Kalas* - CCt
description_book: An introduction to the 64 *Kalas*, or arts, of the Indian courtesan and going over what they were with examples of what they entailed. **Age 18+.**
description_web: An introduction to the 64 *Kalas*, or arts, of the Indian courtesan and going over what they were with examples of what they entailed. **Age 18+.**

name: Low, Slow and Flirtatious for Three: *Pelligrina*
description_book: Highly seductive, this is an intermediate *bassadanza* for three. Dancers should be familiar with *doppii, sempii, saltarelli*, and *riprese*.
description_web: Highly seductive, this is an intermediate *bassadanza* for three. Dancers should be familiar with *doppii, sempii, saltarelli*, and *riprese*.

location: Denys the Decadent's Camo  (EO7 off great Eastern Hiughway, Look for 12 Steppe Sign)
name: 12-Step Meeting
description_book: An open meeting for those in recovery or any 12-step programs.
description_web: A daily 12-step meeting I hold in my Camp E07 off Great Eastern Highway. Look for the sign. Held at 4:00 PM, **OPEN MEETING .** Holding a meeting here since 1997.

name: Domos Draconum (DnD): In Search of the Unknown
description_book: Vintage 1970s Dungeons & Dragons adventure for ages 10+. No experience necessary. Limit: 8

name: Ancient Games: The *Royal Game of Ur*
description_book: Played before 2600 BC until after 177 BC, this is one of the oldest known games. Learn to play a game popular throughout Mesopotamia for millennia.
description_web: The related games we now call *The Game of Twenty Squares*, and  *The Royal Game of Ur*, are race games that were popular in Mesopotamia for thousands of years. The oldest surviving boards found are from Ur and date to before 2600 BC. We will learn about the game as played a few thousand years later from a description written in 177 BC.

name: Italian Renaissance Glass Demo (Furnace Glass)
description_book: A fully narrated, live, 2000-degree glassblowing demonstration! Learn about the materials, the techniques, and how glass usage changed over time!
description_web: Come and watch a fully narrated, live, 2000-degree glassblowing demonstration! See how we can take this fascinating material and turn it into a never-ending variety of items! Learn about the materials we use, and how glass making techniques, its uses, and value varied throughout time and culture! For this demo see items from the 14th-16th centuries in the Italian style! Family-friendly, all ages welcome, open Q&A to follow.

name: *Odhecaton*: Introduction and Praticum
description_book: The *Odhecaton* is the first printed book of music from 1501. We will play through various pieces. Bring an instrument and stand if you have one.
description_web: The *Odhecaton* is the first printed book of music from 1501, and covers more or less the top hits of the previous 50 years, making it a wonderful sampler of mid- to late-15th-century music. It has a mix of more and less complicated pieces; we'll play through some favorites, picking based on who we get, so don't worry about coming if you're not as experienced. Bring an instrument and stand if you have one. All ages welcome.

name: How to Write for The Pennsic Independent
description_book: How you can create content for publication in Pennsic’s newspaper!
description_web:
The Pennsic Independent is the recorded history of the War. That history depends upon reporters, photographers, and anyone who has a story to tell. 
This class will teach you the basics of writing for PI. It will include an overview of staff reporting, how to submit unsolicited stories, submitting stories and other material for the Web Edition, and so much more!
Discover the benefits of being a part of your favorite daily newspaper!

name: Archery Long Distance Shooting
description_book: Long distance shooting from 140 to 50 yards from various positions.
description_web: Long distance shooting from 140 to 50 yards from various positions.

name: Pick-up Fighting (Sponsored by HRM Ealdormere)
description_book: All fighters are welcome to come out for some pick-up fighting.
description_web: All armored fighters are welcome to come out for some pick-up fighting.

name: Throw Away Your Wristwatch
description_book: Learn period methods of timekeeping to tell time day and night at Pennsic. Discussion of scientific principles so you can tell time anywhere, anytime.
fee_itemization: 30 page color booklet. Cardboard nocturnal. A stick.

name: Pennsic Homes, Part 1: Wagon Homes
description_book: What you need to consider before buying or building. For beginners.
description_web: A What-You-Need-to-Consider class: Do you want something that looks like an in-period house? Or a period wagon/coach? Stays at Pennsic (Do you know the Pennsic Regs?) or a wagon to take to other events? Brief history of period carts and wagon. Adaptations to make it a livable-for-us today. Includes some of my available resources. Also, why these are or are *not* out-of-period "Gypsy" *vardos*.

name: Period Card Games: *Piquet* (or *Cent*)
description_book: Do you like to play cards? Come learn to play this challenging late-period two-player card game.
description_web: Looking for something to pass the time at events? Do you like to play cards? Come learn to play this challenging late-period two-player card game.

name: Yoga for Anyone and Everyone
description_book: All-level friendly, basic *vinyasa* class, open to complete beginners & seasoned yogis. Bring your own mat, towel & water, prepare to work and relax.

location: Courtesan College (Strawberry Fields B06 (off eLeri Lane between Ankara and Visby Vale))
name: The Dangerous Beauty: Series 1, *Esprimiti*! - CCt
description_book: The Arts of a Courtesan. Discussion and practice in how to look and act like an elite historical sex worker. **Age 18+.**
description_web: A series on the Arts of a Courtesan. You - yes, *you* have within you the power to secure a military alliance, curate courtly influence, maybe feel more assurance about attending Court, or just chat with that interesting person you met at fighter practice last week. We will be discussing and practicing how to look and act like an elite sex worker while in persona, based on a combination of both extant European period writings on social behavior with modern framing of deportment, etiquette, and seduction. This section will cover conversation skills, remembering names, wit, charm, walking and talking, flirting, non-verbal languages. There will be handouts available. **Age 18+.**

name: Cartomancy in Period
description_book: An overview of the history of cartomancy (divination with cards), and which *Tarot* cards and techniques are most appropriate at SCA events.
description_web: *Tarot* is one of the most popular forms of divination, but cards did not reach Europe until mid-14th century. Not long after that, diviners started using playing cards to tell fortunes. Let's talk about what earliest forms of cartomancy were practiced up to the 17th century, which decks are most appropriate for use at events (if you want to be historically accurate). If attendees are interested, we'll discuss which other forms of divination are suitable to different cultures.

name: Pennsic Glass Challenge
description_book:
Looking for beadmaking enthusiasts of all skill levels! Each session will have a different surprise challenge!
Visit tinyurl.com/glassapprentice.
description_web:
Looking for beadmaking enthusiasts of all skill levels! If you can work at a beadmaking torch, safely, without direct supervision, join us! 
This is a fun challenge meant to push individuals along their own learning paths, to try something new and find new horizons in their creativity and technical skill. This is **not** a competition.
Back again, by popular demand at Pennsic 50!

Visit tinyurl.com/glassapprentice for more information.
fee_itemization: All equipment, materials, and tools will be provided for each daily challenge. If you have your own favourite glass-rated safety glasses (didymium), please bring them along.

name: Period Card Games: *Losing Loadem*
description_book: Do you like to play cards? Come learn to play this late-period card game.
description_web: Looking for something to pass the time at events? Do you like to play cards? Come learn to play this late-period card game based on a reconstruction from Francis Willughby’s *A Volume of Plaies* (~1665).

name: Bedtime Stories for Children
description_book: Nightly telling of stories for children. This year's theme will be The Brothers Grimm!
description_web: Stories and fables for children, 7 pm nightly. This year's theme will be The Brothers Grimm. All are welcome to attend; children must have adult escort.

location: Courtesan College (Strawberry Fields B06 (off eLeri Lane between Ankara and Visby Vale))
name: Writing for Raunch and Romance - CCt
description_book: Beginner poet? Curious about pre-1600 forms, ye olde English conventions, and dirty language? Come for a lesson, sample language, & good fun. **18+**
description_web:
This class is designed to be self-moldable by each participant. Several pre-1600 conventional poetic forms will be available for participant perusal, including sonnets, ballades, and sestinas, as well as topic-driven poetry that holds less stringent conventions. Mundanely an English teacher with degrees in Creative Writing and Literature, de Luna is accustomed to helping people reach personal goals in a group setting. Participants may also practice presenting their work or the work of period poets, if desired. Repeat attendance permitted beyond material limits, participants are welcome but not required to bring their own writing supplies.
Note: many forms are not language specific; instructor only speaks English. **Age 18+.**
fee_itemization: I am going to be providing pens, pencils, sharpeners, paper handouts including form references for each type of poem as well as (English) language samples and paper to write on. In fact, I will probably have more things available. If I really need to justify every penny of $5 a person, I will end up eating all of my expenses like I do at work.

name: T(w)een Lounge: Welcome To War Meet-n-Greet
description_book: **Age 12-17.** Join us at Family Point for a chance to meet other teens and 'tweens at Pennsic.

name: *Commedia* Frescoes Slideshow: *Trausnitz*
description_book: *Commedia* Frescoes Slideshow: *The Trausnitz Narrentreppe*, period source for masks, physicality, action, vulgarity. Age **18+**

instructor: Aule og Amon Amarth The Wizard
name: The Next Degeneration Party
description_book: Held by the Church of Debauchery hosted by the Wizard and Cadre, W10, where the Church is. With Turkish coffee from Your Inner Vagabond. **18+**
description_web: It's a next generation party held by the Church of Debauchery hosted by the Wizard and Cadre, W10, where the Church is. Come and carry the light forth into the next generation. Make memories and new friends as we welcome you all home. Turkish coffee from Your Inner Vagabond. Non-alcoholic beverages will also be had. **Age 18+.**

name: Intermediate Archery Class
description_book: Designed to improve your skills beyond basic archery. Class will concentrate on range shoots and War Point shooting.
description_web: Archers must bring their own equipment to the range.
fee_itemization: None

name: Yoga for Fighters,  Dancers and Everybody
description_book: Yoga for all levels! Bring mat or towel for the floor & strap, scarf, or strip of cloth for class if you can; some loaner gear available.
description_web:
Yoga for all levels! Bring mat or towel for the floor & strap, scarf, or strip of cloth for class if you can; some loaner mats and straps will be available. If you have blocks, please bring them if you can! This class is geared for folks who have never done yoga through seasoned practitioners. Amendments for poses will be offered as we go, and each class will build upon the one before, however, anyone can jump in at anytime. 
Class will begin with a few minutes of breath work followed by approximately 45 minutes of yoga.

name: Coffee with Friends of Bill and Dr Bob
description_book: Open agnostic 12-Step meetings.
description_web: Open agnostic 12-Step meetings. From 8:00 am-9:00 am.

name: *Études* 2 and 3 for Single Sword (Fencing)
description_book: These drill sequences will focus on form, balance, movement, and coordination. For beginners, intermediates, and teachers alike.
description_web: For beginner and intermediate fencers and those who teach them. These drills will focus on form, balance, movement and coordination. *Étude* 2 is thrust centric. *Étude* 2 adds diversity of cuts. Emphasis will be on learning the *études* for home drill, as well as taking elements out of the drill for more focused work in groups.

name: Youth Heavy List Skills, Games, and Drills
description_book: Daily morning regular practices to be run from 8:30 till 11 am on the Pennsic Battlefield Youth List. Youth aged 6-17. Loaner gear will be available.
description_web: Daily morning regular practices to be run from 8:30 till 11 am on the Pennsic Battlefield Youth List. Youth aged 6-17, all levels of experience on three different list fields. Loaner gear will be available.

name: Ask a Scribe
description_book: These drop-in classes are ideal for scribes of all levels to speak one-on-one with an experienced scribe for help and advice.
description_web: These are informal drop-in classes for any scribe who's looking for advice, guidance, or help with any aspect of calligraphy and/or illumination. Several different experienced scribes will be hosting these sessions during Peace Week and War Week.

name: Beginning Bobbin Lace
description_book: Three-day class for a total of 9 hours. Learn the basic movements and make three basic projects. Start a period pattern.
description_web: This is a three-day class for a total of 9 hours of bobbin lace! First Day: Students will learn the basic movements of bobbin lace and begin a project. Second Day: Students will finish the project and learn some simple grounds. Third Day: Students will begin a period pattern from the *Nüw Modelbuch*.
fee_itemization: $30 – One-time fee for all three days. Includes pillow with cover, bobbin holder, 10 pair of bobbins, pins, handout, patterns

name: Beginning Tatting, Part 1
description_book: Tatting is a type of lacemaking. Supplies can be found at craft stores. Learn a craft that fits in a Ziploc bag, can be done in the car, or at court!
description_web: Tatting is a type of lacemaking. Supplies can be found at most craft stores. Learn a craft that fits in a Ziploc bag, and can be done in the car or at court! Focus is on learning how to make both parts of the double stitch flip every time, forming the double stitch and making a ring of double stitches. If no one teaches tatting in your home area, here's your opportunity to learn. Students from previous years are always welcome to stop by for a refresher.
fee_itemization: I provide prewound shuttles and a handout with directions and projects.

name: The History and Development of the Houppelande
description_book: A discussion of the history and development of the houppelande, the last universal style in Europe for men and women. Pattern discussion included.
description_web: A discussion of the history and development of the houppelande, the last universal style in Europe for men and women. Pattern discussion included. From pictorial sources, we will look at the way the houppelande developed and where it headed in each region of Europe. We will look at two different pattern ideas and what makes them each work.
fee_itemization: $7 for a full-color thick handout.  15 handouts available.

name: Drop Spinning 101
description_book: Want to learn to drop spin or have had a hard time picking it up? Learn using a high whorl spindle. Spindles and wool will be provided.
description_web: Want to learn to drop spin or have had a hard time picking it up? Come and learn using a high whorl spindle. Spindles and wool will be provided. Spindles can be purchased for $3.00.

name: Modern Media & the SCA: Making Them Work Together
description_book: How to connect with modern media to share the SCA on a larger scale and provide a good story for the news.
description_web: Reaching people who are interested in the SCA can be difficult; reaching a large number at once even more so. In this class, Æthelmearc Media Liaison and broadcast journalist Baron Arias Beltran del Valle discusses how to reach out to modern media and share activities and events with them, while also adhering to Society media policies. Includes what to do (and not to do!) when the media arrives at an event. Included in the discussion will be suggestions on how to make an event more interesting to news outlets. We'll touch on rights given to the reporters and to participants. We'll also discuss who should be involved in preparations for meeting the media at an event, and how to present the best face for your group!

name: Wood Block Stamping and Stenciling on Fabric
description_book: Using woodblock stamps to print on fabric is hundreds of years old and is period for the SCA time frame. Come give it a try!
description_web: Using woodblock stamps to print on fabric is hundreds of years old and is period for the SCA time frame. The class will have a discussion on the history of the craft and the handout will include a timeline and detailed instructions on how to print on fabric. This is a hands-on class. Come on out and learn how to enhance anything that is fabric.
fee_itemization: Each kit will include a woodblock stamp, a stencil, a piece of fabric, a felt base to work on, and plates as palettes. All of these are for the students to keep. Paint and other supplies to share will be provided in class.

name: Wire Jewelry
description_book: Learn the basics of wire jewelry and make a bracelet or medallion hanger. Bring tools and materials if you have them.
description_web: Learn the basics of wire jewelry (making links with beads on them) and make a bracelet or medallion hanger. **Note: Class does not include wrapping a stone or bead**. Please bring tools, wire and beads if you have them. There will be some tools available to borrow and some to purchase at cost.
fee_itemization:
$2 - beads, wire, clasp
$10-$20 - Tools

name: Pins and Brooches and Buttons, Oh, My!
description_book: Hands-on survey of period clothing closures and how to use them. Covers antiquity to 1600, and all the cultures that I have time for.
description_web: Survey of period clothing closures and how to use them. Covers antiquity to 1600, and all the cultures that I have time for. Includes information on where to purchase these items and how to use them. I will pass around actual closures and demonstrate their use. Bring your questions!
fee_itemization: $4 for handout

name: Embroidery: How Do I Do That!?!
description_book: Embroidery for the absolute beginner. Come out and learn a few easy stitches!
description_web: Embroidery for the absolute beginner. Do you want to decorate your garb or projects but aren't sure where to start? Come learn a few easy stitches. See some examples of basic embroidery projects. Sample fabric, needle and thread provided. Please bring scissors and a small embroidery hoop if you have them. Strict limit of 10 students! Handouts will be given to everyone but kits and hands-on teaching will be limited to 10.
fee_itemization:
Embroidery floss
Needles
Hoops
Sample fabric

name: Modern Gaming: Peace Week
description_book: A place, with power, to play modern games from 9 am to 10:30 pm every day.

name: History of Sheep
description_book: Discussion of the history of sheep breeds and which ones would have been available before 1600.
description_web: Sheep have been domesticated since around 10,000 BC. They can be used for wool, meat and milk production. We will discuss the history of sheep breeds and which ones would have been available before 1600.
fee_itemization: Printing charge.

name: Introduction to *Kumihimo*
description_book: Learn the ancient Japanese art of *kumihimo*. This is a hands-on beginner class and each kit contains all you need to complete a *kumihimo* cord.
description_web: Learn the Japanese art of weaving/braiding. Kit includes all you need to make a *kumihimo* cord, instructions, and a brief history of *kumihimo*.
fee_itemization:
Foam disk
Craft yarn
Counter weight
Kumihimo history
Kumihimo instruction
Instructions on various patterns
Basic plastic embroidery floss bobbins

name: Goldwork Sampler
description_book: Create a goldwork sampler while trying a couple of different techniques using real metal threads.
description_web: We will discuss the use of metal thread embroidery in European embroideries of the Middle Ages. We will learn more about the types of metal thread used, what the various threads were, how to use them, and we will make a sampler of stitches to keep so you can use it as a reference. We will be using real metal thread, a very good quality linen for the ground fabric, and silk thread. This class will be taught in 3 sessions. The third session relies on the techniques learned in the earlier classes; attendance at both of the first two classes is encouraged, but it is possible to participate in the 3rd class if you were only able to attend one of the other classes. Different techniques will be covered in each class, and they will build on each other. Bring your scissors, and eyeglasses if you need them. Everything else you need will be in the kit. The kit will include an embroidery hoop, fabric, an acid free marker, needles, wool felt, cotton thread for padding, silk thread, gilded leather, and a variety of real metal threads.
fee_itemization: A variety of metal threads, silk thread, linen thread, linen fabric, silk fabric, and all supplies needed except scissors.

name: Scroll Painting for the Very Young
description_book: We have scroll blanks and water colors! You have a 2- to 7-year-old who wants to paint! Let's combine them, and everyone will win.

name: Inkle Weaving Basics
description_book: Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and weave an inkle strip on our mini inkle loom.
description_web: Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and weave an inkle strip on our mini inkle loom. Classroom loaner looms provided. Class limited to 10 looms.
fee_itemization: weaving materials, string, & instructions

name: Youth Rapier Activities
description_book: There will be a variety of youth rapier activities each day including drills, games and one-on-one instruction. Some loaner gear will be available.
description_web: There will be a variety of youth rapier activities each day including drills, games and one-on-one instruction. Some days may include special additional activities. Some loaner gear will be available. Participants do not have to be authorized. Children age 6 and up may participate. Please bring your parent/guardian the first day you attend to learn more about the youth rapier program.

location: The Camp of the Three Bears (N17 along Battle Road)
name: Cooking with Crockery on a Campfire
description_book: Practice and discuss cooking over fire using period crockery pots and skillets.
description_web: A practicum on cooking over fire using period crockery pots and skillets. We'll provide the fire, some food, and a limited supply of crockery, and advice. You'll actually heat the crockery and cook, getting a feel for how to use these tools. Feel free to bring your own pots or pipkins if you want to take them for a run with support.

name: *Qigong* and *Taiji* Flow
description_book: *Qigong* exercises have been used for health and well-being in China for many centuries. Come and wake up with some morning movement.
description_web: *Qigong* and *Tai Chi* exercises have been used for health and well-being in China for many centuries. This class will include many ancient moves that will help you get ready for your day at Pennsic, whether it’s going to war, performing, shopping, or just relaxing in camp. This is a follow-along *Qigong*-style set to music. No experience or special abilities required; just come and enjoy the movement.

name: *Iki*: Composing Japanese Scroll Texts
description_book: Learn to compose Japanese-style writs, edicts, and petitions. Based on a 16th-c manual by João Rodrigues with ancient and medieval Japanese exemplars.
description_web: An introduction to Japanese diplomata along with the methods by which they are attested and delivered. The structure of Japanese official documents and correspondence is rather different from the textual style in Society documents, letters, and public announcements. This class introduces Japanese epistolatory style and the structures commonly found in official documents. This class will also introduce a few Japanese words which might appear as the header for an official document as well as several stylistic features of official Japanese writing both in Japanese and in English.
fee_itemization: There will be a multipage handout.

name: Introduction to A&S Documentation
description_book: We'll focus on approaches to documentation for projects in the SCA.
description_web: Whether you are creating an item for a competition, a gift, or simply a step in developing a skill or craft, it's generally a good idea to write down a few notes on your ideas, thoughts and lessons learned - all of which creates the seed to become documentation. Documentation need not be a "one size fits all" situation. This class will include a discussion of the essential elements, customizing your documentation, and when to start this process.

name: How to Write Poetry Like a Well-Mannered Brute!
description_book: A poetry workshop for the aspiring heart! An introduction to various period-specific forms. Come with longing, leave with poems of your own devising!
description_web: A poetry workshop for the aspiring heart! An introduction to various period-specific forms, devices, figurative language, the mysteries of enjambment, and the acrostic! Come with longing, leave with poems of your own devising!

name: Getting and Using Feedback for A&S
description_book: How to ask for and use feedback on your Arts & Sciences work. We will cover consent, communication, and best practices.
description_web: Getting useful feedback can be challenging and sometimes nerve wracking. Learn best practices for consent and communication as well as strategies for how to use the advice you're given. This class will focus on feedback for Arts and Sciences work, but will easily be applicable to other situations.
fee_itemization: A $1 fee will cover a handout with outline.

name: How to Make Period Furniture that Packs Flat
description_book: Make medieval-style beds, tables, and chests that pack flat for travel and snap together in minutes. Requires a beginner's skill and simple tools.
description_web: Learn how to make medieval-style beds, tables, and cooler chests that pack flat for travel and snap together in minutes. Requires a beginner's level of skill and simple tools.
fee_itemization: publication costs

name: The *Gest of Robin Hood*
description_book: This early poetic recounting of the legendary "hero" contains many surprises and fascinating insights on social practices.

name: Nalbinding: How to Make Socks That Fit
description_book: Students need to be familiar with at least one basic stitch. We will learn how to start the socks and how to do the heel.
description_web: Attending students need to be familiar with at least one basic stitch in order to attend this class. We will discuss and practice how to start the socks with either a round or flat start. Secondly, we will discuss and practice how to create a heel that fits in any circumstance. Bring your own wool and needle; material will not be supplied by teacher.

name: Finding Your Niche: Getting Started in A&S
description_book: How to find your direction or apply your modern-day expertise when entering into A&S studies.
description_web: Do you feel lost when thinking about A&S topics in the SCA? Do you have a specialty you are good at, but are worried it is not "medieval enough"? This class is an open discussion on how to focus on what you know and what you already do well and apply it toward a more concrete A&S presentation or class. We'll use some examples and do some brainstorming in your particular interests.

location: Atlantian Royal (Fiber Arts Pavilion) (Block N40, front edge of the Atlantian Royal Encampment, in the Artisans Easement)
name: Inkle Weaving: Pattern Design
description_book: Learn common motifs used in complex inkle patterns and how to pattern those motifs. Will also touch on how to reverse engineer a pattern.
description_web: Inkle weaving is used to craft bands of trim or tapes which can be used for a variety of purposes. This class will focus on common motifs used in complex inkle patterns and how to pattern those motifs. We will also touch on how to reverse engineer a pattern from an existing piece of inkle trim.

location: Budgardr (W09 South side of True Way just west of Enchanted Ground)
name: Blacksmithing: An Introduction - Making an S-hook
description_book:
We'll use a solid-fuel forge to create this useful item. Focus: technique & efficiency, function & beauty.
The first 4 students get hands-on. **18+**

name: *Kumihimo* on the *Marudai*: Getting Started
description_book: Learn to set up a *marudai* round braiding stand for *kumihimo* braiding.
description_web: *Kumihimo* braiding on the round braiding stand is faster and more traditional than braiding on a disc or plate. Learning to set up a *marudai* for braiding can be the biggest barrier to getting started. If you are having trouble setting up your *marudai*, or haven't acquired one yet and want to learn how before investing, this class is for you. Students will learn how to measure material for custom lengths, construct multi-ply bundles for smoother braiding, wind material onto traditional *tama* bobbins (including how to tie the special knot), and load this material onto the *marudai*. If time allows, you may be able to get started with a braid. Please bring your own equipment if you have it, otherwise some equipment can be provided.

location: Courtesan College (Strawberry Fields B06 (off eLeri Lane between  Ankara and Visby Vale))
name: The Riddle Ages: Old English Riddles & Poems - CCt
description_book: Get ready to blush and laugh in equal measure as we decode the raunchy riddles and saucy poems of Old English. Warning: not for the prudish! **18+.**
description_web:
Get ready to blush and laugh in equal measure as we decode the raunchy riddles and saucy poems of Old English. Warning: not for the prudish!
Our main source will be the *Exeter Book*. *The Exeter Book* is a 10th-century manuscript of Anglo-Saxon poetry and riddles. It is one of the four major collections of Old English literature. It contains a diverse range of poems, including religious and secular works, elegies, and riddles. Many of the poems in the *Exeter Book* are considered masterpieces of Anglo-Saxon literature and provide valuable insights into the culture and society of the time. **Age 18+.**

name: Paint the European Dance Floor
description_book: Come and help paint the European Dance Floor. Supplies are provided. Modern clothes are acceptable (you do not have to ruin garb)
description_web: Come and help paint the European Dance Floor. Supplies are provided. Modern clothes are acceptable (you do not have to ruin garb)  (actually 2 hours)

name: Make a Pouch!
description_book: Learn to sew and create something useful for the rest of Pennsic! Create a pouch to carry your things.

name: Using a Medieval Low Bench
description_book: Introducing an example of a medieval low woodworking bench, showing the tool kit of a woodworker, and demonstrating the use of the bench. **Age18+.**
description_web: This class will introduce the idea of using a low bench for the production of wooden furniture, etc. A list of tools will be provided along with working examples. A bench will be available in order to illustrate how to build the bench, how to use it, demonstrate the work-holding devices, and use the tools/bench to complete various woodworking tasks, including joints. **Age 18+.**
fee_itemization: $2 fee for a 4 page handout.

name: Storytelling Academy
description_book: Explore genres, tools, styles, and uses of storytelling. Cultural and medieval approaches, applications, performance coaching. New topics each day.
description_web: During this academy, students will gain knowledge about the history and techniques for storytelling both in the SCA and the modern world. Students may attend individual sessions or all of the academy. There may be guest teachers and will be time for students to practice and receive feedback. The academy may culminate in a student performance. No classes are repeated. The focus is on developing comfort, nurturing, and honing skills within the students’ capabilities. All levels are welcome. Students may view a class outline at the academy space, Minerva’s Spindle 158, where classes will also be listed on the message board. Seating is limited; feel free to bring your own chair. Student Performance, date, time, and location will be announced.

name: Known World Choir Rehearsals
description_book: Join the oldest Pennsic Choir as we rehearse in preparation for a concert on Thursday of War Week. Previous KWC Directors have been invited.
description_web: The Known World Choir, along with the Children's and Youth Choirs, and *Chorulus Pennsicus* will present a concert of medieval and Renaissance choral literature. Previous Directors of the KWC have been invited to conduct a selection. Bring a 1/2 inch black binder or plan to purchase one for use during the concert for $5. **Over age 18.** (There is a Youth Choir for those 12-18.)
fee_itemization: Copies of KWC Literature. $5 more if you wish to keep the 1/2 Inch Black Binder

name: Early Bird Tournament 17
description_book: Pick fights, take names and get acquainted.
description_web: Pick fights, take names and get acquainted. The purpose of this tourney isn't to win the most bouts, but to find the most interesting facts about your opponents. **"More talk! Less fighting!"** Who will the MIC give the bird to this year?

name: Beginner Thrown Weapons
description_book: Learn axe throwing, basic care of your weapons, and basic rules. A hands-on session is included. Limit of 25 participants; no experience necessary.
description_web: Learn axe throwing, basic care of your weapons, and basic rules. A hands-on session is included. Limit of 25 participants; no experience necessary.

name: *Mehteran*: Ottoman *Janissary* Band
description_book: *Osmanlı Mehter Takımı* studies music & history of the Ottoman *Mehter* military marching band of the 14th-17th C for Pennsic performance. **18+**
description_web: The *Osmanlı Mehter Takımı* (Ottoman *Janissary* Band) studies music and history of the Ottoman *Mehter* military marching band from the 14th-17th century. The *Mehteran* will learn the historic Ottoman songs, *Ceddin Deden*, *Osman Pasa*, and *Nevâ-Ceng-i Harbî* which are played on *zurna, davul*, horns, cymbals, and kettledrums, and sung by a choir, and will learn the historic *Janissary* march for performance at Pennsic. Brass horn players, percussionists and singers are welcome and encouraged to participate. Further details on the *Mehteran* Facebook Group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/134233213955988/ . **Age 18+.**

name: Weed Walk
description_book: Wild plant identification. Wear walking shoes and hat; leave from Univ. Point. Different teachers on different days; walk with us more than once!
description_web: Cooper's Lake abounds with medicinal and food plants that were used by various primitive and medieval cultures. Learn to identify them during a walk around the campsite. The walk will take place rain or shine. Please wear sturdy shoes and a hat. Meet at University Point for the start of the class. We have multiple teachers, so if you attend more than one walk, you will likely learn different things!

name: Known World Adventurers Guild: **Social Day**
description_book: Informal meetup for teen explorers (and youth 10+). Social Days alternate with Walk Days (see separate class info) - KWAGuild.com
description_web: All teens (and youth 10+) are welcome at these informal meetups for the Known World Adventurers Guild. Our Social Days alternate with KWAG Walk Days. See separate class info.

location: Heralds Point (Herald's Point, behind the playground. )
name: Heralds' Mentoring Meet-Up at Heralds' Point
description_book: A heraldic staff member will discuss your mentoring needs (armory or names). We will find you someone to shadow.
description_web: A heraldic staff member will discuss your mentoring needs (armory or names). We will find you someone to shadow.

instructor: Master Piero di Paxiti da Vincenza
name: The Angle and the Line: Calligraphy
description_book: Learn how pen angle strongly directs the shape of your letter forms in broad nib calligraphy. Learn to develop a "feel" for different period hands.

name: Peace Week Archery Practice
description_book: Warm up, practice shoot, and have fun on the Archery Range. Peace Week, Wednesday through Friday
description_web: Warm up, practice shoot, and have fun on the Archery Range. Ranges will be open depending upon marshal availability. Peace Week, Wednesday through Friday.

name: Heian Get Ready With Me: Traveling Outfit
description_book: Demonstration of how to use modern theatrical makeup to achieve a period aesthetic and how to put on a traveling outfit without help.
description_web: See the process of getting dressed in a Heian Japanese traveling outfit from makeup to hat.  Demonstration of modern theatrical makeup application to achieve a plausibly period look and discussion of how to manage with more or less makeup and time. Demonstration of how to get dressed in the ensemble's multiple layers without assistance.

name: Women Pirates
description_book: Women pirates in the Middle Ages -- and beyond.
description_web: Piracy: It’s not just for Jack Sparrow anymore. We will discuss women who chose to take up the profession of piracy. What did it take to be a woman pirate in an occupation dominated by men? What were their motivations? What happened to them? Come and learn about these bold women through their stories and we’ll try to separate fact from fiction. Let's dish out the dirt on these dastardly damsels!

name: Period Fabrics and Modern Sources
description_book: Back for Pennsic 50, learn about what fabrics were used in period and where to find them today. Make a swatch book with samples to help when shopping.
description_web: Learn about what fabrics were used in clothing during the Middle Ages and Renaissance in Western Europe. Learn about how and where we can find these fabrics for our own garb. We will make a swatch book,so you have some physical examples to help when you’re trying to identify and compare the fabric. The class is back after a long break for Pennsic 50. The instructor has over a decade of experience working in fabric stores and making garb for family, friends and strangers.

name: *Xia*: The Chinese Knight-Errant
description_book: An examination of the history and motivations of Chinese *youxia*.  **Age 18+.**
description_web: A discussion of how chivalry was practiced in China in the Middle Ages. This class will cover how *Xia* is different from Western chivalry, how it is the same, and ways to incorporate these into your persona. **Age 18+.**

name: Learn to Spin
description_book: Introduction to spinning on a spindle, focusing on the park-and-draft method.
description_web: Focusing on the park-and-draft method, we’ll walk through the basics of how to spin wool into yarn. This is intended for people who have never spun before, or people who need a refresher for that spindle they bought three years ago and never quite figured out. We will focus on basic spinning techniques, not necessarily period techniques. Spindle and fiber will be provided, but feel free to bring any spinning implement or fiber you may already possess.

name: Sijilmassa: Gateway to the Sahara Desert
description_book: Through archeological evidence, maps, and 1st person accounts, we will explore medieval Sijilmassa; its history, culture, and defining industries.
description_web: At the northern edge of the Sahara desert, the medieval oasis of Sijilmassa developed into a major center of trade between Africa, Europe, and Asia. This class will cover the history of the city, highlighting cultures and industries that defined the region; focusing on (but not limited to) influence by the Amazigh/Berber, Tuareg, and Jewish populations.
fee_itemization: N/A

name: Ships in the SCA Period: A Chronological Overview
description_book: A comprehensive overview of the development of ships in western Europe between 600 and 1600.
description_web: A comprehensive overview of the development of ships in western Europe between 600 and 1600.

name: Street Smarts
description_book: What's in a name? A folkloric history of Pennsic geography: how the streets and areas of Pennsic came by their distinctive designations.
description_web: What's in a name? A folkloric history of Pennsic geography: how the streets and areas of Pennsic came by their distinctive designations.

location: Atlantian Royal (Fiber Arts Pavilion) (Block N40, front edge of the Atlantian Royal Encampment)
name: Inkle Weaving: Warping Your Loom
description_book: We'll focus on modern inkle loom anatomy, pattern reading, loom setup, and how to weave an inkle band. Looms not provided.
description_web: Inkle weaving is used to craft bands of trim or tapes which can be used for a variety of purposes. This class will focus on modern inkle loom anatomy, pattern reading, loom setup, and how to weave an inkle band. Looms will not be provided. Please bring a loom if you want to set up a warp during the class. Crochet cotton will be available on a first-come, first-served basis.

name: It's hot! Make a Hand Fan
description_book: Class will include making and decorating hand fans.

name: Games of Chance: *Gluckhaus*Lotto (Crown & Anchor)
description_book: Learn these two games of chance so you can sit down at a gaming table with confidence and maybe even run a gaming table.
description_web: Learn these two games of chance so you can sit down at a gaming table with confidence and maybe even run a gaming table.

name: Scribing on Parchment
description_book: Interesting in scribing on parchment, but intimidated by the material? This class is a hands-on introduction to tools, materials, and techniques.
fee_itemization: Handmade vellum to experiment on and take with you, 4x6

name: Indigo *Sutras*: Illuminated Buddhist Manuscripts
description_book: Black Hours have nothing on these! Learn how the need for preservation resulted in one of the most visually arresting forms of Buddhist art.

name: Pilgrimage and Power: The Travelling Outfit
description_book: Discussion of why Heian noblewomen went on pilgrimage and what they wore.
description_web: While the life of a Heian noblewoman was fairly sedentary, she could take pilgrimages to temples near the capitol, Heiankyo. We will discuss the reasons noble women of the Heian period (794-1186) undertook these pilgrimages and what they wore on those journeys.

name: Codes, Ciphers and Cryptography: 600BC to 1600AD
description_book: An introduction of codes, ciphers, cryptography, plus other intelligence tools from the Ancient Greeks to the death of Mary Queen of Scots.
description_web: An introduction of codes, ciphers, cryptography, plus other intelligence tools from the Ancient Greeks to the death of Mary Queen of Scots: a Lochac perspective.

name: Eating with Your Hands: Arabic Dining Etiquette
description_book: Eating with your hands is not simple. The complex rules for dining in the medieval Arabic-speaking world and how not to get thrown out of a banquet.
description_web: Eating with your hands is not a simple thing. We will discuss the complex rules for dining in the medieval Arabic-speaking world, how to be a good guest, and how to avoid getting thrown out of a banquet. Based on both manuals of behavior and satirical writings.

name: A Bardic Primer
description_book: “You’re only as good as your next performance.” If it will be your first, how to be ready. If you have performed before, how to be better each time.

name: Rock Painting to Make a Rock Dragon
description_book: Come paint a rock with acrylic paints and add it to our Rock Dragon (location of dragon tbd). All ages and abilities welcome!

name: Navigating by the Stars
description_book: Learn a critical medieval skill: how to navigate by the stars, moon, and sun! Simple and advanced navigational tricks for orienteering.
description_web: Learn a critical medieval skill: how to navigate by the stars, moon, and sun! All skill levels covered, from "I can't find Orion" to "I have built my own telescope." I will explain simple and advanced navigational tricks so that anyone can orient themselves at any time. Handy whether you're lost in the Bog, a survivalist, or simply want to know what your persona would have known. Please note: This is a daytime astronomy class!
fee_itemization: Handout -- $1 donation

name: Tips for Teaching a Better A&S Class
description_book: Helpful tips for new teachers to make it simpler and more efficient to turn your ideas into classes.
description_web: Do you have a skill or information you want to share but don’t know where to start? A&S classes can be a lot of work to develop and present, especially if you have never taught before. This class aims to provide some helpful tips to make it simpler and more efficient to turn your ideas into classes that are both easy for you to teach and easy for your students to understand.

name: Early Period Book Club: *The Shipwrecked Sailor*
description_book: Open discussion of *The Tale of the Shipwrecked Sailor,* a Middle Kingdom Ancient Egyptian tale in verse. Pre-reading not required but recommended.
description_web: This class will be an open discussion format, and attendees are not required, but are highly encouraged, to read the work prior to attendance. We will be discussing *The Tale of the Shipwrecked Sailor*, which is a Middle Kingdom Ancient Egyptian tale in verse. A translation by Casey Christian has been made freely available by him online and has excellent context and background: https://christiancasey.github.io/Casey%20Christian%20(2008)%20The%20Story%20of%20the%20Shipwrecked%20Sailor.pdf . A version is also available in The Literature of the Ancient Egyptians by E. A. Wallis Budge, which is in the public domain. My preferred translation is by William Kelly Simpson in The Literature of Ancient Egypt (2003), which is not in the public domain.  Any of these should work for the discussion. Instructor will open with a brief introduction of the work and its historical context, and then will move into open discussion.

name: Neurodiversity in the SCA
description_book: Join me in a discussion on how the Society has been built in a way to provide a safe port in a storm of non-acceptance, and how it continues to do so.
description_web: Join me in a discussion on how the Society has been built in a way to provide a safe port in a storm of non-acceptance, and how it can provide help and growth by the way it functions.

name: Pennsic: You’re Here! Now what?
description_book: This class will give you ideas for activities and answer common questions about the largest SCA event in the Knowne World!
description_web: You’ve made it to the largest SCA event in the Knowne World! Now what is there to do? This class will give you ideas for things to see, places to visit, and answer any questions about the event or the SCA, in general.

name: Frame Drumming 101
description_book: *Tar, bendir, lag-na, Patayani thappu* . . . Frame drums are built and played every where/when we study. A hands-on introduction to hand drumming.
description_web: *Tar, bendir, lag-na, Patayani thappu* . . . Frame drums are built and played every where/when we study. We'll introduce some of the more common varieties of hand drums as well as their fundamental techniques. Some discussion of stick-played drums is included, but this is not the emphasis. *Bodhrans* are allowed but not recommended. A limited number of loaner drums will be available.

name: Advanced 15th-Century Dance: *Fia Guilemina a due*
description_book: Set to a beautiful song, the most complicated, yet elegant, 15th-C couple's dance of which we know. Impress both the crowd and yourselves.
description_web: Set to a beautiful song, the most complicated, yet elegant, 15th-century couple's dance of which we know. You and your partner will impress both the crowd and yourselves.

name: Frying Pan Bread and Pastries
description_book: A demonstration of a period flatbread recipe and two or three period pastry recipes, all of which can be made in a frying pan over your campfire.
description_web: A demonstration of a period flatbread recipe and two period pastry recipes, all of which can be made in a frying pan over your campfire. The flatbread is 10th-century Middle Eastern; the pastries are 13th-century Andalusian. The class will be taught in persona.

name: Instrumental Dances of the 16th and 17th Centuries
description_book: Dance music of the 16th and 17th centuries for instruments (mostly). All instruments welcome.
description_web: Dance music of the 16th and 17th centuries for instruments (mostly). All instruments welcome.

name: Readers' Theatre: Rehearsal
description_book: Rehearsal: script-in-hand performance of an original script titled *The Reckoning* by John St. Dennis, known in the SCA as Master Lorcan Dracontius.
description_web: Readers' Theatre is a style of theater in which the actors present dramatic readings of narrative material without costumes, props, scenery, or special lighting. Actors do not need to memorize lines; they just read scripts in hand. Rehearsal Day 1 is an introduction and read through of the script before determining roles. Rehearsal for script-in-hand performance of an original script titled *The Reckoning* by John St. Dennis, known in the SCA as Master Lorcan Dracontius. The storyline consists of a re-imagining of the origins of Shakespeare's play "Twelfth Night".

instructor: Aule og Amon Amarth The Wizard
name: A Guide to Viking Age Living History
description_book: What it takes to do faithful Viking Age living history/reenactment. Identifying what is accurate and what is not.
description_web: What it takes to do faithful Viking Age living history/reenactment. Identifying what is accurate and what is not. The European festivals are more strict on what's allowed. This class is to help refine what changes you would like to make. You'll get to learn about some of the misinformation surrounding certain finds. About the instructor: The Wizard has been a living Viking Age historian for the past 10 years. He is a professional bladesmith and jeweler, teaching Viking Age combat as well as making the swords. He has spoken at several museums around the world, including Moesgaard Museum, Solothern Armory, Centrum Slowian i Wikingow, Franklin Institute, and the Metropolitan. His presentations have included period clothing and making jewelry. Other topics included the progression of sword types and techniques of using them.

name: Speed Introduction to *Commedia*
description_book: An introductory-level class covering basic history of Italian *Commedia* and stock characters with opportunities to play short scenes to try them out.
description_web: An introductory-level class covering basic history of *Commedia dell' Arte*, the 16th-century Italian improvisational comic theater, and its stock characters with opportunities to play short scenes to try them out. We will play some theater improv games, so all students will participate! We'll also cover how to make *Commedia* happen in the modern SCA. Instructors are from the troupe *Commedia All Stars.*

name: Late Antique Secular Manuscript Illumination
description_book: A discussion from an art historical perspective of the surviving non-biblical manuscripts from prior to 600 C.E.
description_web: A discussion from an art historical perspective of the few surviving non-biblical manuscripts from prior to 600 C.E plus a look at surviving Carolingian Renaissance manuscripts thought to be close copies of ancient manuscripts. Manuscripts to be discussed include several papyrus fragments, the Vatican and Roman *Virgils*, the *Ambrosian Iliad*, the Vienna *Dioscurides*, the *Corpus Agrimensorum Romanorum* and the Carolingian manuscripts the *Bern Physiologus*, the Leiden *Aratea*, the Vatican *Terence* and the Morgan *Dioscurides*.

name: The Pennsic Mightier: Improv Workshop
description_book: Improv workshop for experienced performers: address higher level improv skills, create character, build scenes leading to a performance. **Age limit**
description_web: This improv workshop is designed to address intermediate and advanced level improv skills focused on creating unique characters, building relationships, committing to a scene, and exploring long-form improv. Long-form improv is a building block for work in *commedia* and sketch comedy. The character and scene work will improve your overall acting skills as well as building confidence in everyday life. This workshop will culminate in a performance on Friday 8/5 in the Performing Arts Tent; however, the performance is optional if you would prefer to attend the workshops without performing live. You must have prior improv experience (modern experience or prior Pennsic classes, etc.) and be familiar with the basics of “Yes, and” to participate in this class. Those without experience may be allowed at the instructor’s discretion. You do not have to attend every workshop; however, different skills will be addressed each day and attendance at all is beneficial. The Friday workshop is mandatory if you would like to perform in the show. **This class is for ages 18 and up; however, younger students may be allowed with both parental and instructor permission.** Please attend the first workshop (with a parent, for those under 18) or contact the instructor in advance to participate.

name: Jesus Christ: War Chief
description_book: An examination of the *Heliand*, a retelling of the gospel of Jesus from the point of view of the Saxon warrior culture.
description_web: The *Heliand* is a retelling of the gospel of Jesus from the point of view of the Saxon warrior culture. We will examine this primary source for insight into the use of epic poetry in converting the Saxons to Christianity in the 9th century.

name: Nigel's Fire-Starting Class
description_book: You too can start a fire with flint and steel. Explore the history of fire and how to start a fire with flint and steel. You will make fire. **14+**
description_web: Formerly titled “How to Start a Fire Like a Moderately Intelligent Saxon”. Yes, you too can start a fire with flint and steel like a Saxon, Roman, Viking, or any other civilized culture in the Middle Ages. Includes history of fire and the flint-and-steel mechanics of starting a fire. Hands-on class; you will start a fire. **You must be at least 14 years old** and have your parents' or wife’s permission.
fee_itemization: Instructor is not charging for the materials.

name: The Richest Man Who Ever Lived: Jakob Fugger
description_book: A look at the life of the richest man who ever lived (depending how you calculate it), Jakob Fugger: the Augsburg banker who financed Europe.
description_web: A look at the life of the richest man who ever lived (depending how you calculate it), Jakob Fugger: the Augsburg banker who financed Popes, Kings and Emperors. His fortune would today be valued between 300 and 400 billion US dollars.  Fugger is responsible for redefining banking and finance as well as establishing modern capitalism. His impact reached across Europe.

name: Really Basic Leather Stamping for Teens
description_book: Come make a bracelet and/or a bookmark and learn the loud art of leather stamping!

name: The Way of Saint James: Pilgrims to Santiago
description_book: We examine the legends, history, battles, miracles, and lore of Spain's *Camino de Santiago*, in period and today, taught by former pilgrims.
description_web: We will examine the legends, history, and lore of the *Camino de Santiago*, with special emphasis on the nature of medieval pilgrimage, sites of special historic, religious, and cultural importance along the route, plus advice for planning and completing the pilgrimage today. Taught by former pilgrims. *¡Buen camino!*

name: Early Period Book Club: *Njal's Saga*
description_book: Open discussion of the 13th-century Icelandic epic *Njal's Saga*, transl. by George Dascent (1861).  Pre-reading not required but encouraged.
description_web: This class will be an open discussion format, and attendees are not required, but are highly encouraged, to read the work prior to attendance. We will be discussing *Njal’s Saga*, or the *Story of Burnt Njal*, which is a 13th-century Icelandic Saga. The text read will be *The Story of Burnt Njal*, translated by G. Dasent. Public domain copy may be found here: https://sagadb.org/brennu-njals_saga.en. Audible has an excellent audiobook version available: https://www.audible.com/pd/Njals-Saga-Audiobook/1781982694 . Instructor will open with a brief introduction of the work and its historical context, and then will move into open discussion.

name: The Invention of the Post Windmill
description_book: We'll cover the medieval windmill, its predecessors, features, and development from the 12th century.
description_web: We'll cover the medieval windmill, its predecessors, features, and development from the 12th century.
fee_itemization: Paper & ink for handouts

name: An Introduction to Sweets in the Medieval Period
description_book: An overview of candies and sweets in cooking and medicinal use. We will look at different cultures and time periods. Recipes and samples included.
fee_itemization: $3 to help cover the cost of copying the handout.

name: What's in Your Roman Pantry?
description_book: Find out what ingredients were common in Roman cooking, and how they were used.
description_web: We will discuss and sample some of the most common ingredients featured in recipes from Apicius, learn their many uses, and how we can bring Roman flavors into our everyday cooking. **Tasting samples may contain allergens.**
fee_itemization: fee for handout and food samples

name: African Medieval History: Christian Kingdoms
description_book: Learn about the rich cultures of historically Christian African empires including Aksum, Nubia, and Ethiopia.

name: Make Your Own Roman-Style Brooch (*Fibula*)
description_book: Make your own Roman-style brooch/*fibula* from wire and a package of glass/metal beads. Tools available. Bring yours, if possible. **Age 12+.**
description_web: You will enjoy learning how to make your own Roman-style brooch or *fibula* from wire and a package of glass/metal beads. Jewelry-making tools will be available, but if you have your own, **please** bring them along. **Age 12+.**
fee_itemization: includes wire, beads and use of tools.  If you have your own jewellery tools, please bring them along.

name: *Kamon*: Designing and Documenting Japanese Armory
description_book: Make "Individually Attested Patterns" work for you! Learn to use online resources to design, document, and register a pre-modern Japanese *kamon*.
description_web: Do you want to design and register real Japanese heraldic designs called *kamon*? Are you a herald who wants to increase your repertoire of culturally specific heraldic design resources? Then this class is for you.
