Learn how to use online resources to design, document, and register a pre-modern Japanese *kamon*.
fee_itemization: There will be a multipage handout.

name: Intermediate Irish Language for SCAdians
description_book: Conversational Irish based on SCA scenarios.
description_web: Already speak *a cupla focal* (a few words) in Irish? Or have you attended the Beginning Irish Language class? Brush up your basics and keep the momentum going. Learn more SCA-related phrases to start conversations, and some Irish blessings and curses.
fee_itemization: copying costs

location: Courtesan College (Strawberry Fields B06 (off eLeri Lane between Ankara and Visby Vale))
name: Writing for Raunch and Romance - CCt
description_book: Beginner poet? Curious about pre-1600 forms, ye olde English conventions, and dirty language? Come for a lesson, sample language, & good fun. **18+**
description_web:
This class is designed to be self-moldable by each participant. Several pre-1600 conventional poetic forms will be available for participant perusal, including sonnets, ballades, and sestinas, as well as topic-driven poetry that holds less stringent conventions. Mundanely an English teacher with degrees in Creative Writing and Literature, de Luna is accustomed to helping people reach personal goals in a group setting. Participants may also practice presenting their work or the work of period poets, if desired. Repeat attendance permitted beyond material limits, participants are welcome but not required to bring their own writing supplies.
Note: many forms are not language specific; instructor only speaks English. **Age 18+.**
fee_itemization: I am going to be providing pens, pencils, sharpeners, paper handouts including form references for each type of poem as well as (English) language samples and paper to write on. In fact, I will probably have more things available. If I really need to justify every penny of $5 a person, I will end up eating all of my expenses like I do at work.

name: Fingerloop Medallion Cord Make-and-Take
description_book: Look spiffy with a medallion cord you made yourself by fingerloop braiding.
description_web: Look spiffy with a medallion cord you made yourself by fingerloop braiding. This is an easy-to-learn technique to create handsome strong cord in any combination of colors. We will start with three loops braid and for those who enjoyed it, try five.
fee_itemization: Fiber

name: Multiplayer Chess
description_book: Chess games for four players. We will review rules and variations, then provide time to play.
description_web: Chess games for four players. We will review rules and variations, then provide time to play.

name: Beyond the Cloth: Persona Glassware, Early Period
description_book: Discussion of glassware from ancient times through the Middle Ages, including Europe, the Middle East, and parts of Asia.
description_web: Have you ever walked around an event with a glass in your hand? People will notice it long before they even think about looking at your shoes. Make a statement by having the right kind of glass vessel for your persona! Discussion of various types of glassware from ancient times through the Middle Ages, including Europe, the Middle East, and parts of Asia. Join us again at 3:00 pm for a live, narrated demonstration of the making of an Early Period drinking vessel by Master Ali (Arab Boy) or Magistra Gnaea Celera.

name: Sprang Basics
description_book: Using the twisted warp-based weaving of sprang, create a useful pouch.
description_web: Using the twisted warp-based weaving of sprang, create a useful pouch.
fee_itemization: loom, accessories, string, & instructions

name: Iron *Commedia*: Creating a New 16th-Century Play
description_book: We will cast and perform a brand new *commedia* play in just one afternoon with its world premiere at the Performing Arts Amphitheater that same day!
description_web: If you've ever laughed at the zany antics of improvisational *commedia dell'arte*, if you just love improvisation or if you want to challenge yourself and try something new, come to Iron *Commedia*! Open to all participants, Iron *Commedia* is not a competition – it is a group challenge where we will craft, cast, and perform a brand new *commedia* play in just one afternoon with its world premiere at the Performing Arts Amphitheater that same day!

name: Open Scribal Time
description_book: Take advantage of our clean, well-lit space to work on existing projects or to try your hand at calligraphy and/or illumination.

name: Scribal Swap Meet (Bring a Brush, Take a ???)
description_book: Bring your extra or unused items to swap or just to re-home your un-needed materials and tools.
description_web: All scribes have those things that clutter up the art box. Bring your extras here to swap for something you don't have or just to re-home your un-needed materials and tools. Swappable items include paints, brushes, templates, totes, rulers, ink, pens ... anything in good and useable condition. We will also be accepting unfinished scroll blank layouts that might be sitting in your portfolio. Others can use these as practice pieces or complete into award scrolls for their group or kingdom.

name: Viking Penannular Brooches Make-and-Take
description_book: Brief history of the Viking penannular brooch. Construction based on historical finds using hand tools and fixtures. Class may run over.
description_web: A brief history of the Viking penannular brooch. Construction based on historical finds using hand tools and fixtures. Class may run over. Earplugs provided.
fee_itemization:
Materials 3
Abrasives 1
handout 1

name: Anatomy of a Basic Weaving Loom
description_book: Come experiment with a small tabletop loom. Learn how fabric weaving was done in period across several cultures.
description_web: Come experiment with a small tabletop loom. Learn how fabric weaving was done in period across several cultures.

name: Teen/Tween Fingerloop Braiding
description_book: Learn how to do a simple 5-bow fingerloop braid and make a bracelet to take home with you!
description_web: Learn how to do a simple 5-bow fingerloop braid and make a bracelet to take home with you!

name: Elizabethan Embroidered Tokens
description_book: A discussion of emblems and *impresas* during the 16th century by reviewing the embroideries of Mary, Queen of Scots and Bess of Hardwick.
description_web: A discussion of emblems and *impresas* during the 16th century by reviewing the embroideries of Mary, Queen of Scots and Bess of Hardwick, Countess of Shrewsbury. We will review many of the emblem books printed during that time period.

name: Telling Stories as Your Persona
description_book: How to tell stories in a way that creates the illusion of a period story being told to a period audience, along with a discussion of sources.
description_web: How to tell stories in a way that creates the illusion of a period story being told to a period audience, along with a discussion of sources.

name: Peerage Basics and Roundtable
description_book: A discussion-based roundtable for peers and non-peers. What is the peerage about and what can peers do better?
description_web: A discussion-based roundtable for peers and non-peers. What is the peerage about and what can peers do better? During this session, we will talk about the peerages, the highest awards in the SCA, and we will have peers there to talk about what their peerages mean to them and how the peerages have changed their SCA experiences. Given on behalf of the late Liam St Liam.

name: Arts and Sciences Power Hour
description_book: Take an hour away from camp to double down on your learnings.
description_web: Do you come to Pennsic University, learn something awesome, mean to pursue it, only to wind up in your noisy camp where the idea flies from your mind? Come sit with us for an hour; hone your crafts, write your notes, collect your thoughts.

name: Favors and Tokens
description_book: A discussion on the meaning of favors and tokens and their uses within the SCA.
description_web: A discussion on the meaning of favors and tokens and their uses within the SCA.

name: Newcomers 101
description_book: Titles and customs across the Known World. Camping and what to bring with you to events. How to get along in the SCA.
description_web: Handouts showing the common titles and responsibilities. Discussion about all things SCA. Camping, names, bylaws about bullying. Anything they want to know that I can answer or direct them to another person or class.

name: *Contrapasso da Farsi in Ruota*
description_book: Come learn this graceful *Contrapasso* from Signor Caroso's second book! Dancers of all ages welcome. Prior dance experience helpful but not required.
description_web: Come learn *Contrapasso da Farsi in Ruota*, a lovely *ballo* from *Nobiltà* in the style of earlier *contrapassi*. Dancers of all ages welcome. Prior dance experience helpful but not required; we will be teaching steps. If we finish early, I will also teach *Villanella*.

name: Know Your Dough
description_book: An introductory family-friendly class experimenting with a variety of kinds of dough and a variety of ways of cooking them in a hands-on class.
description_web: An introductory family-friendly class experimenting with a variety of kinds of dough and a variety of ways of cooking them in a hands-on class.

name: Heraldic Field Games
description_book: Herald Says! Heraldic Twister! Run around and learn your heraldic colors, commands, and shapes.

name: Long Distance Shooting: Archery
description_book: Shoot the clout from 140 to 50 yards at various positions.
description_web: Shoot the clout from 140 to 50 yards at various positions.

name: Nalbinding for Lefties
description_book: Nalbinding isn't difficult, but can be confusing if you are left-handed. Learn the Oslo stitch specifically for lefties. Bring needle if you have one.
description_web: Nalbinding isn't difficult, but directions can be confusing if you are left-handed. In this class I will teach the Oslo stitch specifically from the left-handed perspective. Bring a nalbinding or darning needle if you have one. Feel free to bring your own yarn. Some yarn and needles will be available for student use.

name: Beginning Netting
description_book: Create that final piece of 14th-century bling, a netted hairnet. Learn how to cast on a circular net, use a gauge stick, and tie the netting knot.
description_web: Create that final piece of 14th-century bling, a netted hairnet. I'll teach how to cast on a circular net, use a gauge stick, and tie the netting knot. Netting can be scaled down to make hairnets of silk, or scaled up to make fish nets or tote bags using a sheet bend knot.
fee_itemization: The material fee covers the cost of the prewound netting shuttle, the gauge stick, and the base rod.

name: Carry All Your Crap on Your Head
description_book: Learn the proper walk to help you balance loads of gear and goods on your noggin like a bellydancer!
description_web: The problem: You have only two hands, and a lot of stuff to transport. The solution is right on your shoulders! We will cover the proper walk technique to help you balance loads on your head, talk about how to bundle goods to carry, what baskets work well, and practice putting things on your head with grace and aplomb. Not dancer-specific, but for anyone who needs an extra hand while traversing the world. Information applicable to multiple cultures. Kindly bring a coil-built basket if you have one, and a lightweight cotton veil or scarf. (This class is inspired by all the fine folk who have stopped me at previous Pennsics and asked how I'm carrying my loads hands-free.)

name: Cheese Making 101
description_book: Learn the basics of cheesemaking using historic techniques with guaranteed results. Use milk from any grocery store. Can be made lactose-free!
description_web: Learn how to make cheese from a historic recipe with readily available grocery store milk. This cheese can be made in under an hour to produce a soft, spreadable cheese, similar to ricotta. Lactose-free cow's milk can be used to make this lactose-free cheese! The resulting cheese can be used in a variety of recipes, both sweet and savory!
fee_itemization: request $1.00 for printed recipe

name: Make Your Own Medallion Cord
description_book: Why wear a plain white string? Learn *Slung*, cord-making described as juggling with strings! Children welcome with adult. OK to be late.
description_web: Why wear a plain white string? Learn *Slung*, a method for cord-making that can best be described as juggling with strings! Children welcome with adult. *Slung* is also known as Viking whip-cording. It is not only useful but a lot of fun for all ages. Can be done as a children's activity or at demos. Bring a friend! People will be taking turns on a limited number of set-ups. Showing up late is perfectly fine.

name: Make a Travel-Size *Shut the Box* Game
description_book: Learn how to make a travel-sized version of the historic pub game *Shut the Box*. All materials will be included including dice and coin markers.
fee_itemization: $5 includes pouch materials, dice, coin markers, instructions, and documentation.

name: Food Safety for SCA Cooks
description_book: Preparing an SCA feast is different from preparing a family dinner. Learn about the food safety practices needed to ensure a safe event.
description_web:
Preparing an SCA feast is different from preparing a family dinner. Learn about the food safety practices needed to ensure a safe event. Students will learn the causes of food-borne illness as well as safe food handling practices related to these:
Preventing Cross Contamination
Controlling Time and Temperature
Good Personal Hygiene
Cleaning and Sanitizing
Planning a Successful Food Event

Whether you are a new event cook, or you and your kitchen staff have been doing this for years, it is important to be up-to-date and knowledgeable about food safety.
fee_itemization: $2 for class handout

name: 14th-Century Open-work Shoe Workshop
description_book: Make a pair of 14th-century open-work shoes suitable for fancy-dress occasions. Patterns are derived from archaeological finds in The Netherlands.
description_web: In this make-and-take class, you will learn how to put together a pair of lightweight shoes like those worn by 14th-century Europeans. You will measure your feet, cut out leather for soles and uppers, design a pattern (or use a historical template) and cut it out. Then you will assemble the shoes by sewing the pieces together.
fee_itemization: Leather, needles, thread, and handout.

name: SCA Persona Development
description_book: Whether this is your first event or you remember when there were just two kingdoms, every good gentle can continue to build or develop their persona!
description_web:
Whether this is your first event or you remember when there were just two kingdoms, every good gentle can continue to build or develop their personas! The idea of this class is to consider the ways in which you can become a more authentic version of the medieval you. We will explore ways to improve your representation of material culture, consider how a medieval version of yourself might have viewed the world, and learn ways to validate and authenticate your sources. Additionally, with the expansion of the SCA's allowed regions, resources will be available to consider exploring non-Western personas (and navigate ways in which to do so gracefully). If you happen to have source books for your persona or others, please bring them!
Note: The first half of the class will broadly cover developing your persona, the second half will consist of working through and filling out your persona development worksheet.

location: Courtesan College (Strawberry Fields B06 (off eLeri Lane between Ankara and Visby Vale))
name: The History Of English Sex Work - CCt
description_book: A survey of the history of English prostitution, from 100 to 1600 AD. **Age 18+.**
description_web: A survey of the history of English prostitution, from 100 to 1600 AD. We will be covering the biographies of famous sex workers and topics including the formation of red light districts, bath houses, brothel management, municipal laws, church law, and the garb and identification of a prostitute within this time period. **Age 18+.**

name: Dances for Two Left Feet: *Bransles* Edition
description_book: A dance class for those who want an easy introduction to historic dance.
description_web:
Do you feel overwhelmed when you peek into the dance tent? Are you convinced your feet could not possibly do those steps? Do you feel confused when viewing all the different figures? Then this class is for you! Join Eleanor as she unpacks and breaks down a few easy *bransles*.
One or two dances will be selected from the following list: *Pease Bransle, Official Bransle, SCA Montard Bransle*.

location: Denys the Decadent's Camo  (EO7 off great Eastern Hiughway, Look for 12 Steppe Sign)
name: 12-Step Meeting
description_book: An open meeting for those in recovery or any 12-step programs.
description_web: A daily 12-step meeting I hold in my Camp E07 off Great Eastern Highway. Look for the sign. Held at 4:00 PM, **OPEN MEETING .** Holding a meeting here since 1997.

name: Domos Draconum (DnD): In Search of the Unknown
description_book: Vintage 1970s Dungeons & Dragons adventure for ages 10+. No experience necessary. Limit: 8

name: Create a Heraldic Device
description_book: Learn the basics of heraldry and create your own coat of arms. (Kids' class; no conflict checking or registration of arms planned.)

name: Beginning Embroidery for the Young Sewer
description_book: An introduction to basic embroidery for young beginners. Learn the basic stitches and tricks to making a simple embroidered design.
description_web: An introduction to basic embroidery for young beginners. Learn the basic stitches and tricks to making a simple embroidered design. Starter kits available for 8 participants. Students should be comfortable handling needles and scissors.

name: Introduction to *Go*
description_book: A basic introduction to rules and play of the Japanese/Chinese game of *go/weiqi*.
description_web: Will teach the rules of the Japanese game *go* (also known as *weiqi* in China), and offer a chance to play afterwards.

name: Early Medieval Glassblowing Demo (Furnace Glass)
description_book: A fully narrated, live, 2000-degree glassblowing demonstration! Learn about the materials, the techniques, and how glass usage changed over time!
description_web: Come and watch a fully narrated, live, 2000-degree glassblowing demonstration! See how we can take this fascinating material and turn it into a never-ending variety of items! Learn about the materials we use, and how glass making techniques, its uses, and value varied throughout time and culture! For this demo, see items from the 5th -11th centuries from Europe and the Middle East! Family-friendly, all ages welcome, open Q&A to follow.

name: Period Round Singing Part 1
description_book: Learn to sing rounds that were sung during the SCA period. Sheet music provided. Different music will be taught in Part 1 and Part 2.
description_web: Learn to sing rounds that were sung during the SCA period. Sheet music provided. Different music will be taught in Part 1 and Part 2.

name: Templar TA-50
description_book: Templar equipment layout, as well as practical application for SCA combat.
description_web: The clothing, arms, armor and equipment used by a member of the Knights Templar. This equipment will also be applicable to other Military Knightly Orders, as well as secular Crusader portrayals.

name: Sprucing Up Your Calligraphy
description_book: Scribes, is your calligraphy not what you want it to be? We'll cover tools and techniques to make your calligraphy look like real period hands.
description_web: Scribes, is your calligraphy not quite what you want it to be? This class is for you! We'll cover tools and techniques to make your calligraphy look like the real period hands seen in manuscripts. You'll learn how to use a square nib dip pen to make thick and thin strokes, how to control your ink flow, how to properly space the letters based on the style and time period of the hand, and how to create the best layout. Bring your scribal box and let's practice! Supplies will be available for loan during the class or for purchase.
fee_itemization:
Attendees who want to take supplies home will receive:
- Pen Handle
- Nib
- Ink
- Pergamenata
- Typewriter eraser

name: Pick-up Fighting (Sponsored by HRM Ealdormere)
description_book: All fighters are welcome to come out for some pick-up fighting.
description_web: All armored fighters are welcome to come out for some pick-up fighting.

name: Rune Interpretation
description_book: New to runes? Learn what the runes mean for divination. Covers the *Elder Futharc* and, if there's time, the extra runes on the Anglo-Frisian set.
description_web: New to the runes? Learn what the runes mean for divination. We'll cover the *Elder Futharc* (24) and, if there is time, the extra runes from the Anglo-Frisian *Futhorc*.

name: Beginner Dance: *Bransles*
description_book: Come join us for some simple fun! No partner needed. We will be focusing on staple bransles like *Charlotte, War* and *Scottish*.
description_web: Come join us for some simple fun! No partner needed. We will be focusing on staple *bransles* like *Charlotte, War* and *Scottish* (actually two *bransles* strung together!).

name: Period Card Games: *Karnoffel*
description_book: Do you like to play cards? Come learn to play this oldest identifiable European card game (1426 reference).
description_web: Looking for something to pass the time at events? Do you like to play cards? Come learn to play this oldest identifiable European card game (1426 reference).

name: Yoga for Anyone and Everyone
description_book: All-level friendly, basic *vinyasa* class, open to complete beginners & seasoned yogis. Bring your own mat, towel & water, prepare to work and relax.

location: Courtesan College (Strawberry Fields B06 (off eLeri Lane between Ankara and Visby Vale))
name: The Dangerous Beauty: Series 2, *La Bella...*- CCt
description_book: The Arts of a Courtesan. Discussion and practice in how to look and act like an elite historical sex worker. ** Age 18+.**
description_web: The Dangerous Beauty: a series on the Arts of a Courtesan. You - yes, *you* have within you the power to secure a military alliance, curate courtly influence, maybe feel more assurance about attending Court, or just chat with that interesting person you met at fighter practice last week. We will be discussing and practicing how to look and act like an elite sex worker while in persona based on a combination of both extant European period writings on social behavior with modern framing of deportment, etiquette, and seduction. This section will cover attractiveness, confidence, sex appeal, body language, and comportment. There will be handouts available. **Age 18+.**

name: Iron *Commedia* Performance
description_book: The culmination of the work from the Iron *Commedia* class earlier in the day!
description_web: The culmination of the work from the Iron *Commedia* class earlier in the day!

name: Concerning Mohammed and the Well-Guided Caliphs
description_book: A history of the early years of Islam, taught in persona from the standpoint of a later Muslim.
description_web: Concerning Our Lord the Prophet Mohammed (Blessings upon Him, his Kindred and his Companion Train) and the Well-Guided Caliphs. A history of the early years of Islam, taught in persona from the standpoint of a 12th-century North African Muslim.

name: *RúnValdr*
description_book: In period, runes were very rarely used for divination, but there are many examples of runes being used for magic. A modern system for rune magic.
description_web: In period, runes were very rarely used for divination, but there are many examples of runes being used for magic. This is a system that shows, for example, how to use Norse or Anglo-Saxon runes to hear even at distance, or to awaken inanimate objects. This is a system of energy manipulation using runes and another set of symbols. This workshop introduces the symbols and what each of them is used for, and includes the attunement. It does *not* include introduction to runes. You may take this workshop without knowing the runes, but you will need to learn them to be able to use this system. You will be able to use this technique immediately.
fee_itemization: optional handout

name: Zsof and Tommaso Go to War
description_book: For Pennsic 50, Zsof and Tommaso present an all new Extravaganza of family-friendly music, theatre, and storytelling.
description_web: For Pennsic 50, Zsof and Tommaso present an all new Extravaganza, never before seen on any stage! Period and SCA music, theatre, and storytelling. Family-friendly.

name: Late Medieval Continental European Manuscripts
description_book: Many late medieval period manuscripts are available online in various digitized archives. Find out where *Très Riches Heures du Duc de Berry* is.
description_web: Many manuscripts from the late medieval period are available online in various libraries' digitized archives. The focus will be on Bohemian, Burgundian, German, and French manuscripts from roughly 1350-1520 in libraries across Europe. Come find out where the *Très Riches Heures du Duc de Berry* is.

name: Pennsic Glass Challenge
description_book:
Looking for beadmaking enthusiasts of all skill levels! Each session will have a different surprise challenge!
Visit tinyurl.com/glassapprentice.
description_web:
Looking for beadmaking enthusiasts of all skill levels! If you can work at a beadmaking torch, safely, without direct supervision, join us! 
This is a fun challenge meant to push individuals along their own learning paths, to try something new and find new horizons in their creativity and technical skill. This is **not** a competition.
Back again, by popular demand at Pennsic 50!

Visit tinyurl.com/glassapprentice for more information.
fee_itemization: All equipment, materials, and tools will be provided for each daily challenge. If you have your own favourite glass-rated safety glasses (didymium), please bring them along.

name: Period Card Games: *Laugh and Lie Down*
description_book: Do you like to play cards? Come learn to play this simple late-period card game.
description_web: Looking for something to pass the time at events? Do you like to play cards? Come learn to play this simple late-period card game.

name: A Sweet Maple Singers Duet
description_book: These two bards will charm your senses and mystify your mind with their eclectic mix of folk songs.
description_web: Sweet, savory, and delectable. These two bards will surely be the frosting on your musical cake. They will charm your senses and mystify your mind with their eclectic mix of folk and feel-good songs.

name: *i Verdi Confusi*: Peace Week Follies
description_book: The first week needs entertainment too! Join us for *Commedia dell'Arte* follies at the Amphitheatre!
description_web: The first week needs entertainment too! Join us for *Commedia dell'Arte* follies at the Amphitheatre!

name: Jewish Illumination & Illustration in 1350's Spain
description_book: Hour 1: Presentation & overview of the artistic contents of the Sarajevo *Haggadah*. Hour 2: History of the manuscript, its survival, & influences.

name: Bedtime Stories for Children
description_book: Nightly telling of stories for children. This year's theme will be The Brothers Grimm!
description_web: Stories and fables for children, 7 pm nightly. This year's theme will be The Brothers Grimm. All are welcome to attend; children must have adult escort.

location: Courtesan College (Strawberry Fields B06 (off eLeri Lane between Ankara and Visby Vale))
name: Raunch and Romance - CCt
description_book: Take turns reading period & Scadian romantic & erotic poetry. We will provide some options to pick from, or feel free to bring your own! **18+ only.**
description_web: Take turns reading period and Scadian romantic and erotic poetry. Bring your sauciest stanzas, your lustiest limericks, and your amorous alliteration! We will provide some options to pick from, or feel free to bring your own! **18+ only.**

name: T(w)een Lounge: Game Night/ Character Building
description_book: **Age 12-17.** Bring your favorite board or card game to share! Play others' favorites. Interested in an RPG tomorrow? Build your character tonight!
description_web: Have your favorite board or card game to share? Bring them along, teach, or learn how to play! For those interested, Lady Cecily is planning an RPG adventure (think D&D but different mechanics). Use this time to think through the character sheet and prepare yourself. **Ages 12-17.**

name: Warm Up Hafla!!!
description_book: Live music and dance! Please come to the Middle Eastern tent for playing music and dancing! All instruments and dancers are invited.
description_web:
Have you had a long town run? Have you missed playing and dancing at Pennsic? Then come for a warm-up hafla to get your blood moving!
Live music and dance! Please come to the Middle Eastern tent for playing music and dancing to said music! All instruments, and musicians attached to them, are invited. All dancers of any age, gender, and experience are welcome!

name: The Brendan Show: Favorites Old and New
description_book: A bardic journey through four decades of the Modern Middle Ages.
description_web: Master Brendan O Corraidhe reprises favorite songs, poems, and tales going back to Pennsic X.

name: *Dark Woods Ahead*
description_book: Not all stories are about fairies and good luck. Lady Scholastica Joycors shares some dark tales from around the world.
description_web: Not all stories are about fairies and good luck. Lady Scholastica Joycors shares some dark tales from around the world..

name: DragonSong Live!
description_book: Join us for a journey around the world highlighting the fusion of music and dance from a variety of cultures in the Middle Ages.

name: Archery 5th Annual Pennsic Flight Shoot
description_book: 5th Annual Pennsic Flight Shoot. Flight shoot for distance. Categories: Period Handbow, Modern Handbow, Crossbow.
description_web:
The 5th Annual Flight Shoot has Period Handbow, Modern Handbow, and Crossbow categories. All shooters at the Flight Shoot will have their distance measured, and there will be prizes for each category. 

In addition, the Period Handbows and Period Crossbows will get points for the Period Bow Shoot, which takes place Sunday morning of War Week. For Period bows, the distance in yards will be divided by 10, so 300 yards equals 30 points, 200 yards equals 20 points, and those scores will be added to the points they score at the Period Bow Shoot.

Period Bow means **NO** plastic arrow nocks; all arrows must be shot off the hand with no fixed arrow-shelf of any kind, no pistol grips. *Period bow score requires garb to match.*

This shoot uses the entire Archery range.

name: Intermediate Target Archery
description_book: The focus is on teaching TA skills with specific emphasis on clout, speed, and overall TA competency.
description_web: This class will focus on those skills required of a target archer to improve within the SCA environment. In addition to those SCA unique skills, form and overall archery skills will be addressed as well as how to continue improving throughout an archer's career. Archers must bring their own equipment.

name: Yoga for Fighters,  Dancers and Everybody
description_book: Yoga for all levels! Bring mat or towel for the floor & strap, scarf, or strip of cloth for class if you can; some loaner gear available.
description_web:
Yoga for all levels! Bring mat or towel for the floor & strap, scarf, or strip of cloth for class if you can; some loaner mats and straps will be available. If you have blocks, please bring them if you can! This class is geared for folks who have never done yoga through seasoned practitioners. Amendments for poses will be offered as we go, and each class will build upon the one before, however, anyone can jump in at anytime. 
Class will begin with a few minutes of breath work followed by approximately 45 minutes of yoga.

name: Coffee with Friends of Bill and Dr Bob
description_book: Open agnostic 12-Step meetings.
description_web: Open agnostic 12-Step meetings. From 8:00 am-9:00 am.

name: *Études* 2 and 3 for Single Sword (Fencing)
description_book: These drill sequences will focus on form, balance, movement, and coordination. For beginners, intermediates, and teachers alike.
description_web: For beginner and intermediate fencers and those who teach them. These drills will focus on form, balance, movement and coordination. *Étude* 2 is thrust centric. *Étude* 2 adds diversity of cuts. Emphasis will be on learning the *études* for home drill, as well as taking elements out of the drill for more focused work in groups.

name: Youth Heavy List Skills, Games, and Drills
description_book: Daily morning regular practices to be run from 8:30 till 11 am on the Pennsic Battlefield Youth List. Youth aged 6-17. Loaner gear will be available.
description_web: Daily morning regular practices to be run from 8:30 till 11 am on the Pennsic Battlefield Youth List. Youth aged 6-17, all levels of experience on three different list fields. Loaner gear will be available.

name: Chinese Calligraphy Brush Painting
description_book: Grinding ink and the brush writing of ancient Chinese characters from oracle bone to cursive scripts. **Adults only.**
description_web: A brief history of Chinese calligraphy: Brush painting Chinese characters that were developed over 3000 years ago and that are still used today. Explore a variety of Chinese scripts from oracle bone pictographs to the more modern scripts of the Han Dynasty (200 BC to 200 AD). We will explore the 4 treasures and create beautiful characters. This class is intended for beginners, but students at any level may benefit. We will be grinding  our own ink and writing ancient Chinese characters. There will be supplies for 6 people to use, but others can observe. **Adults only.**

name: Screaming Snails: Doodling Marginalia Decorations
description_book: A make-and-take scribal class where students will create notecards, bookmarks, and an insert for a pendant based on popular marginalia designs.
description_web: A make-and-take scribal class where students will create notecards, bookmarks, and an insert for a pendant based on popular marginalia designs. There will also be a handout with common marginalia designs, including simple line work for future scroll uses.
fee_itemization:
Notecards and envelopes (2 per student) - $1
1 bookmark  - $1
Pendant pieces - $3

name: Intermediate Target Archery
description_book: Focus is on teaching TA skills with specific emphasis on clout, speed, and overall TA competency.
description_web: Focus is on those skills required of a target archer to improve within the SCA environment. In addition to those SCA unique skills, form and overall archery skills will be addressed as well as how to continue improving throughout an archer's career. Archers must bring their own equipment.

name: Beginning Bobbin Lace
description_book: Three-day class for a total of 9 hours. Learn the basic movements and make three basic projects. Start a period pattern.
description_web: This is a three-day class for a total of 9 hours of bobbin lace! First Day: Students will learn the basic movements of bobbin lace and begin a project. Second Day: Students will finish the project and learn some simple grounds. Third Day: Students will begin a period pattern from the *Nüw Modelbuch*.
fee_itemization: $30 – One-time fee for all three days. Includes pillow with cover, bobbin holder, 10 pair of bobbins, pins, handout, patterns

instructor: Baroness Aranwen verch Rhys ap Gwalter
name: Lampwork Glass Bead-Making: Safety and Basic Bead
description_book: Intro to lampwork bead-making. Instruction given regarding setting up a work area and making basic shapes. **18+; age 14 up with parent.**
description_web: An introduction to lampwork bead-making. Instruction will be given regarding setting up a work area and making basic shapes. If time allows, demonstration will be given on beads the students are interested in creating. The class handout  will include what will be discussed and give historical background. **18+; age 14 up with parent, due to live fire.**
fee_itemization: 5 for MAPP gas, 5 for cost of glass, 0 for tool usage

name: Leatherworker Roundtable
description_book: To celebrate 50 years of Pennsic, let's share our knowledge. Bring a project, tools, tips, materials, sources or questions.
description_web: To celebrate 50 years of Pennsic, let's share our knowledge. Bring a project, tools, tips, materials, sources or questions. I'm hosting this in part as a memorial to Marc Carlson (Diarmaid O'Duinn) and Thom Brasch (Jekylthehidesmith) who we lost in 2022 and 2023. We honor them by sharing. See you there, *mahalo*!

name: Hammer of the Witches: Witch Hunts and Trials
description_book: Examines the various texts, tactics, and histories of witch-hunters, along with information on the enemies they believed they fought.

name: Lucet, Beyond Square Cord
description_book: You can make good square cord; what's next? Flat and multi-strand cords. Bring your lucet. (We can slip a cord off and put it back on after class.)
description_web: You’re comfortable making square cord; what's next? We'll work on flat and multi-strand cord variations. Please bring your lucet. (We'll also demonstrate how to slip a cord off-and-on so you can put it back on after class.)
fee_itemization: (4) colors of floss on bobbins, and handout.

name: Dining with the Sultan: A Taste of Ottoman Cuisine
description_book: Cook & eat 2 dishes using actual 15th- and 16th-C. Ottoman sources. Discuss Ottoman cuisine in Constantinople. Not suitable for vegetarians or vegans.
description_web: Using actual 15th- and 16th-century Ottoman recipes, we will cook and eat two dishes: a meat dish and a grain or vegetable dish. As we cook, I will discuss Ottoman cuisine in Constantinople, especially that of the palaces. Information includes street food and market regulations. Also what was served to the Sultans and their pages, to European diplomats at palace feasts, and at circumcision festivals for the Sultans' sons. Please bring kitchen knives and pot holders, if you can. Includes recipe handout. Not suitable for vegetarians or vegans.
fee_itemization: Material fee will cover meat, grain, any fruits and/or vegetables, onions and/or garlic, fresh herbs, canned chickpeas, packaged chicken broth. I will supply spices, sugar, and specialty ingredients from my own kitchen.

name: From Period Recipe to Modern: A Map
description_book: Experiment with an approach to redacting period recipes using recipes from the *Curye on Inglysch*.

name: Domestication of a Wild Horse
description_book: The journey of socializing an untamed horse based on J. Ruffus, 13th C.
description_web: In this class I will share my experience of socializing an untamed horse, Rose. Over the past 2 years I domesticated a spotted draft mare based on the documentation of Jordanus Ruffus, a 13th-century officer of the Royal Stables of the Holy Roman Emperor Frederick II.

name: Making the Magic: Court Prep for a Memorable Court
description_book: Doing a good court is not hard, but making it look effortless takes much more! Learn what goes into a great court with a former Æ voice of the crown!
description_web: Court can be a magical moment for people in the SCA, and can be a memorable experience for those who take part and who are recognized. However, like anything else, a little preparation goes a long way to making such magic happen. We'll discuss what goes into preparation before the event, on the day, and what should be done after for official and unofficial tasks.

name: Modern Gaming: Peace Week
description_book: A place, with power, to play modern games from 9 am to 10:30 pm every day.

name: Safely Foraging Local Mushrooms
description_book: Wild mushroom foraging is sexy these days. Gastrointestinal distress is not. Learn from a Pennsylvania-approved mushroomer how to stay safe! **18+.**
description_web: I will give you the tools you need to forage safely. We will discuss about 10 beginner mushrooms that grow locally. The last half hour of class will include a wild mushroom petting zoo. Mostly dried samples, unless the weather gods are good to us. **Absolutely no one may attend under the age of 18. Not even with parent.**
fee_itemization:
Alys: In descrip, deleted "Come" to add in age limit.
Alys: It's back. In WD, bold type for age.

name: Roman Africa
description_book: An introductory look at the role that the people, landscape and provinces of Africa played in the history of Rome.

name: Anglo-Saxon Magick
description_book: Covers the spells, chants, amulets, runes, and other techniques used by Anglo-Saxons as they changed over the six centuries of AS England.
description_web: The Anglo-Saxons used spells, chants, amulets, runes, and other sorts of magickal techniques well after they were nominally converted to Christianity. This workshop gives an overview of the material that has survived, as what was acceptable changed from year to year and place to place in the first millennium as well as in the second.

name: Goldwork Sampler
description_book: Create a goldwork sampler while trying a couple of different techniques using real metal threads.
description_web: We will discuss the use of metal thread embroidery in European embroideries of the Middle Ages. We will learn more about the types of metal thread used, what the various threads were, how to use them, and we will make a sampler of stitches to keep so you can use it as a reference. We will be using real metal thread, a very good quality linen for the ground fabric, and silk thread. This class will be taught in 3 sessions. The third session relies on the techniques learned in the earlier classes; attendance at both of the first two classes is encouraged, but it is possible to participate in the 3rd class if you were only able to attend one of the other classes. Different techniques will be covered in each class, and they will build on each other. Bring your scissors, and eyeglasses if you need them. Everything else you need will be in the kit. The kit will include an embroidery hoop, fabric, an acid free marker, needles, wool felt, cotton thread for padding, silk thread, gilded leather, and a variety of real metal threads.
fee_itemization: A variety of metal threads, silk thread, linen thread, linen fabric, silk fabric, and all supplies needed except scissors.

name: Introduction to Central Asian Archery/Thumb Ring
description_book: Learn how to shoot like a Mongol, Turk, etc. Requires a horse bow and arrows at least 4" longer than your finger draw. **Age limit 18+.**
description_web: Learn to shoot the way Mongols and other steppes and horse archers did. Naran Numuchi, Noyon of Ponte Alto, Order of the Laurel for Mongol and Turkish Archery, OP, Companion of the Order of the Yew Bow (Atlantia), has been shooting thumb ring since 1998 and, since then, has focused on the use and history of static-eared recurve bows. Naran Noyon will have some thumb rings to try, but you must bring your own bows and arrows, preferably with no shelf or pistol grip, and arrows should be sufficiently long to accommodate the 2-4" extra of thumb draw. **Age limit 18+.**

name: Weaving
description_book: Learn basic weaving and make a bracelet or bookmark

name: Keeping Bees in the Knowne World
description_book: Get an idea of what is involved in keeping bees in the here and now. I'll walk you through a typical year.
description_web: Get an idea of what is involved in keeping bees in the here and now. I'll walk you through a typical year.

name: Pennsic Instrumental Youth Consort
description_book: The Youth Instrumental Consort is open to all youth who play an instrument. No audition is required to participate.
description_web: Rehearsals will be from 9:00 am - 9:45 am daily from Saturday, August 5, 2023, until Wednesday, August 9, at the Performing Arts Rehearsal Classroom (PARC) located by the Amphitheatre. We will participate in a Dress Rehearsal/Recording Session on Thursday, Aug. 10, at noon, and perform on Thursday, August 10 at 6:30 pm, as part of the Pennsic Choirs Concert. Your director will provide you with a media release to sign.

name: Stick Weaving
description_book: Stick weaving is a simple, weft-based weaving method.
description_web: Stick weaving is a simple, weft-based weaving method. Great for making belts and straps. Upgradable to make everything from shawls to rugs. Sticks and string provided; take your work home with you.
fee_itemization: Sticks, string, & instructions

name: Youth Rapier Activities
description_book: There will be a variety of youth rapier activities each day including drills, games and one-on-one instruction. Some loaner gear will be available.
description_web: There will be a variety of youth rapier activities each day including drills, games and one-on-one instruction. Some days may include special additional activities. Some loaner gear will be available. Participants do not have to be authorized. Children age 6 and up may participate. Please bring your parent/guardian the first day you attend to learn more about the youth rapier program.

instructor: Aule og Amon Amarth The Wizard
name: Class Casanova
description_book: Designed to give you the tools necessary to develop the skill set to approach anyone in social settings, i.e., not come off as a creep. **18+**
description_web:
This class is designed to give you the tools necessary to develop the skill set to approach anyone in social settings. How to show the best version of yourself, conversation, pick up body language and how to handle social rejection with grace and still leave you in good standing. 
Along with the class will be a practical class participation to help ease your nervousness and help you find your confidence. 
About the instructor: The Wizard has taught several classes on social dynamics, testing the theory in practice across several countries and cultures. Knowledge is power and the more perspectives you have will only help. **Age limit 18+.**

name: 25 Signs You Need to Know for Court: Sign Heraldry
description_book: Learn the 25 SCA specific signs you need to know to Sign-Herald court.
description_web: Learn the 25 SCA specific basic signs you need to know to be the sign herald for court. You do not need to know American Sign Language yet to start learning these signs.

name: Anglo-Saxon Alliterative Poetry Workshop
description_book: Brief intro to the Anglo-Saxon Alliterative Tradition (think "Beowulf"); most of the class is guided group-work to produce some actual poetry.
description_web: The Anglo-Saxon Alliterative Tradition (for example: "Beowulf") is poetry meant not to be read to oneself, but to be listened to: the rough rhythm of the beats, threaded together by alliteration forms the groundwork; kennings are the bright jewels embedded in it; and the tapestry ideas should capture the imagination with vivid imagery of high deeds or fell; of heroes and villains larger than life; of sentiments that mark the soul. We will look briefly at the metrical forms, the alliteration rules, and examples of kennings; but the bulk of the learning comes in the workshop: constructing lines that ring in the air, telling a story that needs hearing. We will work together to create a product.

name: Henna History
description_book: Learn the history of henna across centuries and cultures.
description_web: We'll discuss the multicultural history of henna as used for hair, cloth dye, and for body art.
fee_itemization: a copy of my current research and bibliography

name: How to Be an Ally
description_book: How to be an ally to queer people, as well as queer history from the time period, and the history of queer people in the SCA.
description_web:
How to be an ally to queer people, as well as queer history from the time period, and the history of queer people in the SCA.

We will discuss common identities and flags, as well as pronouns and basic respect towards queer people. (Feel free to ask questions. This is what the class is for!)
fee_itemization: Printed 6+ page handout, some pages  in color

name: Drafting and Distaff
description_book: How you treat your fiber will change what type of yarn you end up with. Come experiment with drafting methods and using a distaff.
description_web: How you treat your fiber will change what type of yarn you end up with. Come experiment with a distaff and discover how silly modern spinners are for not using one. Try different drafting methods and see how yarns behave differently. Attendees should know how to spin. Spindle and fiber will be provided, but feel free to bring any spinning implement or fiber you may already possess.

name: Making an Italian Renaissance Chemise
description_book: Instructions and walk-through for making an Italian Renaissance chemise. Includes a look at both pleating and gathering.
description_web: Instructions and walk-through for making an Italian Renaissance chemise. Includes a look at both pleating and gathering.
fee_itemization: $2 for printed handout.  20 printouts will be available

name: Not Baked: Early Foods from Grain
description_book: Ancient grains: Threshing, grinding and cooking of whole and crushed grain foods.
description_web: What were the first foods made from grain and how were they prepared? We’ll be looking at the early history of grain processing and milling, what it took to prepare the oldest kinds of grain for milling, how grain was ground, and the porridges and other crushed grain dishes that were common before bread.
fee_itemization: Cost of grain samples.

name: Pretzels
description_book: A short history of pretzels.
fee_itemization: Fee to help cover cost of multipage handout.

name: Advanced Atlatl
description_book: There will be a quick review of atlatl basics, but the emphasis will be on the use of different types of atlatls, and use of weights.
description_web: There will be a quick review of atlatl basics, but the emphasis will be on the use of different types of atlatls, the use of weights on the atlatls.

name: *Seishin-ryū Chadō Okeiko*: Tea Ceremony Workshop
description_book: Learn the rudiments of *wabi*-style tea including both the role of the host and the role of the guest. This is a multi-part workshop for beginners.
description_web:
Learn the rudiments of *wabi*-style tea including both the role of the host and the role of the guest. This is a multi-part workshop for beginners. Please come to as many classes as possible. 
*Okeiko* means "honorable practice". Both the role of the guest and the role of the host will be introduced. You will learn something new in each workshop. We will begin with walking and bowing and progress to the rudiments of preparing and consuming a bowl of *matcha*. Limited materials will be available for student use during the workshop. 
If you are interested in purchasing materials for long-term personal use, then you should acquire a guest kit and a *fukusa*: 
A guest kit for men can be acquired at http://www.teadogu.com/guest-starter-kit-man339.html
A guest kit for women can be acquired at http://www.teadogu.com/guest-starter-kit-woman339.html
A *fukusa* for men can be acquired at http://www.teadogu.com/fumepunu9si.html
A *fukusa* for women can be acquired at http://www.teadogu.com/fuworenu9si.html
While it is possible to save money by ordering directly from Japan, doing so requires dealing with Japanese online storefronts. A note about *fukusa*. A number #9 *fukusa* is much easier to manipulate than *fukusa* with lower numbers. Paying extra is worth the price. A *fukusa* and a fan are what  you need to practice during class. I have an extremely limited number of loaner *fukusa*. You can substitute a number of items  for a fan. Please read the online descriptions of the fans carefully if you choose to provide a substitute or acquire a fan from another source.
There are a number of ways to acquire a 袱紗 *fukusa*. You can even try to make one, but please don't until you know what they are supposed to be like. There is some controversy over just how old they are. Today, men use slightly larger *fukusa* than women do. Further, men always use purple *fukusa* and women typically only use purple *fukusa* after they have become senior instructors. Regardless, here are purchase options. (1) You can always try ebay. (2) You can order online from any of several tea supply stores in Japan through rakuten.co.jp. (3) You can order one from a fellow in Portland http://www.teadogu.com/fukusa.html. (Yes, they really are that expensive.) I will try to pick up a couple of loaners (I currently have one) between now and Pennsic. Regardless, the fan is the symbol of the guest, and the *fukusa* is the symbol of the host in the world of tea.
fee_itemization: This class will include a multi-page printed handout.

name: Beginner Dance Drills: Figuring Out Footwork
description_book: Are you a beginner dancer and want to better understand footwork while improving balance and endurance? This class will do all that and more!

name: The Great Exchange Game
description_book: The Great Exchange of Foods happened during the colonization of the New World. This family class will entertain and inform thru interactive games.
description_web: The Great Exchange of Foods happened during the colonization of the New World. This family class will entertain and inform thru interactive games. We will play bean pot, birds of a feather, and find that spice. Small edible prizes will be provided.

name: Beginner Sewing: Make A Ball
description_book: Learn sewing basics and create a small felt ball to keep.

name: Beginner Sewing for Tweens: Dragon Stuffies
description_book: Learn sewing basics and create your own personal dragon (ages 9-14).

name: Storytelling Academy
description_book: Explore genres, tools, styles, and uses of storytelling. Cultural and medieval approaches, applications, performance coaching. New topics each day.
description_web: During this academy, students will gain knowledge about the history and techniques for storytelling both in the SCA and the modern world. Students may attend individual sessions or all of the academy. There may be guest teachers and will be time for students to practice and receive feedback. The academy may culminate in a student performance. No classes are repeated. The focus is on developing comfort, nurturing, and honing skills within the students’ capabilities. All levels are welcome. Students may view a class outline at the academy space, Minerva’s Spindle 158, where classes will also be listed on the message board. Seating is limited; feel free to bring your own chair. Student Performance, date, time, and location will be announced.

name: Known World Choir Rehearsals
description_book: Join the oldest Pennsic Choir as we rehearse in preparation for a concert on Thursday of War Week. Previous KWC Directors have been invited.
description_web: The Known World Choir, along with the Children's and Youth Choirs, and *Chorulus Pennsicus* will present a concert of medieval and Renaissance choral literature. Previous Directors of the KWC have been invited to conduct a selection. Bring a 1/2 inch black binder or plan to purchase one for use during the concert for $5. **Over age 18.** (There is a Youth Choir for those 12-18.)
fee_itemization: Copies of KWC Literature. $5 more if you wish to keep the 1/2 Inch Black Binder

name: Readers' Theatre: Rehearsal
description_book: Rehearsal: script-in-hand performance of an original script titled *The Reckoning* by John St. Dennis, known in the SCA as Master Lorcan Dracontius.
description_web: Readers' Theatre is a style of theater in which the actors present dramatic readings of narrative material without costumes, props, scenery, or special lighting. Actors do not need to memorize lines; they just read scripts in hand. Rehearsal Day 1 is an introduction and read through of the script before determining roles. Rehearsal for script-in-hand performance of an original script titled *The Reckoning* by John St. Dennis, known in the SCA as Master Lorcan Dracontius. The storyline consists of a re-imagining of the origins of Shakespeare's play "Twelfth Night".

name: Pre-School  Playgroup
description_book: Let our preschoolers tire each other out! Let the parents and guardians make friends! Meets at Toddler Lounge Shade by playground

name: 11th Annual Rapier Poker Tournament
description_book: Heavy rapier tournament. Bear-pit style. Earn playing cards to make the best poker hand. Will run twice if weather allows.
description_web: This is a bear-pit style format where the loser of the bout stays to fight the next fencer. Fencers stay until they have won or have 3 deaths. Double kills count towards the number of deaths. Fencers leaving the field, whether they won or lost, shall receive a poker card and shall keep up to 7 cards. The winner of the tournament shall be determined by the best poker hand of 5 cards. This format will be run twice to determine two winners. There will also be a volunteer winner chosen at random from the marshals that help assist in running the tournament. You could win by playing or by volunteering!

location: The Camp of the Three Bears (N17 along Battle Road)
name: Anglo-Saxon Cookery
description_book: A discussion and demonstration of Anglo Saxon cooking.

name: Youth Axe-Throwing Instruction
description_book: Teaching youth 5-12 to throw axes. Focus on range rules and technique. Parent must accompany child per Pennsic rules. Tournament later in the week.
description_web: Teach youth, ages 5-12, to throw axes. This class will focus on Pennsic range rules, range etiquette and technique. There will be time for the children to throw and there will be loaner equipment available from the instructor. Parent must accompany the child per Pennsic rules. There will be a youth tournament later in the week.

name: *Mehteran*: Ottoman *Janissary* Band
description_book: *Osmanlı Mehter Takımı* studies music & history of the Ottoman *Mehter* military marching band of the 14th-17th C for Pennsic performance. **18+**
description_web: The *Osmanlı Mehter Takımı* (Ottoman *Janissary* Band) studies music and history of the Ottoman *Mehter* military marching band from the 14th-17th century. The *Mehteran* will learn the historic Ottoman songs, *Ceddin Deden*, *Osman Pasa*, and *Nevâ-Ceng-i Harbî* which are played on *zurna, davul*, horns, cymbals, and kettledrums, and sung by a choir, and will learn the historic *Janissary* march for performance at Pennsic. Brass horn players, percussionists and singers are welcome and encouraged to participate. Further details on the *Mehteran* Facebook Group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/134233213955988/ . **Age 18+.**

name: Weed Walk
description_book: Wild plant identification. Wear walking shoes and hat; leave from Univ. Point. Different teachers on different days; walk with us more than once!
description_web: Cooper's Lake abounds with medicinal and food plants that were used by various primitive and medieval cultures. Learn to identify them during a walk around the campsite. The walk will take place rain or shine. Please wear sturdy shoes and a hat. Meet at University Point for the start of the class. We have multiple teachers, so if you attend more than one walk, you will likely learn different things!

location: Heralds Point (Herald's Point, behind the playground. )
name: Heralds' Mentoring Meet-Up at Heralds' Point
description_book: A heraldic staff member will discuss your mentoring needs (armory or names). We will find you someone to shadow.
description_web: A heraldic staff member will discuss your mentoring needs (armory or names). We will find you someone to shadow.

name: Known World Adventurers Guild: **Walk Day**
description_book: Teen explorers (and youth 10+) will gather information via supervised Pennsic site walks. All activities begin and end at Family Point. KWAGuild.com.
description_web:
**WANTED**: Teen adventurers (and youth 10+) with a thirst for exploration, cultural exchange, and making friends within the SCA. Guildmistress Marian of Heatherdale invites you to join KWAG (the Known World Adventurers Guild) here at Pennsic 50. Her noble company of young explorers will gather information through supervised in-person walks around the Pennsic site. Who knows who you'll meet... Visiting royalty? One of the SCA's Founders? Someone from the esteemed Cooper Family? Come and find out. KWAG activities run throughout both weeks, and alternate between KWAG Walk Days and KWAG Social Days. All activities begin and end at Family Point. Everyone is welcome! Please note: this is an active class. The group will be walking to various public locations on the Pennsic site (no private camps). All participants should wear sturdy shoes, a hat and sunscreen, and bring water. More info at KWAGuild.com.
     **INFO FOR PARENTS/CAREGIVERS:**  KWAG classes are designed for teens and older children (10+). All activities will be supervised by a warranted and background-checked youth officer plus at least one other responsible adult. All abilities are happily welcomed. Please email heather@heatherdale.com if we can help provide any special accommodations in advance. Parents and caregivers are very welcome to join the walks, and are encouraged to accompany their kids if any special needs might affect the child's enjoyment of the classes.

name: Ask a Scribe
description_book: These drop-in classes are ideal for scribes of all levels to speak one-on-one with an experienced scribe for help and advice.
description_web: These are informal drop-in classes for any scribe who's looking for advice, guidance, or help with any aspect of calligraphy and/or illumination. Several different experienced scribes will be hosting these sessions during Peace Week and War Week.

name: How to Be Heard: Vocal Techniques to get **LOUD**
description_book: Modern theatrical vocal techniques to be heard loudly and distinctly on the field or in Court. Drop-in, take one session or multiple.
description_web: Modern theatrical vocal techniques for the Creative Anachronist to help you be heard loudly and distinctly on the field or in Court. We will learn and practice a vocal warm-up designed to enhance breath, resonance, and diction. Class is led by a professional actor and teaching artist. Attend any or all sessions, you do **NOT** need to be at all classes to fully participate.

name: Peace Week Archery Practice
description_book: Warm up, practice shoot, and have fun on the Archery Range. Peace Week, Wednesday through Friday
description_web: Warm up, practice shoot, and have fun on the Archery Range. Ranges will be open depending upon marshal availability. Peace Week, Wednesday through Friday.

name: Drachenwald Ribbon Tournament
description_book: Kingdom of Drachenwald hosts a ribbon tournament. Contestants pledge their points to the flat or holy side. A prize will be presented to the winner.
description_web:
Each Spring the people of Drachenwald go to war over which side the *knäckebröd* (crispy bread) should be buttered: the flat side, or the holy side. This conflict has made its way to the great Pennsic War! Join the people of Drachenwald on the field in a ribbon tourney to see which side truly is the best side. 
The rules of the tournament are as follows: 
At the beginning of the tournament, each participant will have to pledge which side their winning points will count towards; the flat side or the holy side.
Each fighter will start with three ribbons. When a fighter has lost all of their ribbons, they are out of the tournament.
Fighters will challenge each other for one ribbon and each fight will be fought best two out of three. 
The winner of the challenge will gain one ribbon from their opponent and will then present that ribbon to the list mistress.
The ribbon will then be put in a bowl for either the flat side or the holy side, according to which side the winning fighter declared for.
The tournament is over when there is only one fighter left with ribbons. The winner will be presented with a prize and it will be announced which side of the *knäckebröd* had the most ribbons collected.
Come join in this fun tournament at 11:00 on Friday of Peace week.
   Sven (Flat side) and Siobhan (Holy side)
   King and Queen of Drachenwald

name: Heraldry for the Newcomer
description_book: An unconfusing (hopefully) guide on how to find a name and device. How to research and then submit. Want to be a herald...stop by!
description_web: Choosing a Society/persona name and device is both personal and fulfilling. In this class we will begin with the basics to get you started. Learn how and where to begin your research, who to contact, and the rules governing submissions. If you are interested in becoming a herald, we will be talking about that towards the end of the class.

name: English Rosaries and Paternosters
description_book: Discussion of prayer beads (paternosters) in England from the 11th to 16th centuries, especially the impact of the English Reformation.
description_web: Focus is on prayer beads (paternosters) in England from the 11th to 16th centuries, especially the impact of the English Reformation.
fee_itemization: Paper, ink

name: Ancient Inventions
description_book: Are modern people smarter that our ancestors? Probably not; we just have better machines.
description_web: Are we smarter that our ancestors? Probably not; we just have better machines, although our ancestors did have some pretty smart machines. Did aliens build the pyramids? Only in our imagination. Learn about a number of surprising tools and objects our ancestors had and used. Some of them may surprise you. Then bust some myths about history that you thought you knew. For example, why do all cultures have a seven-day week? Who invented spectacles? What’s the oldest musical instrument?

name: Latin Smack Talk 2023 Edition
description_book: It's back! The class that teaches you to insult your friends, enemies,  and the unsuspecting in LATIN!!! All in good fun of course.
description_web: It's back! The class that teaches you to insult your friends, enemies,  and the unsuspecting in LATIN!!! All in good fun of course.
fee_itemization: Handout

name: Shakespearean Original Pronunciation
description_book: How did Shakespeare's plays sound when he wrote them? Demo, background, and practice notes on Shakespearean OP.
description_web: Shakespeare’s actors did **not** speak like Sir Ian McKellen. But what did they sound like, and how do we know? The class will include a demonstration of the reconstructed Shakespearean Original Pronunciation (OP), details of how it was unearthed and how it’s being performed today, plus practice notes for learning to speak it.

name: Women Warriors of the Middle Ages
description_book: We will discuss women who donned armor, picked up weapons, and fought alongside their male counterparts.
description_web: We will discuss women who donned armor, picked up weapons, and fought alongside their male counterparts. Were they really so unusual? Why did they choose to forgo traditional women’s roles? What’s fact and what’s fiction? Come and hear their stories and learn more about these wondrous warrior women.

name: Four-Color Flat Lucet Cord
description_book: We will make a flat cord on the lucet that will have up to 4 colors using bobbins.
description_web: Cord from a lucet can be quite flexible in color and structure. We will be making a flat cord with up to four colors. The threads hang below the lucet on bobbins to keep from getting tangled. Bring your own lucet and bobbins which can be made out of cardboard or foam, or we will have kits for $25 containing both a lucet, fiber and four bobbins.
fee_itemization:
Lucet $20
thread and bobbins $5

name: Passover Foods for a Medieval Seder
description_book: Covers the foods eaten at Ashkenazi Passover seders in the Middle Ages. We'll taste a number of these foods.
description_web: We'll cover the foods eaten at Passover seders in the Middle Ages when matzah was an inch thick and horseradish was only eaten as an ingredient in *charoset*. We will be looking at the evolution of the rulings about various foods, recipes to make some of them, how some of the practices changed. Includes taste testing.
fee_itemization: to cover cost of handout and foods we taste test.

name: Atlatls of the World: A Geographical Survey
description_book: A discussion of (and chance to use) the different types of atlatls, where they came from, and how they were used in their various regions.
description_web: A discussion of (and chance to use) the different types of atlatls, where they came from, and how they were used in their various regions.

name: All in the *Bransle*
description_book: An introduction to *bransles* (pronounced brawl) for new dancers. We'll cover as many *bransles* as we can. Come join us in a *bransle* or four!

name: Let's Make Some Noise: Instrument Making
description_book: Make a drum, maraca, or a kazoo! Class will include some sing-along so we can use our new instruments.

name: Youth Beginner Kumihimo: Three Basic Weaves
description_book: Together we will learn & practice the most basic forms of the 3 types of *kumihimo* weaves. Boards & thread will be provided.
description_web: Together we will learn and practice the most basic forms of the three types of *kumihimo* weaves: the square-shaped *kado-uchi himo,* the round *maru-uchi himo,* and the flat *hira-ucho himo.* *Kumihimo* boards and thread will be provided.
fee_itemization:
Kumihimo boards 10
thread 5

name: Ancient Games: *Senet*
description_book: Learn some history and learn to play a reconstruction of one of the oldest known board games.

name: Egg Tempera Panel Painting: Part 1, Gesso and Prep
description_book: Period egg tempera panel painting, using egg yolk and mineral pigments! Hands-on and in-depth. Discover the paint used by Duccio, Cimabue and Giotto!
description_web: Egg tempera is an ancient medium dating from the Egyptians through today. Tempera reached its height in medieval and Renaissance Europe. Virtually all panel paintings executed before the mid-1400s used solely the yolk of the egg as the binder. Class is in-depth, hands-on. Part I covers panel and object prep, handmade gesso, and all info needed to authentically prep surfaces for polychrome and painting. Materials included; beginner to advanced. Visit Guild Mirandola for full list of classes.
fee_itemization: Fee is for all materials: gesso panel, pigments, eggs, brushes, tools.

name: Sino-Scribal Playtime
description_book: An opportunity for those who took any of the classes in the Sino-Scribal Workshop to practice the techniques they learned earlier in the week.

name: Glass Animal Beadmaking
description_book: Intermediate lampworking: making glass animals. Observers welcome.
description_web: Intermediate lampworking: making glass animals. Observers welcome.
fee_itemization: gas and glass

name: 19 Irish Goddesses
description_book: The Irish pantheon is filled with a rich and glorious collection of powerful goddesses. Come learn their stories and songs, and share your own.
description_web: The Irish pantheon is filled with a rich and glorious collection of powerful goddesses. Come learn their stories and songs, and share your own.
fee_itemization: Copying costs

name: Opening Up a Can of Worms: Research in the SCA
description_book: If you interested in doing an A&S project but don't know where to start, this is the class for you.
description_web: Do research and documentation seem overwhelming? Are you interested in doing an A&S project but don't know where to start? This class will teach you how to find, evaluate, and document the sources you need to research and complete an A&S project in any category.

name: The *Ganassa Troupe* ~1560-1584
description_book: We look at the amazing history of Zan Ganassa's troupe, who performed before the *Gelosi* Troupe got famous.
description_web: Just before the time of the *Gelosi Troupe* and other famous troupes of the end of the sixteenth century was the *Ganassa Troupe*. An unusually large amount of information is known about them, who they were, where they came from what they performed, how they performed, where they performed, and where they got the ideas that they used to create their plays and invent lines to deliver in those plays. In this class we will touch on all those details.
fee_itemization: No fees.

name: The **Perfect Hat Stretcher** Made Easy.
description_book: Learn how to make a hat stretcher at home in an hour or so that exactly replicates the shape of your head for **under five dollars**!
description_web: Hat stretchers not only can stretch a small hat to fit your head, they will also keep a hat from shrinking. A stretcher is great for all hats and a must for felt hats. The problem with commercial hat stretchers is that they are expensive and rarely fit the shape of an individual's head. Learn how to make a hat stretcher at home in an hour or two that will exactly duplicate the shape of your head! This will make and keep your hat shaped perfectly, so you can wear it comfortably all day long without getting hot spots and it will be unlikely to blow off in the wind. And best of all, it will cost you around $5 or less to make. The stretcher is so easy and inexpensive to make that you will probably make one for each hat that you own. A brand new class that I developed, it debuts at Pennsic 50.
fee_itemization: $2 for handout.

name: Brew Like a Viking: All Natural Mead
description_book: Modern and medieval brewing techniques and tips for a truly period mead. Includes a demo on using comb honey, and the egg float test. **Age 21+.**
description_web: Modern and medieval brewing techniques and tips for a truly period mead. Honey is one of the most forgiving ingredients to work with, making mead the perfect concoction for the new or inexperienced brewer. Much of the information I will go over is general, and focuses on natural brewing instead of depending on using store-bought additives, including yeast. A plethora of medieval mead recipes will be shared. I will demonstrate how to extract crystallized comb honey, and how to measure the sugar density of the must, both using medieval techniques. Includes a detailed handout. **Age 21+.**
fee_itemization: copying costs, toner

name: Asian Persona Meet-up
description_book: General meet-and-greet for people with Asian personas including Russia.
description_web: General meet-and-greet for people with Asian personas including Russia. If you have SCA business cards or a Dot, please bring those so we can network. Topics will include navigating appropriation, advances in research and documentation, anticipating modern cultural concerns, and general support.

name: The Assassin Pennsic Game Get-Together
description_book: Are you playing in the Assassins Game? We would like all players to meet up with the Referee and go through all the rules and concepts of the game.
description_web: Are you playing in the Assassins Game? The Chartered Assassins Guilds of the East and Æthelmearc would like to meet up with the people participating and go through all the rules and concepts of the game during either of two scheduled times during the first week. On August 10th, we'll have a check-in just in case anyone has any complaints, suggestions, or wants to ask questions about where things were.

name: Classical Cryptology: Codes and Ciphers
description_book: Codes and ciphers from antiquity to the Renaissance. Hands-on class will allow students to learn about the ancient and medieval forms of encryption.
description_web: Codes and ciphers from antiquity to the Renaissance. Hands-on class will allow students to learn about the ancient and medieval forms of encryption. Please bring writing instrument.

name: African Spices
description_book: Bring jars and take home *Berbere, Piripiri, Harissa* and preserved lemons.
description_web: Bring jars and take home *Berbere, Piripiri, Harissa* and preserved lemons. Ingredients and recipes will be provided so you can make some of the spice blends and condiments used on the African continent. We will definitely make the four listed but it is possible to make other blends with the same spices. Bring 4 small (8 oz) jars/bottles for the spices and a quart mason jar equivalent for the lemons.
fee_itemization: $2 for the recipes,$5 for lemons and spices =$7

name: Celtic Textiles & Women’s Dress of Central Europe
description_book: Discussion of textiles, period iconography, dress accessories, and garments for women in Iron Age Central Europe.
description_web: Analysis of textiles from the Iron Age in Central Europe, along with information on dress accessories, period iconography, and burial practices. This class aims to help make informed choices for crafting women’s dress in the Late Hallstatt and Early La Tene periods in Central Europe.

name: Gathering of the Louds
description_book: Shawms, sackbutts and curtals, oh my. Join other players of louds. Each session features a different style of music. Bring chair/stand/clothespins.
description_web: Shawms, sackbutts and curtals, oh my. Players of loud Renaissance instruments gather just for fun to play different styles of music at each session such as *intradas* and other instrumental processionals as well as polychoral music. Not sure what these instruments are? Come listen. Do you play recorder and want to play something with more volume? Some instruments (with new reeds) may be available to try, but this is not a class for beginners. A reading knowledge of music is necessary. Bring a chair, music stand, and clothespins.

name: Advanced Dance: *Fia Guilemina* for Four
description_book: This delightful passion play for four people represents one of the most challenging, yet gratifying dances of the 15th century. Test your mettle!
description_web: This delightful passion play for four people represents one of the most challenging, yet gratifying dances of the 15th century. Test your mettle!

name: Very Basic Belly Dancing
description_book: We will be working on the very basics of belly dancing, no previous experience needed.

name: English Period Ballads and Songs to Sing and Play
description_book: Songs and ballads in English from the fifteenth, sixteenth, and seventeenth centuries. All vocal ranges and instruments welcome.

name: Illumination 101, or How I learned to Love the Dot
description_book: If you are thinking you can’t possibly create a scroll, but you would really like to, let me show you how. No experience necessary!
description_web:
If you are thinking you can’t possibly create a scroll, but you would really like to, let me show you how. No experience necessary! I will show you valuable resources and handy tools to help you get started.
If you have paper (thick art paper is best), pencil (with white eraser), paintbrush (small), paint (gouache), and a palette, please bring them. I will, however, have materials for those that don’t.
fee_itemization: I will share use of my materials, including pencils, paintbrush, paint, paper, and pallet.  You can take the paper with you.

name: *Shūji*: Japanese Calligraphy Workshop
description_book: A hands-on introduction to Japanese calligraphy for official documents. Please bring large bamboo writing brushes and ink stones if you have them.
