description_web: A hands-on introduction to designing and executing Japanese official documents. This class will introduce the role of the scribe in imperial and military governments. Epistolatory style and the structure of official documents will be introduced. Participants will learn about the evolution of character styles and how documents were attested. We will also discuss paper and signature seals. The bulk of the class will consist of a hands-on calligraphy class similar to those held in Tokyo. Please bring large bamboo writing brushes, ink stones, paper weights, and *hanshi*-size felt mats if you have them. There will be limited loaner supplies of all of these available at class. Paper and ink is included in the class materials fee.
fee_itemization:
Covers production cost of the handout. I have been advised to include a handout for this class.
Cost of paper and ink both of which are specialized and imported directly from Japan.

name: The Pennsic Mightier: Improv Workshop
description_book: Improv workshop for experienced performers: address higher level improv skills, create character, build scenes leading to a performance. **Age limit**
description_web: This improv workshop is designed to address intermediate and advanced level improv skills focused on creating unique characters, building relationships, committing to a scene, and exploring long-form improv. Long-form improv is a building block for work in *commedia* and sketch comedy. The character and scene work will improve your overall acting skills as well as building confidence in everyday life. This workshop will culminate in a performance on Friday 8/5 in the Performing Arts Tent; however, the performance is optional if you would prefer to attend the workshops without performing live. You must have prior improv experience (modern experience or prior Pennsic classes, etc.) and be familiar with the basics of “Yes, and” to participate in this class. Those without experience may be allowed at the instructor’s discretion. You do not have to attend every workshop; however, different skills will be addressed each day and attendance at all is beneficial. The Friday workshop is mandatory if you would like to perform in the show. **This class is for ages 18 and up; however, younger students may be allowed with both parental and instructor permission.** Please attend the first workshop (with a parent, for those under 18) or contact the instructor in advance to participate.

name: Introduction to the Hebrew Calendar
description_book: An introduction and overview meant to situate the Hebrew calendar in its cultural context and give a little insight into its evolution.
description_web: Still in use today, the Hebrew calendar has deep roots in the ancient Levant. This class is an introduction and overview meant to situate one specific calendar in its cultural context and acquaint you with some of its month-names, holidays, and cycles, and give a little insight into its evolution from its Bronze Age origins to its use today.

name: Viking Wire Weaving
description_book: A hands-on class for learning to do basic wire weaving, including drawing down and finishing. I will have basic tools and supplies for class use.
description_web: A hands-on class for learning to do basic wire weaving, including drawing down and finishing. I will have basic tools and supplies for students, a handout, and kits available for purchase.
fee_itemization: Handout, tools, and supplies for in class are included. Additional supplies may be bought separately.

name: The Life of Götz von Berlichingen
description_book: He can lick my a@@.  The life of German knight Götz von Berlichingen or Götz of the Iron Hand. Learn about this colorful robber knight.
description_web: He can lick my a@@.  The life of German knight Götz von Berlichingen or Götz of the Iron Hand. Learn about the colorful robber knight who wasn't slowed by the loss of his hand to a cannon ball.

name: History and Evolution of Jewish Prayer
description_book: Guidelines for Jewish prayer. Biblical sources, format, & codification through history. All invited to a Friday evening service in a private camp TBA.

name: Medieval Fan Fiction
description_book: A discussion of how "fan fiction" was produced and used in the Middle Ages; how we can produce it and use it in our Society.
description_web: A discussion of how "fan fiction" was produced and used in the Middle Ages; how we can produce it and use it in our Society. Topics will include the definition of fan fiction, its modern and pre-modern history, plus its techniques and authors. Time permitting, we will attempt our own fan fiction.

name: *Cuirboulli*: Water-Hardened Leather Armor
description_book: How to make armor from vegetable-tanned leather, using hot water.
description_web: How to make armor from vegetable-tanned leather, using hot water.

name: So You Want to Bring a Period Tent to Pennsic
description_book: What tent should you get? Tips for easier set-up. Avoid "A river runs through it." Furniture and lighting.
description_web: What tent to get. How many people will it house? Are you camping solo? Tips for easier set-up: shorter tent poles, accordion-pleated walls, mark "tab A" and "slot B" for error-free alignment. Bathtub the edge of the ground cloth to avoid "A river runs through it." Furniture and lighting. Decorative touches like chandeliers, tapestries, and rugs.
fee_itemization: printing costs

name: East Kingdom A&S General Rubric Training by EKMoAS
description_book: This class sponsored by the East Kingdom Minister of Arts & Sciences provides a deeper understanding of the EK A&S general rubric.
description_web: This class sponsored by the EKMoAS provides a deeper understanding of the EK A&S general rubric used to judge Crown's A&S Championships in the East. It is designed both for judges to promote consistent calibration and for entrants to allow them to better understand what their judges will be looking for. People from all Kingdoms and all levels of experience welcome.
fee_itemization: $1 for handout, or QR code for digital handout

name: Introduction to SCA Period Archery
description_book: Discussion, explanation, and show-and-tell of SCA-period class archery rules, archery equipment, period shoots, period targets, and sources.
description_web: Discussion, explanation, and show-and-tell of SCA-period class archery rules, archery equipment, period shoots, period targets, and sources. Hands-on look at period class recurves, longbows, crossbows, and ammunition (no shooting!). Learn how Period Class is different from Open Class, and how easy, rewarding, and fun it can be to shoot medieval equipment in our medieval Society!

name: Make Your Own Roman-Style Brooch (*Fibula*)
description_book: Make your own Roman-style brooch/*fibula* from wire and a package of glass/metal beads. Tools available. Bring yours, if possible. **Age 12+.**
description_web: You will enjoy learning how to make your own Roman-style brooch or *fibula* from wire and a package of glass/metal beads. Jewelry-making tools will be available, but if you have your own, **please** bring them along. **Age 12+.**
fee_itemization: includes wire, beads and use of tools.  If you have your own jewellery tools, please bring them along.

name: Savory Cabbage, Meat Pottage, Soused Fish
description_book: Savory cabbage, chicken and salt pork pottage, and a soused fish from the 1549 *Banchetti*.
description_web: Savoy cabbage cooked in water with a crust of hard cheese, butter and salt and when nearly done more butter is added with Italian parsley and then cooked a bit more. Served for the feast with grated hard cheese and black pepper on top. Pottage of chicken breast with salt pork with true cinnamon, crushed ginger, and eggs. This is layered over a low pastry crust and baked cooked and when done served with a garnish of true cinnamon and candied pine nuts. A whole cleaned fish with a small amount of salt, floured, and fried in olive oil till done and then drained. Next a sousing mixture of vinegar, pepper, true cinnamon, ginger, cloves, salt, and saffron is brought to the boil and the fish is soused for a minute in the mixture and then wrapped in dried bay leaves and dried in a 150 F oven for several hours for preservation purposes.

name: *Adventure Maximus*: An Introductory D&D-style RPG
description_book: *Adventure Maximus* is a D&D-style game for young players, with simple character sheets and a basic dungeon crawl. Limited to no more than 8 players.
description_web: *Adventure Maximus* is a D&D-style game for young players, with simple character sheets and a basic dungeon crawl. Limited to no more than 8 players.

name: Soapmaking
description_book: Make-and-take soap. Learn a brief history of soapmaking and why we aren't making "proper" soap at Pennsic while we make melt-and-pour soap.
description_web: Make-and-take soap. Learn a brief history of soapmaking and why we aren't making "proper" soap at Pennsic while we make melt-and-pour soap. I will have references you can look at if you want to do more.
fee_itemization: covers cost of supplies

name: Intro to *Xiangqi* (Chinese Chess)
description_book: Come learn the Chinese form of chess which dates back 1300 years to T'ang Dynasty. Boards and equipment provided for use.
description_web: Come learn the Chinese form of chess which dates back 1300 years to T'ang Dynasty. Boards and equipment provided for use.

name: Beyond the Cloth: Persona Glassware, Late Period
description_book: Discussion of glassware from the Late Middle Ages to the Renaissance, including Europe, the Middle East, and parts of Asia.
description_web: Have you ever walked around an event with a glass in your hand? People will notice it long before they even think about looking at your shoes. Make a statement by having the right kind of vessel for your persona! Discussion of glassware from the Late Middle Ages to the Renaissance, including Europe, the Middle East, and parts of Asia. Join us again at 3:00 pm for a live, narrated demonstration of the making of a Late Period drinking vessel by Master Ali (Arab Boy)or Magistra Gnaea Celera.

name: Known World Woodworkers Meet and Greet
description_book: Sometimes I feel like I work in a void, But I know all yall are out there ;) So come get a cookie and meet some of your fellow woodworkers!
description_web:
Sometimes I feel like I work in a void, But I know all yall are out there ;) So come get a cookie and meet some of your fellow woodworkers! 
My House has decided to allow me to host a party Friday of peace week so we can meet each other.
my name is K
Hus Faerhaga, N8, Fletcher's row

name: Lucet Basics
description_book: Make a square cord and a two-color cord. Lucet, string, and instructions provided as part of the class fee.
description_web: Make a square cord and a two-color cord. Lucet, string, and instructions provided as part of the class fee.
fee_itemization: Lucet, string & instructions

name: Beginner Thrown Weapons
description_book: Learn axe throwing, basic care of your weapons, and basic rules. A hands-on session is included. Limit of 25 participants; no experience necessary.
description_web: Learn axe throwing, basic care of your weapons, and basic rules. A hands-on session is included. Limit of 25 participants; no experience necessary.

name: Children's Choir
description_book: For children 13 and younger. Sing music in a period style. Meets daily. Performance on Thursday of War Week!
description_web: For children 13 and younger. Sing music in a period style. Meets daily. Performance on Thursday of War Week! Responsible adult needs to be within reach for the younger ones. Bring a folder to hold music. We will teach rounds, songs and melodies from the medieval to Renaissance. Session will be 45 minutes. Dress rehearsal in PA tent on Thursday with a performance at 6 pm.

name: Scythian and Saka Meet-up
description_book: Calling all Iron Age Nomads for a Scythian- and Saka-focused meet-up!
description_web: For those who have an established persona or are simply curious about this fascinating culture, we are gathering to share information, ask questions, and socialize. Wearing Scythian garb is highly encouraged, as well as the sharing of literature and/or personal research. And of course, flash your Scythian tattoos!

name: Holy Cows and Flaming Monks
description_book: True to form, the SCA has produced its own folk saints, and what may start as an inside joke ends up looking like a real saint's cult.
description_web: Like the Middle Ages itself, the SCA has produced its own folk saints, and what may start as an inside joke ends up looking like a real saint's cult. We'll explore some of the weirder saints to come out of the SCA, and look at the cult of St. Bunstable as a case study.

name: Learn to Knit!
description_book: [YouthU] Want to learn to knit? In this class, we will learn to cast on, garter stitch, and how to bind off. Geared for youth participants.
description_web: [YouthU] Want to learn to knit? In this class, we will learn to cast on, garter stitch, and how to bind off. Geared for youth participants. Other knitters who wish to help are most welcome. :)
fee_itemization: Practice needles and practice yarn the students can take home.  If you have your own yarn and needles, bring them.

name: Combat Archery Tactics from *The Senryaku*
description_book: A survey of stratagems and training methods for combat archers drawn from a classic of period strategy, with discussion of equipment and doctrine.

name: Crossing Cultures in Storytelling
description_book: We'll discuss moving stories across cultures. I will focus on my character, Isu Odinnson, and the steps I took to create his stories.
description_web: This class will discuss moving stories across cultures. I will focus on my character, Isu Odinnson, and the steps I took to create his stories.

name: Canvas Painting Practicum
description_book: Practicum of painting on canvas. Using modern acrylics, we will cover how you can decorate your tent, etc.
description_web: Practicum of painting on canvas. We will use the modern acrylics and discuss how you can decorate your tent, etc. Covers how you plan a project and adjust paint. Take home the canvas you painted yourself.
fee_itemization: Canvas to take home. Use of brushes, paints and other mediums for decorating the canvas.

name: Spanish Rope Shoes, Part 1: Soles
description_book: Part 1 of making Spanish rope shoes: making the cord and soles.
description_web: Rope shoes have been around for thousands of years. This class will focus on the production of Spanish-style rope shoes, their history and their construction. This is a two-part class and students **MUST** attend both sessions in order to complete their first shoe. Limited shoe kits will be available. Kits will include all materials and tools necessary to complete one pair of shoes.
fee_itemization:
Cording for shoes: $10
Needles and pliers: $5

name: *Romani*: An Introduction to "Gypsy" Persona
description_book: Want a *Romani* persona, but don't know how/where to start? Learn about the *Rom*, their history, and the fun of this fascinating persona.
description_web: Want a *Romani* persona, but don't know how/where to start? Learn about the *Rom*, their history, common pitfalls, and the fun of this fascinating persona. We will be covering their history, migration routes, clothing, and how to portray this persona within the SCA.

name: Medieval Africa South of the Maghreb
description_book: An introductory overview of aspects of African medieval material culture, primarily from archaeological sources in East and West Africa.
description_web: An introductory overview of aspects of African medieval material culture, primarily from archaeological sources in East and West Africa, with the goal of helping people interested in portraying personas or recreating arts in the spirit of respectful scholarship. A handout and online resource will be provided, and students are encouraged to share their knowledge and resources as well.

name: Sunk Cost Support
description_book: A short lecture and discussion of how we may be feeling about changing our SCA involvement after pandemic. **Age 18+.**
description_web: Sunk Cost is an economic idea that can be used to evaluate our SCA experiences. Have you found yourself questioning or wishing to change your level of SCA involvement? You're not alone. Sunk Cost Support is a community of people who are reconsidering how, and to what degree they're involved in our hobby. Please join us if any part of this rings true for you. There is also a Facebook group and quarterly calls where we discuss different facets of what goes into our decisions to change our participation. Contact info for these will be shared during the class. **Age 18+.**

name: Newcomers 101
description_book: Titles and customs across the Known World. Camping and what to bring with you to events. How to get along in the SCA.
description_web: Handouts showing the common titles and responsibilities. Discussion about all things SCA. Camping, names, bylaws about bullying. Anything they want to know that I can answer or direct them to another person or class.

name: Beginner Dance: 15th-Century Italian
description_book: Never danced before, or afraid to try Italian steps? All steps and patterns for several simple and popular dances will be taught; no partner required.

name: Make-and-Take SCA Memory boxes
description_book: Using shoe boxes for younger children and tissue boxes for older children, decorate and take your own SCA memory boxes.
description_web: Using shoe boxes for younger children (3+ are welcome!) and tissue boxes for older children, decorate and take your own SCA memory boxes.  Kids will be given stickers and other art supplies to decorate their boxes, and can also draw or write down memories from Pennsic 50. These boxes can be filled through the year and brought back next year to talk about what they have done while making a new box.

name: Frets & Fingers: Intro to Stringed Instruments
description_book: Basic technique and theory for playing stringed instruments. Fundamental exercises as well as tricks and tips to make you a better player.
description_web: Guitar, lute, uke, citole, mandolin... From "How do I hold it" to semi-advanced pro-tips that fool the audience into thinking you're better than you really are, this class is a distillation of nearly a half-century of performing experience on stringed instruments. For all ages and ability levels. Bring your instrument if available, but it's not required.

name: Toddler Playgroup
description_book: Let our toddlers tire each other out! Let the parents and guardians make friends! Meets at Toddler Lounge Shade by playground

name: Un-Squashed Bugs
description_book: A hands-on class based on late period *Books of Hours* with realistic insects painted in the margins. Scadians often call the style "squashed bug."
description_web: The "squashed bug" style of book illumination is a late-period fashion designed to fool the eye into thinking that insects have landed on the page. In this hands-on class, we will look at some medieval examples from *Books of Hours*, then try to paint an equally convincing bug.
fee_itemization: No fee

name: Open Scribal Time
description_book: Take advantage of our clean, well-lit space to work on existing projects or to try your hand at calligraphy and/or illumination.

name: Clout Shooting Practice: Archery
description_book: Practicing 50-100 yards to increase accuracy. All are welcome.
description_web: Practicing 50-100 yards to increase accuracy. All are welcome. This will be on the clout range (white flags).

name: Archery Marshal and MIT Orientation
description_book: All Archery Marshals are required to attend **ONE** orientation meeting. This meeting is to explain Pennsic specific rules, the ranges, and scoring.
description_web: All Archery Marshals are required to attend **ONE** orientation meeting. This meeting is to explain Pennsic specific rules, the ranges, and scoring. You're welcome to bring MITs and attend as often as you want. We want you to learn the scoring system to make getting the totals faster, easier and more accurate.

name: Eight Essential Knots for the SCA Camper
description_book: Hands-on class on how to tie eight basic and important knots that can make your camping life easier and safer.
description_web: Hands-on class on how to tie eight basic and important knots that can make your camping life easier and safer.

location: Atlantian Royal (Fiber Arts Pavilion) (N40, front edge of the Atlantian Royal Encampment, in the Artisans Easement)
name: Retrieving Retted Flax at Pennsic
description_book: We will be retrieving the bundle of flax we put in to rett in the creek near the Fiber Arts Pavilion.
description_web: Flax is one of the oldest fibers used by man to create thread for weaving, but how do they get the fibers *out* of the flax plants? Retting is the term used for the process of "rotting" the plant fiber enough to release the bast fibers within the plants so they can be separated from the other plant material and used for spinning and weaving. We will be retrieving the bundle of flax we put in to rett in the creek near the Fiber Arts Pavilion.

name: Siege Inspection Tent
description_book: I was told this is how I reserve a tent for siege inspections on the battlefield.
description_web: Siege engine and ammo inspection. I also have no problems if any interested in siege wish to stop by see what we do and ask questions.

name: Irish Frame Drum: Introduction to the *Bodhrán*
description_book: Learn session etiquette and how to play jig, reel, slip-jig, polka, and hornpipe rhythms. Bring a drum; some loaners available.
description_web: The acclaimed *bodhránista* from Three Weird Sisters teaches how to choose and care for the *bodhrán*: what makes a good tipper; tune and set structure; how to identify and play jig, reel, hornpipe, slip jig, polka rhythms; session etiquette; *bodhrán* jokes. Learn secret arcane hand gestures to amaze and stun your listeners. Demonstration of how to adapt *bodhrán* drumming to period music. Bring a *bodhrán* if you have one. A few loaner drums will be available. Teens and older welcomed.

name: 16th-C Dance Music Forms (Pavan, Salterello, Etc.)
description_book: Teaching acoustic instrumental musicians to read any 16th-C tune to convert it to the different dance forms. **Experienced.**
description_web: This class will teach acoustic instrumental musicians to read any 16th-century tune and convert it to the different dance forms. **The ability to read music and familiarity with your acoustic instrument will be a must.** We will play at A=440.

location: Courtesan College (Strawberry Fields B06 (off eLeri Lane between Ankara and Visby Vale))
name: Male Sex Workers of India - CCt
description_book: Explore the lives and livelihoods of male sex workers in India; who they were, what they did, and why they were important. **Age 18+.**
description_web: Explore the lives and livelihoods of male sex workers in India; who they were, what they did, and why they were important. We'll cover everything from male dancers and musicians to escorts and beyond. **Age 18+.**

name: Fun 15th-Century Set Dances: *Pizochara*
description_book: A fun allegorical set dance depicting the less official happenings in monastic communities. Tempo changes and all steps to be taught!
description_web: A fun allegorical set dance depicting the less official happenings in monastic communities. Tempo changes and all steps to be taught!

location: Denys the Decadent's Camo  (EO7 off great Eastern Hiughway, Look for 12 Steppe Sign)
name: 12-Step Meeting
description_book: An open meeting for those in recovery or any 12-step programs.
description_web: A daily 12-step meeting I hold in my Camp E07 off Great Eastern Highway. Look for the sign. Held at 4:00 PM, **OPEN MEETING .** Holding a meeting here since 1997.

location: Enchanted Ground or next to it (W09)
name: Period Portable Furniture You Can Make
description_book: Chairs, tables, and a bed, all based on period designs.
description_web: Chairs, tables, and a bed, all based on period designs. At least one chair, one table, and the bed are simple enough so that someone with only basic tools and no expertise should be able to make them.

name: Domos Draconum (DnD): In Search of the Unknown
description_book: Vintage 1970s Dungeons & Dragons adventure for ages 10+. No experience necessary. Limit: 8

name: Children's Bead Bracelets & Necklaces
description_book: Children will learn to make a simple bead bracelet or necklace using wood, glass, acrylic, and ceramic beads.
description_web: Children will learn to make a simple bead bracelet or necklace using wood, glass, acrylic, and ceramic beads.

name: Youth Beginning Basket Weaving
description_book: We will make a small reed basket. It's not going to be complicated so it's perfect for learning.
fee_itemization: 5- reeds for baskets

name: Period Card Games: *Noddy*
description_book: Before cribbage there was *noddy*. Learn how to play this 52-card game. Rules based on *Francis Willughby's Book of Games*.
description_web:
"Cribbage is not period!" We have all heard this and it is true. It was created around 1604-1606, but *noddy* was and is one of the games that cribbage is derived from. *Noddy* is a faster game that still has a slightly complex scoring set of rules that is easy to learn. Game uses a 52-card deck.

Teacher will have her copy of the book *Francis Willughby's Book of Games* (for geeks to look at) for those interested. Besides learning the rules and playing the game, each player will walk away with a copy of the rule set.
fee_itemization: pamphlet

name: German Renaissance Glass Demo (Furnace Glass)
description_book: A fully narrated, live, 2000-degree glassblowing demonstration! Learn about the materials, the techniques, and how glass usage changed over time!
description_web: Come and watch a fully narrated, live, 2000-degree glassblowing demonstration! See how we can take this fascinating material and turn it into a never-ending variety of items! Learn about the materials we use, and how glass making techniques, its uses, and value varied throughout time and culture! For this demo, see items from the 14th -16th centuries in the Dutch German style! Family-friendly, all ages welcome, open Q&A to follow.

name: Best of the Knowne Worlde Rapier Tourney
description_book: Come one, come all! Come watch the best of the best fight! Open only to those with a grant-level rapier awards, MoD, Knights, and Masters of Arms.

name: Templar TA-50
description_book: Templar equipment layout, as well as practical application for SCA combat.
description_web: The clothing, arms, armor and equipment used by a member of the Knights Templar. This equipment will also be applicable to other Military Knightly Orders, as well as secular Crusader portrayals.

name: Voice Heralding 101
description_book: Come learn the basics of voice heralding for court and tournaments!
description_web:
From SCA.org: “Voice heralds” are used for “crying out announcements, announcing the fighters entering the list field, as well as acting as the voice of the nobility in court, reading the scrolls that accompany the awards being given out.”

“Book heralds”: helping members of the SCA to research period names and design devices (armory), as well as registering them with the SCA College of Heralds.

“Protocol heralds”: recording the awards and honors that are given in court, drafting period-style ceremonies for use in court, determining the precedence of award holders, as well as other legal niceties in all sorts of situations.

This class deals with Voice Heralds. Learn how to project your voice, what to say, and how to say it!

name: Archery Long Distance Shooting
description_book: Long distance shooting from 140 to 50 yards from various positions.
description_web: Long distance shooting from 140 to 50 yards from various positions.

name: Pick-up Fighting (Sponsored by HRM Ealdormere)
description_book: All fighters are welcome to come out for some pick-up fighting.
description_web: All armored fighters are welcome to come out for some pick-up fighting.

name: Make Your Own Medallion Cord
description_book: Why wear a plain white string? Learn *Slung*, cord-making described as juggling with strings! Children welcome with adult. OK to be late.
description_web: Why wear a plain white string? Learn *Slung*, a method for cord-making that can best be described as juggling with strings! Children welcome with adult. *Slung* is also known as Viking whip-cording. It is not only useful but a lot of fun for all ages. Can be done as a children's activity or at demos. Bring a friend! People will be taking turns on a limited number of set-ups. Showing up late is perfectly fine.

name: Beginner Dance: English Country
description_book: Never danced before? No problem! Start with basic steps and patterns, and then learn simple English Country Dances.
description_web: Never danced before? No problem! Start with basic steps and patterns, and then learn simple English Country Dances.

name: Is Chocolate Period?
description_book: A lecture on chocolate in period with a handout of period and period-ish recipes. Bring a cup and we will approximate the period chocolate.
description_web:
A lecture on chocolate in period with a handout of period and period-ish recipes. Bring a cup/mug/horn and we will approximate the period chocolate.
Handout: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1CXO_HcetT8D4KHf91x6OiV0qFewh3ZTO4N0ynfdjPDY/edit?usp=sharing
fee_itemization: $2 for handout, donation for taste.

name: Yoga for Anyone and Everyone
description_book: All-level friendly, basic *vinyasa* class, open to complete beginners & seasoned yogis. Bring your own mat, towel & water, prepare to work and relax.

name: Intro to Period Pigments and Paints
description_book: Malachite and ochre! Glair and gum arabic! Learn about period pigments and binders.
description_web: Learn about pigments and binders such as glair and gum arabic, malachite and ochre.
fee_itemization: covers pigments, binders, palette, tools

name: Build a Rapier Tower IKEA style
description_book: Learn to build a sturdy structure for rapier fighting that flat packs.
description_web: Tired of using hay bales for the corners of walls and having "That Talk" with your opponent because the shot breached the air above the hay bale? Have you been a marshal with a staff trying to be the corner and praying "Not the Face!"  Well, in this class you will learn how easy it is to build a flat pack rapier tower that will be sturdy enough to lean up against, easy to take down and easy on your storage space. Class handouts will include cutting diagrams, parts lists and tips on construction for hand tool and power tool users.

location: Courtesan College (Strawberry Fields B06 (off eLeri Lane between Ankara and Visby Vale))
name: The Dangerous Beauty: Series 3, *La Tresca*! - CCt
description_book: The Arts of a Courtesan. Discussion and practice in how to look and act like an elite historical sex worker. **Age 18+.**
description_web: The Dangerous Beauty: a series on the Arts of a Courtesan. You - yes, *you* have within you the power to secure a military alliance, curate courtly influence, maybe feel more assurance about attending Court, or just chat with that interesting person you met at fighter practice last week. We will be discussing and practicing how to look and act like an elite sex worker while in persona based on a combination of both extant European period writings on social behavior with modern framing of deportment, etiquette, and seduction. This section will cover table manners, eating and drinking, serving and being served, and the fine art of being a host. There will be handouts available. **Age limit 18+.**

name: A Brief Intro to Medieval Middle Eastern Dance
description_book: We'll briefly discuss the history of dance in the Middle East and how all of this relates to M.E./belly dance within the SCA.
description_web: The focus of this class is to briefly discuss the history of dance in the Middle East, the different eras and areas that are involved, cultural and societal views of dance and dancers (both professional and non-professional), and how all of this relates to Middle Eastern dance within the SCA. *Please bring your own seating if possible. There are hay bales and the dance floor is available for towels, rugs and mats.* Handout available for free online or $10 for a paper copy (to cover printing costs. It's long with a lot of high-resolution images). Here's the virtual handout: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1OqWLGMmhwzWS7f5VF2OCxs2Ug42RUIDUkEEW-yfY1zM/edit?usp=sharing .
fee_itemization: Here's the virtual handout: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1OqWLGMmhwzWS7f5VF2OCxs2Ug42RUIDUkEEW-yfY1zM/edit?usp=sharing

name: The Pennsic Mightier: Improv Comedy Show
description_book: Enjoy our montage-style improv comedy show.
description_web: It’s the Pennsic "mightier than the sword" montage-style improv comedy show and anything can happen! Enjoy a fun night of long-form improvised comedy based on your suggestions and stories presented by the Pennsic Mightier Workshop cast!

name: Pennsic Glass Challenge
description_book:
Looking for beadmaking enthusiasts of all skill levels! Each session will have a different surprise challenge!
Visit tinyurl.com/glassapprentice.
description_web:
Looking for beadmaking enthusiasts of all skill levels! If you can work at a beadmaking torch, safely, without direct supervision, join us! 
This is a fun challenge meant to push individuals along their own learning paths, to try something new and find new horizons in their creativity and technical skill. This is **not** a competition.
Back again, by popular demand at Pennsic 50!

Visit tinyurl.com/glassapprentice for more information.
fee_itemization: All equipment, materials, and tools will be provided for each daily challenge. If you have your own favourite glass-rated safety glasses (didymium), please bring them along.

name: Period Card Games: *Piquet* (or *Cent*)
description_book: Do you like to play cards? Come learn to play this challenging late-period two-player card game.
description_web: Looking for something to pass the time at events? Do you like to play cards? Come learn to play this challenging late-period two-player card game.

name: *La Belle Compagnie*: How Shall a Man Be Armed?
description_book: Armored men representing the length of the Hundred Years War will be armed to demonstrate the evolution of plate armor through the period.
description_web: Armored men representing the length of the Hundred Years War will be armed to demonstrate the evolution of plate armor through the period and demonstrate what we have learned by wearing armor that is as close as possible to the originals.

name: Whose Cause Is It Anyway Improv Comedy Show
description_book: Improv comedy show for raising awareness of good causes!
description_web: This troupe of SCAdians has been producing livestreamed improv comedy shows since the US election of 2020 and continues to generate laughter online every month to raise awareness about causes we believe in! Come see this troupe **live** as we generate laughter about our lives as SCAdians, Pennsic, Pandemic, and Philanthropy!

name: Bedtime Stories for Children
description_book: Nightly telling of stories for children. This year's theme will be The Brothers Grimm!
description_web: Stories and fables for children, 7 pm nightly. This year's theme will be The Brothers Grimm. All are welcome to attend; children must have adult escort.

name: Anglo-Saxon Magick
description_book: Covers the spells, chants, amulets, runes, and other techniques used by Anglo-Saxons as they changed over the six centuries of AS England.
description_web: The Anglo-Saxons used spells, chants, amulets, runes, and other sorts of magickal techniques well after they were nominally converted to Christianity. This workshop gives an overview of the material that has survived, as what was acceptable changed from year to year and place to place in the first millennium as well as in the second.

location: Courtesan College (Strawberry Fields B06 (off eLeri Lane between Ankara and Visby Vale)))
name: Risqué Pompeii: Art Under the Volcano - CCt
description_book: Come have a look at the artwork that caused such an uproar that it was hidden away for nearly two centuries. **Age 18+.**
description_web: Upon the discovery of Pompeii, and its neighbor Herculaneum, Victorian explorers were both surprised and horrified by what they found. The sexually explicit artwork they uncovered would forever change their view of Ancient Rome and eventually lead to our modern concept of pornography. Come have a look at the artwork that caused such an uproar that it was hidden away for nearly two centuries. **Age 18+.**

name: T(w)een Lounge: The Great Pennsic RPG Adventure
description_book: Proudly presenting The Great Pennsic RPG Adventure! Simplified TTRPG Rules. Participate or watch. Explore Pennsic's magical mysteries. **Ages 12-17.**
description_web: Lady Cecily is proud to present The Great Pennsic RPG Adventure! We will use simplified TTRPG rules to make both character building and play accessible to all players. Join us (either by participating or watching) as we explore Pennsic and the magical mysteries it holds. **Ages 12-17.**

name: Readers' Theatre: *The Reckoning*
description_book: Script-in-hand performance of an original script titled *The Reckoning* by Master Lorcan Dracontius. This story is a re-imagining of *Twelfth Night*.
description_web: Readers' Theatre is a style of theater in which the actors present dramatic readings of narrative material without costumes, props, scenery, or special lighting. Actors do not need to memorize lines; they just read scripts in hand. This is a script-in-hand performance of an original script titled *The Reckoning* by John St. Dennis, known in the SCA as Master Lorcan Dracontius. The storyline consists of a re-imagining of the origins of Shakespeare's play *Twelfth Night*.

name: The Contessa's Red and Gold Ball
description_book: Join us for a fête in the style of the Dukes of Burgundy, themed Red and Gold. Many dances to be taught! Non-dancers welcome!
description_web: Join us for a fête in the style of the Dukes of Burgundy, themed Red and Gold. Many dances to be taught! Non-dancers welcome!

name: Ruaidhri's Stories
description_book: Ruaidhri is going to rave for a while. There will be gratuitous singing and storytelling. If you wish to preserve your innocence...good luck.
description_web: A tale or two by a simpleton told. A horde of brass appearing as gold. Ruaidhri is going to rave for a while. There will be gratuitous singing and storytelling. If you wish to preserve your innocence...good luck.

name: Unofficial Pennsic Half Marathon
description_book: Race starts outside First Aid Point on middle Saturday at 7 am. Come a bit early to sign up. Prize for best dressed runner!
description_web:
Lace up your running shoes, put on your running clothes (modern or historical) and meet us outside of the First Aid Point at the crossing of Brewer's Road and St. Lawrence Way early in morning of Saturday, August 5th. Race starts at 7 am. Please come a bit in advance to sign your name on the race registration sheet. 
This year we will be inviting everyone on site to vote for best dressed runner so start planning your running outfit today!
For inspiration and information join the Unofficial Pennsic Half Marathon Facebook group.

name: Yoga for Fighters,  Dancers and Everybody
description_book: Yoga for all levels! Bring mat or towel for the floor & strap, scarf, or strip of cloth for class if you can; some loaner gear available.
description_web:
Yoga for all levels! Bring mat or towel for the floor & strap, scarf, or strip of cloth for class if you can; some loaner mats and straps will be available. If you have blocks, please bring them if you can! This class is geared for folks who have never done yoga through seasoned practitioners. Amendments for poses will be offered as we go, and each class will build upon the one before, however, anyone can jump in at anytime. 
Class will begin with a few minutes of breath work followed by approximately 45 minutes of yoga.

name: Coffee with Friends of Bill and Dr Bob
description_book: Open agnostic 12-Step meetings.
description_web: Open agnostic 12-Step meetings. From 8:00 am-9:00 am.

name: Youth Heavy List Skills, Games, and Drills
description_book: Daily morning regular practices to be run from 8:30 till 11 am on the Pennsic Battlefield Youth List. Youth aged 6-17. Loaner gear will be available.
description_web: Daily morning regular practices to be run from 8:30 till 11 am on the Pennsic Battlefield Youth List. Youth aged 6-17, all levels of experience on three different list fields. Loaner gear will be available.

name: When You Don't Need to Paint: Ink Scrolls
description_book: Class discussion will center around not painting scrolls but using ink only. This includes puzzle initials, cadels, and much more.
description_web: Ink-only scrolls are something to behold. Painting isn't necessary when you have ink. We'll discuss the use of puzzle initials, cadels and other options in scrolls and their rich history.

name: Archery Marshal and MIT Orientation
description_book: All Archery Marshals are required to attend **ONE** orientation meeting. This meeting is to explain Pennsic specific rules, the ranges, and scoring.
description_web: All Archery Marshals are required to attend **ONE** orientation meeting. This meeting is to explain Pennsic specific rules, the ranges, and scoring. You're welcome to bring MITs and attend as often as you want. We want you to learn the scoring system to make getting the totals faster, easier and more accurate.

name: Carthage in the Atlantic: *The Periplus of Hanno*
description_book: Summary of Hanno's voyage down the Atlantic coast of Africa, comparison with evidence of early exploration, trade beyond the Pillars of Herakles.
description_web: Summary of Hanno's voyage down the Atlantic coast of Africa; comparison of this account with historical accounts and archaeological evidence of early exploration and trade beyond the Pillars of Herakles. Digital version of handouts available.

name: Slavic Rus Headwear 10-13th Century
description_book: Creation of Slavic Rus headwear with two examples: copper diadem and silk on birchbark. Will discuss research and construction techniques.
description_web:
Creation of Slavic Rus headwear with two examples: copper diadem and silk on birchbark. We will discuss research and construction techniques as well as lessons learned. 
Also discussion on Tournament of Arts and A&S participation, scoring, and future projects.

name: Horse Maintenance in the 14th Century
description_book: This presentation will be about horse care during the 14th century in Europe.
description_web: This presentation will be about horse care during the 14th century in Europe. The information presented is based primarily on documentation by Jordanus Ruffus. We will talk about how horses were stabled, groomed, and fed during this time period.

name: Viking Wire Weave Basics
description_book: Viking wire weave is a period-correct art form that is fun, easy and inexpensive. I will show you how to get started.
description_web: Viking wire weave is a period-correct art form that is fun, easy and inexpensive. Also known as *trichinopoly* or Viking Knitting, there is archaeological evidence for wire chains constructed using “circular plaiting” in Viking burials and treasure hoards dating as early as the 8th century to as late as the 12th century. Come learn with the Mistress of Wire herself! You will learn how to make a *sextapus* to hold your chain in place, a basic 6-loop pattern, draw plate techniques, and how to finish the ends to add a clasp.
fee_itemization: Copper "sextapus" $.50, wooden dowel $.50, draw plate $1, craft wire $2, end cones $2.50, clasp $1.50

name: The Care and Feeding of Canvas Tentage
description_book: Learn how to keep your remote home worthy of your investment.
description_web: So you finally splurged on a tent, and want to know how to keep it... Or maybe you have or inherited one, and it has been through the wringer and you want to fix it up? Maybe you are interested in how to fix them? Learn how to keep your remote home worthy of your investment.

name: Garb From Simple Shapes
description_book: We'll discuss how clothing can be constructed from simple geometric shapes, based on extant garments from various parts of SCA period.
description_web: This class will discuss how clothing can be constructed from simple geometric shapes, based on extant garments from various parts of SCA period. We will look at how the extant pieces use rectangles and triangles to create clothing to fit the human body. Strategies for fitting and sizing to the individual will be discussed.

name: Modern Gaming: Peace Week
description_book: A place, with power, to play modern games from 9 am to 10:30 pm every day.

name: Embroidery of 16th-Century India
description_book: Explore the marvelous embroideries of 16th-century India. We'll discuss techniques, materials, and designs in both European and Indian contexts.
description_web: Explore the marvelous embroideries of 16th-century India! Items embroidered in SCA-period India were used domestically and also exported to Europe, the Muslim world, and east Asia. We'll go over techniques, materials, and designs for embroidery in the Bengali and Gujarati styles, and talk about how the results could be used in an SCA context. I'll share close-up photos of three extant pieces I've examined. If you can do chain stitch, you can embroider in a 16th-century Indian style!

name: Project Management for Embroidery and Other Arts
description_book: Have you ever had a big idea but didn't know how to make it happen? This class teaches you how to turn a big idea into reality.
description_web: Have you ever had a big idea but froze when you realized how much time and effort you needed to make it? This class will teach you how to turn those big ideas into reality. We’ll talk about breaking a project into manageable tasks, designing for group projects, recruiting workers, timelines, managing materials, managing volunteers, surviving pitfalls, and successful finishes. Bring the big idea you always wanted to work on and we’ll start you turning your vision into a reality. This class uses embroidery projects as the examples but the lessons apply to any art.

name: Goldwork Sampler
description_book: Create a goldwork sampler while trying a couple of different techniques using real metal threads.
description_web: We will discuss the use of metal thread embroidery in European embroideries of the Middle Ages. We will learn more about the types of metal thread used, what the various threads were, how to use them, and we will make a sampler of stitches to keep so you can use it as a reference. We will be using real metal thread, a very good quality linen for the ground fabric, and silk thread. This class will be taught in 3 sessions. The third session relies on the techniques learned in the earlier classes; attendance at both of the first two classes is encouraged, but it is possible to participate in the 3rd class if you were only able to attend one of the other classes. Different techniques will be covered in each class, and they will build on each other. Bring your scissors, and eyeglasses if you need them. Everything else you need will be in the kit. The kit will include an embroidery hoop, fabric, an acid free marker, needles, wool felt, cotton thread for padding, silk thread, gilded leather, and a variety of real metal threads.
fee_itemization: A variety of metal threads, silk thread, linen thread, linen fabric, silk fabric, and all supplies needed except scissors.

name: Babies at Pennsic: A Discussion
description_book: How to deal with babies and small children at Pennsic: a discussion by and for those who have done it, are doing it, or will do it.

name: Wire Strung Harp for Absolute Beginners I
description_book: Brief history, basic technique, learn a first tune. You must bring your own harp. Nail plucking technique is optimal but not mandatory.
description_web:
A very basic introduction to the fundamentals of the Gaelic wire-strung harp. Topics include these points:
* Holding the harp and hand position. Learn how not to injure yourself playing! 
* Tuning the harp.
* Striking the strings with the fingernails... or not.
* Exercises with fingers in a fixed position.
* Learn the first tune traditionally taught to Gaelic Harpers.
You must bring your own harp, and a chair if you need one. 
Handouts include a brief history and the beginning exercises and first and second tunes.
Ability to either read music or memorize from ear is a definite plus, but anyone is welcome to show up and I'll teach you what I can. All ages emphatically welcomed. This is the first in a sequence of two classes. This class is aimed at wire-strung harps. Gut/nylon-strung are welcome but I can't teach that style (which is different), though I will try to point you at people who can.

name: Medieval Game Make-and-Take
description_book: Learn about some medieval games. Then, create your own fabric game board and pieces to keep.

name: Rapier Battle of La Rochelle
description_book: Defenders of La Rochelle **will** die! The only question is **when**? Join us at the Fort to find out. Heavy rapier, rubber band gun melée. **18+**
description_web: The defenders of La Rochelle **will** die! The only question is **when**? Join us at the Fort to find out. Heavy rapier and rubber band gun melée. Attackers will have unlimited resurrections, defenders will have limited resurrections. RBG cannon are welcome. No archery, please. Pennsic standard rules for rapier apply. Don't have a heavy rapier? Bring a dagger or two. Bring a friend or 20. The more the merrier. Don't like to fight melée? Come and get close to the action and help marshal the battle. Please muster **at the Fort**  half an hour before the start time, especially if you want to fight with a particular group. **Age 18+.**

name: Pennsic Instrumental Youth Consort
description_book: The Youth Instrumental Consort is open to all youth who play an instrument. No audition is required to participate.
description_web: Rehearsals will be from 9:00 am - 9:45 am daily from Saturday, August 5, 2023, until Wednesday, August 9, at the Performing Arts Rehearsal Classroom (PARC) located by the Amphitheatre. We will participate in a Dress Rehearsal/Recording Session on Thursday, Aug. 10, at noon, and perform on Thursday, August 10 at 6:30 pm, as part of the Pennsic Choirs Concert. Your director will provide you with a media release to sign.

name: *Kumihimo* Basics
description_book: *Kumihimo* is cord braiding on a disk. Make a basic round cord. Disk and string provided.
description_web: *Kumihimo* is cord braiding on a disk. Make a basic round cord. Disk and string provided; take your work home with you.
fee_itemization: Disk, bobbins, string, & instructions

name: Youth Rapier Activities
description_book: There will be a variety of youth rapier activities each day including drills, games and one-on-one instruction. Some loaner gear will be available.
description_web: There will be a variety of youth rapier activities each day including drills, games and one-on-one instruction. Some days may include special additional activities. Some loaner gear will be available. Participants do not have to be authorized. Children age 6 and up may participate. Please bring your parent/guardian the first day you attend to learn more about the youth rapier program.

name: Whitework Illumination
description_book: Using white paint on scrolls. Tips and tricks for painting clear, crisp lines and shaded designs (cameo). Class for all levels of experience.
description_web: Tips and tricks that will help scribes paint two main styles of whitework ... crisp, clean, white embellishments on colored backgrounds and monochromatic shading.
fee_itemization:
Total cost of class $2
Each attendee will receive a multi page handout & prepared design on watercolor paper
Additional materials (Paints, brushes, etc) will be available for use by those who do not have them+

name: Ask a Scribe
description_book: These drop-in classes are ideal for scribes of all levels to speak one-on-one with an experienced scribe for help and advice.
description_web: These are informal drop-in classes for any scribe who's looking for advice, guidance, or help with any aspect of calligraphy and/or illumination. Several different experienced scribes will be hosting these sessions during Peace Week and War Week.

name: Æthelmearc Laurel Meeting
description_book: Meeting of the members of the Order of the Laurel who live in Æthelmearc.
description_web: Meeting of the members of the Order of the Laurel who live in Æthelmearc.

name: Ullr’s Revenge: A Known World Archery Challenge
description_book: Novelty shoot for 4 to 8 archers. **Must** bring your own marshal who can shoot with the group. Prizes for top finishers for each RR ranking.
description_web: Kingdoms from the Known World are contributing 10 target stations for this challenge. Prizes will be given out to top finishers from each of the Royal Round Rankings plus youth. A prize will also be given to the maker of the best target station, as chosen by the populace. The shoot is designed as a “Bring your own marshal” (BYOM) shoot. Each group should bring their own marshal who will accompany them thru each station and can shoot with the group. So form your group, grab your marshal, and see if you can face up to the "The Great Hunt” at Ullr's Revenge.

name: The English Reformation
description_book: Basics of the English Reformation: timeline, politics, major players, and what differentiates it from the continent.
fee_itemization: Paper, ink

name: The Renaissance Barber-Surgeon
description_book: The instructor will use reproduction medical tools and facsimile texts to explain medical and surgical techniques and the role of the Barber-Surgeon.

name: Henna for Skin Mixology and Application
description_book: Learn how to find, mix, and apply henna for skin from a professional henna artist.
description_web: Learn how to find good henna and get a proven and flexible recipe you can tailor to suit your needs. Then we'll practice applying it, with tips and guidance from a veteran artist. We will mix some henna in class, which for me was the hardest part to learn. Everyone gets a cone of paste to use and take with them.
fee_itemization: One cone of fresh henna paste. You may also take the class without this, or bring your own henna. The handout is my current mixing instructions and recipe.

name: How to Write Praise Poetry
description_book: Turn your friends into legends. Come and learn how to plan, begin, and deliver a praise poem. We will adapt to serve writers at all levels.
description_web: Praiseworthy deeds happen all the time in the SCA. What can you do if you notice someone being awesome? Write a praise poem and tell the world! This class offers a straightforward process for writers at any level to plan and deliver a praise poem, and resources for continuing to improve on your own. Novice, journeyman, or laureate, you are welcome.

name: Life of William Marshal
description_book: A class on the life of William Marshal, tournament champion and knight (1146-1219); his biography was written just a few years after his death.
description_web: A class on the life of William Marshal, the 1st Earl of Pembroke, tournament champion, and knight (1146-1219); his biography was written just a few years after his death.

name: Through the Looking Glass: North America in Period
description_book: Curious what was happening in North America in period? This 90-minute class will provide information on the complex cultures of North America.
description_web: North America in period was way more than you were taught in history class. Did you know that the largest city in the 12th century existed in North America? Trade items traveled over 2,000 miles, although, there is evidence that people were also traveling that far to obtain certain items. Cultures that extended over thousands of miles.  The largest man-made earthwork in the world exists a little over two hundred miles from the grounds of Pennsic. This 90-minute class is a high level survey of cultures that flourished in the eastern half of North American continent prior to European contact.

name: Archaeology of the Roman Diet
description_book: This is a lecture class focusing on how recent archaeological finds have changed our understanding of the Roman diet. **Adult only.**
description_web: This is a lecture class focusing on how recent archaeological finds have changed our understanding of the Roman diet. The class will focus on recent archaeological digs at the port cities of Herculaneum and Pompeii. It will discuss how new finds and methods are being used to re-examine the traditional viewpoint of the diet of the average citizen and reach towards a better understanding of the diets of these members of the Roman population. **Adult only.**

name: Pennsic Without a Cooler
description_book: How to feed yourself period food at long camping events without the use of a cooler.

name: Guild of Saint Barbara Annual Meeting
description_book: Annual meeting will cover safety, new items, and also go over the firing schedule. As always, please bring questions. **18+**
description_web:
The Guild of Saint Barbara will having its annual meeting on Middle Saturday at 10 am. The meeting will cover safety, new items, and also go over the firing schedule for Pennsic 50. Please join us for this informative session and feel free to bring questions. 
There will be a break between the meeting and training. Please **DO NOT** bring powder to Pennsic! **Age 18+.**

name: Dances Without Dignity
description_book: Let's do some high energy dancing. These dances can be done slowly and stately - but not today: *Petit Vriens, Gathering Peascods, Montarde Bransle*.

name: Whole Animal Roasting
description_book: Discussion and demonstration of spitting and trussing both a pig and lamb for roasting over coals. Economics, food safety and serving will be covered.
description_web: Discussion and demonstration of spitting and trussing both a pig and lamb for roasting over coals. Economics, food safety and serving will be covered. Interactive discussion with experienced kitcheners designed to inform and reassure cooks new to whole animal roasting. Stop back during the day to see progress.

name: It's OK to Play with Your Food
description_book: This class is designed to bring youngsters into the kitchen  by introducing them to a simple recipe for period marzipan.

name: Storytelling Academy
description_book: Explore genres, tools, styles, and uses of storytelling. Cultural and medieval approaches, applications, performance coaching. New topics each day.
description_web: During this academy, students will gain knowledge about the history and techniques for storytelling both in the SCA and the modern world. Students may attend individual sessions or all of the academy. There may be guest teachers and will be time for students to practice and receive feedback. The academy may culminate in a student performance. No classes are repeated. The focus is on developing comfort, nurturing, and honing skills within the students’ capabilities. All levels are welcome. Students may view a class outline at the academy space, Minerva’s Spindle 158, where classes will also be listed on the message board. Seating is limited; feel free to bring your own chair. Student Performance, date, time, and location will be announced.

name: Known World Choir Rehearsals
description_book: Join the oldest Pennsic Choir as we rehearse in preparation for a concert on Thursday of War Week. Previous KWC Directors have been invited.
description_web: The Known World Choir, along with the Children's and Youth Choirs, and *Chorulus Pennsicus* will present a concert of medieval and Renaissance choral literature. Previous Directors of the KWC have been invited to conduct a selection. Bring a 1/2 inch black binder or plan to purchase one for use during the concert for $5. **Over age 18.** (There is a Youth Choir for those 12-18.)
fee_itemization: Copies of KWC Literature. $5 more if you wish to keep the 1/2 Inch Black Binder

name: Beginning *Fabris*
description_book: Introduction to Salvatore Fabris' treatise on Rapier combat, and the Italian school of rapier. Rapier and mask required.
description_web:
Introduction to Salvatore Fabris' treatise on Rapier combat, and the Italian school of rapier. Rapier and mask required.
We will go over the basics of his teachings, to include stance, movement, attack and defense, plus basic concepts.

name: The Da Vinci Atlatls
description_book: A discussion/presentation of the various types of atlatls that appeared in Leonardo Da Vinci’s manuscripts.
description_web: This class will be a discussion/presentation of the various types of atlatls that appeared in Leonardo Da Vinci’s manuscripts

name: Beginner Thrown Weapons
description_book: Learn axe throwing, basic care of your weapons, and basic rules. A hands-on session is included. Limit of 25 participants; no experience necessary.
description_web: Learn axe throwing, basic care of your weapons, and basic rules. A hands-on session is included. Limit of 25 participants; no experience necessary.

name: *Mehteran*: Ottoman *Janissary* Band
description_book: *Osmanlı Mehter Takımı* studies music & history of the Ottoman *Mehter* military marching band of the 14th-17th C for Pennsic performance. **18+**
description_web: The *Osmanlı Mehter Takımı* (Ottoman *Janissary* Band) studies music and history of the Ottoman *Mehter* military marching band from the 14th-17th century. The *Mehteran* will learn the historic Ottoman songs, *Ceddin Deden*, *Osman Pasa*, and *Nevâ-Ceng-i Harbî* which are played on *zurna, davul*, horns, cymbals, and kettledrums, and sung by a choir, and will learn the historic *Janissary* march for performance at Pennsic. Brass horn players, percussionists and singers are welcome and encouraged to participate. Further details on the *Mehteran* Facebook Group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/134233213955988/ . **Age 18+.**

name: Weed Walk
description_book: Wild plant identification. Wear walking shoes and hat; leave from Univ. Point. Different teachers on different days; walk with us more than once!
description_web: Cooper's Lake abounds with medicinal and food plants that were used by various primitive and medieval cultures. Learn to identify them during a walk around the campsite. The walk will take place rain or shine. Please wear sturdy shoes and a hat. Meet at University Point for the start of the class. We have multiple teachers, so if you attend more than one walk, you will likely learn different things!

name: Known World Adventurers Guild: **Social Day**
description_book: Informal meetup for teen explorers (and youth 10+). Social Days alternate with Walk Days (see separate class info) - KWAGuild.com
description_web: All teens (and youth 10+) are welcome at these informal meetups for the Known World Adventurers Guild. Our Social Days alternate with KWAG Walk Days. See separate class info.

name: Glass Gilding: *Verre Églomisé*
description_book: Roman to medieval, glass gilding creates detailed linear drawings with gold on glass. Learn about and create a period glass gilded artwork.
description_web: Glass gilding, or *verre églomisé*, was used in Roman antiquity and reached great popularity in the 14th and 15th centuries. It was incorporated into reliquaries, furniture, and *objects d'art*. Create a small *verre églomisé* work using gelatin water gilding technique. Hands-on!
fee_itemization: 22k gold leaf, glass, glue, tools

location: Heralds Point (Herald's Point, behind the playground. )
name: Heralds' Mentoring Meet-Up at Heralds' Point
description_book: A heraldic staff member will discuss your mentoring needs (armory or names). We will find you someone to shadow.
description_web: A heraldic staff member will discuss your mentoring needs (armory or names). We will find you someone to shadow.

name: Illumination 101, or How I learned to Love the Dot
description_book: If you are thinking you can’t possibly create a scroll, but you would really like to, let me show you how. No experience necessary!
description_web:
If you are thinking you can’t possibly create a scroll, but you would really like to, let me show you how. No experience necessary! I will show you valuable resources and handy tools to help you get started.
If you have paper (thick art paper is best), pencil (with white eraser), paintbrush (small), paint (gouache), and a palette, please bring them. I will, however, have materials for those that don’t.
fee_itemization: I will share use of my materials, including pencils, paintbrush, paint, paper, and pallet.  You can take the paper with you.

name: Open Scribal Time
description_book: Take advantage of our clean, well-lit space to work on existing projects or to try your hand at calligraphy and/or illumination.

name: Æthelmearc Pelican Meeting
description_book: Order meeting for members of the Order of the Pelican living in Æthelmearc.
description_web: Order meeting for members of the Order of the Pelican living in Æthelmearc.

name: Twine Woven Bags
description_book: Learn open-weft twining to make a panel bag. An ancient weaving technique for clothing, bags, and other items. Hands-on, make-and-take class.
description_web: Learn open-weft twining - an ancient weaving technique for clothing, bags, and other items - to make a panel bag. Hands-on, make-and-take class. Strings of twisted cordage are used to twine the structure of the bags, both the warp and weft. Class includes frame and twine to get you started.
fee_itemization:
Frame per person $7
Jute/Hem Twine per person $5

name: Poetic Engineering
description_book: The mechanics of versemaking in English and the technical language that describes it. Powerful tools of the wordsmith's craft.
description_web: What is a trochee? How do I get my lines to sound the way I want? How come this poem is called a ballad but that one isn't? We will answer all these questions and more. You will gain understanding of the mechanics of versemaking and the technical language that describes it. Come grab a share of these powerful tools of the wordsmith's craft.

name: Designing and Carving Blocks for Fabric Printing
description_book: Learn how to plan and create blocks and layout designs for printmaking on fabric recreating brocade and other patterns.
description_web: We will discuss historical designs and patterns, how to design your own based on these, and then learn how to carve blocks. Techniques will include historical methods as well as modern materials which can be substituted. Directions on printing will be touched on, but we will not be printing in class.
fee_itemization: different materials for blocks

name: Roundtable Discussion: Bread
description_book: We will have an informal discussion about any thing bread-related in the SCA, including history, recipes, tools, and bread at events.
description_web: We will have an informal discussion about anything breadrelated in the SCA, including history, recipes, tools, and bread at events. Feel free to bring books or items to show and tell, as well as any questions you may have.

name: Nosh Like an Ancient Roman: Camping Edition
description_book: Camp in leisure like a Roman with these delectable treats you can indulge in while camping.
description_web: Camp in leisure like a Roman with these delectable treats you can indulge in while camping.
fee_itemization: Multiple page handout with recipes included.

name: Rapier Hangers, Sword Belts and How to Wear Them
description_book: Interested in wearing your sword and not smacking everyone with it as you walk around? Come learn! We will also discuss making them, and scabbards.
description_web: Interested in wearing your sword in a period fashion, and not smacking everyone with it as you walk around? Come learn! We will also discuss making them, and scabbards.

name: Pennsic: You’re Here! Now what?
description_book: This class will give you ideas for activities and answer common questions about the largest SCA event in the Knowne World!
description_web: You’ve made it to the largest SCA event in the Knowne World! Now what is there to do? This class will give you ideas for things to see, places to visit, and answer any questions about the event or the SCA, in general.

name: *Commedia* All Stars **Rehearsal**
description_book: Rehearsal for *Commedia* All Stars troupe: Saturday, Aug. 5, through and including Thursday, Aug. 10, daily, from 11:00 am - 1:00 pm.
description_web: Rehearsal for *Commedia* All Stars troupe: Saturday, Aug. 5, through and including Thursday, Aug. 10, daily, from 11:00 am - 1:00 pm.

name: Intro to 1604 Welsh *Robert ap Huw* Harp MSS
description_book: Learn a tune from the tablature of the 1604 *Robert ap Huw* MSS. **Intermediate+ players!** You must bring your own harp.
description_web: Introduction to the Welsh 1604 *Robert ap Huw* manuscript, the oldest known manuscript of music specifically for the harp and the unique tablature used in that manuscript. You will learn *Caniad San Silin* from the manuscript tablature. The tablature expects a nail-struck technique, but the concepts works well for bray, wire, or gut/nylon harps. **You must bring your own harp. This is an intermediate level harp class+!** Students should be comfortable with placing, striking, and damping with moving hand positions.

location: Courtesan College (Strawberry Fields B06 (off eLeri Lane between Ankara and Visby Vale))
name: Courtesan Persona 101 - CCt
description_book: This is an **adults only** class for those interested in portraying a courtesan persona in the SCA. **Age 18+**
description_web: This is an **adults only** class for those interested in portraying a courtesan persona in the SCA. People of all ages **over 18** and all genders welcome. We will be discussing how to speak and act like an elite sex worker and how to handle a number of situations you might find yourself in while in persona at events. For a list of content warnings or any further information, please contact Ginevra at ginevrafiammettadisilvestri@gmail.com.

name: Beginner Dance: *Branles*
description_book: Never danced before? No problem! Start with basic steps and patterns, and then learn fun *branles* from 16th-century France.
description_web: Never danced before? No problem! This class will start with basic steps and patterns, and then introduce you to fun *branles* from 16th-century France. (P. S. Experienced dancers are also welcome to show up and learn.)

name: My First *Carcassonne* (Board Game)
description_book: A modern board game good for kids as young as 4/5. Basic rules with patient teacher. Limit 4 players. Other games available to play independently.

name: Rolling Things, Dice Shells, Sticks & Bones
description_book: Learn to score cowrie shells, dice knuckle bones and Egyptian sticks and what games can be played with these items.
description_web: Learn to score cowrie shells, dice knuckle bones and Egyptian sticks and what games can be played with these items. Learn liar's dice, and ship captain crew, and other games to to play with these items.
fee_itemization: Pamphlet

name: Spear the Boar Tournament
description_book: Call your shots. Spear the Boar.
description_web: Call your shots. Spear the Boar.

name: Seven Rhythms of Pennsic Apocalypse
description_book: Beginner rhythms used most often in drum circles and music within the SCA. A 3-part class; different rhythms each day. **Bring your own drum.**
description_web:
This is a beginner drumming class. Learn the basic rhythms used most often in drum circles and music within the SCA. This is a 3-part class that teaches different rhythms each day. **Bring your own drum**.
Day 1- *Saidi, Beladi, Maqsum*
Day 2- *Chiftitelli, Masmoudi*
Day 3- *Ayub, Malfouf*

name: Chinese Heraldry
description_book: A discussion of some common charges in period Chinese banners and how to incorporate these into registerable SCA heraldry.
description_web: This class will show you some common symbols, colors, and arrangements so that you can shoehorn your Chinese persona into the SCA College of Arms. Full color handouts.
fee_itemization: Full color handout.

name: Turk's Head Knots
description_book: Learn how to tie up to three different Turk's Head knots.
description_web: Do your tassels look a bit too mundane? Would you like to take them up a notch? In this hands-on class you will learn up to three common Turk's head knots that can not only be used to decorate all sorts of things, but are also just like those that adorned fancy period tassels.

name: Norse Poetry Overview
description_book: Learn about Viking-era poetry. Includes forms, metrics, and alliteration and how to write in Norse verse. We'll talk about the ways poetry was used.
description_web: Iambic pentameter got you down? Want to know what exactly a “ring giver” is? Do you want to write a line that ends with "silver?" Are you a fan of Egil Skalagrimson? (Who isn't?) Come on over, and we’ll go over the basics of Viking-era poetry. I will go over how Norse poetry alliterates, talk about the types and ways Norse poetry was used, and go over poetic devices such as *kennings*. We'll then go over style and format, and the specific forms Norse poetry takes. Whether you want to try your hand at writing it, or just want a better appreciation of the form, stop by!

name: *Ifriquiya*: Medieval North Africa
description_book: A brief historical overview of North Africa in the Middle Ages, from the Muslim conquest to around 1500.
description_web: A brief historical overview of North Africa in the Middle Ages, from the Muslim conquest to around 1500.

name: Justice by Blood and Iron
description_book: Why would anyone resolve a legal dispute by having two people brutalize each other? Come find out the history and legal process of trial by combat!
description_web: For centuries various European societies resolved some of their greatest legal disputes through a procedure where two people tried to slaughter each other. This class aims to address a single question: Why? Why in the name of all that is just, and at least slightly sensible, would people, cultures, and entire kingdoms agree to this? In the process of answering this question we'll look at various techniques and legal practices that marked these trials, specific cases which were resolved by combat, and the lasting legacy of trial by combat on our own system of justice.

name: Build a Better Dancer: Int. Drills & Exercises
description_book: Take your dance and physical fitness to the next level through drills and exercises to improve balance, dexterity and endurance! Intermediate/Advanced
description_web: Take your dance and physical fitness to the next level through drills and exercises to improve balance, dexterity and endurance! Intermediate/Advanced.

name: Barter Town Meet-up
description_book: Annual Meet-Up of the SCA Medieval Barter Town Citizens & Friends. Trade old SCA items for something new! Bring an item for the raffle if you want!
description_web:
Greetings and well met! We humbly invite you to join us for the 10th annual SCA Medieval Barter Town Meet-up! This event has become a favorite among those who love trading their goods with others.

Do you have items you no longer use or wish to find a new home for? Bring them with you to the meet-up, and you might just find something new to take home with you!

We must note that there will be no money exchanged for any items, as it is all about the art of bartering and gifting. We encourage all attendees to bring items to trade, as this is a great way to meet new people and acquire new treasures.

In addition to the trading and bartering, we are excited to announce that the **raffle** is back this year! If you bring an item to donate to the raffle, you will receive a ticket. When your number is called, you will have the opportunity to pick an item out of the donated items. This is an exciting way to participate in the event, and you never know what amazing treasure you might win!

So come one, come all, and join us for the 10th SCA Medieval Barter Town Meet-up! It promises to be a wonderful event filled with trading, bartering, and exciting opportunities to acquire new treasures.

name: Greatest Hits of the Renaissance
description_book: The most famous tunes of the Renaissance, known in various countries and by assorted names. All vocal ranges and instruments are welcome.
description_web: The most famous tunes of the Renaissance, known in various countries and by assorted names.  All vocal ranges and instruments are welcome.

name: *i Verdi Confusi*: Closed Dress Rehearsal
description_book: Closed dress rehearsal for *i Verdi Confusi*'s performance in the PA Tent.

name: Using a Sling in the SCA
description_book: Slings are now approved for Thrown Weapons (at Society level). Come learn techniques of sling usage and be ready when they come to a kingdom near you.
description_web: Slings are now approved for Thrown Weapons (at Society level). Come learn techniques of sling usage and be ready when they come to a kingdom near you.

name: How to Cry Like a Herald
description_book: Voice projection and enunciation for clear communication at considerable distance.
description_web: This is a workshop for anyone who wants to be understood at a distance--measured in tens (or scores) of yards. Doesn't matter if you're shy-voiced, if you habitually never raise your voice; overcoming inhibitions is part of what this is about. This isn't shouting; it's resonance in the chest cavity combined with some specific hints on enunciation that help a great deal in being understood.

name: Attavante Made Easy
description_book: Learn to create an illumination in the style of the *Codex Heroica* frontispiece by Attavante delgi Attavanti.

name: The Medieval Palette: Mixing up Your Paint Pt.1
description_book: Students will mix up a take-home palette of 8-10 medieval pigments/paints to use, with notes on safety/usage/protocols.
description_web:
The first hour will be discussing pigments and paint, and how the medieval artist built his palette for use. We'll also discuss safety concerns regarding toxicity, what binder choices you can make, how they affect your painting strategy, and any chemical interactions that the medieval artist had to be careful of. The second hour will be a practical in which the students will mix up their own take-home palette of medieval pigments/paints. Colors will most likely include white lead, yellow ochre, *terre verte*, brown ochre, lamp black, cabbage or leek green, iris green from a clothlet, red lead, *alazarin* (madder), possibly malachite/azurite, or ultramarine.  We'll work with vegetable dye pigments as well as traditionally ground pigments.

Children are welcome, since I will be providing safety gear for everyone.  I will also be providing the take-home palettes, and brushes, so you don't need to bring anything equipment-wise.
fee_itemization: fee will cover nitrile safety gloves, safety mask, palettes, pigments, binders, paper towels, cleaning spray, and mixing solvents (water, wine, vinegar), measuring and mixing equipment, and possibly pH strips.
