name: Tarl's Little Polearm Tourney 16
description_book: Welcome to Tarl's Little Polearm Tourney! It is a Sweet 16 party, but with Polearms! Tourney starts at 1pm and runs until 3 pm. **18+**
description_web: Welcome to Tarl's Little Polearm Tourney!  It is a Sweet 16 party, but with Polearms! Tourney starts at 1 pm and runs until 3 pm. The Tourney is open to all inspected adult heavy fighters using polearms legal according to Pennsic rules. The Tourney is in a "Bear-Pit" format in two 45-minute sessions, with a break in between. There will be multiple lists, and combatants are free to line up in any list they choose. All skill levels are welcome. Bring your honor, your skill, and your love of the One True Weapons Form. **Age 18+.**

name: Make and Take Waxed Linen
description_book: Come make and take your own waxed linen cup cover!
description_web: We will talk about the historical use and benefits of waxed linen, the modern day resurgence, and supply sources. Then, we'll make our own to take and use.

name: Make Your Own Roman-Style Brooch (*Fibula*)
description_book: Make your own Roman-style brooch/*fibula* from wire and a package of glass/metal beads. Tools available. Bring yours, if possible. **Age 12+.**
description_web: You will enjoy learning how to make your own Roman-style brooch or *fibula* from wire and a package of glass/metal beads. Jewelry-making tools will be available, but if you have your own, **please** bring them along. **Age 12+.**
fee_itemization: includes wire, beads and use of tools.  If you have your own jewellery tools, please bring them along.

name: The Humoral Doctrine
description_book: An explanation of the origins and structure of the prevailing doctrine of health in the Medieval and Renaissance periods.

name: Viking Age Clothing: Archeological Evidence
description_book: A survey of the major finds of Viking Age clothing, with an emphasis on interpreting the finds to make accurate reproductions.
description_web: A survey of the major finds of Viking Age clothing, with an emphasis on interpreting the finds to make reasonably accurate reproductions. We will cover Birka, Hedeby, Mammen, Thorsbjerg, Viborg, and other finds.
fee_itemization: 45-page handout

name: Periodness of the Pennsic Homes
description_book: Did anything exist in the pre-17th-century European world that looked like a Pennsic House? Yes! Come to the class to find out when and where!
description_web: Many people love to see the Pennsic homes - those houses built on trailers - but how "period correct" are they? Did anything even remotely similar exist in the pre-17th-century world? Yes, it did. Handouts will be given showing various depictions of homes on wheels in illuminations.
fee_itemization: $3 for paper printouts of illuminations in color with text desciptions

name: Beginning Inkle Weaving
description_book: Learn to read inkle patterns, loom setup, weaves. Bring loom and shuttle, or borrow both. Yarn, all equipment will be provided.
description_web: Learn to create beautiful trim for your garb. We will cover how to read an inkle pattern, how to set up and weave efficiently on the inkle loom. Bring your own loom and shuttle, or borrow one/both. Supplies provided: #10 cotton crochet thread/equivalent, in two colors; scissors; paper and pencil for notes. If you prefer, you may bring your own cotton yarn.
fee_itemization:
handout, 
thread, 2 colors.  approximately 70 yards total per student.
Use of equipment

name: The Mythology of Harps
description_book: We'll cover the mythology surrounding the harp from several different cultures through the ages. Roundtable discussion encouraged.
description_web: This class will cover the mythology surrounding the harp from several different cultures through the ages. We will cover creation stories, magic, deities, dragons, healing and death stories. Please bring your stories. Harps are encouraged but not required.
fee_itemization: $2.00 per handout; 4-5 pages per handout.

location: Courtesan College (Strawberry Fields B06 (off eLeri Lane between Ankara and Visby Vale))
name: The History of Prostitution - CCt
description_book: History of prostitution, from the late Roman era to 1600 AD. Topics include brothels, daily life, garb, and courtesan culture. **Age 18+.**
description_web: A survey of the history of prostitution, from the late Roman era to 1600 AD. We will be covering such topics as the formation of red light districts, brothel management, contraception, municipal laws, church law, and the garb and identification of a prostitute within this time period. **Age 18+.**

name: *Chiara Stella*
description_book: Come learn *Chiara Stella*, a lovely *cascarda* from *Il Ballarino*! Dancers of all ages welcome. This is an advanced class.

name: Ealdormere Afternoon
description_book: Join the Kingdom of Ealdormere for an afternoon of activities!

name: *Kamikaze* Battle
description_book: Three-hour unlimited resurrection battle. No War points, no prizes, just fighting. **Adult only.**
description_web: Three-hour unlimited resurrection battle. No War points, no prizes, just fighting. **Adult fighting age only.**

name: Intro to *Xiangqi* (Chinese Chess)
description_book: A class on the basic rules and beginning tactics of the game, with time to play afterwards.
description_web: A class on the basic rules and beginning tactics of the game, with time to play afterwards.

location: Guild of St. Barbara Gunners Fly atop Mt Eislinn (Meeting at N17 Household of the White Rose Artillery Camp at corner of Battle Rd and Fosse Way to move equipment to theTop of Mt Eislin under the Gunners Red Fly. Bring chairs and water)
name: Guild of Saint Barbara Black Powder Training
description_book: Black powder safety and hands-on training. Bring pre-1600 firearms and cannon with you to be inspected. **DO NOT BRING YOUR OWN POWDER! Age 18+**
description_web:
Muster at the Artillery Camp Household of the White Rose, corner of Battle Road and Fosse Way. Artillery Park is on the front lawn. We muster here so we can get pieces to the artillery point atop of Mt. Eislinn. The Guild of Saint Barbara will holding its hands-on training and safety inspection on the middle Saturday at 1 pm. The hands-on black powder training session is for new gentles who wish to learn and join us on the line, or as a refresher for those who would desire. 
Hands-on training will be from 1 pm to 4 pm. Please join us for this informative session and feel free to bring questions. And, if you have pre-1600 firearms, bring them with you to be inspected. Please **DO NOT** bring powder to Pennsic! Powder will be provided. **Age 18+.**

name: Roman Glassblowing Demo (Furnace Glass)
description_book: A fully narrated, live, 2000-degree glassblowing demonstration! Learn about the materials, the techniques, and how glass usage changed over time!
description_web: Come and watch a fully narrated, live, 2000-degree glassblowing demonstration! See how we can take this fascinating material and turn it into a never-ending variety of items! Learn about the materials we use, and how glass-making techniques, its uses, and value varied throughout time and culture! For this demo see items from the 1st to the 5th centuries, from across the Roman Empire! Family-friendly, all ages welcome, open Q&A to follow.

name: Middle Eastern Melody and Drumming
description_book: The Middle Eastern Melody and Drumming classes will cover several several different folk songs and drum rhythms from various Middle Eastern countries
description_web:
The Middle Eastern Melody and Drumming classes will cover several several different folk songs and drum rhythms from Turkey, Armenia, Lebanon, and medeval Spain. The following melodies will be covered on the days listed below. Basic instruction for learning the new drum rhythms will be provided for each of the melodies. Bring your favorite melody instrument or a drum or both if you are so inclined. A limited number of handouts including historical notes, drumming notations, melody notations, and sheet music will be available on a first-come basis. A Google docs copy of the handouts and MP3 files of the songs can be obtained by sending an email request to briansbeaman@gmail.com.


Song Name		    Rhythm	Origin		        Class Date
A La Una Yo Nací	    6/8		Sephardic		8/5/2022
La Rosa Enflorece    Bolero	Sephardic		8/5/2022

Yavuz / La Komida   7/8		Sephardic		8/7/2022
Malatya			    Bayou	        Turkish 		8/7/2022

Ha Nina			    D tktkt	Armenian		8/9/2022
Ya Sitti			    Ayoub	        Lebanese		8/9/2022

name: Card Weaving Basics
description_book: Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and, using cards, you will weave a small strap or trim piece on our mini-card loom.
description_web: Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and weave a small strap or trim piece on our mini-card loom. Classroom loaner looms provided. Class limited to 5 looms. Fee covers string and cards; take your work home with you.
fee_itemization: cards, string, & instructions

name: The Knights Templar: An Overview
description_book: A synopsis of the history and everyday life of the Knights Templar.

location: the old Cafe Marhaba location or what ever coffee shop is taking that place (South-West of the Pennsic Market store. (Coffee shop that is South West of the Food Court Near Barn)
name: Pre-16th-Century Musical Modal Improvisation
description_book: This is a practical application class for musicians to learn improvisational skills that were practiced in the Middle Ages. **College level.**
description_web: Musician class for acoustic instruments to learn medieval modal improvisation that will teach the student to create melodies on the spot for both free form and structured rhythmic forms. Students are required to be very familiar with their instruments. Reading music is not required but really helps, especially your major and natural minor scales. **College level.**

name: Plumbata Tournament
description_book: "Experimental" tournament to see what styles of throwing and targets will work best for plumbatas as newly approved thrown weapons options
description_web: "Experimental" tournament to see what styles of throwing and targets will work best for plumbatas as newly approved thrown weapons options. Bring your own plumbatas. Some will be available to borrow.

name: Post-Apocalypse: The Walking *Dum*
description_book: Begintermediate and pre-advanced rhythms to get beyond the basic rhythms. Different rhythms each day. **Bring your own drum.**
description_web: This is a begintermediate/pre-advanced  drumming class. Rhythm exercises to strengthen both right and left hands with different accents. Learn different rhythms and patterns beyond the basic 2, 4, and 8 counts. **Bring your own drum**.

name: Children's Choir
description_book: For children 13 and younger. Sing music in a period style. Meets daily. Performance on Thursday of War Week!
description_web: For children 13 and younger. Sing music in a period style. Meets daily. Performance on Thursday of War Week! Responsible adult needs to be within reach for the younger ones. Bring a folder to hold music. We will teach rounds, songs and melodies from the medieval to Renaissance. Session will be 45 minutes. Dress rehearsal in PA tent on Thursday with a performance at 6 pm.

name: Coronation Ceremonies from Period Sources
description_book: Creating "authentic-as-possible" SCA coronations from period services. Methods of converting period liturgies to secular forms. Sources and examples.
description_web: Creating "authentic-as-possible" SCA coronation ceremonies from period *ordines*. Methods and philosophies of secularizing period liturgies. Examples and sources. In the early days of the SCA, our ceremonials were made from sketchy sources such as fantasy and historical novels, but period sources are now relatively widely available. We can present our royalty and people moving experiences that are evocative of real period coronations (of which the recent coronation of King Charles III was a descendant). The presenter has designed several successful "verbatim as possible" ceremonies in several kingdoms for Anglo-Saxon, Holy Roman Empire, English, Danish, and other personas.

name: Feeding Your Fighting Demons
description_book: How's your head game? Struggling? Discuss some possible mental hurdles to fighting and ways to think about addressing them. All disciplines. **18+**
description_web: How's your head game? Struggling? Discussion of some possible mental hurdles to fighting and ways to think about addressing them. Open to all disciplines (yes, even combat archery). **Age 18+.**

name: Teen/Tween Fingerloop Braiding
description_book: Learn how to do a simple 5-bow fingerloop braid and make a bracelet to take home with you!
description_web: Learn how to do a simple 5-bow fingerloop braid and make a bracelet to take home with you!

name: Prologues from 16th-Century *Commedia dell'Arte*
description_book: Eight or nine prologues used by Zan Ganassa's troupe in the 1570s & 80s were written down. We look at their content, and how to make similar ones.
description_web: How were *Commedia dell’Arte* plays performed in period? One aspect that we could add to our plays is the prologue. There is a collection of generic prologues that were presented to start plays by the Ganassa Troupe from about 1572 to 1584. They might be too long (as written) to use before plays in an SCA context (nine to twelve minutes of one person monologuing on a topic), but they tell a lot about how *Commedia dell’Arte* was performed in period, and to whom. Further the structure can be trimmed significantly to let you create something useful while making your shows more closely reflect the structure of shows from the SCA period of interest. I will also briefly touch on another collection published in 1623 which are mostly too late for us, but show how the prologues evolved over forty years or so.
fee_itemization: There is no fee.

name: Spanish Rope Shoes, Part 2: Shoe Uppers
description_book: Part 2 of the Spanish Rope shoe class: creating the rope upper for your shoes.
description_web: Rope shoes have been used for thousands of years. This class is a continuation of Part 1, and students must have taken that class in order to participate. Part 2 will focus on creating the upper for their shoes, looking at different examples and learning how to weave it onto their completed rope sole.

name: Viking Age Feast Gear: Archaeological Evidence
description_book: A survey of feast gear and cookware options from among the archaeological finds of the Old Norse World.
description_web: A survey of feast gear and cookware options from among the archaeological finds of the Old Norse World. We will look at items from Birka, Dublin, Gotland, Hedeby, Oseberg, York, and other sites.
fee_itemization: 43-page handout

name: Natural Cord Making
description_book: Students will learn two ways to make cordage using natural materials; we'll also cover its history. This is a make-and-take class.
description_web: Cordage made from plant and animal fibers have been used throughout history. It can be used for bowstrings, fishing lines, snares, basketry, and bag making. We will provide materials and teach you two different ways of making your own cordage.

name: North African and Ethiopian Coffee
description_book: Learn how to make the perfect cup of coffee in the North African and Ethiopian styles, then enjoy a cup or two!
description_web: From beans to cup, we will roast green coffee beans together, then learn the techniques you need to make the perfect brew. We will look at Ethiopian *bunna* coffee, as well as North African *qahwah*. Come thirsty! There is an option to go home with the tools you need to make coffee at home. I will have 20 kits available (approx. $30).
fee_itemization: handouts are 1.00 and supply kits containing cup, pot, coffee etc. run between $30.00 and $60.00 [a few  actually have their own braziers] depending on pot size and size/pieces in kit, as available

name: Cooking from Period Sources
description_book: How to start with a recipe that was written in period and end up with a dish that is consistent with that recipe and tastes good.
description_web: How to start with a recipe that was written in period and end up with a dish that is consistent with that recipe and tastes good. Also, a discussion of available sources for recipes.

name: Newcomers 101
description_book: Titles and customs across the Known World. Camping and what to bring with you to events. How to get along in the SCA.
description_web: Handouts showing the common titles and responsibilities. Discussion about all things SCA. Camping, names, bylaws about bullying. Anything they want to know that I can answer or direct them to another person or class.

name: Beginner Dance: *English Country*
description_book: Never danced before? No problem! Start with basic steps and patterns, and then learn simple *English Country Dances*.
description_web: Never danced before? No problem! This class will start with basic steps and patterns, and then teach simple English Country Dances. (P. S. Experienced dancers are also welcome to show up and learn.)

name: Shakespeare’s Music
description_book: Songs and dances from Shakespeare’s time with an emphasis on those mentioned in Shakespeare’s plays. All vocal ranges and instruments are welcome.

name: The Battle of Tortuga (Rapier)
description_book: Two ships meet at sea and battle for survival and glory! Pirates vs merchants! Bring your RBGs as this event is set for gun and blade duels.
description_web: Two ships meet at sea and battle for survival and glory! Pirates vs merchants vs unexpected complications! Bring your RBGs as this event is set for gun and blade duels. Non-War Point nautical-themed fun! Three rounds (sometimes four) of stab 'em and shoot 'em goodness. Also Bombs! Ever wanted to use the petard from La Rochelle as an anti-personnel weapon? Then this is your event!

name: A Different Approach to Overhand Spear Throwing
description_book: A hands-on class for people to learn to throw spears overhand more effectively.
description_web: A hands-on class for people to learn to throw spears overhand more effectively. This technique is for people who cannot rely on just their arm strength to reach the target. Those who teach throwing are encouraged to come and learn this technique to pass along. The class will start with a brief lecture on the differences between this technique and how spear is usually taught and then move on to hands-on practice.

instructor: Thl Cynthia Anne of Silver Lakes
name: Pennsic Youth Choir
description_book: The Youth Choir is open to all youth ages 12 to 19 who enjoy singing. No audition is required to participate.
description_web: We will participate in a Dress Rehearsal/Recording Session on Thursday, Aug. 10 at noon, and perform that evening at 6:30 pm, as part of the Pennsic Choirs Concert. Your director will provide you with a media release to sign.

instructor: Master Piero di Paxiti da Vincenza
name: Medieval Miniatures: The Stick Figure Method
description_book: Drawing 14th- and 15th-century miniatures can seem very threatening, but I will show you a simple method to make it less intimidating!

name: Scribal Swap Meet (Bring a Brush, Take a ???)
description_book: Bring your extra or unused items to swap or just to re-home your un-needed materials and tools.
description_web: All scribes have those things that clutter up the art box. Bring your extras here to swap for something you don't have or just to re-home your un-needed materials and tools. Swappable items include paints, brushes, templates, totes, rulers, ink, pens ... anything in good and useable condition. We will also be accepting unfinished scroll blank layouts that might be sitting in your portfolio. Others can use these as practice pieces or complete into award scrolls for their group or kingdom.

name: Anatomy of a Basic Weaving Loom
description_book: Come experiment with a small tabletop loom. Learn how fabric weaving was done in period across several cultures.
description_web: Come experiment with a small tabletop loom. Learn how fabric weaving was done in period across several cultures.

name: Speak the Speech: Shakespearian Text Analysis
description_book: A deep dive into text work for the actor, and tools to make Shakespeare's text clear and approachable for yourself and your audience.
description_web: A deep dive into the (mundane) process a professional actor uses to analyze Shakespearean text for performance to make it clear and approachable. We will start with the basics (scansion, paraphrasing) and, depending on class comfort and experience level, continue into advanced topics like tone color, imagery, pitch/pace/intensity, point of view/point of focus, breath work, etc. Appropriate for novice and experienced performers alike, class level will be tailored for those present. This will be a participatory class, though observers are permitted. If possible, please bring 3-6 lines of Shakespearean verse, memorized and written down. Instructor will have options for those who do not have text ready to work with.

name: East Kingdom Soothsayers’ Guild Meeting
description_book: Meeting for Soothsayers from the East Kingdom Guild (and others interested).
description_web: Meeting for current and potential guild members of the EK Soothsayers' Guild. If you scry, see, dowse, cast, foretell or otherwise say the sooth, come meet the other members. We want to find out who's in the different regions. Come ask questions if you've never heard of it before.

name: Period Islamic Cooking
description_book: A description of a wide range of recipes from period Islamic cookbooks, along with a discussion of the available sources.
description_web: A description of a wide range of recipes from period Islamic cookbooks, along with a discussion of the available sources.

name: Siege Inspection Tent
description_book: I was told this is how I reserve a tent for siege inspections on the battlefield.
description_web: Siege engine and ammo inspection. I also have no problems if any interested in siege wish to stop by see what we do and ask questions.

location: Courtesan College (Strawberry Fields B06 (off eLeri Lane between Ankara and Visby Vale))
name: Courtesans of the Renaissance *Not* Named... - CCt
description_book: Veronica Franco was lucky enough to get a movie about her, but what about the rest of Italy's famous courtesans? Come hear their stories. **18+**
description_web: Veronica Franco was lucky enough to have her story recorded in the movie *Dangerous Beauty*, but what about the rest of Italy's famous courtesans? Come hear about Fiametta, Imperia the Divine, Tullia d'Aragona, and the stories of their lives, and even some of their poetry. **Age 18+.**

name: Dances for Two Left Feet
description_book: Dances for those who think they can't dance.
description_web:
If you think you can't dance, this class is for you. Join Eleanor as she simplifies some common dances.
One or two dances will be chosen from the following list: *Orynge, Petite Rose, Petit Vrienes, Grene Gynger*.

location: Denys the Decadent's Camo  (EO7 off great Eastern Hiughway, Look for 12 Steppe Sign)
name: 12-Step Meeting
description_book: An open meeting for those in recovery or any 12-step programs.
description_web: A daily 12-step meeting I hold in my Camp E07 off Great Eastern Highway. Look for the sign. Held at 4:00 PM, **OPEN MEETING .** Holding a meeting here since 1997.

name: Domos Draconum (DnD): In Search of the Unknown
description_book: Vintage 1970s Dungeons & Dragons adventure for ages 10+. No experience necessary. Limit: 8

name: Tables/ *Nard*/ Backgammon
description_book: How to play backgammon plus some of the long, long, long history of the game.
description_web: how to play backgammon. and some of the long long long history of the game

location: Gunnery Point on Mt Eislinn (Top of Mt Eislinn)
name: Period Black Powder Firearms: Safety and Handling
description_book: Firearm safety, handling, and shooting procedures for small arms and artillery, 1320-1600. Powder and match supplied by teacher. **Ages 18+.**
description_web: Firearm safety, handling, and shooting procedures for small arms and artillery, 1320-1600. Owners of period arms are requested/encouraged to bring them and help with coaching newer shooters. Powder and match are supplied by instructor. **Ages 18+.** Handouts for all classes: http://www.3fgburner.net/#info. Under 18 may watch, but cannot handle arms or powder.

name: Late Medieval Glassblowing Demo (Furnace Glass)
description_book: A fully narrated, live, 2000-degree glassblowing demonstration! Learn about the materials, the techniques, and how glass usage changed over time!
description_web: Come and watch a fully narrated, live, 2000-degree glassblowing demonstration! See how we can take this fascinating material and turn it into a never-ending variety of items! Learn about the materials we use, and how glass making techniques, its uses, and value varied throughout time and culture! For this demo you'll see items from Europe to the Middle East from the 11th - 14th centuries! Family-friendly, all ages welcome, open Q&A to follow.

name: Lord Ramirez' "Unofficial" Official Cigar Social
description_book: Join Lord Ramirez Sat, Aug 5th, from 3-6 pm in Runestone Park, to share fellowship with your fellow cigar enthusiasts. This is our 3rd year! **21+**
description_web:
The Unofficial Pennsic Cigar Social will be held Saturday, Aug 5th, from 3-6pm in Runestone Park. So for the Cigar Aficionados amongst us, bring your cigars, a chair, and a drink, and meet your fellow attendees at Pennsic in friendship and fellowship, learn about different groups attending, share war stories, and generally be excellent to one another.
I hope I will see you there. **Age 21+.**

name: How to Write for The Pennsic Independent
description_book: How you can create content for publication in Pennsic’s newspaper!
description_web:
The Pennsic Independent is the recorded history of the War. That history depends upon reporters, photographers, and anyone who has a story to tell. 
This class will teach you the basics of writing for PI. It will include an overview of staff reporting, how to submit unsolicited stories, submitting stories and other material for the Web Edition, and so much more!
Discover the benefits of being a part of your favorite daily newspaper!

name: Advanced Thrown Weapons
description_book: Focuses on advanced throwing technique for more experienced throwers.
description_web: Focuses on advanced throwing technique for more experienced throwers.

name: Teen Silk Painting
description_book: Learn the basics of silk painting. Create a small piece to take home.
description_web: Learn the basics of silk painting. Create a small piece to take home. Bring a hair dryer if you have one with you.
fee_itemization: Silk stretched hoop. Paint and gutta to be shared by the class.

name: Rise of the Mongolian Empire and Europe in 13th C
description_book: Rise of Mongolian Empire and its direct and indirect impacts on the political and military situation in Europe in 13th C. Class 1 of 3.
description_web: Rise of Mongolian Empire and its direct and indirect impacts on the political and military situation in "larger" Europe in 13th century. Class 1 of 3.
fee_itemization: for printed handouts

name: Make Your Own Medallion Cord
description_book: Why wear a plain white string? Learn *Slung*, cord-making described as juggling with strings! Children welcome with adult. OK to be late.
description_web: Why wear a plain white string? Learn *Slung*, a method for cord-making that can best be described as juggling with strings! Children welcome with adult. *Slung* is also known as Viking whip-cording. It is not only useful but a lot of fun for all ages. Can be done as a children's activity or at demos. Bring a friend! People will be taking turns on a limited number of set-ups. Showing up late is perfectly fine.

name: Beginner's Ball Prep
description_book: A review of dances for the Beginner's Ball.
description_web: A review of dances for the Beginner's Ball.

name: Yoga for Anyone and Everyone
description_book: All-level friendly, basic *vinyasa* class, open to complete beginners & seasoned yogis. Bring your own mat, towel & water, prepare to work and relax.

name: Overview of Gold Leafing: Period to Modern
description_book: Sample the field of gold leaf methods for both period and modern gilding. Period fish glue, garlic, glair, gesso, permacol for paper and parchment.
description_web: Understand gold leaf methods for illumination by making a sample page on parchment, paper, and perg of period and modern glue as well as application. Class will focus on period fish glue, garlic, glair, plus modern gesso, permacol and miniatum for paper and parchment. Learn application tricks for glue, and tips for a perfect finish in both period and modern methods. Bring your gilding questions and problems for troubleshooting and analysis! Create small gilded samplers on parchment, pergamenata, and paper. All materials included.
fee_itemization: gold leaf, glues, paper, parchment, pergamenata, tools

name: Late Period Rounds
description_book: Come help sing through (or listen to) some late period rounds.

name: Gab and Stab Rapier Gathering
description_book: Non-grant level fencers take the field to fight and learn from all grant level (White Scarf, Bronze Ring, OGR) fencers. **18+**
description_web: All non-grant level fencers are welcome to come spend 2 hours fencing any and all grant or higher level fencers for a chance to learn tips, tricks and techniques! Grants and above get to see the up and coming or new fencers and share their advice! A raffle will be available for all fencers with prizes tba! All authorized fencers welcome! **Age 18+.**

name: KW Thrown Weapons Marshals: Opening Meeting
description_book: This meeting is open to all Known World Thrown Weapons Marshals. Please attend to hear this year's range procedures.
description_web: This meeting is open to all Known World Thrown Weapons Marshals. Please attend to hear this year's range procedures.

location: Courtesan College (Strawberry Fields B06 (off eLeri Lane between Ankara and Visby Vale))
name: The Dangerous Beauty: Series 4, *Allora!* - CCt
description_book: The Arts of a Courtesan. Discussion and practice in how to look and act like an elite historical sex worker. **Age 18+.**
description_web: The Dangerous Beauty: a series on the Arts of a Courtesan. You - yes *you*! have within you the power to secure a military alliance, curate courtly influence, maybe feel more assurance about attending Court, or just chat with that interesting person you met at fighter practice last week. We will be discussing and practicing how to look and act like an elite sex worker while in persona based on a combination of both extant European period writings on social behavior with modern framing of deportment, etiquette, and seduction. This section will cover games, period arts and pursuits, research subjects, SCA skills, and consort arts. Handouts will be available. **Age 18+.**

name: *Jeu-Parti* Party! Geoffrey, Siobhan, Harps, Voice
description_book: Join Geoffrey of Exeter and Siobhan the Harper for troubadour and troubadour-style duets and solos. Harps, voices and joy!
description_web: Building further on a long plague project since meeting at Pennsic 48, Siobhan the Harper has worked with Geoffrey of Exeter to locate, arrange and compose troubadour and troubadour-style music for two voices and two harps. Join Geoffrey (countertenor, harp) and Siobhan (mezzo, harp) to hear these medieval sounds come to life.

name: *Janissary* Band Performance at Opening Ceremonies
description_book: Not a class. The *Janissary* Band will gather to perform their repertoire in Opening Ceremonies.
description_web: The *Janissary* Band will gather to perform their repertoire.

name: Pennsic Glass Challenge
description_book:
Looking for beadmaking enthusiasts of all skill levels! Each session will have a different surprise challenge!
Visit tinyurl.com/glassapprentice.
description_web:
Looking for beadmaking enthusiasts of all skill levels! If you can work at a beadmaking torch, safely, without direct supervision, join us! 
This is a fun challenge meant to push individuals along their own learning paths, to try something new and find new horizons in their creativity and technical skill. This is **not** a competition.
Back again, by popular demand at Pennsic 50!

Visit tinyurl.com/glassapprentice for more information.
fee_itemization: All equipment, materials, and tools will be provided for each daily challenge. If you have your own favourite glass-rated safety glasses (didymium), please bring them along.

name: Known World Player Meet & Greet and Read Through
description_book: Closed rehearsal for the cast and crew of Romeo & Juliet.
description_web: Closed rehearsal for the cast and crew of Romeo & Juliet.

name: Period Card Games: *Karnoffel*
description_book: Do you like to play cards? Come learn to play this oldest identifiable European card game (1426 reference).
description_web: Looking for something to pass the time at events? Do you like to play cards? Come learn to play this oldest identifiable European card game (1426 reference).

name: Duke Moonwulf's Annual Pennsic War 50 Concert
description_book: A Pennsic tradition! Laugh, cry, and sing along with Moonwulf in his concert celebrating the 50th Pennsic!
description_web: Come to listen, sing along, laugh and cry with the songs, stories and shenanigans of Duke Moonwulf (aka Michael Longcor) in a concert that has become a Pennsic Tradition. This year's performance features new songs, old favorites and stories of Pennsic Wars 3, 4 and 5!

name: Family Point Movie Night
description_book: Double feature in the Great Hall! Disney's *Robin Hood* for the younger set, followed by *Princess Bride*! Bring blankets/chairs. All ages.
description_web: Join us in the Great Hall for a double feature! Disney's *Robin Hood* for the younger set, followed by *Princess Bride*! Bring blankets/chairs. All ages welcome, with appropriate supervision.

location: Kingdom of the East (E06, corner of Low Road and Berwick Road, a block south of troll)
name: East Royal Encampment Benefit Dinner
description_book: Fundraising dinner to benefit the East Royal Encampment. The theme of this Pennsic 50 dinner will be early period elegance.
description_web:
This year we return to our fundraising dinner to benefit the East Royal Encampment. The theme of this Pennsic 50 dinner will be early period elegance. Featured will be a whole roast swine and a whole roast lamb. Along with these center pieces will be a variety of roasted vegetables, grain loaves and sweet items. We encourage you to bring libations to share to supplement to teas and waters provided. Aethelhawk and the cooks' crew will make sure no one leaves hungry. As in years past we will have entertaining guest and songs from the crowd. 
We will be selling tickets at $25 a person limited to a maximum of 100. All proceeds will be used for East Kingdom Encampment kitchen and public spaces improvements. Write to Chris Hourclé, Judi Cole Tazelaar and Jim Tazelaar.
fee_itemization: Cost for dinner

name: Glow Stick: Rise of the Gnomes Tournament
description_book: This fun evening tournament includes throwing at glow sticks; 8:30 pm or dusk until complete. **Age 18+. Max 30 entries.**
description_web: This fun evening tournament includes throwing at glow sticks; 8:30 pm or dusk until complete. Competition slots; first-come, first-served. **Age 18+. Max 30 entries.**

name: Bedtime Stories for Children
description_book: Nightly telling of stories for children. This year's theme will be The Brothers Grimm!
description_web: Stories and fables for children, 7 pm nightly. This year's theme will be The Brothers Grimm. All are welcome to attend; children must have adult escort.

name: Geoffrey of Exeter's Medieval Atmosphere
description_book: Join Geoffrey for an evocative medieval atmosphere with countertenor voice and harp. Journey with sound into historical and magical kingdoms!
description_web: Join Lord Geoffrey of Exeter, former Queen's Bardic Champion (East) and composer/performer of medieval and medieval-inspired music in modern life (mka David Yardley), as he summons an evocative atmosphere with his professional-standard countertenor voice and harp playing. Not a "look at me" but a "journey with me" performance, which invites you to close your eyes and drift on period and period-inspired sound into historical and magical kingdoms.

location: Courtesan Camp (Courtesan College (Strawberry Fields B06 off eLeri Lane, enter on Visby Vale))
name: Courtesan Tableaux - CCt
description_book: Living scenes from the private dressing rooms of the social elite showcasing courtesan fashion from select cultures in Europe and abroad. **18+**
description_web: Living scenes from the private dressing rooms of the social elite showcasing courtesan fashion from select cultures in Europe and abroad. Observe the garments and elaborate effort of three high-class courtesans as they prepare from a state of dishabille for an evening out, or undressing for intimate evenings in. Join us in contemplating the art and effort that goes into period dressing and primping in this performance. Social to begin at 7:30 pm. RSVPs are appreciated to https://rb.gy/ocexy. **Age 18+.**

name: Pip & Wystle: Medieval Music & Ambiance
description_book: Efenwealt, Aenor, Pippin, and friends provide an evening of medieval music, poetry, and ambience focused on the 12-13th century.
description_web: Efenwealt, Aenor, Pippin, and friends provide an evening of medieval music and ambience focused on the 12-13th century with music from across culture. Goliard sinaglongs, songs of crusaders, cantigas, amigas, trouveres and maybe even some originals.

name: Beginner's Ball
description_book: At the Beginner's Ball, we teach all of the dances. Never danced? No problem! A perfect ball for the eager but still learning. No partner is needed!
description_web: At the Beginner's Ball, we teach all of the dances. Never danced? Not a problem! A perfect ball for the eager but still learning. No partner is needed. Bring your friends! All musicians are welcome, too! The pit is open! The more the merrier!

name: *i Verdi Confusi*: Players' Patchwork Theatre Co
description_book:
Back for more *Commedia dell'Arte all'Improvviso* hilarity! Of course! It All Makes Sense Now!
Show Contains Adult Themed Content.
description_web:
Back for more *Commedia dell'Arte all'Improvviso* hilarity! Of course! It All Makes Sense Now!
Show Contains Adult Themed Content.

location: University Point (University Point, look for sign)
name: Night Sky over Pennsic
description_book: Come enjoy the night sky over Pennsic and learn to identify some classical constellations, weather permitting.

name: Yoga for Fighters,  Dancers and Everybody
description_book: Yoga for all levels! Bring mat or towel for the floor & strap, scarf, or strip of cloth for class if you can; some loaner gear available.
description_web:
Yoga for all levels! Bring mat or towel for the floor & strap, scarf, or strip of cloth for class if you can; some loaner mats and straps will be available. If you have blocks, please bring them if you can! This class is geared for folks who have never done yoga through seasoned practitioners. Amendments for poses will be offered as we go, and each class will build upon the one before, however, anyone can jump in at anytime. 
Class will begin with a few minutes of breath work followed by approximately 45 minutes of yoga.

name: Coffee with Friends of Bill and Dr Bob
description_book: Open agnostic 12-Step meetings.
description_web: Open agnostic 12-Step meetings. From 8:00 am-9:00 am.

name: Known World Players Rehearsal for Romeo & Juliet
description_book: A closed rehearsal for cast and crew for the Pennsic 50 production of Romeo & Juliet by William Shakespeare.
description_web: A closed rehearsal for cast and crew for the Pennsic 50 production of Romeo & Juliet by William Shakespeare.

name: Youth Heavy List Skills, Games, and Drills
description_book: Daily morning regular practices to be run from 8:30 till 11 am on the Pennsic Battlefield Youth List. Youth aged 6-17. Loaner gear will be available.
description_web: Daily morning regular practices to be run from 8:30 till 11 am on the Pennsic Battlefield Youth List. Youth aged 6-17, all levels of experience on three different list fields. Loaner gear will be available.

instructor: Master Piero di Paxiti da Vincenza
name: The Angle and the Line: Calligraphy
description_book: Learn how pen angle strongly directs the shape of your letter forms in broad nib calligraphy. Learn to develop a "feel" for different period hands.

name: Pennsic Youth *Commedia dell'Arte*
description_book: Hands-on class giving the description and history of *commedia* before having the youth create and eventually perform their own skit. Ages 13-17.
description_web: Young adults will learn the art of *commedia dell'arte* while practicing and creating skits that will be performed at the end of the week. Ages 13-17.

name: Archery 9th Pennsic Period Bow Shoot
description_book: The 9th Annual Pennsic Period Bow Shoot welcomes all archers who enjoy the period side of archery. Come and shoot period targets with period gear!
description_web: Greetings to all Knowne World Archers. The 9th Annual Pennsic Period Bow Shoot welcomes to the range all archers who enjoy the period side of archery. The categories for the competition are period longbow, static-eared recurve (aka horsebow), and crossbow. Participants' garb needs to match their archery kit. No Vikings with a Yumi bow, for example. Period arrow nocks only, no plastic nocks. Those who participate in the Flight Shoot the 2 days before this competition will earn bonus points for the Period Shoot. We hope you will join us for an exciting day of archery. This event will happen on the Pennsic archery range.

name: Pennsic Glass Challenge
description_book:
Looking for beadmaking enthusiasts of all skill levels! Each session will have a different surprise challenge!
Visit tinyurl.com/glassapprentice.
description_web:
Looking for beadmaking enthusiasts of all skill levels! If you can work at a beadmaking torch, safely, without direct supervision, join us! 
This is a fun challenge meant to push individuals along their own learning paths, to try something new and find new horizons in their creativity and technical skill. This is **not** a competition.
Back again, by popular demand at Pennsic 50!

Visit tinyurl.com/glassapprentice for more information.
fee_itemization: All equipment, materials, and tools will be provided for each daily challenge. If you have your own favourite glass-rated safety glasses (didymium), please bring them along.

name: Cartomancy in Period
description_book: An overview of the history of cartomancy (divination with cards), and which *Tarot* cards and techniques are most appropriate at SCA events.
description_web: *Tarot* is one of the most popular forms of divination, but cards did not reach Europe until mid-14th century. Not long after that, diviners started using playing cards to tell fortunes. Let's talk about what earliest forms of cartomancy were practiced up to the 17th century, which decks are most appropriate for use at events (if you want to be historically accurate). If attendees are interested, we'll discuss which other forms of divination are suitable to different cultures.

name: How to Train a Warhorse
description_book: This class will provide training suggestions on how to desensitize a horse for our SCA games, mounted archery, one-on-one combat, and jousting.
description_web:
This class will provide training suggestions on how to desensitize a horse for our SCA games, mounted archery, one-on-one combat, and jousting. Information will address various horse behaviors and provides suggestions on how to condition the horse to spooky and strange moving obstacles, including water beds and bridges. 

This class is all about the horse and its behaviors and open to all riding styles or riding levels.

name: Staying in Shape: Early 16th-Century Hats
description_book: Combining English and German expertise, we will compare the structure and design of early 16th-century hats and their hidden millinery secrets.
description_web: Combining English and German expertise, join us as we compare the structure and design of early 16th-century hats, such as the English gable hood, the German *tellerbarret*, and their hidden millinery secrets.

name: The Everyday Tudor
description_book: Clothing of the common Tudor man or woman. Will cover daily wear, sumptuary laws, sources of secondhand clothing, and clothing as an asset.
description_web: Takes a look at wills and inventories to examine what clothing and domestic items were owned by the average Tudor/Elizabethan person. Plus, how to use basics and accessories to create a "capsule wardrobe" to take you from the marketplace to feast.

name: Modern Gaming: War Week
description_book: A place, with power, to play modern games from 9 am to 10:30 pm every day.

name: Food and Festivals of the Roman Empire
description_book: The goal of this class is to provide an overview of Roman festivals and the foods, if any, that may be directly associated with them.
description_web: The goal of this class is to provide an overview of Roman festivals and the foods, if any, that may be directly associated with them. It will discuss food in the context of holiday celebration and perhaps even talk about some recipes that might be able to be recreated.

name: Period Fabrics and Modern Sources
description_book: Back for Pennsic 50, learn about what fabrics were used in period and where to find them today. Make a swatch book with samples to help when shopping.
description_web: Learn about what fabrics were used in clothing during the Middle Ages and Renaissance in Western Europe. Learn about how and where we can find these fabrics for our own garb. We will make a swatch book,so you have some physical examples to help when you’re trying to identify and compare the fabric. The class is back after a long break for Pennsic 50. The instructor has over a decade of experience working in fabric stores and making garb for family, friends and strangers.

name: Project Management for Embroidery and Other Arts
description_book: Have you ever had a big idea but didn't know how to make it happen? This class teaches you how to turn a big idea into reality.
description_web: Have you ever had a big idea but froze when you realized how much time and effort you needed to make it? This class will teach you how to turn those big ideas into reality. We’ll talk about breaking a project into manageable tasks, designing for group projects, recruiting workers, timelines, managing materials, managing volunteers, surviving pitfalls, and successful finishes. Bring the big idea you always wanted to work on and we’ll start you turning your vision into a reality. This class uses embroidery projects as the examples but the lessons apply to any art.

name: Beaded Flowers 1: Rose
description_book: Make a miniature rose in the style of beaded flowers of 16th-century Venice. If you have needle-nose pliers/wire cutters, bring them to class.
description_web: Make a miniature rose in the style of beaded flowers of 16th-century Venice. If you have needle-nosed pliers/wire cutters, please bring them to class. Not recommended for youth.
fee_itemization: beads, wire, yarn

name: East Kingdom Morning
description_book: Join us for a morning of activities sponsored by the East Kingdom! Specific Activities will be announced in advance.

name: Kid Garb Swap Meet
description_book: Kids grow too fast! Come to family point to donate or swap your kids' old garb, and swap or receive new garb that fits. All items must leave at end.

name: Goldleafing Made Easy
description_book: Learn how to leaf the easy way with garlic and patent leaf! Class limit is 10. Using a 22k gold patent leaf, you learn hands-on how to smoothly leaf.
description_web: Using a 22k gold patent leaf, you learn hands-on how to smoothly leaf your project! A take-home booklet is provided. Bring a pencil or ink liner. Create a smooth line, corners, and more!
fee_itemization: $13.00 for booklet, $2 for gold leaf, board and other supplies provided. Total is $15.00.

name: Pennsic Instrumental Youth Consort
description_book: The Youth Instrumental Consort is open to all youth who play an instrument. No audition is required to participate.
description_web: Rehearsals will be from 9:00 am - 9:45 am daily from Saturday, August 5, 2023, until Wednesday, August 9, at the Performing Arts Rehearsal Classroom (PARC) located by the Amphitheatre. We will participate in a Dress Rehearsal/Recording Session on Thursday, Aug. 10, at noon, and perform on Thursday, August 10 at 6:30 pm, as part of the Pennsic Choirs Concert. Your director will provide you with a media release to sign.

name: Family *Kumihimo* Basics
description_book: Family-oriented *kumihimo*: braiding round cord on a disk. Youth welcome with parent or guardian.
description_web: Family-oriented *kumihimo*: braiding round cord on a disk. Youth welcome with parent or guardian. Make a basic round cord which can be used for everything from shoestrings to medallion cords. Disk and string provided.
fee_itemization: disk, bobbins, string, & instructions

name: Youth Rapier Activities
description_book: There will be a variety of youth rapier activities each day including drills, games and one-on-one instruction. Some loaner gear will be available.
description_web: There will be a variety of youth rapier activities each day including drills, games and one-on-one instruction. Some days may include special additional activities. Some loaner gear will be available. Participants do not have to be authorized. Children age 6 and up may participate. Please bring your parent/guardian the first day you attend to learn more about the youth rapier program.

name: Thrown Weapons MIT: Part 1
description_book: Learn the SCA rules and guidelines to be a Thrown Weapons Marshal. Parts 1 & 2 required with on-the-range training and written test on Friday.
description_web: Learn the SCA rules and guidelines to be a Thrown Weapons Marshal. Parts 1 & 2 required with on-the-range training and written test on Friday.

name: Creating a Sampler of Medieval Pigments
description_book: Create your own sampler using historical pigments.
description_web: Create your own sampler using historical pigments.

name: Recreating the Art of Period Fencing Plates
description_book: Introductory class on figure drawing. Students will be able to recreate a rudimentary sketch by the end of class. **Age 18+.**
description_web: Introductory class on figure drawing. Students will be able to recreate a rudimentary sketch by the end of class. Please bring art and drawing supplies. **Age 18+.**
fee_itemization: Graphite transfer paper, tracing paper, pencil, eraser, sketching paper, pigment pen

name: Parchment Workshop
description_book: Come see how animal hides are transformed into parchment and vellum. Be as hands-on as you like. Feel free to drop in and out; no need to stay all day
description_web: Come see how animal hides are transformed into parchment and vellum. Be as hands-on as you like. Feel free to drop in and out; no need to stay all day. Please wear garb and shoes that can get wet, and possibly a little smelly. Dead animal parts are involved in this class.

name: Pennsic Youth Theatre
description_book: Kids ages 5-17, join us in creating & performing, from story book to stage, your very own play! Creative minds + theatrical tools = a fun-filled time!
description_web: For kids ages 5-17 interested in exploring their creative and theatrical sides through storytelling, acting, and producing their very own play! Come join us as we build a theatre show from the ground up, giving younger kids a creative outlet for all that pent-up camping energy! Children 12 and under must have a parent or guardian present.

name: Deed of Arms: Global Polio Eradication Initiative
description_book: The Barbarians of Ealdormere, inspired by Her Majesty, invite all comers to a heavy combat deed of arms; fights will fund polio vaccines. **18+**
description_web: https://www.rotary.org/en/our-causes/ending-polio  **18+ only.**

name: Decorated Veils: Part 1, Rolled Hem
description_book: Tired of trying to fold and pin a tiny hem on your veil or garb. There is an easier way. Learn how to sew a rolled hem and end the frustration.
description_web: Tired of trying to fold and pin a tiny hem on your veil or garb. There is an easier way. Learn how to sew a rolled hem and end the frustration. Please bring your own snips or scissors. Fee is not required to participate. You are welcome to bring your own material and sewing supplies.
fee_itemization: $10 gets you 1 yd of 100% linen or silk for a veil, sewing needle and thread. Please bring your own snips or scissors. Fee is not required to participate. You are welcome to bring your own material and sewing supplies.

name: Camino de Santiago in Period Clothing
description_book: I will share my experience of walking the Camino Frances to Santiago in September 2022 wearing period clothing.
description_web: I will share my experience of walking the Camino Frances to Santiago in September 2022 wearing period clothing. I will go through what clothing and accessories I wore during the walk with historical examples of what medieval pilgrims wore. I will also talk about the Camino today, practical stuff like finding your way, where to sleep, where to eat and tips for planning if you are curious about going on a pilgrimage of your own.

name: Roman/Byzantine Wire and Bead Jewelry
description_book: Learn about Roman and early Byzantine women's necklaces and earrings made with wire and beads and then create a replica set of your own.
description_web: Learn about Roman and early Byzantine women's necklaces and earrings made with wire and beads and then create a replica set of your own. Bring round needle nose pliers or rosary pliers and cutters if you have them.
fee_itemization: Wire, gem and glass beads, earwires, earring findings

name: History of Gunpowder and Gunpowder Weapons
description_book: Documenting the origins and history of gunpowder and gunpowder weapons from their earliest use to circa 1600 CE.

name: Spinning in the Hand
description_book: Learn to prep wool, make a hand-spindle and distaff, and spin wool. For those new to spinning, failed at drop-spinning, or still learning.
description_web: Failed at drop-spinning? Want to improve your draft? Want to learn spinning for the first time? In this class, we will go over preparing wool for spinning (card, comb, hand), build a hand spindle and distaff. We'll practice drafting and spinning "in the hand", while discussing the history of spinning, and variety of different cultural techniques.
fee_itemization: $2 for spindle & distaff

name: Book Lovers' Tea
description_book: Please bring your favorite book(s) to discuss. Books with medieval themes and topics are encouraged but not required. Be ready to take notes!
description_web: Please bring your favorite book(s) to discuss. Books with medieval themes and topics are encouraged but not required. Bring paper and pencil to jot down new authors to check out. Iced tea, water and treats will be provided. For those of you who attended last year don't forget your homework!

name: Dyes and Mordants
description_book: We'll look at the basic concepts of natural dyes and mordants from terminology to what chemistry is actually going on in there.
description_web: This conversational class will look at the basic concepts of natural dyes and mordants from the terminology used to a bit of the chemistry going on in there. All experience levels welcome.

name: All the Way to Timbuktu
description_book: A brief overview of the Empire of Mali, daily life, and the legacy of Mansa Musa.
description_web: A brief overview of the Empire of Mali, daily life, and the legacy of Mansa Musa.

name: Stepping Up Your Roman Game 2.0
description_book: Ideas on how to step up your Roman kit whether you strive for accuracy or just wear Roman for fun.
description_web: Ideas on how to step up your Roman kit whether you strive for accuracy or just wear Roman for fun.
fee_itemization: Handout

name: WTF? Watching The Fight: Understanding SCA Combat
description_book: Is watching SCA combat confusing? Wonder why that Duke just lost to an unbelt? Learn how to watch a fight! (Covers armored, rapier, and C&T.)
description_web:
Following a fight can be hard, even for experienced fighters. Whether it's for armored combat, rapier, or cut-and-thrust, this class will help you to be better able to understand why some blows are good and others aren't. We will discuss what counts as a "telling blow", what armor a combatant is assumed to be wearing, and why that Duke is lying on the ground "dead" when all you saw was that unbelt twitch her spear. Come for the information, stay for the anecdotes and handout.
While this class will be most beneficial to those who watch fighting with no combat experience themselves, all are welcome to attend!

name: 16th-Century Arbeau Historical Field Drum Class
description_book: For drummers who own & play historical field drum (this is the rope tension drum with sticks), including *tupon* with drum sticks. **College level.**
description_web: Class for drummers who own and play historical field drum (this is the rope tension drum with 2 sticks). Also welcome are  *tupan* (aka *davul, tapan, atabal* or *tabl*) with 2 drum sticks and frame drums with a drum stick. No *derbekes*, please. The class will study the only historical manuscript instructions on both military and dance rhythms. Possible coordination to support one of the field battles as a historical drum corps. **College level.**

name: *Kumihimo* on the *Marudai*: Getting Started
description_book: Learn to set up a *marudai* round braiding stand for *kumihimo* braiding.
description_web: *Kumihimo* braiding on the round braiding stand is faster and more traditional than braiding on a disc or plate. Learning to set up a *marudai* for braiding can be the biggest barrier to getting started. If you are having trouble setting up your *marudai*, or haven't acquired one yet and want to learn how before investing, this class is for you. Students will learn how to measure material for custom lengths, construct multi-ply bundles for smoother braiding, wind material onto traditional *tama* bobbins (including how to tie the special knot), and load this material onto the *marudai*. If time allows, you may be able to get started with a braid. Please bring your own equipment if you have it, otherwise some equipment can be provided.

name: Beginner Dance: English Country Plus
description_book: Suitable for beginners, we will have fun while learning *Maltese Bransle, Rufty Tufty*, and *Black Nag*.
description_web: Suitable for beginners, we will have fun while learning the *Maltese Bransle, Rufty Tufty*, and *Black Nag*.

name: Using a Medieval Low Bench
description_book: Introducing an example of a medieval low woodworking bench, showing the tool kit of a woodworker, and demonstrating the use of the bench. **Age18+.**
description_web: This class will introduce the idea of using a low bench for the production of wooden furniture, etc. A list of tools will be provided along with working examples. A bench will be available in order to illustrate how to build the bench, how to use it, demonstrate the work-holding devices, and use the tools/bench to complete various woodworking tasks, including joints. **Age 18+.**
fee_itemization: $2 fee for a 4 page handout.

name: Storytelling Academy
description_book: Explore genres, tools, styles, and uses of storytelling. Cultural and medieval approaches, applications, performance coaching. New topics each day.
description_web: During this academy, students will gain knowledge about the history and techniques for storytelling both in the SCA and the modern world. Students may attend individual sessions or all of the academy. There may be guest teachers and will be time for students to practice and receive feedback. The academy may culminate in a student performance. No classes are repeated. The focus is on developing comfort, nurturing, and honing skills within the students’ capabilities. All levels are welcome. Students may view a class outline at the academy space, Minerva’s Spindle 158, where classes will also be listed on the message board. Seating is limited; feel free to bring your own chair. Student Performance, date, time, and location will be announced.

name: Natural Hair Dye: Henna and Beyond
description_book: Use period dye techniques and materials to make your hair red, black, brown, or just shinier, healthier, and longer than ever. **Bring chairs.**
description_web: Learn how to use period dye techniques and materials to make your hair red, black, brown, or just shinier, healthier, and longer than ever. We'll focus on henna but explore other herbs to color and protect hair naturally without dangerous chemicals. Some supplies will be available at the class. **Please bring chairs.**

name: Known World Choir Rehearsals
description_book: Join the oldest Pennsic Choir as we rehearse in preparation for a concert on Thursday of War Week. Previous KWC Directors have been invited.
description_web: The Known World Choir, along with the Children's and Youth Choirs, and *Chorulus Pennsicus* will present a concert of medieval and Renaissance choral literature. Previous Directors of the KWC have been invited to conduct a selection. Bring a 1/2 inch black binder or plan to purchase one for use during the concert for $5. **Over age 18.** (There is a Youth Choir for those 12-18.)
fee_itemization: Copies of KWC Literature. $5 more if you wish to keep the 1/2 Inch Black Binder

name: Pre-School  Playgroup
description_book: Let our preschoolers tire each other out! Let the parents and guardians make friends! Meets at Toddler Lounge Shade by playground

name: Kinetic Tournament
description_book: A motion-based throwing competition. You walk towards the target while throwing. Limited to 12 participants, expert level only.
description_web: A motion-based throwing competition. You walk towards the target while throwing. Limited to 12 participants, expert level only.

name: Weed Walk
description_book: Wild plant identification. Wear walking shoes and hat; leave from Univ. Point. Different teachers on different days; walk with us more than once!
description_web: Cooper's Lake abounds with medicinal and food plants that were used by various primitive and medieval cultures. Learn to identify them during a walk around the campsite. The walk will take place rain or shine. Please wear sturdy shoes and a hat. Meet at University Point for the start of the class. We have multiple teachers, so if you attend more than one walk, you will likely learn different things!

name: Developing Stage Presence
description_book: Is “stage presence” just something innate, like “talent”? Or is it something bards can develop and expand through thoughtful planning and preparation?
description_web: Is “stage presence” just something innate, like “talent”? Or is it something bards can develop and expand through thoughtful planning and preparation? (Hint: It’s option 2.)

location: Heralds Point (Herald's Point, behind the playground. )
name: Heralds' Mentoring Meet-Up at Heralds' Point
description_book: A heraldic staff member will discuss your mentoring needs (armory or names). We will find you someone to shadow.
description_web: A heraldic staff member will discuss your mentoring needs (armory or names). We will find you someone to shadow.

name: Known World Adventurers Guild: **Walk Day**
description_book: Teen explorers (and youth 10+) will gather information via supervised Pennsic site walks. All activities begin and end at Family Point. KWAGuild.com.
description_web:
**WANTED**: Teen adventurers (and youth 10+) with a thirst for exploration, cultural exchange, and making friends within the SCA. Guildmistress Marian of Heatherdale invites you to join KWAG (the Known World Adventurers Guild) here at Pennsic 50. Her noble company of young explorers will gather information through supervised in-person walks around the Pennsic site. Who knows who you'll meet... Visiting royalty? One of the SCA's Founders? Someone from the esteemed Cooper Family? Come and find out. KWAG activities run throughout both weeks, and alternate between KWAG Walk Days and KWAG Social Days. All activities begin and end at Family Point. Everyone is welcome! Please note: this is an active class. The group will be walking to various public locations on the Pennsic site (no private camps). All participants should wear sturdy shoes, a hat and sunscreen, and bring water. More info at KWAGuild.com.
     **INFO FOR PARENTS/CAREGIVERS:**  KWAG classes are designed for teens and older children (10+). All activities will be supervised by a warranted and background-checked youth officer plus at least one other responsible adult. All abilities are happily welcomed. Please email heather@heatherdale.com if we can help provide any special accommodations in advance. Parents and caregivers are very welcome to join the walks, and are encouraged to accompany their kids if any special needs might affect the child's enjoyment of the classes.

name: How to Be Heard: Vocal Techniques to get **LOUD**
description_book: Modern theatrical vocal techniques to be heard loudly and distinctly on the field or in Court. Drop-in, take one session or multiple.
description_web: Modern theatrical vocal techniques for the Creative Anachronist to help you be heard loudly and distinctly on the field or in Court. We will learn and practice a vocal warm-up designed to enhance breath, resonance, and diction. Class is led by a professional actor and teaching artist. Attend any or all sessions, you do **NOT** need to be at all classes to fully participate.

name: Western Books Through the Ages
description_book: Western books are made differently through the ages. Come learn the differences from century to century.
description_web: From the first Western book to those made today, there are differences in the styles of books from century to century. From the way books are sewn, how boards are shaped, the weight of the leather, and so many more variations, books evolved over the years for different purposes and fashions. This class will explain those differences, explore suppositions on why changes were made through the years, and provide the knowledge to recognize when a book has been rebound instead of being contemporary to the text.
fee_itemization: Copies of handout - $1

name: The Elegant Edge...Hemstitching and Needle Lace
description_book: Want to add an elegant touch to your smocks and veils? In this class we will learn pulled work hemming and some simple needle lace edges.
fee_itemization: Linen, thread, needles, loan of embroidery hoop, wheat starch

name: Did the Vikings Have Printed Textiles?
description_book: Examine extant finds and contemporaneous accounts to draw conclusions on whether the Vikings made or had printed textiles.
description_web: The art of block printing is sweeping across the reenactor and living history world, with two extant designs that are often cited as "Viking" being put all over Norse clothing... but were those designs actually "Viking"? Are there extant block printed textiles or garments attributed to the Vikings, Kievan Rus, and/or Varangians? Is there **any** evidence that the Vikings made or encountered printed textiles? This lecture will walk you through extant finds and contemporaneous accounts - including recent unpublished research - to help you conclude whether the Vikings made or had access to printed textiles.

name: Leather Coronets: Light, Bright and Beautiful
description_book: Come learn about an alternative to metal coronets. Discuss ideas on how to make and decorate them.
description_web:
Come learn about an alternative to metal coronets. Discuss ideas on how to make and decorate them.
This often ends up becoming a round-table discussion of ideas, techniques, etc.

name: 100 Years of Planning SCA Feasts: A Roundtable
description_book: An open discussion about planning SCA feasts, led by some who have done it a while, and are still looking for ways to improve.

name: Mythbusting Period Piracy
description_book: The differences between period and non-period piratical portrayals will be outlined.
description_web: The differences between period and non-period piratical portrayals will be outlined. Common myths and mistakes about piracy in the SCA period will be highlighted.

name: Bardic Circles 101
description_book: Entertainment for the people, by the people! Find out what a bardic circle is, the etiquette, where to find material, and how to participate.
description_web: Entertainment for the people, by the people! Find out what a bardic circle is, the etiquette, where to find material, and how to participate. We won't actually be performing, but we will play a game to give you an idea of how to join in a bardic circle. If you'd like to try it for real, there's the Runestone Bardic Circle (Pennsic's Least Intimidating!) at 2 pm Sunday at Runestone Hill, so you can put your new knowledge and skills to use! For masks and distancing, we will be following the Pennsic CovidSafe guidance.

name: *Rostiboli Gioioso*: A Dance that Heats Up
description_book: We'll work on some basic steps, then learn a popular 15th-century Italian dance that keeps getting hotter as it goes on.

name: *Game of the Goose*
description_book: Period game in the style of *Chutes and Ladders*. Suitable for children, but also a popular tavern game for adults.
description_web: Period game in the style of *Chutes and Ladders*. The game is purely deterministic/dice-based so it is suitable for children. It was also known from its tavern version which required gambling and/or drinking. We will review the rules and then play through a game.

name: How to Teach Youth to Throw
description_book: Discussion of legal requirements for youth throwing in the SCA as well as talk about teaching techniques that have been successful with minors.
description_web: Recommended for Marshals in Training. This class will go into more detail than the marshaling class about legal requirements for youth throwing in the SCA, as well as talking about teaching techniques that have been successful with minors.

name: Seven Rhythms of Pennsic Apocalypse
description_book: Beginner rhythms used most often in drum circles and music within the SCA. A 3-part class; different rhythms each day. **Bring your own drum.**
description_web:
This is a beginner drumming class. Learn the basic rhythms used most often in drum circles and music within the SCA. This is a 3-part class that teaches different rhythms each day. **Bring your own drum**.
Day 1- *Saidi, Beladi, Maqsum*
Day 2- *Chiftitelli, Masmoudi*
Day 3- *Ayub, Malfouf*

name: *Commedia* All Stars **Rehearsal**
description_book: Rehearsal for *Commedia* All Stars troupe: Saturday, Aug. 5, through and including Thursday, Aug. 10, daily, from 11:00 am - 1:00 pm.
description_web: Rehearsal for *Commedia* All Stars troupe: Saturday, Aug. 5, through and including Thursday, Aug. 10, daily, from 11:00 am - 1:00 pm.

name: Rotational Symmetry in Islamic Illumination
description_book: Learn to design your own Islamic-inspired patterns in this hands-on workshop. No drawing skill required... seriously!
description_web:
Learn to design your own Islamic-inspired patterns in this hands-on workshop. No drawing skill required... seriously!
While this class will be focused on designs for scribes, this class is for anyone who may be interested in how to make symmetrical designs for any project.
All materials needed will be provided but please feel free to bring your favourite drawing tools, inking pens, paints, etc. Also, there will be a limited number of drafting tools available (compass, protractor, ruler), so bringing your own means you won't have to share. 
Please note: This class is all about hands-on creation of original designs. There will be no lecture or documentation provided.

name: Developing Your *Commedia* Character!
description_book: Whether you are trying to improve a stock *commedia dell'arte* character, or changing to a different character, this class is made to help you!
description_web: Whether you are trying to improve a stock *commedia dell'arte* character, or changing to a different character, this class is made to help you become your character!

name: Known World Baronial Archery Champions' Tourney
description_book: Calling all baronial archery champions to join us for our Eighth Annual Known World Baronial Archery Champions' Shoot-Off.
description_web: Calling all baronial archery champions to join us for our Eighth Annual Known World Baronial Archery Champions' Shoot-Off. This is a friendly competition among all current baronial archery champions (youth and adult) as well as for Shire, Canton, Riding, and Marche champions. Barons/Baronesses (or group Seneschal if not a barony) are requested to come join, as well. No pre-registration is required.

name: So You Want to Be a Scythian
description_book: First hour: basics of clothing, weapons, armor, and society. Second hour: making an iconic Scythian hat. **Age 18+.**
fee_itemization:
5$- talk notes packet
15$- hat-making materials (wool fabric)

name: Introduction to Cloisonné Enameling
description_book: Participants will be able to design and fabricate a cloisonné enameled pendant to take home.
description_web: Cloisonné enameling is the art of creating designs using a ribbon of wire and then fusing powdered glass to a background to create a finished piece of jewelry. In this class, you will learn the process of creating a cloisonné pendant from design considerations, wire manipulation and fusing and finishing. We will be using a MAPP torch to fire the pieces, and participants are encouraged to wear natural fiber clothing without hanging sleeves. No previous experience is needed.
fee_itemization: $5 materials fee, no charge for handouts

name: German Renaissance Smocked Apron
description_book: German Ren smocked apron make-and-take class. Mark, pleat, and smock an apron to go with your German 16th-C clothing. Materials are not provided.
description_web:
Learn how to make the quintessential German Renaissance accessory, the smocked apron. You will learn how to mark, pleat, and honeycomb smock the top of an apron. We will also look at some of the decorative stitch options for the hem. 
You will need basic sewing supplies: white thread for basting, and color of your choice for smocking stitches, scissors, needle, beeswax, some sort of marking tool (washable is best, but a sharp pencil can work as well) and ½ yard of 57-60” wide linen.

name: A Receipt from Paré: A Period Plaster
description_book: Learn about the instructor's experiment in creating a wound plaster (adhesive) as written in Ambroise Paré's *Works*.

name: Putting a Leash on Performance Anxiety
description_book: Stage fright plagues many performers. How does it work? How do you deal with it? Learn some simple strategies to help you overcome your fears.
description_web: Stage fright plagues many performers. How does it work? How do you deal with it? Learn some simple strategies to help you overcome your fears and give you the freedom to enjoy what you already love to do!

name: Adult Doll Meet
description_book: Geared towards adults who collect or want to collect dolls and stuffed animals. Please bring your favorite doll or animal. **Adults 18+ only.**
description_web: This class is geared towards adults who collect or want to collect dolls and stuffed animals. Please bring your favorite doll or animal, as we will be making something special for them. **Adults 18+ only**, because these hobbies can be expensive.

name: Options for Governing the SCA: Roundtable
description_book: Practical alternatives for non-profits and the effects for diversity, equality, inclusion, recruitment, and retention.

name: Viking Wools for Fiber Artists
description_book: Students will put together a roving sampler pack of North European short-tailed breeds to create a reference for their future Viking Age projects.
description_web: Come explore the many options for plausibly Viking Age wools. Students will put together a roving sampler pack of North European short-tailed breeds to create a reference for their future projects. Breeds will include those from England, Scotland, the Faroe Islands, Finland, Norway, Sweden and Iceland. Materials available for 20 participants, but others are welcome to take notes and feel the fiber samples.
fee_itemization: Wool roving samples from 20 breeds of sheep

name: Medieval Sigillography: Wax Seals
description_book: We delve into the nuances of how and why wax seals were used (and misused) in legal documents during the Middle Ages.
description_web: Who were the bastards of Armagnac? Why did St. Peter send missionaries to Europe in 47 AD? And how did the monks of Montier-en-Der protect themselves? This class delves into the nuances of how wax seals were used (and misused) in legal documents during the Middle Ages. Class will be a lecture format and include topics of methods for doing wax sealing with modern and period materials. Handouts provided. Includes demonstration of making and using sealing wax.

name: Making Better T-Tunics
description_book: Now that you have made your first t-tunic, learn some pointers for making the next one better.
description_web: Now that you have made your first t-tunic, learn some pointers for making the next one better.

name: Siege Weapons for Noobs
description_book: Tactics and uses of SCA siege weapons and how a new fighter can get involved.

location: Atlantian Royal Encampment (Block N40, front edge of the Atlantian Royal Encampment, in the Artisans Easement)
name: Ancient to Early Medieval Decorative Stitching
description_book: Ancient to early medieval basic decorative stitches and how they can be used on clothing: an overview of global decorative stitch techniques.
description_web: An overview of global decorative stitch techniques from the 6th century BCE through the 12th century CE. The class covers historical examples available, materials used, stitch techniques, and design elements. Hands-on practice will be available for those unfamiliar with basic embroidery stitches. PDF of handout can be sent to attendees as needed.
fee_itemization: Full color Handout

name: Intro to 1604 Welsh *Robert ap Huw* Harp MSS
description_book: Learn a tune from the tablature of the 1604 *Robert ap Huw* MSS. **Intermediate+ players!** You must bring your own harp.
description_web: Introduction to the Welsh 1604 *Robert ap Huw* manuscript, the oldest known manuscript of music specifically for the harp and the unique tablature used in that manuscript. You will learn *Caniad San Silin* from the manuscript tablature. The tablature expects a nail-struck technique, but the concepts works well for bray, wire, or gut/nylon harps. **You must bring your own harp. This is an intermediate level harp class+!** Students should be comfortable with placing, striking, and damping with moving hand positions.

name: Italian *Balletti*
