description_book: *Balletti*: Slow dances from 16th-century Italy. Dances include *Dolce Amoroso Foco* and *Bassa Pompilia*. Everyone welcome, steps will be taught.

name: DADGAD  Guitar in Period Music
description_book: Intro to DADGAD guitar tuning & its application to period music. Bring basic skills & a 6- or 12-string guitar. Capo recommended. Tablature provided.
description_web: An introduction to the versatile DADGAD guitar tuning, useful in several forms of period music. Students should possess basic guitar skills and bring their own 6- or 12-string guitar; a capo is strongly recommended, electronic tuners helpful. Basic DADGAD tuning and chord forms to be reviewed. Students will be familiarized with a medieval tune (a *cantiga*), a Renaissance tune, and a Middle Eastern tune. Time permitting, an Irish tune and song accompaniment will be explored. Handouts in tablature provided.

instructor: Aule og Amon Amarth The Wizard
name: Viking Age Weapons and Armor
description_book: Covers the combat use of the weapons and armor found in Scandinavia from the 7th-10th century. **18+**
description_web: Covers the combat use of the weapons and armor found in Scandinavia from the 7th-10th century. Proper technique for fighting with a overview of the creation and progression of the weaponry. About the instructor: The Wizard has been a living Viking Age historian for the past 10 years. He is a professional bladesmith and jeweler, teaching Viking Age combat as well as making the swords. He has spoken at several museums around the world, including Moesgaard Museum, Solothern Armory, Centrum Slowian i Wikingow, Franklin Institute, and the Metropolitan. **Age 18+.**

name: Making a Braided Sling
description_book: Come see how to create your own sling, using just twine or other natural material. There will be some "starter kits" available. Others can observe.
description_web: Come see how to create your own sling, using just twine or other natural material. There will be some "starter kits" available. Others can still observe and learn.

name: Sprucing Up Your Calligraphy
description_book: Scribes, is your calligraphy not what you want it to be? We'll cover tools and techniques to make your calligraphy look like real period hands.
description_web: Scribes, is your calligraphy not quite what you want it to be? This class is for you! We'll cover tools and techniques to make your calligraphy look like the real period hands seen in manuscripts. You'll learn how to use a square nib dip pen to make thick and thin strokes, how to control your ink flow, how to properly space the letters based on the style and time period of the hand, and how to create the best layout. Bring your scribal box and let's practice! Supplies will be available for loan during the class or for purchase.
fee_itemization:
Attendees who want to take supplies home will receive:
- Pen Handle
- Nib
- Ink
- Pergamenata
- Typewriter eraser

name: Decorated Veils: Part 2, Knot Just Beads
description_book: Learn about decorated veils and choose a method to learn from simple beading to *Oya* (Turkish knot work).
description_web: Learn about decorated veils and choose a method to learn from simple beading to *Oya* (Turkish knot work).
fee_itemization: $10 gets you beads, thread, se wing and beading needles, and a crochet hook.

name: Historic Costume for Stage and Masque
description_book: A look at costuming for stage and masques in period.
description_web: As theatre and performance arts became more popular during the Renaissance, costume design and techniques began to evolve and become more formalized. This class will look at that evolution in style, design and functionality with an emphasis on 16th-century designs for theatre and masques.

name: The Astrolabe in Theory and Practice
description_book: We'll discuss the history, theory and function of the astrolabe and provide extensive hands-on practical experience using one.
description_web: We will be discussing the history and theory of the astrolabe and provide extensive hands-on practical experience. Details at http://astrolabeproject.com.

instructor: Master Dani of the Seven Wells
name: Money
description_book: Money in premodern Europe. Gold, silver, letters of credit...What could possibly go wrong?
description_web: Money in premodern Europe. Gold, silver, letters of credit...What could possibly go wrong?

name: Text to Telling
description_book: How do you go from source text to a powerful presentation with six months to prepare? What if you have only three days?
description_web:
I discuss a simple (if time-intensive) process for taking source material and turning it into a powerful performance, using as case studies two of my pieces.  
One, "Gawain and the Green Knight" (which I have performed - in full kit - for the Brit Lit classes at the college where I work), was worked up over a period of six months. It's a 30-minute prose rendition of the famous tale of knightly virtues, attempted seduction, and sorcery. Here's the first part: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7mG4MnMZwtM.
The second, "The Death of The Cid," was cooked up *literally overnight*, but resulted in me being named as Queen's Champion the next weekend. I performed it at Pennsic, where a Crown Prince sought me out afterward to thank me.

name: Viking Wire Weaving
description_book: Learn how to wire weave. For beginners.
fee_itemization: Wire, drawplate, dowel

name: Introduction to Combat Archery
description_book: Covers the basics of combat archery: what equipment you need, the rules, and basic tactics.
description_web: Have you ever wanted to be a part of the action on the battlefield, but didn't want to swing a sword? Have you ever wanted to shoot back at that pesky archer who keeps killing you? Give combat archery a try. The class will cover the basics of combat archery: what equipment you need, the rules, and basic tactics.

name: Peafowl and Pheasants During Medieval Times
description_book: A roundtable discussion of what types of pheasants were commonly seen in medieval Europe and their uses.
description_web: A roundtable discussion of what types of pheasants were commonly seen in medieval Europe. From food to heraldry, how these gorgeous birds were utilized in period.

name: Beaded Flowers 2: Daisy
description_book: Make a daisy in the style of beaded flowers of 16th-century Venice. If you have needle-nosed pliers/wire cutters, please bring them to class.
description_web: Make a daisy in the style of beaded flowers of 16th-century Venice. If you have needle-nosed pliers/wire cutters, please bring them to class. Not recommended for youth. Take the Rose class first; this is a more advanced technique.
fee_itemization: beads, wire, yarn

name: Newcomers' Social
description_book: Newcomers are encouraged to come and meet other Newcomers & Chatelains from around the Knowne World, ask questions, & learn about the SCA and Pennsic.
description_web: For the eighth year, Chatelains from around the Knowne World will be hosting the Newcomers’ Social from 1:00 pm – 2:00 pm on Sunday, August 6th, in the Newcomers’ Tent (A&S 20). Newcomers are encouraged to come and meet other Newcomers and Chatelains, ask questions, and learn about the SCA and Pennsic.

location: Atlantian Royal Encampment (Block N40, front edge of the Atlantian Royal Encampment, in the Artisans Easement)
name: Applied Decorative Stitching: Needlebook
description_book: Applying the skills of ancient to early medieval embroidery to create a needlebook.
description_web: Applying the skills of ancient to early medieval embroidery to create a needlebook. Materials provided will be wool or wool-blend felt and cotton embroidery thread.
fee_itemization: Wool or wool-blend felt pieces, wool felt, cotton DMC thread, embroidery needle

name: Pick-up Recorder Consort
description_book: Bring recorders and music; we'll jam. Moderate skill presumed.

location: Courtesan College (Strawberry Fields B06 (off eLeri Lane between Ankara and Visby Vale))
name: 16th-Century Western Erotica - CCt
description_book: An exploration of the *I Modi* and other erotic works of the 16th century. **Age 18+**
description_web: *I Modi* (*The Ways*), also known as *The Sixteen Pleasures*, is a famous erotic book of the Italian Renaissance in which a series of sexual positions were explicitly depicted in engravings. We will examine images from this work and others that explore sexual art for its own sake. There are handouts available. Because of the nature of the class, **age 18+ only.**

name: 16th-Century Dances from Caroso
description_book: 16th-century Italians are fun once you get to know them! Let me introduce you to *Bella Gioiosa, Candida Luna*, and *Fedelta*.
description_web: Everyone can learn 16th-century Italian dances, and they're worth the effort! We'll review a few of my favorites. *Fedelta* and *Candida Luna* are short and sweet, and *Bella Gioiosa* has lots of delightful figures. We'll review the Italian steps -- both the fancy way and the easy way to do them.

name: East Kingdom Afternoon
description_book: Join us for a afternoon of activities sponsored by the East Kingdom! Specific Activities will be announced in advance.

name: Introduction to *Shogi* (Japanese Chess)
description_book: We'll teach the rules of *Shogi* or "Japanese Chess", describe a few historic variants, and have a chance to play a game.
description_web: We'll teach the rules of *Shogi* or "Japanese Chess", describe a few historic variants, and have a chance to play a game. Teaching pieces will be available for use.

name: Pennsic 50 Known World Arts & Sciences Display
description_book: Pennsic 50 Known World Arts & Sciences Display will be held on Sunday, August 6, in the Great Hall across from the European Dance Tent.
description_web:
The Arts & Sciences Display will be held on Sunday, August 6, in the Great Hall across from the European Dance Tent. 
11:30 am: Artisans may set up their entries. 1 pm – 5 pm: the Display is open to the public; 5 – 5:30 pm: break down displays. 
• All objects / displays need to be removed by 5:30.  
• Please assist with the take-down of tables to return the Great Hall to its empty state. 
• Any display items left behind will be taken to Lost & Found.

name: Early Medieval Glassblowing Demo (Furnace Glass)
description_book: A fully narrated, live, 2000-degree glassblowing demonstration! Learn about the materials, the techniques, and how glass usage changed over time!
description_web: Come and watch a fully narrated, live, 2000-degree glassblowing demonstration! See how we can take this fascinating material and turn it into a never-ending variety of items! Learn about the materials we use, and how glass making techniques, its uses, and value varied throughout time and culture! For this demo, see items from the 5th -11th centuries from Europe and the Middle East! Family-friendly, all ages welcome, open Q&A to follow.

name: How to Sing, Plus How to Sing This New Piece
description_book: Join Lord Geoffrey of Exeter, former Queen's Bardic Champion of the East, for two classes in one! Singing technique, then learn a new piece.
description_web: Join Lord Geoffrey of Exeter, former Queen's Bardic Champion of the Kingdom of the East, for two classes in one! First, we will learn some pointers about good group singing technique, focused on vocal projection, tuning, blend, breathing and dynamics. Second, we will learn a piece written by Lord Geoffrey for multiple vocal parts, written with SCA use in mind and using a period text. To get a sense of previous works by Lord Geoffrey (mka David Yardley) in advance of the class, you can find samples of his professionally-recorded albums of compositions online, "New Carols and Songs for Chaucer's Pilgrims" and "The Lost Codex of Avalon".
fee_itemization: N/A

name: *i Sebastiani* Closed Rehearsal
description_book: Closed rehearsal for the *i Sebastiani* performance on Sunday night.

name: Peg Loom Basics
description_book: The tabletop peg loom is a step up from stick weaving.
description_web: The tabletop peg loom, also known as a rake loom, is a step up from stick weaving. The base allows you to do a wider piece. Class limited to 10 looms.
fee_itemization: loom, yarn & instructions

name: Care and Feeding of Thrown Weapons
description_book: Discussion of weapon selection and maintenance. Recommended for MITs and new throwers.
description_web: Discussion of weapon selection and maintenance. Recommended for MITs and new throwers.

name: Post-Apocalypse: The Walking *Dum*
description_book: Begintermediate and pre-advanced rhythms to get beyond the basic rhythms. Different rhythms each day. **Bring your own drum.**
description_web: This is a begintermediate/pre-advanced  drumming class. Rhythm exercises to strengthen both right and left hands with different accents. Learn different rhythms and patterns beyond the basic 2, 4, and 8 counts. **Bring your own drum**.

name: Children's Choir
description_book: For children 13 and younger. Sing music in a period style. Meets daily. Performance on Thursday of War Week!
description_web: For children 13 and younger. Sing music in a period style. Meets daily. Performance on Thursday of War Week! Responsible adult needs to be within reach for the younger ones. Bring a folder to hold music. We will teach rounds, songs and melodies from the medieval to Renaissance. Session will be 45 minutes. Dress rehearsal in PA tent on Thursday with a performance at 6 pm.

name: Gothic Hybrid Drolleries and Grotesques
description_book: Where do the ideas for the fantastic creatures in the margins of illuminations came from and why they are there? Short drawing exercise at end.
description_web: Have you ever wondered where the ideas for the fantastic creatures often found hiding in the margins of illuminations came from? Do they serve a purpose other than making people giggle? Find out the answers to these questions and more. And, if you'd like, participate in a fun little drawing exercise.
fee_itemization: 5 page (double sided) handout and a hand bound flip book for creating unique original grotesques. No fee for materials (per instructor).

name: Open Scribal Time
description_book: Take advantage of our clean, well-lit space to work on existing projects or to try your hand at calligraphy and/or illumination.

name: Stage Combat for Theater (Slaps, Punches, & Falls)
description_book: A class for those in theater and *commedia* to learn how to safely use slaps, punches, and falls on the stage and make them look real. **Age 16+.**
description_web: A class for those in theater and *commedia* to learn how to safely use slaps, punches, and falls on the stage and make them look real to the audience. It is suggested that you wear clothing that it is ok to get dirty in. We would prefer that attendees be **16 or older**, or be accompanied by an adult.

name: Archery Practice
description_book: Warm up, practice shoot, and have fun on the Archery Range.
description_web: Warm up, practice shoot, and have fun on the Archery Range.

name: Scythian Meet-up
description_book: Calling all Iron Age nomads for a Scythian and Saka-focused meet-up!
description_web: For those who have an established persona or are simply curious about this fascinating culture, we are gathering to share information, ask questions, and socialize. Wearing of Scythian garb is highly encouraged, as well as the sharing of literature and/or personal research. And of course, flash your Scythian tattoos!

name: Make Your Own Roman-Style Brooch (*Fibula*)
description_book: Make your own Roman-style brooch/*fibula* from wire and a package of glass/metal beads. Tools available. Bring yours, if possible. **Age 12+.**
description_web: You will enjoy learning how to make your own Roman-style brooch or *fibula* from wire and a package of glass/metal beads. Jewelry-making tools will be available, but if you have your own, **please** bring them along. **Age 12+.**
fee_itemization: includes wire, beads and use of tools.  If you have your own jewellery tools, please bring them along.

name: The Irish Brehon Laws
description_book: The ancient Irish developed a complex, logical system of law based on compensation and honor that lasted centuries.
description_web: The ancient Irish developed a complex, logical system of law based on compensation and honor that lasted centuries. The class focuses on the different levels of qualifications to become a Brehon or Bard, as well as the methods of adjudication and application.
fee_itemization: Copy costs

name: Will the Real *Stickelchen* Please Stand Up
description_book: The dismissal of Anna of Cleves by historians has unfortunately lead to a misunderstanding of her headgear.
description_web:
The term *Stickelchen* has been widely shared in recent years as the term for Anna's headdress. How it came to be used so frequently is as interesting a story as learning what the term means.
I have spent more than a decade searching virtually through records shared by archive holders and historians to better understand both.

name: Cannabis in the SCA Period
description_book: A survey of cannabis as a drug from ancient times to 1600. **Age 18+**
description_web: A survey of cannabis from ancient times to 1600, with emphasis on its use as a drug. We'll explore what it was like, how it was consumed, and its status in SCA-period societies and the modern SCA. Recipes for several period cannabis edibles will be included. **Age 18+**

name: Elizabethan Embroidered Tokens
description_book: A discussion of emblems and *impresas* during the 16th century by reviewing the embroideries of Mary, Queen of Scots and Bess of Hardwick.
description_web: A discussion of emblems and *impresas* during the 16th century by reviewing the embroideries of Mary, Queen of Scots and Bess of Hardwick, Countess of Shrewsbury. We will review many of the emblem books printed during that time period.

name: Tartans in the Tarim: Mummies of Xinjiang
description_book: The Tarim mummies, immaculately preserved, bearing "European features," clad in twill and plaid, are a mystery. Who were they? What can we learn?
description_web: In the parched desert of the Tarim basin in western China, dozens of immaculately preserved mummies have been found dating back to 2100 BC. Bearing "European" features and red hair and clad in twill and plaid, they present a mystery to this day. Who were the Tarim people? What can their mummies tell us? And what can we learn from them?

name: African Games
description_book: Games played in Africa, from pharaonic times to the end of SCA period. History of board games, how they are played, and a chance to try them.
description_web:
A discussion of games played in Africa, from pharaonic times through the SCA period. Covers the history of various games, and what we know or have guessed about their rules. If time is available afterwards, there will be several games available to try.

Most of the class will focus on board games, but will touch on what's known about others.

name: Medieval Food Myths
description_book: Ever get sick of the old myth about people using spices because they were serving rotting meat? Then this is the class for you.
description_web:
Ever get sick of the old myth about people using spices because they were serving rotting meat? Then this is the class for you.`
We will discuss common medieval food myths as well as ask the class for a few of theirs and where to find the real information for your needs.

name: Newcomers 101
description_book: Titles and customs across the Known World. Camping and what to bring with you to events. How to get along in the SCA.
description_web: Handouts showing the common titles and responsibilities. Discussion about all things SCA. Camping, names, bylaws about bullying. Anything they want to know that I can answer or direct them to another person or class.

name: Runestone Bardic Circle Alternate Site
description_book: Alternative site for the Runestone Bardic Circle in case of inclement weather. See class for details
description_web:
Alternative Site for Pennsic's Least Intimidating Bardic Circle.  

If the weather is foul at Runestone, we'll be at this alternative location/time. See the main class for more information.

name: *Chorulus Pennsicus* Auditions for Pennsic 51
description_book: Open auditions for the select choir, *Chorulus Pennsicus* at Pennsic 51 (2024). Prepare a short piece to sing; you will also sight read.
description_web: Open auditions for anyone interested in auditioning for the select choir, *Chorulus Pennsicus* at Pennsic 51 (2024), directed by THL Cynthia Anne of Silver Lakes. Previous choral singing experience is expected. Those who audition will need to sing a short piece that demonstrates their vocal abilities, and perform a short sight-reading exercise.

name: *PA Afternoon Series*: Shakespeare Open Mic
description_book: Come and share your favorite piece from Shakespeare in this open mic experience.
description_web: If you have ever wanted to do just a short piece (up to 10 minutes) of your favorite Shakespeare dialoge or sonnet, this is the time and place to do it. Come and join others who have a love of the Bard of Avon's works in our Performing Arts Afternoon Series.

name: Toddler Playgroup
description_book: Let our toddlers tire each other out! Let the parents and guardians make friends! Meets at Toddler Lounge Shade by playground

name: Æthelmearc Tip Cut Tourney
description_book: Love Tip Cuts but your kingdom doesn't take them? Come fight in this special tourney, where the only valid strike is a Tip Cut!

name: Rapier Bear Pit Tourney
description_book: A no-frills classic bear pit. Three passes, winner stays, three fights maximum. Everyone welcome. Fight until you drop. Lots of prizes!
description_web: Nothing fancy here: a classic bear pit tourney. Three passes, winner stays, three fights maximum. Every skill level welcome. Bring your best, and fight until you can't fight any more. Prize for 1st, 2nd, and 3rd place. If you've ever felt like you didn't get enough fencing in at Pennsic, here's your answer.

name: Runestone Bardic Circle
description_book: Bardic Safe Zone! For first-timers, rusty returners, nervous performers, and all seeking to enjoy a low-key bardic circle as performer or audience.
description_web: Pennsic's Least Intimidating Bardic Circle. Welcome, first-timers, rusty returners, nervous performers, skittish teens, and all seeking to enjoy a un-intimidating, low-key bardic circle as performer or audience! All are welcome to explore the bardic arts: singers, songwriters, poets, storytellers of all levels as well as anyone who may want to simply come listen and enjoy. There are no judging rubrics or documentation police, (though a few Peers have been known to sneak in, in disguise). Our only request is to keep material PG. Our host reserves the right to "gong" and stop a performance if it gets beyond PG material. Hosted by Signore Tommaso Franceschi, at Runestone Park.

name: Beginner Thrown Weapons
description_book: Learn axe throwing, basic care of your weapons, and basic rules. A hands-on session is included. Limit of 25 participants; no experience necessary.
description_web: Learn axe throwing, basic care of your weapons, and basic rules. A hands-on session is included. Limit of 25 participants; no experience necessary.

instructor: Thl Cynthia Anne of Silver Lakes
name: Pennsic Youth Choir
description_book: The Youth Choir is open to all youth ages 12 to 19 who enjoy singing. No audition is required to participate.
description_web: We will participate in a Dress Rehearsal/Recording Session on Thursday, Aug. 10 at noon, and perform that evening at 6:30 pm, as part of the Pennsic Choirs Concert. Your director will provide you with a media release to sign.

name: Medieval Fan Fiction
description_book: A discussion of how "fan fiction" was produced and used in the Middle Ages; how we can produce it and use it in our Society.
description_web: A discussion of how "fan fiction" was produced and used in the Middle Ages; how we can produce it and use it in our Society. Topics will include the definition of fan fiction, its modern and pre-modern history, plus its techniques and authors. Time permitting, we will attempt our own fan fiction.

name: Beginning *Gresley Manuscript*
description_book: Learn some of the more basic *Gresley Manuscript* dances from 16th-century England. No experience or partner necessary. Handouts provided.
description_web: Come and learn some of the dances from one of the most influential manuscripts in England! The *Gresley Manuscript* (also known as *John Banys' Dance Book*) changed the way we view dancing and is the earliest evidence we have for recorded dance in England. Dated between 1480 and 1520, these dances highlight unique dances in the English Court and are fantastic for both small and large groups of dancers. Each of these dances only require 2-3 people, which helps encourage dance for even the smallest shires. Come learn 5 of the easier dances in this collection. Learn about the unique qualities of these dances and be inspired to take these back to your home group! No experience necessary. If you can walk, you can dance!

name: Heckler's Tourney
description_book: Can you throw while being distracted by the tournament spectators? Come throw in this tournament to heckle and be heckled.
description_web: Can you throw while being distracted by the tournament spectators? Come throw in this tournament to heckle and be heckled.

name: Beginner Scribal Track: *Book of Durrow*
description_book: Intensive 4-day workshop focusing on the *Book of Durrow*: history, decoration, and calligraphy. Fee covers all supplies, handouts, and starter kit.
description_web: Intensive workshop, focusing on the 7th-century Irish manuscript, the *Book of Durrow*. Topics to be covered include history, interlace decoration, and calligraphy. Plan to attend all 4 days. Materials will be available for 10 students. $15 fee covers supplies for the 4 days, handouts, and take-home starter kit to keep you working after War! To learn more, visit https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1yNJr8gppgqDx1CCQSlmVqrbP9HXC5jEI?usp=sharing
fee_itemization: $15 fee covers supplies for the 4 days (nibs and holders, ink, etc.), handouts, and take-home starter kit to keep you working after War!

name: Russian Calligraphy
description_book: Medieval Russian calligraphy. Learn the basics of writing the Old Church Slavonic alphabet. Appropriate for all calligraphy skill levels.
description_web: Medieval Russian calligraphy. Learn the basics of writing the Old Church Slavonic alphabet. There will also be a handout for Russian-style English alphabet. The hands-on portion of the class is limited to 15 people. Please bring your calligraphy supplies if you have them. I will have a limited number of loaner nibs and/or markers and paper.

name: Archery Populace Point Shoot
description_book: Shoot the Castle Window, Soldier Shoot, and Clout for Points.
description_web:
Format: The Pennsic Populace Archery War Point consists of three separate shoots; each shoot is worth 1 War Point for a total of 3 War Points. The winner of each shoot is determined by total number of points tallied by archers over the course of the War. Scores will be tallied each day and posted in the Marshals' Tent. Any member of the populace may participate.
Multiple individuals may share a bow; however, it must be inspected with each user to ensure safety.

name: Planispheric Astrolabe Discussion Group
description_book: Bring your astrolabe or use a paper handout to learn about the multiple uses of the planispheric astrolabe, the personal computer of the Middle Ages.
description_web: Bring your astrolabe or use a paper handout to learn about the multiple uses of the planispheric astrolabe, the personal computer of the Middle Ages.

name: Make Your Own Medallion Cord
description_book: Why wear a plain white string? Learn *Slung*, cord-making described as juggling with strings! Children welcome with adult. OK to be late.
description_web: Why wear a plain white string? Learn *Slung*, a method for cord-making that can best be described as juggling with strings! Children welcome with adult. *Slung* is also known as Viking whip-cording. It is not only useful but a lot of fun for all ages. Can be done as a children's activity or at demos. Bring a friend! People will be taking turns on a limited number of set-ups. Showing up late is perfectly fine.

name: Interkingdom Brewers' Guild Competition
description_book: Brewers and vintners: Have your beverages evaluated by experts from across the Known World. Up to two entries per category. **Over 21 only.**
description_web: An opportunity for brewers and vintners to have their beverages evaluated by experts from across the Known World. Up to two entries per category (wine/mead, beer, cordials/others) per participant. IKBG masters are asked to help judge. Entrants are responsible for the temperature/condition of their beverage(s) as it may be some time before a particular beverage is judged. Documentation is encouraged. **Over 21 only.**

name: Interkingdom Brewers' Guild Roundtable
description_book: This roundtable is designed to serve as both a place to discuss period beverages as well as hang out for the IKBG. **Over 21 only.**
description_web: This roundtable is designed to serve as both a place to discuss period beverages as well as hang out until your beverage is called to be judged with the IKBG. It is being held in conjunction with the IKBG. All entrants are asked to wait in this area. Someone will come call you when your entry is ready to be judged. Please bring something to do/drink/discuss until your entry is called. **Over 21 only.**

name: Timed Team Sewing Competition: Info + Discussion
description_book: Revenge of the Stitch/Atlantia: 24-hr team sewing competition, from judge, competitor, autocrat. Plus roundtable on your experiences/questions /input.
description_web: Revenge of the Stitch/ Atlantia: 24-hr team sewing competition Stitch VIII was this year. Input from judge(s), competitor(s), autocrat. Looking for collaboration or information on other kingdom's competitions and followed by roundtable on your experiences/ questions /input.

name: How to Run "It Takes My Child to Raze a Village"
description_book: The history, whys and hows of the Midrealm event that focuses on people of all ages and abilities participating in the SCA. **18+**
fee_itemization: Color Paper copies of handout are $10 each

name: The History of Clan Blue Feather
description_book: Come learn the 30+ year history of the SCA's LGBT+ research and social group, and find out what we're doing today.
description_web: Clan Blue Feather is the research, social, networking, and support group for the SCA's lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, asexual, non-binary, and related gender and sexual minority communities and their allies. Started in 1988, the Clan has since become a vibrant and important part of the SCA throughout the entire Society, from local groups to Pennsic and more. Come learn about what's been happening over the past 30+ years, what we're doing today, and what the future may hold.

name: Siege Inspection Tent
description_book: I was told this is how I reserve a tent for siege inspections on the battlefield.
description_web: Siege engine and ammo inspection. I also have no problems if any interested in siege wish to stop by see what we do and ask questions.

location: Denys the Decadent's Camo  (EO7 off great Eastern Hiughway, Look for 12 Steppe Sign)
name: 12-Step Meeting
description_book: An open meeting for those in recovery or any 12-step programs.
description_web: A daily 12-step meeting I hold in my Camp E07 off Great Eastern Highway. Look for the sign. Held at 4:00 PM, **OPEN MEETING .** Holding a meeting here since 1997.

name: Domos Draconum (DnD): In Search of the Unknown
description_book: Vintage 1970s Dungeons & Dragons adventure for ages 10+. No experience necessary. Limit: 8

name: Youth Early Scandinavian Braids: Beginners
description_book: Learn to Create two easy braids that can be used to trim garments, both from Skjoldhamn
description_web: Looking for a period craft (or a way to trim your garments) that does not require a lot of upfront costs? Why not try braiding? In this class, we will start with two easy braids that can be used to trim garments. The first is a recreation of the 10th Century 4-strand braid used as the ties on the Skjoldhamn Hood.  The second braid is a 6-strand braid used to trim the neckline and cuffs of the same tunic.

name: Multiplayer Chess
description_book: Chess games for four players. We will review rules and variations, then provide time to play.
description_web: Chess games for four players. We will review rules and variations, then provide time to play.

name: Italian Renaissance Glass Demo (Furnace Glass)
description_book: A fully narrated, live, 2000-degree glassblowing demonstration! Learn about the materials, the techniques, and how glass usage changed over time!
description_web: Come and watch a fully narrated, live, 2000-degree glassblowing demonstration! See how we can take this fascinating material and turn it into a never-ending variety of items! Learn about the materials we use, and how glass making techniques, its uses, and value varied throughout time and culture! For this demo see items from the 14th-16th centuries in the Italian style! Family-friendly, all ages welcome, open Q&A to follow.

name: Fencing with the Japanese Sword
description_book: Learn to use the *katana* successfully in SCA rapier, alone or with a *wakizashi*. Limited loaner equipment will be available.
description_web: The SCA rapier combat rules are, not surprisingly, slanted in favor of rapiers, but that doesn't mean that cutting weapons can't be used successfully. This class will cover the use of *katana* alone or with a *wakizashi* (as dagger or case). We will cover entering into the guard of longer weapons and close-combat techniques to use once there.

name: Youth Combat Marshal Collegia: Marshaling
description_book: How to become a marshal, responsibilities at each level, and how to build and grow your group.
description_web: How to become a marshal, responsibilities at each level, and how to build and grow your group.

name: The *One Act* Experience
description_book: Seeking actors **AND** directors for staging and performing *One Act* scripts in an afternoon! Scripted performance directly follows the class.
description_web: Using scripts written by our friends and peers, we will come together for an hour to stage a scripted read of these selected one acts. Performance directly follows the class.

name: An Enchanted Picnic
description_book: Shed the shackles of modernity and join us for an immersive afternoon of dancing, dining, story telling, singing, conversation --  all in persona!
description_web: Shed the shackles of modernity and join us for an enchanted afternoon of dancing, dining, story telling, singing, conversation --all in persona! This gathering shall be reminiscent of the picnics and noble gatherings described in works such as the *Decameron* and the *Book of the Courtier*. Whether or not you have a fully developed persona, come partake in a magical afternoon. If you like, come prepared with a period-style story to tell, song to sing, dance to do or share. We shall even have the pleasure of soloist musician Meister Albrecht Catsprey to play for us!

name: Morris Games
description_book: Come learn to play a classic! *Nine Man's Morris* and other games of that family (which include the modern tic-tac-toe) will be taught.
description_web: Come learn to play a classic! *Nine Man's Morris* and other games of that family (which include the modern tic-tac-toe) will be taught.

name: Yoga for Anyone and Everyone
description_book: All-level friendly, basic *vinyasa* class, open to complete beginners & seasoned yogis. Bring your own mat, towel & water, prepare to work and relax.

name: Midrealm Unbelted Dinner
description_book: Midrealm Unbelted Dinner.
description_web: Midrealm Unbelted Dinner.

name: Known World Recorder Ensemble
description_book: Recorder players of intermediate and above abilities. We will hold four rehearsals to prepare for a brief concert Thursday of War Week.
description_web: Recorder players of intermediate and above abilities are invited to participate in this ensemble. Join us in having fun and making music together! We will meet for four rehearsals: Sunday - Wednesday in the PARC; Concert, 6 pm, Thursday of War Week in the PA Tent.  Age limit: 12 and up. A limited number of soprano and alto recorders are available for loan. If you play more than one instrument, bring them all. Please bring a music stand if you have one; loaners available. Bring a 1/2 inch black binder. Sheet music (intermediate to advanced) will be provided. $2 for music packet, or free PDFs can be found on the Facebook group: Known World Recorder Ensemble. Email the instructors: THL Jolicia atte Northclyfe (washington.julie@gmail.com), and The Honorable Lady Siri Toivosdotter (JoniSyngs@gmail.com).
fee_itemization: Printed Music

name: Thomas Bordeaux
description_book: Songs I've written, a few I didn't. Come join me for an hour of bardic music.
description_web: Songs I've written, a few I didn't. Come join me for an hour of bardic music.

name: Measures of Success/Redefining Victory Conditions
description_book: Psychology and the Fencing Woman series: Gain a more accurate and sounder way of measuring victory in and out of tournaments.
description_web: Taken from Master Gwynn's *Psychology and the Fencing Woman* manual: In this part of the series, class will demonstrate why "win all the things" is an impractical and self-defeating measure of success. This class uses science(TM) to show internal measures are more accurate, why, and provides alternative modes of victory for more fulfilling tournaments and events.

name: Youth Marshal Meet-and-Greet
description_book: Meet other SCA youth marshals of heavy list and fence; discuss current challenges, while sharing solutions. Also cool down with summer treats! **18+**
description_web: Come meet other SCA youth marshals of heavy list and fence and discuss current challenges, while sharing solutions. Also cool down with summer treats! **18+**

name: Byzantine Iconography: Theology in Line and Color
description_book: In-depth overview of origins, history, symbolism, and technique of the ancient art of Byzantine icons.
description_web: In-depth overview of origins, history, symbolism, and technique of the ancient art of Byzantine icons. Also the introduction to hands-on three-part "Icon Writing" class August 6; 11am Panel Prep; August 7, 11am, Gilding; August 9, 11am, Icon Writing with Egg Tempera.

name: PA Afternoon Series: The One Act Experience
description_book: The product of the prior One Act Experience event, a readers' performance of one act plays written by the populace.
description_web: The product of the prior One Act Experience event, a readers' performance of one act plays written by the populace.

name: Archery Champions' Practice
description_book: Everyone who wishes to try out for the Archery Champions' teams is welcome and encouraged to attend. Yes, **you** are good enough to try out!
description_web: This is an opportunity to learn a bit, and give the team captains a chance to see you. Everyone who wishes to try out for the Archery Champions' teams is welcome and encouraged to attend. Yes, **you** are good enough to try out!

name: Bronze Age Wine in the Mediterranean
description_book: A brief survey of the Late Bronze Age in the Levant, through the recreation of a wine based on chemical analysis of pottery. **Age 21+.**
description_web: A brief survey of the Late Bronze Age in the Levant, through the recreation of a wine based on chemical analysis of pottery. **Age 21+.**

name: The Wild Hunt
description_book: The Wild Hunt is a folk myth with many variations involving interaction between humans and a group of supernatural, other world riders.
description_web: The Wild Hunt is a folk myth with many variations involving interaction between humans and a group of supernatural riders. Sometimes *fae*, sometimes dead, sometimes associated with leaders from Odin to Mother Holle. We'll explore many aspects of this phenomenon.
fee_itemization: optional $5 booklet

name: Songs of War, Struggle, and Wonder
description_book: Lanea will perform her translations, original works, and covers she adores and will likely press other bards into service.  **Adult content.**
description_web: Lanea will perform her translations, original works, and covers she adores and will likely press other bards into service. **Adult content.**

name: Brass Choir Jam Session
description_book: Bring your cornetti, sackbuts, lysarden, and serpents (modern trombones and trumpets are ok). Music provided.
description_web:
Works from renaissance composers played on brass instruments!  
Bring your cornetto, your sackbut, lysarden, serpent or other brass instruments. Modern trombones and trumpets are ok, if that is what you have.  
Bring a chair, a stand (a few loaners may be available), some paper clips, and a pencil!
fee_itemization: Printed Music

name: Historical Brewing Roundtable
description_book: A chance to show off and discuss brewing, vintning, and potables, emphasizing period recipes, techniques, and styles. Learn from others. **Age 21+.**
description_web: This is not a competition but a forum where we can focus on period drinks. Not restricted to alcoholic beverages. Are you just starting out and want honest, gentle feedback? Come join us! Proud to have brewed all-grain for the first time, but want to take it to "the next step" in period-ness? Come and join us! Redacted a period recipe, and want others to see and sample? Come join us! **Age 21 and over.**

name: Hesdin: Funhouse Castle of the Burgundian Dukes
description_book: Let's explore the features of the castle and garden "funhouse" at Hesdin and the available technology from that time that made the pranks possible.
description_web: The Dukes of Burgundy were up to some serious business - except when they weren't. Let's explore the features of the castle and garden "funhouse" at Hesdin and the available technology from that time that made the pranks possible.

name: Combat of the Thirty
description_book: 14th-century, 30-vs-30 deed of arms inspired by the original Combat of the Thirty between French and English forces that occurred in 1351.
description_web:
This is a 14th-century, 30-versus-30 deed of arms inspired by the original Combat of the Thirty between French and English forces that occurred in 1351. Combat standards are a modified counted-blow scenario that employs rules for capturing opponents and ransoming of captured parties. Participants must be acceptable to the captains of the French and English forces. You do not have to be invited to participate but your armor and weapons must meet the requirements of the tournament. Armor must be an reasonable attempt at a complete 14th-century harness. Weapons are restricted to ones that closely resemble their medieval counterparts. Final say on weapons and appropriate harness will be at the sole discretion of the captains. 
Requirements: All participants must wear a 14th-century kit. Greaves are required and all are encouraged to wear chausses and braies. All weapons must closely resemble their medieval counterpart and are restricted to bastard swords, pole-arms of period design (axes, hammers, etc.), spears under 7 feet, daggers and single-handed swords. All participants should be prepared to pay a ransom that they feel is appropriate to their station in the event that they are “captured” during this deed of arms. Rules of combat will be explained to all combatants before the battle begins.

name: Atlantian Fort Night
description_book: This is a request to book the fort for three vigils on the evening of Sunday, August 6th. **21+**
description_web: A vigil for Master Bumi to join the Order of the Chivalry, His Excellency Cataldo to join the order of the Laurel, and a third to be announced. This will be at the fort and ceremonies will begin around 6 pm, Sunday, August 6, and go no later than midnight. **Age 21+.**

name: Period Card Games: *Losing Loadem*
description_book: Do you like to play cards? Come learn to play this late-period card game.
description_web: Looking for something to pass the time at events? Do you like to play cards? Come learn to play this late-period card game based on a reconstruction from Francis Willughby’s *A Volume of Plaies* (~1665).

name: The Irish Frau and Friends
description_book: Aibhilin and friends perform bardic and period music.
description_web: Join Aibhilin inghean Daibhidh, known as the Irish Frau, and her friends as they perform a mix of period and bardic music for instruments and voice. We sing, we laugh, you laugh (hopefully with us) and enjoy war songs, humorous poems, period madrigals, harp, and more!

name: Bedtime Stories for Children
description_book: Nightly telling of stories for children. This year's theme will be The Brothers Grimm!
description_web: Stories and fables for children, 7 pm nightly. This year's theme will be The Brothers Grimm. All are welcome to attend; children must have adult escort.

name: Teen Lounge: LGBTQ+ Teen Night
description_book: Join us for an LGBTQ+ focused night of food and entertainment. **(Ages 13-20, strictly enforced.)**
description_web: Join us for an LGBTQ+ focused night for food and entertainment. This night is lightly supervised by background-checked adult allies. As always, no bullying or harassment will be tolerated. Curfew rules still are in play and teens won't be stopped from leaving. **(Ages 13-20, strictly enforced.)**

name: Surreptitious Whiskey
description_book: Dai, Líadan, Lucia, and Tonis return for another multi-instrumental, multi-vocal, multi-shenanigan extravaganza!
description_web: Dai Gerdwr, Líadan Liathán, Tonis van Driele, and Lucia Elena Braganza make up Surreptitious Whiskey. Join us for songs of drink, laughter, love, adventure, and revenge!

name: Whiskey Bards Concert
description_book: Come have a rollicking good musical time with the Whiskey Bards' harmonies. The SCA's original "Medieval Boy Band!"
description_web: Come have a rollicking good musical time with the Whiskey Bards' harmonies. The SCA's original "Medieval Boy Band!"

name: Midrealm Newcomers' Party
description_book: Invite the Midrealm's newcomers to a party.
description_web: Invite the Midrealm's newcomers to a party.

name: Return of the Flamingo Ball
description_book: Are you ready to Dance with Dignity, Strut your Feathers, and Flock Flock Flock to live music? All levels of dancers are most welcome.
description_web: Welcome back to the Flamingo Ball.  Are you ready to Dance with Dignity, Strut your Feathers, and Flock Flock Flock to live music? All levels of dancers are most welcome. Dances will be taught or reviewed. Refreshments will be available. Flamingos Forever!

name: Thórvé Sings Songs
description_book: Come listen to Thórvé sing her songs, tell her stories, and sing her favorites by other artists.

name: *i Sebastiani!*
description_book: Traditional 16th-century Italian *Commedia* performance.
description_web: *Buon giorno!* O, you lucky people! Truly, you are blessed amongst the living, for you have the opportunity to see *i Sebastiani*, the greatest *Commedia dell'Arte* Troupe in the Entire World, perform a show just for you tonight!

name: Yoga for Fighters,  Dancers and Everybody
description_book: Yoga for all levels! Bring mat or towel for the floor & strap, scarf, or strip of cloth for class if you can; some loaner gear available.
description_web:
Yoga for all levels! Bring mat or towel for the floor & strap, scarf, or strip of cloth for class if you can; some loaner mats and straps will be available. If you have blocks, please bring them if you can! This class is geared for folks who have never done yoga through seasoned practitioners. Amendments for poses will be offered as we go, and each class will build upon the one before, however, anyone can jump in at anytime. 
Class will begin with a few minutes of breath work followed by approximately 45 minutes of yoga.

name: Coffee with Friends of Bill and Dr Bob
description_book: Open agnostic 12-Step meetings.
description_web: Open agnostic 12-Step meetings. From 8:00 am-9:00 am.

name: Known World Players Rehearsal for Romeo & Juliet
description_book: A closed rehearsal for cast and crew for the Pennsic 50 production of Romeo & Juliet by William Shakespeare.
description_web: A closed rehearsal for cast and crew for the Pennsic 50 production of Romeo & Juliet by William Shakespeare.

name: *Études* 2 and 3 for Single Sword (Fencing)
description_book: These drill sequences will focus on form, balance, movement, and coordination. For beginners, intermediates, and teachers alike.
description_web: For beginner and intermediate fencers and those who teach them. These drills will focus on form, balance, movement and coordination. *Étude* 2 is thrust centric. *Étude* 2 adds diversity of cuts. Emphasis will be on learning the *études* for home drill, as well as taking elements out of the drill for more focused work in groups.

name: Youth Heavy List Skills, Games, and Drills
description_book: Daily morning regular practices to be run from 8:30 till 11 am on the Pennsic Battlefield Youth List. Youth aged 6-17. Loaner gear will be available.
description_web: Daily morning regular practices to be run from 8:30 till 11 am on the Pennsic Battlefield Youth List. Youth aged 6-17, all levels of experience on three different list fields. Loaner gear will be available.

name: Zoomorphic Creations: Mixing Medieval and Modern
description_book: Creating unique zoomorphic figures by blending medieval and modern elements.
description_web: Using the examples found in the *Book of Kells*, we will create zoomorphic figures that blend medieval themes and modern elements. There will be some scratch paper, but students should try to bring pencils. There will be a handout with examples from the *Book of Kells* (and other zoomorphic examples) for students to look through, but if there are modern (or other medieval) visual examples that you would like to try to blend into zoomorphic creations that would look at home in our modern medieval scrollwork, please bring them to the class.
fee_itemization: $2 for handout

name: Make Beautiful Scrolls Using Micography
description_book: Learn about micography and how it was used in manuscripts. We'll work on plotting out designs and practice what we have learned.
description_web:
First we will learn about micography and how it was used in manuscripts. Then we will work on plotting out designs and practice what we have learned to create some art. Will not have handouts available past 10 gentles, but the handout is also online. 
If you have lightboards, pencils, and dip pens with a crow nib (or C-6), bringing them would be appreciated, but not necessary. Instructor will have some, but may not be able to cover all participants.
fee_itemization: $1 - for handout.

name: Pennsic Youth *Commedia dell'Arte*
description_book: Hands-on class giving the description and history of *commedia* before having the youth create and eventually perform their own skit. Ages 13-17.
description_web: Young adults will learn the art of *commedia dell'arte* while practicing and creating skits that will be performed at the end of the week. Ages 13-17.

name: Archery Practice
description_book: Warm up, practice shoot, and have fun on the Archery Range.
description_web: Warm up, practice shoot, and have fun on the Archery Range.

name: A Short Cut to Mushrooms
description_book:
Choose your best footgear—we’re going for a walk! **Age 18+.**

We will be seeking wild mushrooms in their natural habitats.
description_web:
Expect to walk up and down many hills. There is a lot of walking. We are seeking to find Wild Mushrooms in their natural habitat. We have no permission to pick. Oh, did I mention that there will be a lot of walking?
This class is meant to supplement the beginning foraging mushroom class. Many dried samples will be in the latter. 
Class will go for three hours, give or take. Feel free to leave at any time. **Age 18+.**

name: Through the Looking Glass: North America in Period
description_book: Curious what was happening in North America in period? This 90-minute class will provide information on the complex cultures of North America.
description_web: North America in period was way more than you were taught in history class. Did you know that the largest city in the 12th century existed in North America? Trade items traveled over 2,000 miles, although, there is evidence that people were also traveling that far to obtain certain items. Cultures that extended over thousands of miles.  The largest man-made earthwork in the world exists a little over two hundred miles from the grounds of Pennsic. This 90-minute class is a high level survey of cultures that flourished in the eastern half of North American continent prior to European contact.

name: From Period Recipe to Modern: A Map
description_book: Experiment with an approach to redacting period recipes using recipes from the *Curye on Inglysch*.

instructor: Baroness Aranwen verch Rhys ap Gwalter
name: Lampwork Glass Bead-Making: Safety and Basic Bead
description_book: Intro to lampwork bead-making. Instruction given regarding setting up a work area and making basic shapes. **18+; age 14 up with parent.**
description_web: An introduction to lampwork bead-making. Instruction will be given regarding setting up a work area and making basic shapes. If time allows, demonstration will be given on beads the students are interested in creating. The class handout  will include what will be discussed and give historical background. **18+; age 14 up with parent, due to live fire.**
fee_itemization: 5 for MAPP gas, 5 for cost of glass, 0 for tool usage

name: Persona Development: Down the Rabbit Hole.
description_book: Persona development ideas to sharpen, round, and strengthen your persona.
description_web: Persona development ideas to sharpen, round, and strengthen your persona. Looking for, investigating, and finding sources for developing your personal story.
fee_itemization: handout

name: Planning Your Pennsic Sewing
description_book: Strategies for ending up with wearable garb for Pennsic; what to make, why, and how to organize your projects.
description_web: Have you ever found yourself a few days before a major event (such as Pennsic) with an unknown number of projects-in-progress, but hardly anything finished and wearable? This class is for you! We will be discussing progress tracking, task chunking, and prioritization for large-volume garb-sewing. The first part of this class will discuss what types of items to make/bring to a long camping event and why; the second part will focus on task chunking, tracking, and prioritization. Please bring a small notebook and something to write with. This class is in-person only and will not be recorded.

name: Painting a Floorcloth
description_book: Learn how to use stencils to paint a ground cloth that can be used inside your tent or outside.
description_web: Learn how to use stencils to paint a ground cloth that can be used inside your tent or outside. Ground cloths can help you make your tent, encampment, or your indoor presence look awesome!
fee_itemization: The kit will include an approx 2’x3’ piece of canvas, as well as two stencils and a stenciling brush. All of these items you will take with you. Paint will be provided in class, along with other supplies that the students will share.

name: Viking Wire Weave Basics
description_book: Viking wire weave is a period-correct art form that is fun, easy and inexpensive. I will show you how to get started.
description_web: Viking wire weave is a period-correct art form that is fun, easy and inexpensive. Also known as *trichinopoly* or Viking Knitting, there is archaeological evidence for wire chains constructed using “circular plaiting” in Viking burials and treasure hoards dating as early as the 8th century to as late as the 12th century. Come learn with the Mistress of Wire herself! You will learn how to make a *sextapus* to hold your chain in place, a basic 6-loop pattern, draw plate techniques, and how to finish the ends to add a clasp.
fee_itemization: Copper "sextapus" $.50, wooden dowel $.50, draw plate $1, craft wire $2, end cones $2.50, clasp $1.50

name: Getting and Using Feedback for A&S
description_book: How to ask for and use feedback on your Arts & Sciences work. We will cover consent, communication, and best practices.
description_web: Getting useful feedback can be challenging and sometimes nerve wracking. Learn best practices for consent and communication as well as strategies for how to use the advice you're given. This class will focus on feedback for Arts and Sciences work, but will easily be applicable to other situations.
fee_itemization: A $1 fee will cover a handout with outline.

name: Modern Gaming: War Week
description_book: A place, with power, to play modern games from 9 am to 10:30 pm every day.

name: Pole Lathe Turning for Beginners
description_book: Introduction to spindle turning on a pole lathe. Hands-on class covering tools, techniques, and lathe construction.
description_web: Introduction to spindle turning on a pole lathe. We will cover the basics of lathe construction and proceed to some hands-on work to familiarize you with the tools and techniques for spindle turning. This class involves moving parts, so long hair and loose clothing must be avoided. There are also **sharp tools** involved; **minimum age is 12**. Materials are limited to 8 participants; no fee.

instructor: Mistress Beatriz Aluares de la Oya
name: Introduction to Hispano-Flemish Men's Clothing
description_book: A skin-out examination of Spanish men's clothing 1480-1530.

name: Trans 101 for the SCA
description_book: Information about and historical mentions of transgender individuals.
description_web: As modern society becomes more open and accepting, transgender individuals are becoming more visible in their representation both in and out of the SCA. Please join us for a discussion about interacting with these members of the populace. Topics will include history, etiquette, basic definitions for the community, and an open forum for attendee questions.

name: Slaves and Freedpersons in Ancient Rome
description_book: Enslavement was a fact of life in ancient Rome, so what might a Roman persona be expected to know about it?
description_web: Enslavement was a fact of life in ancient Rome, so what might a Roman persona be expected to know about it? Join us as we dispel the myths, face the facts and gain an understanding of how Roman people interacted with this challenging tradition. Q&A will be during the last half hour.

name: Introduction to Coupled Hands for Harpers
description_book: An introduction to the historically-informed "Coupled Hands" technique for playing the harp. For all harps, but especially wire-strung with nails.
description_web: An introduction to the historically-informed "Coupled Hands" technique for playing the harp. Suitable for all types of harps, but especially useful for wire-strung harps and bray harps played with the fingernails. Students are expected to bring a harp. Students need basic knowledge of playing the harp (at least the ability to hold the harp and play notes with a fixed hand position).
fee_itemization: None

name: Introduction to Central Asian Archery/Thumb Ring
description_book: Learn how to shoot like a Mongol, Turk, etc. Requires a horse bow and arrows at least 4" longer than your finger draw. **Age limit 18+.**
description_web: Learn to shoot the way Mongols and other steppes and horse archers did. Naran Numuchi, Noyon of Ponte Alto, Order of the Laurel for Mongol and Turkish Archery, OP, Companion of the Order of the Yew Bow (Atlantia), has been shooting thumb ring since 1998 and, since then, has focused on the use and history of static-eared recurve bows. Naran Noyon will have some thumb rings to try, but you must bring your own bows and arrows, preferably with no shelf or pistol grip, and arrows should be sufficiently long to accommodate the 2-4" extra of thumb draw. **Age limit 18+.**

name: Beginner Dance for Families
description_book: Some simple steps and dances will be taught to introduce children of all ages and their families to period European dancing. No experience needed.

name: Is Chocolate Period?
description_book: A lecture on chocolate in period with a handout of period and period-ish recipes. Bring a cup and we will approximate the period chocolate.
description_web:
A lecture on chocolate in period with a handout of period and period-ish recipes. Bring a cup/mug/horn and we will approximate the period chocolate.
Handout: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1CXO_HcetT8D4KHf91x6OiV0qFewh3ZTO4N0ynfdjPDY/edit?usp=sharing
fee_itemization: $2 for handout, donation for taste.

name: Æthelmearc Morning
description_book: Join the Kingdom of Æthelmearc for a morning of activities. Specific activities and times will be announced.

name: Pennsic War 50 Year History Display
description_book: 50 years of Pennsic history. Photos, stories, displays. Add your special events to a physical timeline, celebrate with thousands from around the world
description_web: Explore 50 years of Pennsic history in one place! Share your part of the living history of Pennsic, and add yourself and your special Pennsic moments to a physical timeline. Experience the evolution of Pennsic through photos and stories, as well as a variety of displays. What began as a small field event in 1972 has reached its 50th year, and now brings together thousands of people from around the world! Join your fellow Pennsic goers to celebrate this milestone!

name: Pennsic Instrumental Youth Consort
description_book: The Youth Instrumental Consort is open to all youth who play an instrument. No audition is required to participate.
description_web: Rehearsals will be from 9:00 am - 9:45 am daily from Saturday, August 5, 2023, until Wednesday, August 9, at the Performing Arts Rehearsal Classroom (PARC) located by the Amphitheatre. We will participate in a Dress Rehearsal/Recording Session on Thursday, Aug. 10, at noon, and perform on Thursday, August 10 at 6:30 pm, as part of the Pennsic Choirs Concert. Your director will provide you with a media release to sign.

name: Sprang Basics
description_book: Using the twisted warp-based weaving of sprang, create a useful pouch.
description_web: Using the twisted warp-based weaving of sprang, create a useful pouch.
fee_itemization: loom, accessories, string, & instructions

name: Youth Rapier Activities
description_book: There will be a variety of youth rapier activities each day including drills, games and one-on-one instruction. Some loaner gear will be available.
description_web: There will be a variety of youth rapier activities each day including drills, games and one-on-one instruction. Some days may include special additional activities. Some loaner gear will be available. Participants do not have to be authorized. Children age 6 and up may participate. Please bring your parent/guardian the first day you attend to learn more about the youth rapier program.

name: Thrown Weapons MIT: Part 2
description_book: Learn the SCA rules and guidelines to be a Thrown Weapons Marshal. Parts 1 & 2 required with on-the-range training and written test on Friday.
description_web: Learn the SCA rules and guidelines to be a Thrown Weapons Marshal. Parts 1 & 2 required with on-the-range training and written test on Friday.

name: Egg Tempera Panel Painting: Part 2, Painting
description_book: Paint with egg yolk and pigments. Hands-on exploration: period medium of egg tempera panel painting, Egyptian to medieval, in-depth, prep to finish.
description_web: Egg tempera is an ancient medium dating to the Egyptians and used throughout history. Virtually all panel paintings executed before mid-1400s used solely the yolk of the egg and mineral pigments as the basis. This workshop will cover making paint from mineral pigments and all techniques for a medieval-painting method. Hands-on. Materials included, beginner to advanced.
fee_itemization: fee is for all materials: traditional gessoed panel, pigments, brushes, tools.

name: Parchment Workshop
description_book: Come see how animal hides are transformed into parchment and vellum. Be as hands-on as you like. Feel free to drop in and out; no need to stay all day
description_web: Come see how animal hides are transformed into parchment and vellum. Be as hands-on as you like. Feel free to drop in and out; no need to stay all day. Please wear garb and shoes that can get wet, and possibly a little smelly. Dead animal parts are involved in this class.

name: Pennsic Youth Theatre
description_book: Kids ages 5-17, join us in creating & performing, from story book to stage, your very own play! Creative minds + theatrical tools = a fun-filled time!
description_web: For kids ages 5-17 interested in exploring their creative and theatrical sides through storytelling, acting, and producing their very own play! Come join us as we build a theatre show from the ground up, giving younger kids a creative outlet for all that pent-up camping energy! Children 12 and under must have a parent or guardian present.

name: How to Maintain an Outdoor Cooking Fire
description_book: Learn how to lay up and maintain a fire for cooking. A cooking fire is very different than a fire you are just going to sit around.
description_web: Learn how to lay up and maintain a fire for cooking. A cooking fire is very different than a fire you are just going to sit around. The kind of fire you will need depends on what you are going to cook. We will discuss/show the different types.

name: Ingredient Substitution in Cooking
description_book: The logic and method of replacing ingredients in period recipes for availability, allergies and GF.
description_web: Lecture class on logical substitutions in period recipes for various reasons, such as availability and allergies, including gluten free. After lecture, will open the floor to questions and problems encountered.

name: Cryptography in the Middle Ages
description_book: An overview of period cryptography. Handouts are limited but digital copies are available.
description_web: This course is a survey of cryptography up to around 1650. We will review the history and evolution of cryptography in general and look at several cryptographic systems in-depth to provide a working understanding of how these ciphers are employed. Handouts are limited but digital copies are available.

name: The *Tain Bo Cuailnge*: The Irish Epic Cycle
description_book: The stories both about the *Tain* and in it. It will be presented from the perspective of the teacher's persona and that of Fergus Mac Roy.
description_web: The stories both about the *Tain* and in it. It will be presented from the perspective of the teacher's persona and that of Fergus Mac Roy, one of central figures in the epic. In order to find out what really happened, the bards of Ireland had to talk Fergus while he was raised from the dead.

name: Henna for Skin Mixology and Application
description_book: Learn how to find, mix, and apply henna for skin from a professional henna artist.
description_web: Learn how to find good henna and get a proven and flexible recipe you can tailor to suit your needs. Then we'll practice applying it, with tips and guidance from a veteran artist. We will mix some henna in class, which for me was the hardest part to learn. Everyone gets a cone of paste to use and take with them.
fee_itemization: One cone of fresh henna paste. You may also take the class without this, or bring your own henna. The handout is my current mixing instructions and recipe.

instructor: Mistress Beatriz Aluares de la Oya
name: Introduction to Hispano-Flemish Women's Clothing
description_book: A skin-out examination of Spanish women's clothing 1480-1530.

location: Atlantian Royal (Fiber Arts Pavilion) (N40, front edge of the Atlantian Royal Encampment, in the Artisans Easement)
name: Retting Flax at Pennsic
description_book: We will be putting a bundle of flax to rett in the creek near the Fiber Arts Pavilion.
description_web: Flax is one of the oldest fibers used by man to create thread for weaving, but how do they get the fibers *out* of the flax plants? Retting is the term used for the process of "rotting" the plant fiber enough to release the bast fibers within the plants so they can be separated from the other plant material and used for spinning and weaving. We will be putting a bundle of flax to rett in the creek near the Fiber Arts Pavilion.

name: Wire Strung Harp for Absolute Beginners II
description_book: Continues from Wire Strung Harp for Absolute Beginners I. Learn to move your hands and damping, learn second tune. You must bring your own harp.
description_web:
A continuation of the "Wire Strung Harp for Absolute Beginners I" class. A very basic introduction to the fundamentals of the Gaelic wire-strung harp. Topics include these points:
* Exercises that involve moving the hands while playing.
* Adding damping techniques that simplify dampening.
* Learning a second tune on the Gaelic Wire String Harp.
You must bring your own harp, and a chair if you need one. 
Handouts include a brief history and the beginning exercises and first and second tunes.
Ability to either read music or memorize a definite plus, but anyone's welcome to show up, and I'll teach you what I can. All ages emphatically welcomed. This is the second in a sequence of two classes. This class is aimed at wire-strung harps. Gut/nylon-strung are welcome but I can't teach that style (which is different), though I will try to point you at people who can.

name: Paper Making
description_book: Students will make paper using traditional techniques and materials.
description_web: We will discuss the history of paper making from its start in China to its spread into Europe, as well as become familiar with processing raw materials. Students will make sheets of hand-made paper in class using a European-style mould and deckle.
fee_itemization:
Handout is a printed pamphlet.
Materials include paper, pulp, sizing, and pigments.

name: *Kumihimo* Braiding on the *Marudai* Round Stand
description_book: Learn the basics of *kumihimo* braiding on the *marudai* in a workshop setting.
description_web: *Kumihimo* braiding on the round braiding stand is faster and more traditional than braiding on a disc or plate. Join us for this workshop and learn this craft from the novice level, advance your skill by learning a new braid, or share your expert knowledge. Handouts for multiple braids will be available, and I will have a stack of books for reference. If you are really just getting started, please attend the setup class on Peace Thursday or Sunday to save time in this workshop. Please bring your own equipment and materials if you have it, otherwise some equipment and materials can be provided.

name: Ornaments in Arbeau's Dance Manual
description_book: Arbeau's 1589 dance manual contains a lot of information about step ornaments. We'll talk about them, and how they relate to other sources.
description_web: Arbeau's dance manual *Orchésographie*, published in 1589, contains a lot more than just dances and steps: it has tons of ornaments, too! We'll look at what he says about them, and how they relate to other sources from other countries.

name: Storytelling Academy
description_book: Explore genres, tools, styles, and uses of storytelling. Cultural and medieval approaches, applications, performance coaching. New topics each day.
description_web: During this academy, students will gain knowledge about the history and techniques for storytelling both in the SCA and the modern world. Students may attend individual sessions or all of the academy. There may be guest teachers and will be time for students to practice and receive feedback. The academy may culminate in a student performance. No classes are repeated. The focus is on developing comfort, nurturing, and honing skills within the students’ capabilities. All levels are welcome. Students may view a class outline at the academy space, Minerva’s Spindle 158, where classes will also be listed on the message board. Seating is limited; feel free to bring your own chair. Student Performance, date, time, and location will be announced.

name: Known World Choir Rehearsals
description_book: Join the oldest Pennsic Choir as we rehearse in preparation for a concert on Thursday of War Week. Previous KWC Directors have been invited.
description_web: The Known World Choir, along with the Children's and Youth Choirs, and *Chorulus Pennsicus* will present a concert of medieval and Renaissance choral literature. Previous Directors of the KWC have been invited to conduct a selection. Bring a 1/2 inch black binder or plan to purchase one for use during the concert for $5. **Over age 18.** (There is a Youth Choir for those 12-18.)
fee_itemization: Copies of KWC Literature. $5 more if you wish to keep the 1/2 Inch Black Binder

name: Blacksmithing Mortise and Tenon Basics
description_book: A demonstration of a simple set of mortise and tenon tooling and discussion of the variations in geometry and construction.

name: Atlantian Five Person Rapier Tournament
description_book: The pinnacle of small group rapier fighting and strategy. Atlantian mêlée rules. Maximum of two Masters of Defense per team.
description_web: Join the rapier community for our annual Five Person Rapier Tournament, the pinnacle of small group rapier fighting and strategy. The event will be conducted under Atlantian mêlée rules (to be explained at the event). Maximum of two Masters of Defense allowed per team.

name: By-the-Book Historical Fencing Tournament
description_book: Historical fencing tourney. Memorize Marozzo, review Ridolfo, study Saviolo, for the Ninth Annual Tournament where book worms can be winners!
description_web: A historical fencing tourney: Memorize your Marozzo, review your Ridolfo and study your Saviolo, for the Third Annual Tournament where book worms can be winners! Period fencing forms and period dress as seen in the manuals will bring you success. As always, lavish prizes will be bestowed upon the competitor with the most wins, the best dressed, and the one who best adheres to the style of a given master.

name: Elizabethan Pronunciation
description_book: Early Modern English pronunciation reveals “new” rhymes and puns in literature and songs of the period. Come and hear for yourself!
description_web: In this overview of Early Modern English pronunciation trends, we will hear how rhymes and puns emerge from period literature when spoken as originally pronounced. Come and hear how “raising” rhymes with “reason!”

name: Weed Walk
description_book: Wild plant identification. Wear walking shoes and hat; leave from Univ. Point. Different teachers on different days; walk with us more than once!
description_web: Cooper's Lake abounds with medicinal and food plants that were used by various primitive and medieval cultures. Learn to identify them during a walk around the campsite. The walk will take place rain or shine. Please wear sturdy shoes and a hat. Meet at University Point for the start of the class. We have multiple teachers, so if you attend more than one walk, you will likely learn different things!

name: Known World Adventurers Guild: **Social Day**
description_book: Informal meetup for teen explorers (and youth 10+). Social Days alternate with Walk Days (see separate class info) - KWAGuild.com
description_web: All teens (and youth 10+) are welcome at these informal meetups for the Known World Adventurers Guild. Our Social Days alternate with KWAG Walk Days. See separate class info.

name: Cloudwork: Lacquer Deco. of the W. Han Dynasty
description_book: A Han-ds on exploration of Han Dynasty decorative motifs and their practical application to SCA scrolls.

name: Typography for Scribes
description_book: Scribes will learn to calculate the number of words that will fit within a given space and calculate the amount of space needed for a number of words.
description_web: The class will show how to use modern typographic methods to assist making your words fit your scroll better. You will learn about kerning, leading, line spacing, word spacing, and script/nib size. I've adapted the newspaper's technique (the column-inch) to make it easier to calculate how many words you will need for a given space. This is not a calligraphy class. Having a calculator will help.
fee_itemization: 5 for handout

name: Archery Populace Point Shoot
description_book: Shoot the Castle Window, Soldier Shoot, and Clout for Points.
description_web:
Format: The Pennsic Populace Archery War Point consists of three separate shoots; each shoot is worth 1 War Point for a total of 3 War Points. The winner of each shoot is determined by total number of points tallied by archers over the course of the War. Scores will be tallied each day and posted in the Marshals' Tent. Any member of the populace may participate.
Multiple individuals may share a bow; however, it must be inspected with each user to ensure safety.

Description: There are 3 parts to the populace shoot.
Castle Clout Shoot (1 War Point): The target is a simulated castle turret. Archers will be shooting at about 100 yards into a square of approximately 27 feet by 27 feet giving an approximate area of 729 square feet. There will be a moat monster protecting the castle in front at about 50 yards. This is an untimed shoot; archers are allowed 6 arrows or bolts. Scoring for this shoot is as follows:
1 point for inside the moat.
2 points for hitting the moat monster.
3 points for inside the castle.
4 points for hitting objects inside the castle.

Soldier Shoot (1 War Point): The archers will shoot 6 arrows or bolts, untimed, at the soldiers that are invading. These targets will be set at approximately 15 yards, 35 yards, 45 yards, and 55 yards. Any arrow or bolt hitting the painted portion of the target scores as follows:
1 point for the 15-yard target.
2 points for the 35-yard target.
3 points for the 45-yard target.
4 points for the 55-yard target.

Castle Window Shoot (1 War Point): Archers will shoot 6 arrows or bolts, untimed, at a castle window located between 25 and 35 yards. The castle window will be at least 8 inches wide and 36 inches tall. There will be an object inside the castle window. Scoring will be as follows: 1 point for each arrow or bolt inside the castle window, 2 points for each arrow or bolt inside the object in the castle window.

name: Not Baked: Early Foods from Grain
description_book: Ancient grains: Threshing, grinding and cooking of whole and crushed grain foods.
description_web: What were the first foods made from grain and how were they prepared? We’ll be looking at the early history of grain processing and milling, what it took to prepare the oldest kinds of grain for milling, how grain was ground, and the porridges and other crushed grain dishes that were common before bread.
fee_itemization: Cost of grain samples.

name: Accessibility in the SCA
description_book: Learn how to make your event more accessible.
description_web: Learn how to make your event more accessible.

name: Riding Before the Prince
