description_book: How did 16th-C riders show off their own riding skills and their mount's best abilities to royalty?
description_web:
During the 16th century, riding evolved from its martial origins into an art form practiced by noblemen and kings. The riding masters of the mid-16th century had definite ideas of what was proper for both horse and rider. During this class we will review different documentations about how riders showed off their own riding skills and their mount's best abilities to the royalty. 
We will cover how to create your own ride using workable transitions between patterns. The second half of this class will cover how to score the rides, based on horsemanship and use of historical references.

name: Recreating Thread, Yarn and Textiles
description_book: In which my process of recreating a 15th-century linen thread is broadened to show how **you** can recreate an extant thread - or even fabric!

name: Are All Acting Processes the Same?
description_book: *Commedia* vs skit vs long-form improv vs scripted vs method. Different paths? Or different stops on the same spiral?

name: Divination: Palmistry
description_book: History, theory, and practice of one of the most ancient of divinatory arts: palm reading. Hands-on class. Learn to read each others' palms in class.
description_web: History, theory, and practice of one of the most ancient of divinatory arts: palm reading. Learn to read the secrets of a soul, writ upon the hand for only the wise to see. This is a hands-on class where you will actually read each others' palms.

name: Researching Without a Traditional Library
description_book: We'll focus on how to identify and access online resources in your research.
description_web: This class will focus on how to identify and access online resources in your research. The class will demonstrate how to use a variety of specialized online search mechanisms. It will also explore ways to access academic materials via online resources.

name: Pennsic A&S War Point Judges' Training
description_book: This session is required for A&S War Point Judges who have not yet taken the Pennsic 50 A&S Judges' Training.
description_web:
For those who have been assigned to serve as a Judge for the Pennsic 50 A&S War Point, attending one of the Judges' Training sessions is required. This training will be offered twice virtually **before** Pennsic (links to come soon) and will also be offered once in-person at Pennsic. Those who do not watch or attend one of the training sessions will not be permitted to judge.
The A&S War Point event will be hosted on Thursday, August 10, in the Great Hall, where some of the finest artistic talent from around the Knowne World come to display their prowess and knowledge in an effort to earn War Points for the Kingdoms from whom they hail or are allied with.  Judging will take place between 10:00 am and 3:00 pm, with announcement of the results tentatively scheduled for 4:00 pm.

name: Intro to Chinese Garb
description_book: Covers the history and cultural context basics plus how to look for and narrow in. For more detailed garb questions, come and chat!

name: Sijilmassa: Gateway to the Sahara Desert
description_book: Through archeological evidence, maps, and 1st person accounts, we will explore medieval Sijilmassa; its history, culture, and defining industries.
description_web: At the northern edge of the Sahara desert, the medieval oasis of Sijilmassa developed into a major center of trade between Africa, Europe, and Asia. This class will cover the history of the city, highlighting cultures and industries that defined the region; focusing on (but not limited to) influence by the Amazigh/Berber, Tuareg, and Jewish populations.
fee_itemization: N/A

name: Naval Warfare in the SCA Period: An Overview
description_book: A discussion of naval warfare as conducted in the SCA period. Includes the changes made by technical revolutions in armament, etc.
description_web: A discussion of naval warfare as conducted in the SCA period. Basic concepts, economic and strategic influences, supply and design constraints, and the changes wrought by technical revolutions in construction and armament.

name: Pimp Your Drinking Horn with *Pressblech* Plates
description_book: Making bronze fittings for an Anglo Saxon/Norse-style drinking horn: We will cover making the rim (forging, etc.) and *pressblech* decorative plaques.

name: Welcome! What Brings You Here?
description_book: A roundtable for newcomers. Why did you want to join the SCA? Martial Arts? Arts & Sciences? Time Travel? Getting the most out of participation.

location: Atlantian Royal Encampment (Block N40, Fibre Arts Pavilion)
name: Weavers' Meet-and-Greet
description_book: Social get together and inspiration session for weavers of historical fabric.
description_web: A social get-together for weavers of historical fabrics. Do you use a floor loom, jack, counterbalance, countermarch or rigid heddle loom to create historical, or inspired fabric? Bring your samples and a beverage and we'll do a show-and -tell, share tips and tricks and get inspired together to see what sort of cloth we can create at home. Trade hints and get your questions answered by others who have gone through many of the same problems!

name: Forging Clay
description_book: An introduction to blacksmithing techniques in a more forgiving material.
fee_itemization: Instructor is donating materials.

name: *Contentezza D'Amore*
description_book: Come learn *Contentezza D'Amore*, a beautiful 16th-century *ballo* from *Nobiltà*! Dancers of all ages welcome. This is an advanced class.
description_web: Come learn *Contentezza D'Amore*, one of the most beautiful of the 16th-century *balli*! I will be teaching the version from *Nobiltà di Dame*, Signor Caroso's second book, wherein he corrects all the errors of his first; if you think you already know it, be warned! Dancers of all ages welcome. This is an advanced class.

name: *Alquerques*
description_book: A checkers-style period game from the Middle East. We will review the rules and then play through some games to learn the basic strategies.
description_web: A checkers-style period game from the Middle East. We will review the rules and then play through some games to learn the basic strategies.

name: Egg Tempera Panel Painting: Part 1, Gesso and Prep
description_book: Period egg tempera panel painting, using egg yolk and mineral pigments! Hands-on and in-depth. Discover the paint used by Duccio, Cimabue and Giotto!
description_web: Egg tempera is an ancient medium dating from the Egyptians through today. Tempera reached its height in medieval and Renaissance Europe. Virtually all panel paintings executed before the mid-1400s used solely the yolk of the egg as the binder. Class is in-depth, hands-on. Part I covers panel and object prep, handmade gesso, and all info needed to authentically prep surfaces for polychrome and painting. Materials included; beginner to advanced. Visit Guild Mirandola for full list of classes.
fee_itemization: Fee is for all materials: gesso panel, pigments, eggs, brushes, tools.

name: Estrogen and Axes Tournament
description_book: Open to all women regardless of throwing experience.
description_web: Open to all women regardless of throwing experience.

name: Thrown Weapon Accessibility Discussion/Instruction
description_book: Discussion and instruction covering throwing techniques and accommodations for those with physical challenges.
description_web: Instruction covering throwing techniques and accommodations for those with physical challenges and a roundtable discussion for any marshals, marshals in training, future marshals, and throwers who have thought about making Thrown Weapons accessible to all, regardless of physical limitations, neurodiversity, and other conditions that need to be accounted for. Topics likely to be discussed include common accommodations, advocacy, and competition considerations.

name: Seven Rhythms of Pennsic Apocalypse
description_book: Beginner rhythms used most often in drum circles and music within the SCA. A 3-part class; different rhythms each day. **Bring your own drum.**
description_web:
This is a beginner drumming class. Learn the basic rhythms used most often in drum circles and music within the SCA. This is a 3-part class that teaches different rhythms each day. **Bring your own drum**.
Day 1- *Saidi, Beladi, Maqsum*
Day 2- *Chiftitelli, Masmoudi*
Day 3- *Ayub, Malfouf*

name: *Commedia* All Stars **Rehearsal**
description_book: Rehearsal for *Commedia* All Stars troupe: Saturday, Aug. 5, through and including Thursday, Aug. 10, daily, from 11:00 am - 1:00 pm.
description_web: Rehearsal for *Commedia* All Stars troupe: Saturday, Aug. 5, through and including Thursday, Aug. 10, daily, from 11:00 am - 1:00 pm.

name: Smoke and Slither
description_book: Explore *taqsim*-style movements for improvisation that create muscular snake-like shapes and stylizations. We will cover drills and body awareness.
description_web: Explore *taqsim*-style movements for improvisation that create muscular snake-like shapes and stylizations. We will cover drills and body awareness.

name: *i Sebastiani's* Closed Rehearsal
description_book: Closed rehearsal for *i Sebastiani's* Tuesday evening show.

name: A&S Performance/Research Rubric Training - EKMoAS
description_book: This class sponsored by the East Kingdom Minister of Arts & Sciences provides a deeper understanding of the EK A&S performance and research rubrics.
description_web: This class sponsored by the EKMoAS provides a deeper understanding of the EK A&S general rubric used to judge Crown's A&S Championships in the East. It is designed both for judges to promote consistent calibration and for entrants to allow them to better understand what their judges will be looking for. People from all Kingdoms and all levels of experience welcome.
fee_itemization: $1 for handout or QR code for digital handout

name: Silk Painting Basics
description_book: Learn the supplies needed and create a basic silk painting project. **18+** (Separate Teen class at Family Point.)
description_web: Learn the supplies needed and create a basic silk painting project. **18+** (Separate teen class at Family Point.)
fee_itemization: Silk-stretched hoops, dyes, distilled bottled water

name: Intro to Golden Age Sephardic Sacred Verse
description_book: A brief case study using three major poets and their works to examine theme, style, and context of Sephardic sacred verse from the 10th to 12th C.

name: Silk Roads & Spice Routes
description_book: Trans-Asian trade routes existed even before 138 BC, exchanging silk and spices, as well as religions, philosophies, technologies, and diseases.
description_web: It is often stated that the Silk Road was founded in 138 BCE by the Han Chinese and ended when the Ottomans conquered Constantinople. But trans-Asian trade routes go back much farther into the past and continue on, even to the present. The complex network crossed Asia not only east-west, but also north-south, and not only over land, but by the seas. In addition, far more than silk and spices was exchanged, as religions, philosophies, technologies, and diseases traveled with merchants, pilgrims, and adventurers. We will explore the Silk Roads and Spice Routes to get an indication of their significance.

name: Telling Stories as Your Persona
description_book: How to tell stories in a way that creates the illusion of a period story being told to a period audience, along with a discussion of sources.
description_web: How to tell stories in a way that creates the illusion of a period story being told to a period audience, along with a discussion of sources.

name: Blockprinting on Fabric and Paper For Beginners
description_book: European-style blockprinting on fabric and paper. This hands-on class will include period and modern methods for block printing.
description_web: European-style blockprinting on fabric and paper using blocks of various materials. Printed fabric was used for clothing, wall hangings, tablecloths, etc. This hands-on class will start with a discussion of historical techniques and printing with both period and modern materials. The main focus of the class will be on printing with provided blocks.
fee_itemization: ink, disposable brayers and palette paper, paper and fabric

name: The Stigma of LARP
description_book: Come debunk myths and rumors about LARP (Live Action Role Play)! Increase your factual knowledge and learn to safeguard against negativity.
description_web: Stereotypes are bad, and the attitude toward the term LARPing amongst SCAdians needs some improvement. As more of our members come to us from other games, or long-time SCAdians begin to cross game, we need to separate fact from rumor. Come learn how LARP is one of our great assets! Please bring writing implements and materials for note-taking.

name: *Kolrosing* Basics
description_book: *Kolrosing*: Ancient Viking artform used to decorate wood/bone by incising a pattern onto a substrate and highlighting the incisions with a pigment.
description_web: *Kolrosing* is the ancient artform of inscribing a pattern onto wood or bone and highlighting it with a pigment. It is still practiced by the Sami people today. This is a hands-on class where students will make and inscribe their own designs onto a wood base that they can take home with them for further refinement or use.

name: Roman Africa
description_book: An introductory look at the role that the people, landscape and provinces of Africa played in the history of Rome.

name: Goldwork Embroidery with Bullion
description_book: Learn multiple techniques in working with gold bullion. No prior knowledge of embroidery required.
description_web: This class focuses on techniques in working with gold bullion available in period. We'll go over a few techniques on how to create eye-catching designs in simple steps with smooth purl, rough purl, spangles, pearls, and beads. No prior knowledge of embroidery is required. If you have them, bring manicure scissors and tweezers (some will be available to borrow). The rest of the materials (a variety of gold bullion, needles, thread, wax, fabrics, etc.) come with the kit. Don't forget your glasses, but we will work with larger gauge for ease. Students will create a sampler and take home some extra real gilt bullion to complete the project and practice more.
fee_itemization: Gilt bullion: smooth bore purl, crimp bore purl, spangles, and real and imitation gold thread. Imitation pearls and beads. Fabrics, embroidery hoop, thread, needles, pins, wax, felt.

name: Hitchhiker's Guide to the SCA: Don’t Panic
description_book: New to the SCA and events? Learn tips and tricks, ask questions free of judgment!
description_web: Beginner's guide to the SCA, Pennsic and other activities. Get your SCA questions answered in a judgment-free zone. Taught by someone who grew up in the SCA, and is a current officer of Dragonship Haven, East Kingdom. Includes a young adult perspective.
fee_itemization: N/A

name: The History of the Harp
description_book: We'll cover the history of the harp from the most ancient times to the late medieval times. Roundtable discussion. No harp required.
description_web: This class will cover the history of the harp from the most ancient times to the late medieval times. Theory on the divergence of the lyre versus the triangular harp will be discussed, and how the triangular harp came to Europe and Britain. Roundtable discussion is encouraged; no harp is required for this class.
fee_itemization: Handouts are 4 pages. I am charging $2.00 per handout to cover costs.

name: Amber: Northern Gold
description_book: Make-and-take class. Learn how to take a piece of raw amber and begin to shape and polish it while we have casual discussion on historical relevance.
description_web: Amber has played an important part in history. It was sought after not only for decoration, but also used as a talisman or amulet, used medicinally to treat a variety of ailments, and used as currency for trade. Participants will be taught how to take a piece of raw amber and begin to shape and polish it to bring out the natural unique qualities of each piece of history. While you are busy shaping away, there will be a casual discussion on historical and mythical relevance.
fee_itemization:
raw amber
polishing materials

name: Choral Ball Rehearsal
description_book: Singers and instrumentalists rehearse for the Choral Ball to be held Monday of War Week.
description_web: Singers and instrumentalists, come rehearse for the Choral Ball which will be held Monday evening of War Week. If possible, procure music and practice tracks in advance on the Facebook Group SCA Choral Ensemble. Walk-ins are welcome; some music will be provided. This rehearsal is not required to participate in the Ball, but it will be very helpful. Singers are encouraged to take a look and listen to the music ahead of time.
fee_itemization: Photocopied Music for Choral Ball

name: My Guitar's Persona Is a Lute
description_book: Learn how to tune and play your guitar as if it were a lute, how to find and read lute tablature. Guitar not required; all experience levels.
description_web: How do you play authentic lute music if your instrument is a modern guitar? The good news is the instruments are very closely related. Learn how to tune and play your guitar as if it were a lute, how to interpret lute tablature, how to find authentic period composers, songs, and arrangements. The skills are highly transferable, and, while lute music has a different feel and sound, the rewards for your investment of time and effort are great. This is a one-hour lecture class. You are welcome to bring your guitar to experiment on, but because this is not a music lesson, it is not required. Suitable for all experience levels.

name: Creating a Safe Martial Training Environment
description_book: Psychology and the Fencing Woman series: learn how to create safe practices that encourage non-male fighters to thrive and keep coming back.
description_web: Taken from Master Gwynn's *Psychology and the Fencing Woman* manual: In this part of the series, learn how to create safe training environments for non-male combatants so your fighters not only keep coming back but excel.

name: AEthelmearc Scribal Tea
description_book: Join us for light refreshments and a chance to socialize with other scribes from across the Kingdom.

name: Introduction to Research
description_book: Introduction to research skills, focusing on finding and evaluating sources as well as application to A&S entries.

name: Make Your Own Roman-Style Brooch (*Fibula*)
description_book: Make your own Roman-style brooch/*fibula* from wire and a package of glass/metal beads. Tools available. Bring yours, if possible. **Age 12+.**
description_web: You will enjoy learning how to make your own Roman-style brooch or *fibula* from wire and a package of glass/metal beads. Jewelry-making tools will be available, but if you have your own, **please** bring them along. **Age 12+.**
fee_itemization: includes wire, beads and use of tools.  If you have your own jewellery tools, please bring them along.

name: Forging Clay
description_book: [TeenU] Students will learn hands-on basic blacksmithing techniques with a safer and more portable material. **Recommended for age 10 and up.**
fee_itemization: Instructor is donating materials.

name: Real Men Do Write Verse: The Iberian Warrior Poets
description_book: Moorish and Christian kings, a Jewish general, a knight, and a soldier, all were poets. Hear about them and their poems. Some **adult** poems.
description_web: A Moorish king and a Christian one, a Jewish general in Granada's army, a bodyguard to HRE Carlos V, and a Portuguese soldier all had one thing in common: they could wield the pen as well as the sword. This class will take a brief look at the lives of these men and read a sample of their verse. There may be **some adult content**, but nothing explicit or graphic.
fee_itemization: This is a 20 page handout fee to cover paper and ink costs. $2.00 or what you deem fair.

name: Expecting the Unexpected as a Performer
description_book: Or, "How to Fail Gracefully". Tips, tricks, and anecdotes on what to do when a performance doesn't go as planned.
description_web: Or, "How to Fail Gracefully". Tips, tricks, and anecdotes on what to do when a performance doesn't go as planned. How do you recover from forgotten lyrics or skipped verses? Costume malfunctions and instrument mishaps can happen to anyone. From years of experience on stage and in bardic circles, Silence shares what works (and what doesn't) to keep a performance going and leave your audience remembering your strengths, not your hiccups.

name: The **Perfect Hat Stretcher** Made Easy.
description_book: Learn how to make a hat stretcher at home in an hour or so that exactly replicates the shape of your head for **under five dollars**!
description_web: Hat stretchers not only can stretch a small hat to fit your head, they will also keep a hat from shrinking. A stretcher is great for all hats and a must for felt hats. The problem with commercial hat stretchers is that they are expensive and rarely fit the shape of an individual's head. Learn how to make a hat stretcher at home in an hour or two that will exactly duplicate the shape of your head! This will make and keep your hat shaped perfectly, so you can wear it comfortably all day long without getting hot spots and it will be unlikely to blow off in the wind. And best of all, it will cost you around $5 or less to make. The stretcher is so easy and inexpensive to make that you will probably make one for each hat that you own. A brand new class that I developed, it debuts at Pennsic 50.
fee_itemization: $2 for handout.

name: Honey Tasting: The Finest Honeys of the World!
description_book: This is a honey tasting and story telling. The finest world honeys will be sampled from Yemen to Crete, USA to Croatia.
description_web: This is a honey tasting and story telling brought to you by a world traveling beekeeper. The finest honeys of the world will be sampled... from Yemen to Crete, USA to Croatia. We'll cover the honey mentioned by Pliny the Elder to be the finest in the Roman world, to the world's most expensive honey. You will get to explore your palate and write down your thoughts on each.  Bring water to cleanse your palate.
fee_itemization: Handouts, tasting spoons, and these honey's are expensive, especially Sidr at $600/bottle. I'm just trying to break even.

name: Drafting Your Own Garb
description_book: I will show you hands-on how to take your own body measurements and draft your own garb. You will leave with a basic design for a piece of garb.
description_web: I will show you hands-on how to take your own body measurements and draft your own garb. You will leave with a basic design for a piece of garb.

name: Viking Age Food: Archaeological Evidence
description_book: A survey of the evidence for different foods found in Viking Age Norse sites.
description_web: A survey of evidence for plants, birds, fish, domestic and wild animals. Includes shellfish and sea mammals eaten by Viking Age Norse people, with some discussion of farming, cooking, and preserving.
fee_itemization: 50-page handout

name: The *Hortus Conclusus*
description_book: The *Hortus Conclusus*: the medieval walled garden in art and allegory.
fee_itemization: Color copying

name: Africa Unbound
description_book: A brief examination of historical and legendary figures from pre-1600s Africa.
description_web: A brief examination of historical and legendary figures from pre-1600s Africa.

name: Medieval Herbed Beer: *Gruit* Demystified
description_book: The history of Low Country *gruit* beer, as found in contemporary sources. Detailed information on ingredients and likely brewing techniques. **21+.**
description_web: The history of Low Country *gruit* beer, as found in contemporary sources. Includes detailed information on ingredients and plausible brewing techniques. Historic *gruit* beer is quite a different beer from modern herbal *gruit* ale. This class will explore the factual history of this exciting and unusual beer, as well as the dangers of assumptions in brewing research. **Age 21+.**
fee_itemization: printing costs, toner

name: How to Speak SCAdian!
description_book: What is Troll? What is an MoL? The SCA has lots of words and acronyms specific to our game. Attend this class and learn how to translate SCA jargon!
description_web: What is Troll? What is an MoL? The SCA has lots of words and acronyms specific to our game. Attend this class and learn how to translate SCA jargon!

name: Very Basic *Naalbinding*
description_book: *Naalbinding* creates a stretchy fabric by using a large sewing needle and yarn. I demonstrate a simple *naalbinding* stitch and basic techniques.
description_web: Introduction to *nalbinding* for those with no prior experience. *Naalbinding* is a craft which creates a stretchy fabric by using a large sewing needle and yarn. This predates knitting and is found in a variety of medieval cultures. I will demonstrate a simple *naalbinding* stitch (Oslo stitch) and discuss the basic techniques.

name: *Il Titolo Provvisorio* Rehearsal
description_book: Closed rehearsal for *Il Titolo Provvisorio*.

name: The Pilgrimage Project
description_book: Learn the songs of our Pennsic Pilgrimage! Open to all! Take up your staff and join us. Music provided.
description_web: For lo, these many years at Pennsic we have gone on Pilgrimage one afternoon of War Week, singing songs from the *Llibre Vermell de Montserrat* and the *Cantigas de Santa Maria*. Come learn the songs and consider joining us this year! All are welcome! Music provided. Pilgrimage will happen on the Tuesday afternoon of War Week; meeting at University Point, time TBD.

name: Viking Gender Roles
description_book: Popular culture presents one idea of Vikings' gender, but does it reflect what historical sources tell us? **Age 18+.**
description_web:
The idea of the Viking warrior is a strong cultural idiom that pervades medievalism, especially in the early period. In some ways, this idea of a violent, gruff raider taking riches and assaulting women reflects in our modern society as a symbol of masculinity gone wrong, and medieval Christian writers certainly want us to believe they were savage outsiders with no place in society. But how did Norse society look from the inside? What about women? What do we know about the expected gender roles and how they were enforced? What happened to those who deviated? Class will discuss the evidence we have from a variety of sources, and provide possible interpretations of that evidence.

Please be aware that the class will discuss sex, sexual abuse, and violence, especially violence directed at sexual and gender minorities. Content warnings will be offered around the most sensitive sections. **Age 18+.**

name: Æthelmearc Afternoon
description_book: Join the Kingdom of Æthelmearc for an afternoon of fun activities. Specific activities and times will be announced.

name: *Origami* for Experienced Beginners
description_book: Make a couple of creations to learn the folds needed to make a Wings of Fire Dragon. Warning: dragons are hard and require patience but are doable.
description_web: We will make a couple of creations to learn the folds needed to make a Wings of Fire Dragon. Warning: dragons are hard and require patience but definitely doable. Class for youth taught by youth.

name: Introduction to *Go*
description_book: A basic introduction to rules and play of the Japanese/Chinese game of *go/weiqi*.
description_web: Will teach the rules of the Japanese game *go* (also known as *weiqi* in China), and offer a chance to play afterwards.

name: Beyond the Cloth: Persona Glassware, Early Period
description_book: Discussion of glassware from ancient times through the Middle Ages, including Europe, the Middle East, and parts of Asia.
description_web: Have you ever walked around an event with a glass in your hand? People will notice it long before they even think about looking at your shoes. Make a statement by having the right kind of glass vessel for your persona! Discussion of various types of glassware from ancient times through the Middle Ages, including Europe, the Middle East, and parts of Asia. Join us again at 3:00 pm for a live, narrated demonstration of the making of an Early Period drinking vessel by Master Ali (Arab Boy) or Magistra Gnaea Celera.

name: Middle Eastern Melody and Drumming
description_book: The Middle Eastern Melody and Drumming classes will cover several several different folk songs and drum rhythms from various Middle Eastern countries
description_web:
The Middle Eastern Melody and Drumming classes will cover several several different folk songs and drum rhythms from Turkey, Armenia, Lebanon, and medeval Spain. The following melodies will be covered on the days listed below. Basic instruction for learning the new drum rhythms will be provided for each of the melodies. Bring your favorite melody instrument or a drum or both if you are so inclined. A limited number of handouts including historical notes, drumming notations, melody notations, and sheet music will be available on a first-come basis. A Google docs copy of the handouts and MP3 files of the songs can be obtained by sending an email request to briansbeaman@gmail.com.

Ha Nina			    D tktkt	Armenian		8/9/2022
Ya Sitti			    Ayoub	        Lebanese		8/9/2022

name: Intermediate Hurdy Gurdy Techniques
description_book: Learn a bit more about the gurdy and how keep it happy. We will look at some basic maintenance (if necessary) and some tunes.
description_web: Learn a bit more about the gurdy and how keep it happy. We will look at some basic maintenance (if necessary) and some tunes. Secrets to keeping the gurdy sounding wonderful and some pitfalls to avoid. Depending on the level of the students, we may look at some more advanced playing techniques, including coup.

name: Tapestry Frame Weaving Basics
description_book: A simple introduction to frame weaving such as tapestry, etc.
description_web: A simple introduction to frame weaving such as tapestry, etc. Class limited to 10 looms. Fee covers loom, accessories, yarn and instructions.
fee_itemization: loom, accessories, yarn & instructions

location: the old Cafe Marhaba location or what ever coffee shop is taking that place (South-West of the Pennsic Market store. (Coffee shop that is South West of the Food Court Near Barn)
name: Pre-16th-Century Musical Modal Improvisation
description_book: This is a practical application class for musicians to learn improvisational skills that were practiced in the Middle Ages. **College level.**
description_web: Musician class for acoustic instruments to learn medieval modal improvisation that will teach the student to create melodies on the spot for both free form and structured rhythmic forms. Students are required to be very familiar with their instruments. Reading music is not required but really helps, especially your major and natural minor scales. **College level.**

name: Blue Feather Rainbow Fling
description_book: Tournament is open to all members of the greater LGBT+ community regardless of throwing experience. Focus will be on fun and community building.
description_web: Tournament is open to all members of the greater LGBT+ community regardless of throwing experience. The tournament will have an advanced as well as a beginner category to include everyone. The focus will be on fun and community building, but bring your competitive spirit as well.

name: Post-Apocalypse: The Walking *Dum*
description_book: Begintermediate and pre-advanced rhythms to get beyond the basic rhythms. Different rhythms each day. **Bring your own drum.**
description_web: This is a begintermediate/pre-advanced  drumming class. Rhythm exercises to strengthen both right and left hands with different accents. Learn different rhythms and patterns beyond the basic 2, 4, and 8 counts. **Bring your own drum**.

name: Children's Choir
description_book: For children 13 and younger. Sing music in a period style. Meets daily. Performance on Thursday of War Week!
description_web: For children 13 and younger. Sing music in a period style. Meets daily. Performance on Thursday of War Week! Responsible adult needs to be within reach for the younger ones. Bring a folder to hold music. We will teach rounds, songs and melodies from the medieval to Renaissance. Session will be 45 minutes. Dress rehearsal in PA tent on Thursday with a performance at 6 pm.

name: The Ship of Theseus and Other Ancient Conundra
description_book: Roundtable: We will discuss the Ship of Theseus, first described by Plutarch in his *Parallel Lives*, circa A.D 100, and other ancient conundra.
description_web: At this roundtable (oblong seating area?) we will discuss the Ship of Theseus, first described by Plutarch in his *Parallel Lives*, circa A.D 100, and other ancient conundra.  Come prepared to think and discuss and debate the matter, along with Lajos Kossuth's pocket knife, the Ise Grand Shrine, and my Great Grandfather's Axe. If time permits we might discuss other ancient ideas, such as as Zeno's Paradox and Mighty Achilles Racing the Tortoise.

name: Leather Embroidery
description_book: A presentation of all known surviving embroidered leather objects from c. 400-1600. Attendees can try embroidering leather with silk thread.
description_web: This presentation covers the instructor's latest and growing compilation of all known embroidered leather objects surviving from c. 400-1600. Shoes form the largest category, but there are also knife sheaths, belt pouches, doublets, gloves, boots, and other kinds of items. Leather embroidery differs significantly from cloth embroidery and class participants will be able to try their hand at it with a sample of leather and silk thread. Many new items added since last year.

name: Teen Beaded Jewelry
description_book: Learn how to make beaded necklaces, earrings, and bracelets using tiger tail wire, fastenings, and beads that match your look and time period.
description_web: Ever wanted to make beaded jewelry that enhanced your SCA costume? Want to gather ideas for jewelry that represent your chosen look, culture, and time period? Learn how to make beaded necklaces, earrings, and bracelets using tiger tail wire, fastenings, and beads. Learn what necklace length works well with your garb. Throughout history beaded jewelry has been worn by males and females alike...every person is welcome! Beading is easier than you think and a wonderful way to express your personality!
fee_itemization: 5 beads and wire

name: Discovering Pictland
description_book: A look at the recent excavations, resources, and publications revealing more about the Picts (Northern Scotland 600-900 CE).
description_web: Information about the Picts (Northern Scotland 600-900 CE) used to be thin and hard to come by. This will be a look at the recent excavations and publications revealing new information about the Picts, their language, and their place in history.
fee_itemization: Printing costs

name: Characters of *Commedia* Workshop
description_book: Come gather with other enthusiasts and beginners to learn more about the characters of *commedia dell’arte*, and learn how to portray them on stage.
description_web: Come gather with other *commedia* enthusiasts and beginners to learn more about the characters of *commedia dell’arte*! We will be working with personal motivations, movement styles and attitudes to help actors better portray their favorites, or find a new character to enjoy!

name: Canvas Painting Practicum
description_book: Practicum of painting on canvas. Using modern acrylics, we will cover how you can decorate your tent, etc.
description_web: Practicum of painting on canvas. We will use the modern acrylics and discuss how you can decorate your tent, etc. Covers how you plan a project and adjust paint. Take home the canvas you painted yourself.
fee_itemization: Canvas to take home. Use of brushes, paints and other mediums for decorating the canvas.

name: Entering A&S Competitions
description_book: You will learn how to prepare for A&S competitions, set expectations, & maximize your success. Handout to discuss, then a roundtable discussion.
description_web: Arts & Sciences are a core part of what makes our Society so rich and fascinating, but entering competitions can seem scary! Fear not! With this class, you will learn how to prepare for A&S competitions, set expectations, and maximize your success. This class is based on my experiences as an entrant and judge in local, kingdom, and inter-kingdom competitions.

name: Deducing a Jewel from Pictures
description_book: How to design and construct a replica of a period jewel working from pictures taken in a museum, published, or found online.

name: 12th-Century Women's Clothing
description_book: An overview of 12th-century women's clothing, including the elusive bliaut.
description_web: An overview of 12th-century women's clothing, including the elusive bliaut. This class examines period sources outside of the Chartres Portal Sculpture box to explore how women's clothing was made in the 12th century.

name: Conversational American Sign Language: Beginner
description_book: Learn common words and conversational phrases in American Sign Language. Beginner class.

name: Early Period Book Club: *Sundiata*
description_book: An open discussion of *Sundiata, an Epic of Old Mali* by D.T. Niane, transl. by G. Pickett. Pre-reading not required but highly encouraged.
description_web: An open discussion format: attendees are not required, but are highly encouraged, to read the work prior to attendance. We will be discussing *Sundiata*, which is a 13th-century epic from the oral tradition of the Mali Empire about its founder, Sundiata Keita. The text read will be *Sundiata, an Epic of Old Mali* by D.T. Niane, translated by G. Pickett. This is an English translation of a French prose version of the epic. Any edition is fine. Instructor will open with a brief introduction of the work and its historical context, and then will move into open discussion.

name: Half the Heroes: Fighting Sexism and Stereotypes
description_book: A new TL;Dr version of the Impact of Sex & Gender on Martial Arts, explaining gender roles, physiology, and sharing practical solutions.
description_web: This class is a shortened version of a previously 2-hour class. It will discuss the impact of gender roles, physiological differences between the sexes, and the psychological impacts of different actions and choices as they related to SCA fighting, both rapier and armored. It will also offer practical solutions to help with pervasive problems.

name: Street Smarts
description_book: What's in a name? A folkloric history of Pennsic geography: how the streets and areas of Pennsic came by their distinctive designations.
description_web: What's in a name? A folkloric history of Pennsic geography: how the streets and areas of Pennsic came by their distinctive designations.

name: Intermediate English Country Dance
description_book: We will learn some slightly more complicated English Country Dances: *Picking of Sticks* and *Whirligig*.
description_web: We will learn some slightly more complicated English Country Dances - *Picking of Sticks* and *Whirligig*.

name: *Adventure Maximus*: An Introductory D&D-style RPG
description_book: *Adventure Maximus* is a D&D-style game for young players, with simple character sheets and a basic dungeon crawl. Limited to no more than 8 players.
description_web: *Adventure Maximus* is a D&D-style game for young players, with simple character sheets and a basic dungeon crawl. Limited to no more than 8 players.

name: Candlemaking
description_book: Make-and-take candles. Learn to make candles and get a brief history of candlemaking.
description_web: Make-and-take candles. Learn to make candles and get a brief history of candlemaking.
fee_itemization: cost for materials

name: *PA Afternoon Series*: Bardic Arts Exhibition
description_book: Come and enjoy an amazing afternoon display featuring a variety of bardic arts and artists from around the Known World!
description_web: Come and enjoy an amazing afternoon display featuring a variety of bardic arts and artists from around the Known World! Feel free to sign up to tell a story, sing a song, or spout Shakespeare. If it fits in the realms of Bardic performance, you are welcome to participate.

name: Advanced Thrown Weapons
description_book: Focuses on advanced throwing technique for more experienced throwers.
description_web: Focuses on advanced throwing technique for more experienced throwers.

instructor: Thl Cynthia Anne of Silver Lakes
name: Pennsic Youth Choir
description_book: The Youth Choir is open to all youth ages 12 to 19 who enjoy singing. No audition is required to participate.
description_web: We will participate in a Dress Rehearsal/Recording Session on Thursday, Aug. 10 at noon, and perform that evening at 6:30 pm, as part of the Pennsic Choirs Concert. Your director will provide you with a media release to sign.

name: Beginner Scribal Track: *Book of Durrow*
description_book: Intensive 4-day workshop focusing on the *Book of Durrow*: history, decoration, and calligraphy. Fee covers all supplies, handouts, and starter kit.
description_web: Intensive workshop, focusing on the 7th-century Irish manuscript, the *Book of Durrow*. Topics to be covered include history, interlace decoration, and calligraphy. Plan to attend all 4 days. Materials will be available for 10 students. $15 fee covers supplies for the 4 days, handouts, and take-home starter kit to keep you working after War! To learn more, visit https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1yNJr8gppgqDx1CCQSlmVqrbP9HXC5jEI?usp=sharing
fee_itemization: $15 fee covers supplies for the 4 days (nibs and holders, ink, etc.), handouts, and take-home starter kit to keep you working after War!

name: Known World *Capitano* Contest
description_book: Third Annual *Capitano* Contest to be held at Pennsic. Come show us your *Capitano*, and fight against others to win the title of the best!
description_web: Third Annual *Capitano* Contest to be held at Pennsic. Come show us your *Capitano*, and fight against others to win the title of the best!

name: Sea Navigation in the Middle Ages and Renaissance
description_book: Intro to period navigation. Includes techniques of Norsemen, medieval Mediterranean, 15th-16th-C Iberia and Northern Europe. Some hands-on activities.
description_web: Intro to navigation in the SCA period. Includes techniques of Norsemen, medieval Mediterranean, 15th-16th-century Iberia and Northern Europe. Some hands-on activities.

name: 9000 Years of Edged Weapons
description_book: A display and discussion of the history, fabrication and development of edged weapons including many original historical examples.
description_web: A display and discussion of the history, fabrication and development of edged weapons including many original examples from the Neolithic through the Bronze Age, into the Iron Age, and Middle Ages of SCA period, on into later eras and present. See which designs have lasted longest or have repeated. Photos and video welcome; limited hands-on permitted.

name: Making Glass Cabochons
description_book: Making glass cabochons: intermediate lampworking. Includes making glass game pieces.
description_web: Making glass cabochons, intermediate lampworking. Includes making glass game pieces.
fee_itemization: gas and glass

name: Making a "Glastonbury Lite" Chair
description_book: Learn some tips and techniques to make a Glastonbury chair that folds flat, looks period, and holds at least 300 pounds.
description_web: Tired of cheap folding chairs? Learn some tips and techniques to make a Glastonbury chair that folds flat, looks period, doesn't require pins or pegs, and holds at least 300 pounds.

name: World Spindles
description_book: Come learn about and try a variety of spindles from around the world, from the Andes to India. Friendly to newcomers and advanced spinners alike!
description_web: How have different cultures around the world tackled spinning fiber into yarn/thread? We'll discuss a variety of spindles found across history and cultures, from the Peruvian Chac-Chac to the Scottish Dealgan. Students will have an opportunity to try out more than sixteen different spindles as we discuss their similarities, differences, and uses.

name: *Romani*: An Introduction to "Gypsy" Persona
description_book: Want a *Romani* persona, but don't know how/where to start? Learn about the *Rom*, their history, and the fun of this fascinating persona.
description_web: Want a *Romani* persona, but don't know how/where to start? Learn about the *Rom*, their history, common pitfalls, and the fun of this fascinating persona. We will be covering their history, migration routes, clothing, and how to portray this persona within the SCA.

name: Bardic Symposium #1: Finding Friendly Audiences
description_book: Some areas of the SCA are more bardic-friendly than others. How do you search for eager audiences, but avoid where bards aren't wanted?
description_web: Meet your fellow bards. While many of us already know each other, this will give newcomers a chance to match names to faces. Some areas of the SCA are more bardic-friendly than others. How do you search for eager audiences, but avoid or extricate yourself from where bardic isn't wanted? How can a kingdom/region/group be encouraged to be more bard-friendly? View the Bardic Symposium website here: https://tilted-windmill.com/pennsic50_symposium.html .

name: Period Jewelry You Can Make
description_book: A class on how to make simple period jewelry.

name: Neurodiversity in the SCA
description_book: Join me in a discussion on how the Society has been built in a way to provide a safe port in a storm of non-acceptance, and how it continues to do so.
description_web: Join me in a discussion on how the Society has been built in a way to provide a safe port in a storm of non-acceptance, and how it can provide help and growth by the way it functions.

name: North African and Ethiopian Coffee
description_book: Learn how to make the perfect cup of coffee in the North African and Ethiopian styles, then enjoy a cup or two!
description_web: From beans to cup, we will roast green coffee beans together, then learn the techniques you need to make the perfect brew. We will look at Ethiopian *bunna* coffee, as well as North African *qahwah*. Come thirsty! There is an option to go home with the tools you need to make coffee at home. I will have 20 kits available (approx. $30).
fee_itemization: handouts are 1.00 and supply kits containing cup, pot, coffee etc. run between $30.00 and $60.00 [a few  actually have their own braziers] depending on pot size and size/pieces in kit, as available

name: Navigating Pennsic With A Disability
description_book: Roundtable discussion of experiences, tips, tricks, and know-how for navigating Pennsic as a disabled person, hidden or visible. All ages welcome!
description_web: Roundtable discussion of experiences, tips, tricks, and know-how for navigating Pennsic as a disabled person, hidden or visible. All ages welcome! The focus of our roundtable will be sharing resources and experiences, connecting face-to-face for camaraderie, and promoting positive discourse about participating in the SCA at Pennsic and at home (if time allows) while living our various realities. No one will be required to reveal any specifics about their disabilities. Allies and caregivers and DEI Officers welcome as well.

name: Cordial Making in the SCA vs Medieval Medicinals
description_book: Sharing what I have learned on making vodka-based cordials, includes medicinal properties of herbs in the Middle Ages. **Age limit 21+.**
description_web:
Sharing what I have learned on making vodka-based cordials, with an understanding of the medicinal properties of herbs in the Middle Ages.
A very strong emphasis on safe practices is essential for cordial making and dispensing, and is included in the class.
Alcohol will be present and may be consumed during the class. **In PA, you must be 21 in order to drink alcohol**.

name: SCA Basics For Newcomers: Q & A
description_book: Welcome to the SCA! You have a lot of questions; I will try and answer them, and give you an overview of our culture.
description_web: I have over 35 years in the SCA, and I spent over a decade as both a branch and Kingdom Chatelaine (Newcomer Coordinator).  I have extensive experience helping newcomers learn about our history, customs, and culture in the SCA. Bring your questions, and I'll give a basic history of the Society.

name: *Nalbinding* Meet-and-Greet
description_book: Time for those interested in *nalbinding* to meet up, discuss our craft, do some informal teaching or just work on your current project.
description_web: This is some time for those interested in *nalbinding* to meet up, discuss our craft, do some informal teaching or just work on your current project.

name: The Mythology of Harps
description_book: We'll cover the mythology surrounding the harp from several different cultures through the ages. Roundtable discussion encouraged.
description_web: This class will cover the mythology surrounding the harp from several different cultures through the ages. We will cover creation stories, magic, deities, dragons, healing and death stories. Please bring your stories. Harps are encouraged but not required.
fee_itemization: $2.00 per handout; 4-5 pages per handout.

name: Nigel's Fire-Starting Class
description_book: You too can start a fire with flint and steel. Explore the history of fire and how to start a fire with flint and steel. You will make fire. **14+**
description_web: Formerly titled “How to Start a Fire Like a Moderately Intelligent Saxon”. Yes, you too can start a fire with flint and steel like a Saxon, Roman, Viking, or any other civilized culture in the Middle Ages. Includes history of fire and the flint-and-steel mechanics of starting a fire. Hands-on class; you will start a fire. **You must be at least 14 years old** and have your parents' or wife’s permission.
fee_itemization: Instructor is not charging for the materials.

name: Beginner English Country Dance for as Many as Will
description_book: We will go through the basics of English Country Dance and learn dances that can be danced for any number of couples.
description_web: We will go through the basics of English Country Dance and learn dances that can be danced for any number of couples (*Sellengers Round, Gathering Peascods* and, if there's time, *Trenchmore*).

location: Denys the Decadent's Camo  (EO7 off great Eastern Hiughway, Look for 12 Steppe Sign)
name: 12-Step Meeting
description_book: An open meeting for those in recovery or any 12-step programs.
description_web: A daily 12-step meeting I hold in my Camp E07 off Great Eastern Highway. Look for the sign. Held at 4:00 PM, **OPEN MEETING .** Holding a meeting here since 1997.

name: Pit and Stone Games
description_book: Pit and Stone games are an ancient family of games that includes *mancala*. We will learn several variations, including *Wari*, and play some games.
description_web: Pit and Stone games are an ancient family of games that includes *mancala*. They are played by moving stones (or sowing seeds) into pits with a goal of capturing the most stones (or seeds). These games have been played since at least 1000 BC, and there are hundreds of both traditional and modern versions. We will learn several variations, including *Wari*, and we'll play some games.

name: Roman Glassblowing Demo (Furnace Glass)
description_book: A fully narrated, live, 2000-degree glassblowing demonstration! Learn about the materials, the techniques, and how glass usage changed over time!
description_web: Come and watch a fully narrated, live, 2000-degree glassblowing demonstration! See how we can take this fascinating material and turn it into a never-ending variety of items! Learn about the materials we use, and how glass-making techniques, its uses, and value varied throughout time and culture! For this demo see items from the 1st to the 5th centuries, from across the Roman Empire! Family-friendly, all ages welcome, open Q&A to follow.

name: Known World Recorder Ensemble
description_book: Recorder players of intermediate and above abilities. We will hold four rehearsals to prepare for a brief concert Thursday of War Week.
description_web: Recorder players of intermediate and above abilities are invited to participate in this ensemble. Join us in having fun and making music together! We will meet for four rehearsals: Sunday - Wednesday in the PARC; Concert, 6 pm, Thursday of War Week in the PA Tent.  Age limit: 12 and up. A limited number of soprano and alto recorders are available for loan. If you play more than one instrument, bring them all. Please bring a music stand if you have one; loaners available. Bring a 1/2 inch black binder. Sheet music (intermediate to advanced) will be provided. $2 for music packet, or free PDFs can be found on the Facebook group: Known World Recorder Ensemble. Email the instructors: THL Jolicia atte Northclyfe (washington.julie@gmail.com), and The Honorable Lady Siri Toivosdotter (JoniSyngs@gmail.com).
fee_itemization: Printed Music

name: Beginner Thrown Weapons
description_book: Learn axe throwing, basic care of your weapons, and basic rules. A hands-on session is included. Limit of 25 participants; no experience necessary.
description_web: Learn axe throwing, basic care of your weapons, and basic rules. A hands-on session is included. Limit of 25 participants; no experience necessary.

name: Axe Continuous-Throw Tournament
description_book: How many axes can you throw without missing? Single rotation throws until you miss.
description_web: How many axes can you throw without missing? Single rotation throws until you miss.

name: The Medieval Palette: Using Your Paint, Pt. 2
description_book: Attendees of Medieval Palette Pt.1 practice using their pigments effectively, with discussions on mixing, opacity, and application.
description_web: This class is intended to follow The Medieval Palette: Pt. 1. We will use the paints we created in the first class to paint with, to work with getting the consistency right, discussing how to use the properties of opacity and transparency correctly. We'll work on painting a couple of provided scroll blanks. There will also be some color theory discussion regarding shading and highlighting during the class, with discussion regarding various artistic styles throughout the SCA time period.
fee_itemization: Fee will cover pre-made scribal blanks on pergamenata. Each student will also be provided paper towels, gloves, brushes, water dishes, water, pencils, erasers, and any extra binder they may need for their paint to work properly.

name: Whose Line Doth it Be: Auditions
description_book: Audition and rehearsal for the "Whose Line" show! Performance slots limited.
description_web: Think you are a great improviser? Now here's your chance to audition for the improvisational show, "Whose Line Doth It Be?" Performance slots are limited, so sharpen your wit!

name: Mary Queen of Ciphers
description_book: We will look at the history, implementation, and utilization of the cipher systems used by Mary of Scots.
description_web: We will be look at the history, implementation, and utilization of the cipher systems used by Mary of Scots. Handouts are limited but a QR code to access the digital copy will be available at the class.

name: Teen/Tween Fingerloop Braiding
description_book: Learn how to do a simple 5-bow fingerloop braid and make a bracelet to take home with you!
description_web: Learn how to do a simple 5-bow fingerloop braid and make a bracelet to take home with you!

name: Russ and "Russia": 300 Years War
description_book: Wars for dominance between Grand Duchy of Lithuania and Principality of Moscow in 14th-16th centuries. Class 3 of 3.
description_web: Wars for dominance between Grand Duchy of Lithuania and Principality of Moscow in 14th-16th centuries. Class 3 of 3.
fee_itemization: For printed handouts

name: Arts and Sciences Power Hour
description_book: Take an hour away from camp to double down on your learnings.
description_web: Do you come to Pennsic University, learn something awesome, mean to pursue it, only to wind up in your noisy camp where the idea flies from your mind? Come sit with us for an hour; hone your crafts, write your notes, collect your thoughts.

name: Atlantian Unbelted 10-Person Mêlée
description_book: This will be a 10 v 10 mêlée. Each kingdom participating can bring additional fighters to swap out but only 10 will take the field for each round.
description_web: This will be a 10 v 10 mêlée. Each kingdom participating can bring additional fighters to swap out but only 10 will take the field for each round. The format will be based on the number of attendees. Teams are encouraged to wear the colors of their Kingdom. We are asking each Kingdom to supply one marshal if possible.

name: I Feel Pretty and Period
description_book: A discussion of (generally later) period beauty practices, both from the perspective of "What they did" as well as "What can we safely do."
description_web: A discussion of period skin care and hair care practices, both from the perspective of "What they did" as well as "What we can safely do." It is no secret that period skin care and hair care recipes often involved mercury, lead and arsenic, but there are also some great recipes and tools that SCAdians can use to further their immersion into their persona.

name: Ball Prep: Choral Ball
description_book: The Choral Ball has quite a few dances that will be unfamiliar to many dancers, so this is the chance to learn some. All skill levels are welcome.

name: Take Back the Fort
description_book: Combat Archery Novelty Shoot: Practice and hone your skills in a fun shoot designed for combat archery.
description_web: Combat Archery Novelty Shoot: Come join us for our first fun shoot designed for combat archery. Our theme will be "Pennsic State Fair" and we will have a variety of fun, carnival game-themed targets for you to try out. Practice and hone your skills. Armor is not necessary and CA authorization not required. You just need the proper combat bow and arrows to participate.

name: Yoga for Anyone and Everyone
description_book: All-level friendly, basic *vinyasa* class, open to complete beginners & seasoned yogis. Bring your own mat, towel & water, prepare to work and relax.

name: Midrealm Rapier Marshals Refresher Class
description_book: Refresher on current rules/expectations for Rapier Marshals in the Midrealm. It fulfills the class requirement for Continuing Education.
description_web: Refresher on current rules/expectations for Rapier Marshals in the Midrealm. It fulfills the class requirement for Continuing Education. The ~30 minutes will be a refresher from the Midrealm Deputy Earl Marshal for Fencing on the rules and expectations for Rapier Marshals. The remaining time is alloted for questions and discussion.

name: Brass Choir Jam Session
description_book: Bring your cornetti, sackbuts, lysarden, and serpents (modern trombones and trumpets are ok). Music provided.
description_web:
Works from renaissance composers played on brass instruments!  
Bring your cornetto, your sackbut, lysarden, serpent or other brass instruments. Modern trombones and trumpets are ok, if that is what you have.  
Bring a chair, a stand (a few loaners may be available), some paper clips, and a pencil!
fee_itemization: Printed Music

name: Reading Notarial Latin Documents
description_book: Learn about the ways everyday scribes wrote Latin (in all its messy abbreviated glory) and practice reading sample medieval documents in class!
description_web:
We all know the intricate and beautiful work of the Scribes in their scrolls evoking the glorious illuminated manuscripts of the Middle Ages. But those documents were extremely expensive to produce, and very few medieval people read or even saw them. This class will teach about the everyday medieval documents of the notaries, about the culture surrounding this form of writing, and about the techniques they used in writing so that they could save space and time. We will learn some of the most common abbreviation techniques and practice on several 13th/14th-century notarial documents from the Crown of Aragon. 
Those with a working knowledge of the Latin language will benefit the most from this workshop, but anyone interested in scribal notation is welcome!

name: Archery Champions' Practice
description_book: Everyone who wishes to try out for the Archery Champions' teams is welcome and encouraged to attend. Yes, **you** are good enough to try out!
description_web: This is an opportunity to learn a bit, and give the team captains a chance to see you. Everyone who wishes to try out for the Archery Champions' teams is welcome and encouraged to attend. Yes, **you** are good enough to try out!

name: Archery Marshal and MIT Orientation
description_book: All Archery Marshals are required to attend **ONE** orientation meeting. This meeting is to explain Pennsic specific rules, the ranges, and scoring.
description_web: All Archery Marshals are required to attend **ONE** orientation meeting. This meeting is to explain Pennsic specific rules, the ranges, and scoring. You're welcome to bring MITs and attend as often as you want. We want you to learn the scoring system to make getting the totals faster, easier and more accurate.

name: Songs and Stories with Old Tom
description_book: Tommaso sings! He plays music! He tells stories! He does two at once! Period songs and stories for a tavern crowd. Family-friendly.
description_web: Tommaso sings! He plays music! He tells stories! He does two at once! What did Martin say to his man? How did Raven become black? Period songs and stories for a tavern crowd. Family-friendly.

name: Efenwealt Singalong Show
description_book: Let's laugh and sing together while we wait for Whose Line to start!
description_web: Efenwealt & Aenor will once again be warming up the crowd with their SCA sing-alongs and laugh-alongs. Midair and his crew of surly improvisers are certain to surreptitiously creep up behind us near the end of the set, definitely **not** making us feel in the least bit awkward.

name: Where in the World Is Late Medieval Burgundy?
description_book: More than just the wine growing region in France, the Burgundian lands also incorporated what are now the Benelux countries.
description_web: More than just the wine growing region in France, the Burgundian lands also incorporated what are now the Benelux countries. Take a look at what and where this cultural and economic powerhouse was and which royal house ruled it.

name: Making the SCA Work on Your Resumé
description_book: Translate your SCA volunteer experience into modern resumé content.
description_web: We will go over SCA terms and translate them into modern job titles, and learn how to use SCA experience to address gaps in employment. The instructor is a senior recruiter, resumé consultant, and paid writer.
fee_itemization: Copies

name: Pennsic Homes, Part 1: Wagon Homes
description_book: What you need to consider before buying or building. For beginners.
description_web: A What-You-Need-to-Consider class: Do you want something that looks like an in-period house? Or a period wagon/coach? Stays at Pennsic (Do you know the Pennsic Regs?) or a wagon to take to other events? Brief history of period carts and wagon. Adaptations to make it a livable-for-us today. Includes some of my available resources. Also, why these are or are *not* out-of-period "Gypsy" *vardos*.

name: Known World Players Annual Meeting
description_book: KWP's annual meeting. Company members and newcomers alike are invited to hear officer reports and discuss KWP's future.
description_web: The Known World Players annual Guild meeting. Company members and newcomers alike are invited to come share ideas about the company's future, hear officers' annual reports, and discuss future productions.

name: Twelfth Annual Depressing Song Competition
description_book: A competition dedicated to giving sad songs, tales, etc., a chance to shine. Sign up at Moongate Designs, or at the PAT before the competition.
description_web: It’s time to celebrate songs and tales of sorrow once again. Please keep performances SCA-related &/or pre-1600 CE in content, and 5 minutes or less in length. No documentation needed. Judging is based on sadness and performance. Bring any questions and/or sign up at Moongate Designs in the merchant’s area. Prizes will be awarded.

name: Tarl's Youth Polearm Tournament
description_book: Youth Bear Pit Tourney using only polearms.
description_web: Youth Bear Pit Tourney using only polearms.

name: Whose Line Doth It Be
description_book: Improv comedy show where anything can happen. Audience members should bring seating. Would-be contestants must audition.
description_web: Welcome to "Whose Line Doth It Be?", the improv comedy show where anything can happen. Audience members should bring seating. Would-be contestants must attend the Audition at 4 pm. Rated PG-13.

name: Bedtime Stories for Children
description_book: Nightly telling of stories for children. This year's theme will be The Brothers Grimm!
description_web: Stories and fables for children, 7 pm nightly. This year's theme will be The Brothers Grimm. All are welcome to attend; children must have adult escort.

name: Chivalry Vigil: Guillaume le Breton (Ealdormere)
description_book: THL Guillaume le Breton (Ealdormere) is sitting vigil to contemplate entry into the Order of the Chivalry. **All** are welcome.
description_web:
THL Guillaume le Breton (Ealdormere) is sitting vigil to contemplate entry into the Order of the Chivalry. **All** members of the populace are welcome to come give him counsel, or to visit with him. (Darkyard in Roaring Wastes camp). 
Elevation ceremony is scheduled for Ealdormere Kingdom Court on Wednesday, August 9th.

name: *RúnValdr*
description_book: In period, runes were very rarely used for divination, but there are many examples of runes being used for magic. A modern system for rune magic.
description_web: In period, runes were very rarely used for divination, but there are many examples of runes being used for magic. This is a system that shows, for example, how to use Norse or Anglo-Saxon runes to hear even at distance, or to awaken inanimate objects. This is a system of energy manipulation using runes and another set of symbols. This workshop introduces the symbols and what each of them is used for, and includes the attunement. It does *not* include introduction to runes. You may take this workshop without knowing the runes, but you will need to learn them to be able to use this system. You will be able to use this technique immediately.
fee_itemization: There's a free handout, and a bigger optional "manual" available.

name: T(w)een Lounge: 2nd Gen Hangout
description_book: **Ages 12-17.** Open Hangout Night. Come hang out and chat with adults who grew up in the SCA. Hang out with your fellow t(w)eens.

name: Middle Eastern Hafla!!
description_book: Live music and dance! Please come to the Middle Eastern tent for playing music and dancing! All instruments and dancers are invited.
description_web: Live music and dance! Please come to the Middle Eastern tent for playing music and dancing to said music! All instruments, and musicians attached to them, are invited. All dancers of any age, gender, and experience are welcome!

name: St Olga Story
description_book: The story of St Olga of Kiev.

name: Pennsic Homes, Part 2: Tour of Serengeti
description_book: A tour of just a few of the different types of Pennsic homes and other mobile structures. **Lots** of walking.
description_web: A tour of just a few of the different types of wagon homes. There are many different ways to make your life easier, such as adapting a Pennsic storage trailer to be a shower/bath trailer. (Reduces set-up and take-down time!) Purpose is to show ideas and introduce you to homeowners so you know what people to ask questions. A range of expense levels, as well as Pennsic Homes vs. take-it-to-events wagons. **Lots** of walking. Will be cancelled if is a pouring, rainy day, but not if it is quick, light showers

name: The Debatable Choir
description_book: The Debatable Choir performs medieval & Renaissance music by composers like Salamone Rossi, Ludwig Senfl, Thomas Morley, and our favorite, Anonymous!
description_web: The Debatable Choir performs medieval & Renaissance music by composers like Salamone Rossi, Ludwig Senfl, Thomas Morley, and our favorite, Anonymous! For over 35 years, this choir has entertained royalty and peasants, receiving kingdom awards for both the Arts and Service along the way. This year we'll be singing in Occitan, Ladino, German, Italian, Middle English and even modern English!

name: Not Your Typical Atlantian Thugs IV
description_book: A performance by various bards from the Kingdom of Atlantia.
description_web: We dislike the term thug but our bards can beat up your bards. Are you not entertained?

location: Courtesan Camp (Strawberry Fields B06 (off eLeri Lane between Ankara and Visby Vale))
name: Roman Bacchanal - CCt
description_book: The Knowne World Courtesans call you to a celebration of all things Roman! Required: Early Imperial Roman dress and a coin (free) **18+ ID required.**
description_web:
The Festival of Floralia is upon us! The Knowne World Courtesans call you to a celebration of all things Roman in the Knowne World! To gain entry, dress to impress in your finest 1st C Roman garb. We will delight your senses with amphorae of wine, delicacies fit for the Emperor, contests of strength, beauties abundant, and bounteous sensory delights. All in celebration of Summer! **Age 18+. ID required.**

Requirements:
**18+ (no entry without ID!)**
*Early Imperial Roman dress (no pants, no Celtic garb, no plaid).
*a coin (free!); there are only 400 available so get them while they last!
*no phone use outside of checking the time permitted inside the camp. (We will have a designated photo area outside.)
Don't forget your mug!
Coins will be dispensed exclusively during Pennsic by a courtesan host on Sunday, August 6th, at 10 am at a location TBA. Only one coin per person will be dispensed, so if you’re not able to make it, send a friend to pick one up for you!
This year, coins will be collected at the gate and replaced with a marked wristband. For more information about requirements, donations, and more, visit knowneworldcourtesans.org/pennsic-bacchanal-2023 !

name: Choral Ball
description_book: Singers and instrumentalists welcome! Dance to choral music! Sheet music provided or available online.
description_web: Dance to the music of choristers! Sheet music provided for singers and instrumentalists; also available on the SCA Choral Ensemble Facebook group.

name: John Inchingham, Cerian Cantwr, & House Sans Nomen
description_book: Listen to the mad tunes and fantastic tales of Master John Inchingham the Fool, Master Cerian Cantwr, and their household.
description_web: Listen to the mad tunes and fantastic tales of Master John Inchingham the Fool, Master Cerian Cantwr, and their household. Sing along with some of the best-known (and most infamous) bards of the Middle Kingdom. Come prepared for music, mayhem, and merriment of the oddest kind.

name: Yoga for Fighters,  Dancers and Everybody
description_book: Yoga for all levels! Bring mat or towel for the floor & strap, scarf, or strip of cloth for class if you can; some loaner gear available.
description_web:
Yoga for all levels! Bring mat or towel for the floor & strap, scarf, or strip of cloth for class if you can; some loaner mats and straps will be available. If you have blocks, please bring them if you can! This class is geared for folks who have never done yoga through seasoned practitioners. Amendments for poses will be offered as we go, and each class will build upon the one before, however, anyone can jump in at anytime. 
Class will begin with a few minutes of breath work followed by approximately 45 minutes of yoga.

name: Basketry 101: Market Basket
description_book: Learn the basics of basket weaving and make your own 8"x12" market basket to take home. Bring an old towel and scissors for cutting reed.
fee_itemization: Oak D handle, dyed basket reed, plain basket reed, rim filler, tool usage and handouts

name: Coffee with Friends of Bill and Dr Bob
description_book: Open agnostic 12-Step meetings.
description_web: Open agnostic 12-Step meetings. From 8:00 am-9:00 am.

name: Known World Players Rehearsal for Romeo & Juliet
description_book: A closed rehearsal for cast and crew for the Pennsic 50 production of Romeo & Juliet by William Shakespeare.
description_web: A closed rehearsal for cast and crew for the Pennsic 50 production of Romeo & Juliet by William Shakespeare.

name: *Études* 2 and 3 for Single Sword (Fencing)
description_book: These drill sequences will focus on form, balance, movement, and coordination. For beginners, intermediates, and teachers alike.
description_web: For beginner and intermediate fencers and those who teach them. These drills will focus on form, balance, movement and coordination. *Étude* 2 is thrust centric. *Étude* 2 adds diversity of cuts. Emphasis will be on learning the *études* for home drill, as well as taking elements out of the drill for more focused work in groups.

name: Blockprinted Scrolls
description_book: Learn to make scrolls based on blockprinted title pages and book illustrations which include many popular Renaissance illumination styles.
description_web: Learn to make scrolls based on blockprinted title pages and book illustrations which include many popular Renaissance illumination styles.  We will discuss ways of recreating these styles either through printing with blocks or by using pen and ink.

name: Illumination 101, or How I learned to Love the Dot
description_book: If you are thinking you can’t possibly create a scroll, but you would really like to, let me show you how. No experience necessary!
description_web:
If you are thinking you can’t possibly create a scroll, but you would really like to, let me show you how. No experience necessary! I will show you valuable resources and handy tools to help you get started.
If you have paper (thick art paper is best), pencil (with white eraser), paintbrush (small), paint (gouache), and a palette, please bring them. I will, however, have materials for those that don’t.
fee_itemization: I will share use of my materials, including pencils, paintbrush, paint, paper, and pallet.  You can take the paper with you.

name: Pennsic Youth *Commedia dell'Arte*
description_book: Hands-on class giving the description and history of *commedia* before having the youth create and eventually perform their own skit. Ages 13-17.
description_web: Young adults will learn the art of *commedia dell'arte* while practicing and creating skits that will be performed at the end of the week. Ages 13-17.

name: Archery Practice
description_book: Warm up, practice shoot, and have fun on the Archery Range.
description_web: Warm up, practice shoot, and have fun on the Archery Range.

instructor: Noble Lykania of Stone Hill Keep
name: From Furnace to Flame
description_book: Overview of pre-modern glass industry from ancient times to the Early Middle Ages. We will also discuss technology, techniques, and trade.
description_web: This is an overview of the pre-modern glass science, technology, and trade with a focus on the broader glass industry's role in bead production and markets. I will focus on the transition from glass production during the Roman Empire and the impact its collapse had on the glass industry in Northern Europe. We will look at tools, materials, and products.

name: Garbing Myths and How to Destroy Them
description_book: Myths about medieval/Renaissance garb colors and materials? Learn what was really used. Helpful hints with patterns and where to get fabric too!
description_web: Learn about colors and materials that were really used in Middle Ages and Renaissance. This class will focus mostly on appropriate colors and materials for the 12th-16th centuries with some helpful hints on where to start with garbing. Great for experienced garbers as well!
fee_itemization: Handouts for the class

name: A Feast Fit for Bees (and Other Pollinators!)
description_book: Planting a garden for pollinators is easy, fun and period. Discussion history, plants, plantings and what may stop by for a snack. **Adults only.**
description_web: Planting a garden for pollinators is easy, fun and quite period. We will discuss the needs and plant preferences of honeybees and other critters who will stop by for a snack. Historic designs as well as modern garden adaptation will also be explored. The optional second hour, you have the option of walking Cooper’s Lake Campground with me to take a look at flower shapes, plants and pollinators. **Adults only.**

name: Lucet, Beyond Square Cord
description_book: You can make good square cord; what's next? Flat and multi-strand cords. Bring your lucet. (We can slip a cord off and put it back on after class.)
description_web: You’re comfortable making square cord; what's next? We'll work on flat and multi-strand cord variations. Please bring your lucet. (We'll also demonstrate how to slip a cord off-and-on so you can put it back on after class.)
fee_itemization: (4) colors of floss on bobbins, and handout.

name: Pins and Brooches and Buttons, Oh, My!
description_book: Hands-on survey of period clothing closures and how to use them. Covers antiquity to 1600, and all the cultures that I have time for.
description_web: Survey of period clothing closures and how to use them. Covers antiquity to 1600, and all the cultures that I have time for. Includes information on where to purchase these items and how to use them. I will pass around actual closures and demonstrate their use. Bring your questions!
fee_itemization: $4 for handout

name: The Invention of the Post Windmill
description_book: We'll cover the medieval windmill, its predecessors, features, and development from the 12th century.
description_web: We'll cover the medieval windmill, its predecessors, features, and development from the 12th century.
fee_itemization: Paper & ink for handouts

name: Modern Gaming: War Week
description_book: A place, with power, to play modern games from 9 am to 10:30 pm every day.

name: Intro to the Monongahela People and Culture
description_book: An introduction to the Monongahela people and culture based on current understanding from archaeological evidence.
description_web: An introduction to the Monongahela people and culture based on current understanding from archaeological evidence. The Monogahela culture was discovered during the Works Progress Administration during the Great Depression. The Monongahela culture was a Native American group based in modern-day Western Pennsylvania, West Virginia, Western Maryland, and Eastern Ohio.

name: Keyhole Neckline Facing for a Simple Tunic
description_book: Adding a keyhole neckline facing can make nice finished edge and decorative accent to a simple tunic. Make and take a simple pattern for the facing.

name: Herbalism and Botanical References
