description_book: Come find out about period texts on herbalism, horticulture, botany, and agriculture, from Early Egypt to 1600.
description_web: Come find out about period texts on herbalism, horticulture, botany, and agriculture, from the ~1800 BCE to 1600 CE. We will discuss texts, cultures, and the evolution of data within SCA period. There will be no handout this year; instead expect a QR code.  I will have handouts on loan to help those without devices follow along.

name: Rus Goldwork Embroidery
description_book: The history and techniques of metal thread embroidery in pre-Mongol Rus. Class includes hands-on instruction and practice.
description_web: The history and techniques of metal thread embroidery in pre-Mongol Rus. Class includes hands-on instruction and practice.
fee_itemization:
Embroidery hoop- Loops and Threads 10 in hoop, $2.99*15 = $44.85
Gold- spool of fine gold, $15*2 = $30
Needles- DMC embroidery needles, $3.99/pack * 3 packs = $11.97
Fabric- Quilt cotton fabric, $6.99/yard * 2 yards = $13.98
SilkBaron Dupioni, $24/yard * 2 yards = $48
Filament silk- DeVere filament silk, $3.48/spool *5 spools = $17.40
*Scissors and awls are not included; I own several for teaching purposes that are not given out or used up in the course of the class

= $166.20 total
= $11.08/kit 
= $10 kit fee for simplicity

name: 16th-Century Arbeau Historical Field Drum Class
description_book: For drummers who own & play historical field drum (this is the rope tension drum with sticks), including *tupon* with drum sticks. **College level.**
description_web: Class for drummers who own and play historical field drum (this is the rope tension drum with 2 sticks). Also welcome are  *tupan* (aka *davul, tapan, atabal* or *tabl*) with 2 drum sticks and frame drums with a drum stick. No *derbekes*, please. The class will study the only historical manuscript instructions on both military and dance rhythms. Possible coordination to support one of the field battles as a historical drum corps. **College level.**

name: Ealdormere Youth Fun Shoot: Archery
description_book: Ealdormere welcomes the children and youth (under 16) of the Known World to join us on the archery range for a fun shoot.
description_web: Ealdormere welcomes the children and youth (under 16) of the Known World to join us on the archery range for a fun shoot. Children and youth will shoot in cahoots with coaching from Marshals and MITs. Prizes for every participant.

name: Dancing with Children: Stories and Improvising
description_book: It's never too early to learn to dance! Come learn dances fun for all. All youth in attendance require a responsible adult to be present. Ages 4 & up.
description_web: While open to all ages, the class will be geared towards fun and frolicking rather than perfecting steps, and is suitable for ages four and up. All youth in attendance require a responsible adult to be present. After learning some basic steps, the class will cover a variety of dances that tell stories as well as more free-form dances.

location: East Kingdom Royal Kitchen (E06, off of Low Road)
name: Aphrodisiacs: Food & Drink for Sex & Love - CCt
description_book: Period & locale-based aphrodisiacs as common medicine. We will be preparing several picnic/camp-friendly options. **Age 18+ CCt**
description_web: Brief presentation on period and locally-based aphrodisiacs followed by hands-on preparation of samples to take. Italian and European Renaissance drinks and morsels designed to entice, to please, to enhance. This class will focus on recipes that are perfect for making prior to an event and bringing along with minimal fuss, that can be easily kept at food-safe temperatures. There will be a pamphlet of recipes. Possible allergens include dairy, tree nuts, gluten, several types of flowers. Please dress for mess, bring a cutting board, hand towel, paring knife, and a container to take your samples. **Age 18+.**
fee_itemization: At-will Donation appreciated

name: "It Takes My Child to Raze a Village": Pennsic Ed.
description_book: The mini-version of the Midrealm event focused on families participating in the SCA together! The Plague Game is back!

name: Pennsic War 50 Year History Display
description_book: 50 years of Pennsic history. Photos, stories, displays. Add your special events to a physical timeline, celebrate with thousands from around the world
description_web: Explore 50 years of Pennsic history in one place! Share your part of the living history of Pennsic, and add yourself and your special Pennsic moments to a physical timeline. Experience the evolution of Pennsic through photos and stories, as well as a variety of displays. What began as a small field event in 1972 has reached its 50th year, and now brings together thousands of people from around the world! Join your fellow Pennsic goers to celebrate this milestone!

name: Intro to "Medieval-Like" Woodworking, Part A
description_book: Intro to woodworking with only hand tools. Includes modern SOPs and safe practices for building medieval-style furniture. **Age limit. See web.**
description_web: **THIS CLASS IS 2 HALF DAYS**, Tuesday and Wednesday; an overview of hand woodwork, with an opportunity to try things out. We will start on Tuesday morning with a chunk of a log and by noon we should have some boards or other furniture parts using wedges, axes, froes, drawknives, spokeshaves, and wood planes. On Wednesday we will look at making joints, boring, and maybe a bit of carving. Covers saws, chisels, and planes. Extensive instructions on the selection, use and maintenance of all these tools will be covered. The class will be taught both first week and again second week. Students who cannot attend the whole class are encouraged to drop in or out at their convenience. **Youths may attend if accompanied by a parent.**

name: Pennsic Instrumental Youth Consort
description_book: The Youth Instrumental Consort is open to all youth who play an instrument. No audition is required to participate.
description_web: Rehearsals will be from 9:00 am - 9:45 am daily from Saturday, August 5, 2023, until Wednesday, August 9, at the Performing Arts Rehearsal Classroom (PARC) located by the Amphitheatre. We will participate in a Dress Rehearsal/Recording Session on Thursday, Aug. 10, at noon, and perform on Thursday, August 10 at 6:30 pm, as part of the Pennsic Choirs Concert. Your director will provide you with a media release to sign.

name: Family Stick Weaving
description_book: Family-oriented stick weaving. Youth welcome with parent or guardian.
description_web: Family-oriented stick weaving, a simple, weft-based weaving method. Great for making belts and straps. Up-gradable to make everything from shawls to rugs. Fee covers sticks and string; take your work home with you. Youth welcome with parent or guardian.
fee_itemization: Sticks, string, & instructions

name: Youth Rapier Activities
description_book: There will be a variety of youth rapier activities each day including drills, games and one-on-one instruction. Some loaner gear will be available.
description_web: There will be a variety of youth rapier activities each day including drills, games and one-on-one instruction. Some days may include special additional activities. Some loaner gear will be available. Participants do not have to be authorized. Children age 6 and up may participate. Please bring your parent/guardian the first day you attend to learn more about the youth rapier program.

name: Archery Instructor Training
description_book: Following the same curriculum as taught by USA Archery, learn a standard method for teaching archery to beginners. Must be a marshal. **18+**
description_web: Following the same curriculum as taught by USA Archery, students will learn a standard method for teaching archery to beginners. Because of time constraints, you must already be a warranted marshal or an MIT who has already been signed off on range set-up and inspections. We will go over Outfiitting Archers with Equipment, Steps of Shooting, Teaching Your First Class, and Coaching Techniques. For those who have already taken the first three sections, come for the second half of the class. **Age 18+.**
fee_itemization: Hard copies of presentation.

name: Ask a Scribe
description_book: These drop-in classes are ideal for scribes of all levels to speak one-on-one with an experienced scribe for help and advice.
description_web: These are informal drop-in classes for any scribe who's looking for advice, guidance, or help with any aspect of calligraphy and/or illumination. Several different experienced scribes will be hosting these sessions during Peace Week and War Week.

name: Pennsic Youth Theatre
description_book: Kids ages 5-17, join us in creating & performing, from story book to stage, your very own play! Creative minds + theatrical tools = a fun-filled time!
description_web: For kids ages 5-17 interested in exploring their creative and theatrical sides through storytelling, acting, and producing their very own play! Come join us as we build a theatre show from the ground up, giving younger kids a creative outlet for all that pent-up camping energy! Children 12 and under must have a parent or guardian present.

name: Decorated Veils: Part 1, Rolled Hem
description_book: Tired of trying to fold and pin a tiny hem on your veil or garb. There is an easier way. Learn how to sew a rolled hem and end the frustration.
description_web: Tired of trying to fold and pin a tiny hem on your veil or garb. There is an easier way. Learn how to sew a rolled hem and end the frustration. Please bring your own snips or scissors. Fee is not required to participate. You are welcome to bring your own material and sewing supplies.
fee_itemization: $10 gets you 1 yd of 100% linen or silk for a veil, sewing needle and thread. Please bring your own snips or scissors. Fee is not required to participate. You are welcome to bring your own material and sewing supplies.

name: Designing Your Device
description_book: The basic rules of heraldic design will be explained, and the instructor will discuss specific ideas with the individual students. (Bring a pencil.)
description_web: The basic rules of heraldic design will be explained, and the instructor will discuss specific ideas with the individual students. This is intended as a pre-consult to help the student work out a passable design for their device.
fee_itemization: A handout about designing one's device and a worksheet -- a sheet of multiple shields -- and the East Kingdom submission form. Cost is for repro.

name: Known World Webminister Social
description_book: A roundtable discussion and forum for webministers from around the Known World. Discuss issues, exchange ideas and suggestions related to the office.
description_web: A roundtable discussion and forum for webministers from around the Known World. Discuss issues, exchange ideas and suggestions related to the office.

name: Modern Music for the Medievally Minded
description_book: Do you play music by ear or jam with others but wish you had a grasp on reading modern notation? Come learn basics or review music theory.
description_web: Do you play music by ear or jam with others but wish you had a grasp on reading modern notation? Come learn basics or review music theory. Will touch on scales, circle of 5ths, modes, how to find improvisational tonal points, clefs and other basic fundamentals of music and how they relate to what **you** do medievally in music. Think Theory 101 with charts & graphs.
fee_itemization: A photocopied packet of music and information.

name: How to Carve a Viking Duck
description_book: Learn the basics of whittling by making a Viking toy duck in the Birka style. **Age 14+.**
description_web: Learn the basics of whittling by making a Viking toy duck in the Birka style. We will also discuss Viking tools, techniques and sharpening. All tools and materials will be provided. Warning! Very sharp knives are involved. **Students must be at least 14 years old** and have their mother's or wife's permission to attend. Bandages will be provided.
fee_itemization: Instructor is not charging a fee for the materials.

name: How to Make Period Furniture that Packs Flat
description_book: Make medieval-style beds, tables, and chests that pack flat for travel and snap together in minutes. Requires a beginner's skill and simple tools.
description_web: Learn how to make medieval-style beds, tables, and cooler chests that pack flat for travel and snap together in minutes. Requires a beginner's level of skill and simple tools.
fee_itemization: publication costs

name: Ivory Carving Without the Ivory
description_book: An overview discussion of tools, techniques, and substitutions for ivory and marine mammal carving materials.
description_web: Whale teeth, whale bone, plus walrus and elephant ivory were popular carving materials in period that are not useable for most people today so substitutions are necessary. In this class, I will discuss some of those alternate materials as well as the hand tools I've found most useful for working with them. Examples will be available to handle.

name: Lucet Cord for Beginners
description_book: A square lucet cord that dates back to the Viking period can be quickly made for lacing, bag closure or belt hanging.
description_web: Lucet cord has been dated back to the Viking age and throughout the medieval periods. This two-pronged tool is easy to use and makes a quick cord that is not limited in length. This class is an introduction to lucetting and we will make a single color square cord.
fee_itemization:
Lucet $20
Cord and bobbins $5

name: African Medieval History: Christian Kingdoms
description_book: Learn about the rich cultures of historically Christian African empires including Aksum, Nubia, and Ethiopia.

name: Herbalism/Plant Use Safety
description_book: Safety procedures when using plants: proper identification, research, risk prevention, emergency procedures, and biochemical horror stories.
description_web: Plants are used in a variety of SCA activities: cooking, brewing, herbalism, cosmetics, and other fields. Medieval practices often involve plants that modern people are unfamiliar with. To encourage the safest practices possible, this class will cover proper identification of plants, how to research safety concerns, risk prevention, emergency procedures, and biochemical horror stories.
fee_itemization: Printing costs.

name: Finding Your Niche: Getting Started in A&S
description_book: How to find your direction or apply your modern-day expertise when entering into A&S studies.
description_web: Do you feel lost when thinking about A&S topics in the SCA? Do you have a specialty you are good at, but are worried it is not "medieval enough"? This class is an open discussion on how to focus on what you know and what you already do well and apply it toward a more concrete A&S presentation or class. We'll use some examples and do some brainstorming in your particular interests.

name: Gathering of the Louds
description_book: Shawms, sackbutts and curtals, oh my. Join other players of louds. Each session features a different style of music. Bring chair/stand/clothespins.
description_web: Shawms, sackbutts and curtals, oh my. Players of loud Renaissance instruments gather just for fun to play different styles of music at each session such as *intradas* and other instrumental processionals as well as polychoral music. Not sure what these instruments are? Come listen. Do you play recorder and want to play something with more volume? Some instruments (with new reeds) may be available to try, but this is not a class for beginners. A reading knowledge of music is necessary. Bring a chair, music stand, and clothespins.

name: *Seishin-ryū Chadō Okeiko*: Tea Ceremony Workshop
description_book: Learn the rudiments of *wabi*-style tea including both the role of the host and the role of the guest. This is a multi-part workshop for beginners.
description_web:
Learn the rudiments of *wabi*-style tea including both the role of the host and the role of the guest. This is a multi-part workshop for beginners. Please come to as many classes as possible. 
*Okeiko* means "honorable practice". Both the role of the guest and the role of the host will be introduced. You will learn something new in each workshop. We will begin with walking and bowing and progress to the rudiments of preparing and consuming a bowl of *matcha*. Limited materials will be available for student use during the workshop. 
If you are interested in purchasing materials for long-term personal use, then you should acquire a guest kit and a *fukusa*: 
A guest kit for men can be acquired at http://www.teadogu.com/guest-starter-kit-man339.html
A guest kit for women can be acquired at http://www.teadogu.com/guest-starter-kit-woman339.html
A *fukusa* for men can be acquired at http://www.teadogu.com/fumepunu9si.html
A *fukusa* for women can be acquired at http://www.teadogu.com/fuworenu9si.html
While it is possible to save money by ordering directly from Japan, doing so requires dealing with Japanese online storefronts. A note about *fukusa*. A number #9 *fukusa* is much easier to manipulate than *fukusa* with lower numbers. Paying extra is worth the price. A *fukusa* and a fan are what  you need to practice during class. I have an extremely limited number of loaner *fukusa*. You can substitute a number of items  for a fan. Please read the online descriptions of the fans carefully if you choose to provide a substitute or acquire a fan from another source.
There are a number of ways to acquire a 袱紗 *fukusa*. You can even try to make one, but please don't until you know what they are supposed to be like. There is some controversy over just how old they are. Today, men use slightly larger *fukusa* than women do. Further, men always use purple *fukusa* and women typically only use purple *fukusa* after they have become senior instructors. Regardless, here are purchase options. (1) You can always try ebay. (2) You can order online from any of several tea supply stores in Japan through rakuten.co.jp. (3) You can order one from a fellow in Portland http://www.teadogu.com/fukusa.html. (Yes, they really are that expensive.) I will try to pick up a couple of loaners (I currently have one) between now and Pennsic. Regardless, the fan is the symbol of the guest, and the *fukusa* is the symbol of the host in the world of tea.
fee_itemization: This class will include a multi-page printed handout.

name: Sixteen-Strand *Kumihimo* on the *Marudai*
description_book: *Kumihimo* braiding on the *marudai*. Various 16-strand braids. Please bring your own material equipment if you have it.
description_web: *Kumihimo* braiding on the round braiding stand is faster and more traditional than braiding on a disc or plate. Join us for this workshop and learn this craft from the novice level, advance your skill by learning a new braid, or share your expert knowledge. Handouts for multiple braids will be available, and I will have a stack of books for reference. If you are really just getting started, please attend the setup class on Sunday to save time in this workshop. Please bring your own equipment and materials if you have it, otherwise some equipment and materials can be provided.

name: Beginner Dance: *Petits Vriens* Two Ways!
description_book: Come try two different versions of *Petits Vriens*, one for three people and the other for three couples! All levels welcome and catered to!
description_web: Come try two different versions of *Petits Vriens*, one for three people and the other for three couples! All levels welcome and catered to!

name: Youth Beginning Basket Weaving
description_book: We will make a small reed basket. It's not going to be complicated so it's perfect for learning.
fee_itemization: 5- reeds for baskets

name: Glass Gilding: *Verre Églomisé*
description_book: Roman to medieval, glass gilding creates detailed linear drawings with gold on glass. Learn about and create a period glass gilded artwork.
description_web: Glass gilding, or *verre églomisé*, was used in Roman antiquity and reached great popularity in the 14th and 15th centuries. It was incorporated into reliquaries, furniture, and *objects d'art*. Create a small *verre églomisé* work using gelatin water gilding technique. Hands-on!
fee_itemization: 22k gold leaf, glass, glue, tools

name: Storytelling Academy
description_book: Explore genres, tools, styles, and uses of storytelling. Cultural and medieval approaches, applications, performance coaching. New topics each day.
description_web: During this academy, students will gain knowledge about the history and techniques for storytelling both in the SCA and the modern world. Students may attend individual sessions or all of the academy. There may be guest teachers and will be time for students to practice and receive feedback. The academy may culminate in a student performance. No classes are repeated. The focus is on developing comfort, nurturing, and honing skills within the students’ capabilities. All levels are welcome. Students may view a class outline at the academy space, Minerva’s Spindle 158, where classes will also be listed on the message board. Seating is limited; feel free to bring your own chair. Student Performance, date, time, and location will be announced.

name: Natural Hair Dye: Henna and Beyond
description_book: Use period dye techniques and materials to make your hair red, black, brown, or just shinier, healthier, and longer than ever. **Bring chairs.**
description_web: Learn how to use period dye techniques and materials to make your hair red, black, brown, or just shinier, healthier, and longer than ever. We'll focus on henna but explore other herbs to color and protect hair naturally without dangerous chemicals. Some supplies will be available at the class. **Please bring chairs.**

name: Known World Choir Rehearsals
description_book: Join the oldest Pennsic Choir as we rehearse in preparation for a concert on Thursday of War Week. Previous KWC Directors have been invited.
description_web: The Known World Choir, along with the Children's and Youth Choirs, and *Chorulus Pennsicus* will present a concert of medieval and Renaissance choral literature. Previous Directors of the KWC have been invited to conduct a selection. Bring a 1/2 inch black binder or plan to purchase one for use during the concert for $5. **Over age 18.** (There is a Youth Choir for those 12-18.)
fee_itemization: Copies of KWC Literature. $5 more if you wish to keep the 1/2 Inch Black Binder

name: Pre-School  Playgroup
description_book: Let our preschoolers tire each other out! Let the parents and guardians make friends! Meets at Toddler Lounge Shade by playground

name: Known World Rapier Cadet Tournament
description_book: Open to those sponsored by a person with a rapier peerage or high level award for rapier. Format: traditional double elimination tourney.
description_web: Come join rapier combatants from across the Known World in the Pennsic Annual Cadet Tournament. This tournament will be open to those who do not have a rapier high order or Peerage, and are sponsored by a person who has a rapier peerage or kingdom’s high Order award for rapier. This includes the Order of Defense, Order of the White Scarf, Order of the Bronze Ring, Order of the Golden Rapier, The Dragon's Steel, The Order of Thorbjorn's Hammer, The Order of the Queen's Blade, The Meridian Order of the Blade, or equivalent award. A person may sponsor more than one entrant. Sponsors will be required to sign in their cadet or send a letter of entrance. If you need a sponsor, we will find one for you. This will be a traditional double elimination tournament. Each bout shall be fought to a single kill. Double kills will be re-fought one time. On the second double kill, “Dead is dead!” The finals will be fought best two out of three. All bouts shall be fought with default Pennsic rules.

name: Silent Signals: Ways to Communicate While in Helm
description_book: Explaining set motions for those who cannot hear verbal cues in helm whether rapier or armored & tournament using them.
description_web: Seeing more and more people who cannot understand verbal cues in helm whether rapier or armored, this is a project to help people understand what the other combatant is saying. It was originally designed to help the hard of hearing be able to communicate while in helm. However, it has been shown to be extremely helpful to anyone in a helm or mask. Wanting more and more people to enjoy their respective sport is imperative and hopefully retain those who struggled previously.

location: The Camp of the Three Bears (N17 along Battle Road)
name: Anglo-Saxon Cookery
description_book: A discussion and demonstration of Anglo Saxon cooking.

name: How to Be Heard: Vocal Techniques to get **LOUD**
description_book: Modern theatrical vocal techniques to be heard loudly and distinctly on the field or in Court. Drop-in, take one session or multiple.
description_web: Modern theatrical vocal techniques for the Creative Anachronist to help you be heard loudly and distinctly on the field or in Court. We will learn and practice a vocal warm-up designed to enhance breath, resonance, and diction. Class is led by a professional actor and teaching artist. Attend any or all sessions, you do **NOT** need to be at all classes to fully participate.

name: Weed Walk
description_book: Wild plant identification. Wear walking shoes and hat; leave from Univ. Point. Different teachers on different days; walk with us more than once!
description_web: Cooper's Lake abounds with medicinal and food plants that were used by various primitive and medieval cultures. Learn to identify them during a walk around the campsite. The walk will take place rain or shine. Please wear sturdy shoes and a hat. Meet at University Point for the start of the class. We have multiple teachers, so if you attend more than one walk, you will likely learn different things!

location: Heralds Point (Herald's Point, behind the playground. )
name: Heralds' Mentoring Meet-Up at Heralds' Point
description_book: A heraldic staff member will discuss your mentoring needs (armory or names). We will find you someone to shadow.
description_web: A heraldic staff member will discuss your mentoring needs (armory or names). We will find you someone to shadow.

name: Known World Adventurers Guild: **Walk Day**
description_book: Teen explorers (and youth 10+) will gather information via supervised Pennsic site walks. All activities begin and end at Family Point. KWAGuild.com.
description_web:
**WANTED**: Teen adventurers (and youth 10+) with a thirst for exploration, cultural exchange, and making friends within the SCA. Guildmistress Marian of Heatherdale invites you to join KWAG (the Known World Adventurers Guild) here at Pennsic 50. Her noble company of young explorers will gather information through supervised in-person walks around the Pennsic site. Who knows who you'll meet... Visiting royalty? One of the SCA's Founders? Someone from the esteemed Cooper Family? Come and find out. KWAG activities run throughout both weeks, and alternate between KWAG Walk Days and KWAG Social Days. All activities begin and end at Family Point. Everyone is welcome! Please note: this is an active class. The group will be walking to various public locations on the Pennsic site (no private camps). All participants should wear sturdy shoes, a hat and sunscreen, and bring water. More info at KWAGuild.com.
     **INFO FOR PARENTS/CAREGIVERS:**  KWAG classes are designed for teens and older children (10+). All activities will be supervised by a warranted and background-checked youth officer plus at least one other responsible adult. All abilities are happily welcomed. Please email heather@heatherdale.com if we can help provide any special accommodations in advance. Parents and caregivers are very welcome to join the walks, and are encouraged to accompany their kids if any special needs might affect the child's enjoyment of the classes.

instructor: Master Piero di Paxiti da Vincenza
name: Medieval Miniatures: The Stick Figure Method
description_book: Drawing 14th- and 15th-century miniatures can seem very threatening, but I will show you a simple method to make it less intimidating!

name: Archery Populace Point Shoot
description_book: Shoot the Castle Window, Soldier Shoot, and Clout for Points.
description_web:
Format: The Pennsic Populace Archery War Point consists of three separate shoots; each shoot is worth 1 War Point for a total of 3 War Points. The winner of each shoot is determined by total number of points tallied by archers over the course of the War. Scores will be tallied each day and posted in the Marshals' Tent. Any member of the populace may participate.
Multiple individuals may share a bow; however, it must be inspected with each user to ensure safety.

Description: There are 3 parts to the populace shoot.
Castle Clout Shoot (1 War Point): The target is a simulated castle turret. Archers will be shooting at about 100 yards into a square of approximately 27 feet by 27 feet giving an approximate area of 729 square feet. There will be a moat monster protecting the castle in front at about 50 yards. This is an untimed shoot; archers are allowed 6 arrows or bolts. Scoring for this shoot is as follows:
1 point for inside the moat.
2 points for hitting the moat monster.
3 points for inside the castle.
4 points for hitting objects inside the castle.

Soldier Shoot (1 War Point): The archers will shoot 6 arrows or bolts, untimed, at the soldiers that are invading. These targets will be set at approximately 15 yards, 35 yards, 45 yards, and 55 yards. Any arrow or bolt hitting the painted portion of the target scores as follows:
1 point for the 15-yard target.
2 points for the 35-yard target.
3 points for the 45-yard target.
4 points for the 55-yard target.

Castle Window Shoot (1 War Point): Archers will shoot 6 arrows or bolts, untimed, at a castle window located between 25 and 35 yards. The castle window will be at least 8 inches wide and 36 inches tall. There will be an object inside the castle window. Scoring will be as follows: 1 point for each arrow or bolt inside the castle window, 2 points for each arrow or bolt inside the object in the castle window.

name: Fall of Constantinople 1453
description_book: The end of the Middle Ages. The city that couldn’t possibly fall—fell.
description_web: The end of the Middle Ages. The Roman Empire lasted for 1,480 years. They lasted the longest in the east: 1,123 Years and 18 Days. But that all came to an end on May 29, 1453. Warfare would never be the same again. The city that couldn’t possibly fall—fell. The Turks changed the name to Istanbul, meaning “The City.” But it would both unleash the Ottomans on Europe and start the age of discovery that would end up locating the New World.

name: The History of Kissing - CCt
description_book: Juliet stated "palm to palm is holy palmers' kiss", but what do we know about the kiss in period? Our lips aren't sealed; learn the history. **18+**
description_web: Juliet stated "palm to palm is holy palmers' kiss", but what do we know about the kiss in period? Our lips aren't sealed; come learn the history of the kiss. **Age 18+.**

name: Heian Get Ready With Me: Traveling Outfit
description_book: Demonstration of how to use modern theatrical makeup to achieve a period aesthetic and how to put on a traveling outfit without help.
description_web: See the process of getting dressed in a Heian Japanese traveling outfit from makeup to hat.  Demonstration of modern theatrical makeup application to achieve a plausibly period look and discussion of how to manage with more or less makeup and time. Demonstration of how to get dressed in the ensemble's multiple layers without assistance.

name: Divination by Sortilege One: Casting of Lots
description_book: Divination by sortilege: the interpretation of randomized symbols, such as tossed coins, runes, dice, and bibliomancy.
description_web: Divination by sortilege, or interpretation of randomized objects, such as coins, bones, dice, runes, cards, pages of books. We will demonstrate many of these systems, performing live tests by calling on them each to answer a question from the class. Stay for Part Two: divination with cards, including tarot.

name: Women Warriors of the Middle Ages
description_book: We will discuss women who donned armor, picked up weapons, and fought alongside their male counterparts.
description_web: We will discuss women who donned armor, picked up weapons, and fought alongside their male counterparts. Were they really so unusual? Why did they choose to forgo traditional women’s roles? What’s fact and what’s fiction? Come and hear their stories and learn more about these wondrous warrior women.

name: Deeper Look at Textiles & Trim of Viking Age Dress
description_book: By investigating extant textiles, we'll help make informed choices for selecting fabrics and adding details to Viking Age garments.
description_web: By looking deeper at both the textiles and the details from extant items, this class aims to help individuals make informed choices for crafting their garments. Textile examples will clarify the weaves and weights of period fabrics and there will also be discussion of possible modern substitutions. Additionally, practical details for finishing or embellishing garments will be explored and their history investigated. The goal of this class is to help the individual understand how daily life during the Viking Age could affect how textiles were crafted and worn.
fee_itemization: A link will be provided for download for free.  Hardcopy in color will be $20 (60-page document that is mostly in color that is bound with indexed tabs).

name: Needle-Lace Class 1: Prepare the Window
description_book: Students will create a fabric piece prepped and ready to execute a lace design (which will be covered in a subsequent class).
description_web: The earliest forms of needle-lace involved cutting holes into the fabric and then filling those holes back in with decorative stiches. This hands-on class will cover the initial steps you need to prepare the fabric before starting the actual lace. We will learn pulling threads, window edging, hemming and the many helpful uses of starch. Students attending this class will create a fabric piece prepped and ready to execute the lace design (which will be covered in a subsequent class).
fee_itemization: needles, thread, linen, loan of embroidery hoop, loan of 6.0 magnification

name: Evidence-Based Viking Male Clothing
description_book: What can we learn from archaeological, historical, and literary sources about Norse male clothing during the Viking era?
description_web: What can we learn from archaeological, historical, and literary sources about Norse male clothing during the Viking era? Are you committing a deadly reenactorism, or is your garb Hedeby-erific?  We'll talk through several sources of evidence, suggest choices to make or avoid, and if the weather isn't too hot, show some reconstructions with the instructor as model.

name: Getting Started in the SCA
description_book: Finding your place in the culture of the SCA. How to get connected and involved on a local level.
description_web: An introduction to getting involved in the SCA, including how to get connected with your local group and what to expect at your first (non-Pennsic) event. Some tips for figuring out the culture of the SCA overall as well as your local group. Strategies for finding the fun will be discussed.

name: Two Fifteenth-Century Triples: *Vita* & *Voltate*
description_book: Come learn two lovely dances from the 15th century: *Vita di Colino* and *Voltate in Ça Rosina*! Beginners welcome, all ages welcome.
description_web: Come learn two lovely dances from the 15th century: *Vita di Colino* and *Voltate in Ça Rosina*! Beginners welcome, all ages welcome.

name: *Mikado*: Japanese Pick-up Sticks
description_book: Remember how much fun pick-up sticks was? Come learn to play, then stay for a round-robin competition. Winner gets a set of sticks with the rules.
description_web: Remember how much fun pick-up sticks was? Come learn to play, then stay for a round-robin competition. Winner gets a set of sticks with the rules.

name: Arabic Hip Movements
description_book: A study of various shimmies, slides and circles from a Syrian Classic Oriental dance perspective. A beginning knowledge of ME Dance is appreciated.
description_web: A study of various shimmies, slides and circles from a Syrian Classic Oriental dance perspective, taught by Baroness Simone. A beginning knowledge of Middle Eastern dance is appreciated.

name: Ansteorra Rapier Tournament
description_book: The Kingdom of Ansteorra invites you to our prestigious rapier tournament.

name: Turkish Split Finger Drumming Technique
description_book: Intermediate to advanced. This exciting *Darbuka* style will elevate your playing and open up a world of different sounds and drum possibilities

name: *Commedia* All Stars **Rehearsal**
description_book: Rehearsal for *Commedia* All Stars troupe: Saturday, Aug. 5, through and including Thursday, Aug. 10, daily, from 11:00 am - 1:00 pm.
description_web: Rehearsal for *Commedia* All Stars troupe: Saturday, Aug. 5, through and including Thursday, Aug. 10, daily, from 11:00 am - 1:00 pm.

name: Chinese Diapering: Carved Lacquer of Ming Dynasty
description_book: You'll never lack for scroll ideas when you take inspiration from Ming Dynasty lacquer! Learn how in this hands-on scribal class.

name: Parchment Embellishment and Repair with Needlework
description_book: Needlework on manuscripts, seen 13th -14th c, using stitches later seen in Italian needlelace. Examples and techniques, with supplies to try it.

name: Bardic Video Voodoo
description_book: Discussing many of the methods & special effects used in making our concert videos. We hope to encourage other bards to follow in our footsteps.
description_web:
Master Cerian Cantwr and Master John Inchingham the Fool describe and discuss many of the methods and cool special effects they have been utilizing to create their latest YouTube videos. They hope to de-mystify the basic tools and techniques they have been experimenting with, in the hope of encouraging other bards to follow in their footsteps. While it would be useful to have previously viewed some or all of "Another Pennsic Denied Concert" (most of the video examples that Cerian and John will use can be found there), it is not a requirement.

Please join us and learn from our mistakes so that you can make new ones.
The power of Bardic Video Voodoo can be yours.

Class Notes - https://tilted-windmill.com/uploads/bardic_video_voodoo.docx

Another Pennsic Denied Concert - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Mj97uu65nTg
A Pennsic Denied Concert - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3ROMwDOOLzk

name: Archaeology of Caesarea: Crusaders and Templars
description_book: Archaeologists have uncovered Crusader features plus artifacts along the coast of the Mediterranean. See a face reconstructed by Jen Clark.
description_web: Archaeologists have uncovered features (gates, towers, walls, burials, etc.) and artifacts (coins, pottery, lamps, etc.) left by the Crusaders along the coast of the Mediterranean. See a face of a burial that may have been a Templar Knight reconstructed by Jen Clark (Baroness Amani Ahmad ibn Masha’al al-Sabti al-Dulaymi). Some historical discussion, but more archaeology.
fee_itemization: photocopy handout of artifact drawings

name: Medieval Business Practices
description_book: Explore how modern accounting practices evolved following the changes in business during the Middle Ages and Renaissance.
description_web: The most basic accounting techniques used by businesses worldwide today had their start in 12th- and 13th-century Europe, and continued being refined throughout the Renaissance. This class teaches about the sweeping changes in trade that made this evolution necessary...and also changed the face of Europe.

name: Navigating by the Stars
description_book: Learn a critical medieval skill: how to navigate by the stars, moon, and sun! Simple and advanced navigational tricks for orienteering.
description_web: Learn a critical medieval skill: how to navigate by the stars, moon, and sun! All skill levels covered, from "I can't find Orion" to "I have built my own telescope." I will explain simple and advanced navigational tricks so that anyone can orient themselves at any time. Handy whether you're lost in the Bog, a survivalist, or simply want to know what your persona would have known. Please note: This is a daytime astronomy class!
fee_itemization: Handout -- $1 donation

name: A Bardic Primer
description_book: “You’re only as good as your next performance.” If it will be your first, how to be ready. If you have performed before, how to be better each time.

name: How to Make Marzipan
description_book: A hands-on class on the history of and how to make marzipan. Students need to bring their own chef's knife, mortar and pestle.
fee_itemization: 2$ for handouts and 2$ for almonds and sugar used in class

name: Pilgrimage and Power: The Travelling Outfit
description_book: Discussion of why Heian noblewomen went on pilgrimage and what they wore.
description_web: While the life of a Heian noblewoman was fairly sedentary, she could take pilgrimages to temples near the capitol, Heiankyo. We will discuss the reasons noble women of the Heian period (794-1186) undertook these pilgrimages and what they wore on those journeys.

name: Divination by Sortilege Two: Cards Including Tarot
description_book: Cartomancy, fortune-telling with regular 52 and tarot decks. Attending Part One recommended but not required.
description_web: Cartomancy. Imagine a storybook filled with pages and pictures, but with the spine removed, and the pages reordered by Dame Fortuna to tell each person's life story. That book is a deck of cards, and this class will teach you how to read it. Fortune-telling theory and practice with regular and tarot decks. We will end class with a miraculous demonstration of the seer's art.

name: Introduction to Goldwork
description_book: This is a historical overview of types of gold threads and bullion used in period, with some show-and-tell and advice on how to get started.
description_web: This is a historical overview of types of gold threads and bullion used in period, with some show-and-tell and advice on how to get started and where to find the materials.

name: African Spices
description_book: Bring jars and take home *Berbere, Piripiri, Harissa* and preserved lemons.
description_web: Bring jars and take home *Berbere, Piripiri, Harissa* and preserved lemons. Ingredients and recipes will be provided so you can make some of the spice blends and condiments used on the African continent. We will definitely make the four listed but it is possible to make other blends with the same spices. Bring 4 small (8 oz) jars/bottles for the spices and a quart mason jar equivalent for the lemons.
fee_itemization: $2 for the recipes,$5 for lemons and spices =$7

name: Pirates
description_book: Pirate in the Middle Ages (worldwide).
description_web: The Most Wanted Outlaws in the World. Who doesn’t love a good pirate story? Pirate names are part of our lore: Blackbeard, Captain Kidd, and Bartholomew Roberts. They live in literature through Long John Silver and Billy Bones. Yet piracy has an ancient history. Julius Caesar was once captured by pirates! Take a tour through the history of sheltered anchorages and deserted beaches in search of ships flying the Jolly Roger.

name: Show What You Know: Demystifying A&S Documentation
description_book: Members of the EK A&S Ministry will talk about what documentation is, what the goals of good documentation are, and why we are even talking about it.
description_web: Have you heard people talking about "documentation" but felt unsure what it's all about? Does it feel like something you want to explore, but you're not sure what goes into it? Members of the East Kingdom A&S Ministry will talk about what documentation is, what the goals of good documentation are, and why we are even talking about documentation at all.

name: Hitchhiker's Guide to the SCA: Don’t Panic
description_book: New to the SCA and events? Learn tips and tricks, ask questions free of judgment!
description_web: Beginner's guide to the SCA, Pennsic and other activities. Get your SCA questions answered in a judgment-free zone. Taught by someone who grew up in the SCA, and is a current officer of Dragonship Haven, East Kingdom. Includes a young adult perspective.
fee_itemization: N/A

name: 15th-Century Italian Steps
description_book: This class will explain basic steps and patterns, and then teach fun, simple dances from 15th-century Italy.
description_web: Never danced before? Unfamiliar with Italian dance steps? No problem! This class will explain basic steps and patterns, and then teach fun, simple dances from 15th-century Italy.

name: Renaissance Fritters
description_book: Fritters of apples, dried grapes, and pine nuts.  Fritters of carrots. Lenten leaven fritters.
description_web: Fritters made with apples, dried grapes, and pine nuts.  Made with flour, sugar, apples, raisins, pine nuts, candied citron, sweet wine, olive oil, and saffron. Cooked in olive oil and garnished with honey and sugar. Carrot fritters made with carrots, flour, raisins, saffron, sweet wine, water. Cooked in olive oil and garnished with honey and sugar. Lenten leaven fritters are made with flour, yeast, oil, sugar, rose water, water, and saffron. Cooked in olive oil and garnished with sugar.

name: History of Printed Textiles
description_book: History of printed textiles and clothing from prehistoric clues of its origins to documented practices in the Middle Ages.
description_web:
A historic review of printed textiles and clothing from prehistoric clues of its origins to documented practices in the Middle Ages.
First, we will discuss the difference between block printing, stenciling/screen printing, resist dyeing, mordant dyeing, discharge dyeing, and hand-painting on textiles - and even see a few period combinations of the above techniques!
We will address the known uses of these techniques around the world, including (modernly) China, Japan, India, Egypt, Russia, Ukraine, Iran, Iraq, Italy, Germany, Spain, and Peru as the known major centers. See dozens of photos of surviving samples from around the world and learn about the actual processes used to print textiles. Please note: We will **not** actually be doing any block printing in this class as there are other fantastic classes that will offer those opportunities! A full-color handout will be made available online.

name: Knowne World Printed Textiles Gathering
description_book: The second annual Knowne World Printed Textiles Gathering: See different techniques! Meet some makers! Share your love of printed textiles!
description_web:
The second annual Knowne World Printed Textiles Gathering will be hosted in the Midrealm Royal encampment from 12:00 to 5:00 pm ET on Tuesday, August 8, 2022.

12:00 - 2:00: The class "History of Printed Textiles" will be taught by Laureate Aveline de Ceresbroch and Mistress Tatiana Melville. 
2:00 - 3:00: Show us your best printed garment!  Printed Textiles Fashion Show
2:00 - 5:00: Hands-on textile printing and block carving opportunities

Don't have a printed garment? That's okay, come learn how to print on textiles? See different techniques! Meet some makers! Share your love of printed textiles!

More details will be announced very soon about the Events, Activities, and Displays you can expect to see and partake in at the gathering!

name: Lady Brains in Martial Tournaments
description_book: Psychology and the Fencing Woman series: Lady brains, adrenaline, compartmentalization, and tournaments.
description_web: Taken from Master Gwynn's *Psychology and the Fencing Woman* manual: this part of the series will address how female brains respond to adrenaline, how they do (not) compartmentalize, what this all means for her practices and tourney fights.

name: Known World Baronial Youth Champion's Tournament
description_book: Youth Champions Tournament
description_web: A tournament where Baronies champion a Youth Fighter and try to bring victory, glory, and honor to their Baronies.

name: Belly Dance Veil: More than a Prop, a Partner!
description_book: How to think of your veil as a partner and not just prop. Familiarity with Middle Eastern dance appreciated. Veils available to borrow for class.

name: Whitework Illumination
description_book: Using white paint on scrolls. Tips and tricks for painting clear, crisp lines and shaded designs (cameo). Class for all levels of experience.
description_web: Tips and tricks that will help scribes paint two main styles of whitework ... crisp, clean, white embellishments on colored backgrounds and monochromatic shading.
fee_itemization:
Total cost of class $2
Each attendee will receive a multi page handout & prepared design on watercolor paper
Additional materials (Paints, brushes, etc) will be available for use by those who do not have them+

name: Spinning in the Hand
description_book: Learn to prep wool, make a hand-spindle and distaff, and spin wool. For those new to spinning, failed at drop-spinning, or still learning.
description_web: Failed at drop-spinning? Want to improve your draft? Want to learn spinning for the first time? In this class, we will go over preparing wool for spinning (card, comb, hand), build a hand spindle and distaff. We'll practice drafting and spinning "in the hand", while discussing the history of spinning, and variety of different cultural techniques.
fee_itemization: $2 for spindle & distaff

name: Inkle Weaving Advanced: Baltic Pickup Weave
description_book: Learn an advanced technique on the inkle loom, Baltic-style pickup.
description_web: This class is for those who know the basics of inkle weaving. We will learn the Baltic pickup technique: how to warp the loom for Baltic pickup, how to read a draft, and draft your own patterns. It is recommended you have your own loom, but looms will be available for use.
fee_itemization:
Handout 
Supplies provided, yarn and supplies needed

name: Nigel's Fire-Starting Class
description_book: You too can start a fire with flint and steel. Explore the history of fire and how to start a fire with flint and steel. You will make fire. **14+**
description_web: Formerly titled “How to Start a Fire Like a Moderately Intelligent Saxon”. Yes, you too can start a fire with flint and steel like a Saxon, Roman, Viking, or any other civilized culture in the Middle Ages. Includes history of fire and the flint-and-steel mechanics of starting a fire. Hands-on class; you will start a fire. **You must be at least 14 years old** and have your parents' or wife’s permission.
fee_itemization: Instructor is not charging for the materials.

name: Make Your Own Roman-Style Brooch (*Fibula*)
description_book: Make your own Roman-style brooch/*fibula* from wire and a package of glass/metal beads. Tools available. Bring yours, if possible. **Age 12+.**
description_web: You will enjoy learning how to make your own Roman-style brooch or *fibula* from wire and a package of glass/metal beads. Jewelry-making tools will be available, but if you have your own, **please** bring them along. **Age 12+.**
fee_itemization: includes wire, beads and use of tools.  If you have your own jewellery tools, please bring them along.

name: Game On! Medieval Board Games (Teens and Tweens)
description_book: Easy to learn, hard to master. Learn *Rota*, *Six Men's Morris*, and *Fox and Geese*. Everything you need to play these two-player games.
description_web: Most medieval and classical board games are fairly simple to learn to play, but hard to master. Attendees will learn how to play *Rota*, *Fox and Geese*, *Ming Mang*, and *Six Men's Morris*. All attendees will leave with copies of the rules and game boards for each game, with enough game tokens to play all three games. This class is for Youths and Teens, ages 11-17.

name: Introduction to 14th-Century German Brickstitch
description_book: Intro to 14-15th-century German brickstitch. First hour is hands-on; the second is open discussion with my references and research.
description_web: A basic introduction to a simple counted-thread technique used in 14-15th-century Germany. In the first hour the class will cover the basic stitches, and work on a project to take away to finish. In remaining time there will be an open discussion of the design features and history, and lots of pictures to look at (**New research! New patterns!**). Fee includes handout and materials. The number of kits is limited, but the class is open to all (or as many as will fit).
fee_itemization: Covers the cost of materials for the embroidery kit

name: Archaeology of the Vikings
description_book: Discussion of history and archaeology of the Vikings.
description_web: Viking Long Ships... of course, but what about all of the other arts and crafts (metal, textile, bone carving, etc.)? Plus, a debate on when did the Viking Age end. Get the perspective of a professional archaeologist who has seen lots!
fee_itemization: fee covers photocopies of Viking artifacts.

name: Wire Jewelry
description_book: Learn the basics of wire jewelry and make a bracelet or medallion hanger. Bring tools and materials if you have them.
description_web: Learn the basics of wire jewelry (making links with beads on them) and make a bracelet or medallion hanger. **Note: Class does not include wrapping a stone or bead**. Please bring tools, wire and beads if you have them. There will be some tools available to borrow and some to purchase at cost.
fee_itemization:
$2 - beads, wire, clasp
$10-$20 - Tools

name: Honey Tasting: The Finest Honeys of the World!
description_book: This is a honey tasting and story telling. The finest world honeys will be sampled from Yemen to Crete, USA to Croatia.
description_web: This is a honey tasting and story telling brought to you by a world traveling beekeeper. The finest honeys of the world will be sampled... from Yemen to Crete, USA to Croatia. We'll cover the honey mentioned by Pliny the Elder to be the finest in the Roman world, to the world's most expensive honey. You will get to explore your palate and write down your thoughts on each.  Bring water to cleanse your palate.
fee_itemization: Handouts, tasting spoons, and these honey's are expensive, especially Sidr at $600/bottle. I'm just trying to break even.

name: The History of Playing Cards and Tarot
description_book: Trace playing cards from the Han Dynasty cards depicting coins and rolls of coins to the tarot cards recently published in Æthelmearc.

name: Persian Gardens
description_book: This class examines Persian gardens in reality, art, poetry, and religion.
fee_itemization: Color copying - 20 pages

name: Who’s That in the Hat?
description_book: An introduction to officers, medallions, titles, and coronets in the SCA.
description_web: An introduction to officers, medallions, titles, and coronets in the SCA.

name: *Il Titolo Provvisorio* Rehearsal
description_book: Closed rehearsal for *Il Titolo Provvisorio*.

location: Brandr Forge (Booth 75 - Corner of Street of Gold)
name: Basic Blacksmithing
description_book: Learn the basics of blacksmithing, some history in the class, and you get to hit hot steel with a hammer.
description_web: Learn the basics of blacksmithing, some history in the class, and you get to hit hot steel with a hammer.

name: 15th-Century Italian Dances for Couples
description_book: Covers 15th-century Italian dances set for a single couple: *Petite Rose, Leoncello*, and *Rostiboli Gioioso*.

name: Canvas Sheet Wall Painting Techniques
description_book:
Demos of materials and tools to create artwork for your sheet walls etc.
Faux stone techniques, faux metal/rust & simple wood graining. Limit to 20.
description_web:
Demonstrations of materials and tools to use to create artwork for your sheet walls or tent. Includes using oil paints, shellac, faux gold leaf, varnishes and glazes etc. 
There's also a demo on faux stone techniques using foam board and faux metal/ rust on wood and simple wood graining.
Given in a private camp; seating is limited. Limit to 20.

name: Secret Codes and Hidden Messages
description_book: Have you ever wanted to send a secret message to a friend? Learn about secret codes and hidden messages that were used in medieval times.
description_web: Students will learn how to code and de-code secret messages using various encryption tools like Caesar's ciphers and *scytales* (wrapping the message around a rod). Students will make and can keep their own decoding tools.

name: Youth Early Scandinavian Braids: Advanced
description_book: Took the beginner class and want to learn more? This class will recreate a multi-purpose 12-strand braid found at Viborg, Mammen, and Oseberg.
description_web: Looking to learn more? This class will offer an additional braiding technique that is more advanced.  This class will recreate a multi-purpose 12-strand braid found at Viborg, Mammen, and Oseberg. Its usage includes trim on a tunic, decoration on other objects, garters, carrying straps, and holding a ship rudder.

name: "Viking Chess" and Other *Tafl* Games
description_book: Learn the history and play of *Tafl* games.
description_web: *Tafl* games were a popular family of board games across Northern Europe through the Viking age. In this class I will discuss the history of *Tafl* games, some notable finds involving probable *tafl* sets, and teach you the basic rules of play.

name: Introduction to *Pysanky*
description_book: Learn about the rich history of Ukrainian embellished eggs, and try your hand at this "Queen of Folk Arts". Lecture, discussion, and make-and-take.
description_web: *Pysanky* are highly embellished eggs used for centuries in Easter and Vernal Equinox celebrations in many Slavic nations, including modern Ukraine, Poland, and Romania. Come learn about the history, symbolism, and significance of this "Queen of Folk Arts," and make your own *pysanka* to take with you. All materials and tools will be provided. The dyes are permanent, so wear old garb!
fee_itemization: for the tools and materials to make the pysanky

name: Beyond the Cloth: Persona Glassware, Late Period
description_book: Discussion of glassware from the Late Middle Ages to the Renaissance, including Europe, the Middle East, and parts of Asia.
description_web: Have you ever walked around an event with a glass in your hand? People will notice it long before they even think about looking at your shoes. Make a statement by having the right kind of vessel for your persona! Discussion of glassware from the Late Middle Ages to the Renaissance, including Europe, the Middle East, and parts of Asia. Join us again at 3:00 pm for a live, narrated demonstration of the making of a Late Period drinking vessel by Master Ali (Arab Boy)or Magistra Gnaea Celera.

name: *In Nomines*: Practicum.
description_book: *In Nomines* are instrumental pieces for players of uneven skill, consisting of several fantasia lines and one *cantus firmus*. We will play several.
description_web: *In Nomines* are instrumental pieces for players of uneven skill, consisting of several fantasia lines and one *cantus firmus*, from the late 16th century. We will play several. Bring your instrument and music stand if you have one. All ages welcome.

name: *PA Afternoon Series*: European Music Expo
description_book: Come experience the variety of music from the 11th-16th centuries. Bring your voices, instruments, and play along!
description_web: Come and enjoy an afternoon of European music and harpers. Experience vocal and harp music from the 11th-16th centuries. Bring your voices, instruments, and play along!

name: Lucet Basics
description_book: Make a square cord and a two-color cord. Lucet, string, and instructions provided as part of the class fee.
description_web: Make a square cord and a two-color cord. Lucet, string, and instructions provided as part of the class fee.
fee_itemization: Lucet, string & instructions

name: Post-Apocalypse: The Walking *Dum*
description_book: Begintermediate and pre-advanced rhythms to get beyond the basic rhythms. Different rhythms each day. **Bring your own drum.**
description_web: This is a begintermediate/pre-advanced  drumming class. Rhythm exercises to strengthen both right and left hands with different accents. Learn different rhythms and patterns beyond the basic 2, 4, and 8 counts. **Bring your own drum**.

name: Children's Choir
description_book: For children 13 and younger. Sing music in a period style. Meets daily. Performance on Thursday of War Week!
description_web: For children 13 and younger. Sing music in a period style. Meets daily. Performance on Thursday of War Week! Responsible adult needs to be within reach for the younger ones. Bring a folder to hold music. We will teach rounds, songs and melodies from the medieval to Renaissance. Session will be 45 minutes. Dress rehearsal in PA tent on Thursday with a performance at 6 pm.

name: Blackletter: Make It Better
description_book: What makes blackletter calligraphy a blackletter, and how not to ruin it? We will review principles of blackletter, common mistakes, and practice.
description_web: What makes blackletter calligraphy a blackletter, and how not to ruin it? We will review principles of blackletter, common mistakes, and find points of interest in various kinds of blackletter used in manuscripts. If you tried blackletter but have not enjoyed the result, please join us at this class. If you have not tried it but want to start it right way, come and get some experience. Practice! Some pens are available, but better to bring your own tools.

name: Writing and Sealing 16th-Century Letters
description_book: Covers the typical format of personal correspondence in the 16th century, including writing, folding, and sealing.
description_web: Covers the typical format of personal correspondence in the 16th century, as well as the tools and techniques for writing, folding, and sealing letters.

name: KWP Audition Notice Pennsic 51: *The Reckoning*
description_book: KWP Auditions for Pennsic 51: *The Reckoning*, a new play about Shakespeare & Marlowe by Master Lorcan Dracontius. Roles for adults of all ages.
description_web: London, 1593. A young Marlowe and Shakespeare must collaborate on a new script. The Known World Players presents *The Reckoning*, a new play by Master Lorcan Dracontius about the creation of Shakespeare’s classic *The Tempest*. The show asks the question, “What if the production in 1611 was not the first time *The Tempest* was penned?" Roles available for adult cast members of all ages. Rehearsals are held War Week: Sat. evening and mornings Sun-Fri, with one performance Friday evening.

name: *De Lapidibus*
description_book: A class on gemstones, taught in (Muslim) persona, based on period sources.
description_web: A class on gemstones, taught in (Muslim) persona, based on period sources.
fee_itemization: no materials, probably a one page handout. No fee for handout.

name: Summer Assignment Study Group (Teens)
description_book: Do you have a pesky Summer Assignment? Bring it with you and get some help, or have some company while you work on it.
description_web: Do you have a pesky Summer Assignment? Bring it with you and get some help, or have some company while you work on it. Certified teachers will be on hand to help you with your assignments.

name: Leather Embroidery
description_book: A presentation of all known surviving embroidered leather objects from c. 400-1600. Attendees can try embroidering leather with silk thread.
description_web: This presentation covers the instructor's latest and growing compilation of all known embroidered leather objects surviving from c. 400-1600. Shoes form the largest category, but there are also knife sheaths, belt pouches, doublets, gloves, boots, and other kinds of items. Leather embroidery differs significantly from cloth embroidery and class participants will be able to try their hand at it with a sample of leather and silk thread. Many new items added since last year.

name: How to Make a Good Story Great
description_book: A discussion of the dynamics that take a story from good to great. This is a workshop class. Bring a story to work on with the instructor.
description_web: A discussion of the dynamics that take a story from good to great. This is a workshop class. Bring a story to work on with the instructor.

name: Viking Wire Weaving
description_book: A hands-on class for learning to do basic wire weaving, including drawing down and finishing. I will have basic tools and supplies for class use.
description_web: A hands-on class for learning to do basic wire weaving, including drawing down and finishing. I will have basic tools and supplies for students, a handout, and kits available for purchase.
fee_itemization: Handout, tools, and supplies for in class are included. Additional supplies may be bought separately.

name: Transgender and Nonbinary People, Pre-1600
description_book: A series of short biographies and discussion of pre-1600 people who may have used words like "transgender" or "nonbinary" to describe themselves.
description_web: A series of short biographies and discussion of pre-1600 people who may have used words like "transgender" or "nonbinary" to describe themselves. There will be discussions of bodies, death, and sex work (not explicit on any of these themes, but they are mentioned), so this class may not be suitable for very young ears.

name: The *Gest of Robin Hood*
description_book: This early poetic recounting of the legendary "hero" contains many surprises and fascinating insights on social practices.

name: Using Social Media for Everyday Recruiting
description_book: I will go over ways anyone can use social media to evangelize the SCA in their daily lives.
description_web: If you love the SCA, and you love being on all forms of social media, this is the class for you! Learn how you can use social media channels in your everyday life to help the Society grow. "Everyone is a chatelaine" is an oft-used phrase, but many members of the populace have little idea how to incorporate it into their daily lives. I'll show anyone how to accomplish this task.
fee_itemization: Copies of the course material

name: Natural Cord Making
description_book: Students will learn two ways to make cordage using natural materials; we'll also cover its history. This is a make-and-take class.
description_web: Cordage made from plant and animal fibers have been used throughout history. It can be used for bowstrings, fishing lines, snares, basketry, and bag making. We will provide materials and teach you two different ways of making your own cordage.

name: Turban Variations from *al-Andalus*
description_book: Demonstration of how to wrap several turban variants seen in pictures from *al-Andalus* (Muslim Spain), some of which are also seen in the Maghreb.
description_web: The turban is a characteristic piece of men’s headwear seen throughout the medieval Muslim world. This class will examine pictorial evidence for wrapping variations seen in *al-Andalus*/Moorish Spain and will consist of demonstrations of how they are achieved. There will be brief discussion of the evidence for broader use these styles outside of *al-Andalus*.
fee_itemization: Color printing

name: Early Islamic-Influenced Beauty
description_book: The beauty standards within the pre-1650 Islamic-ruled world; including cosmetics, hygiene, and haircare. **Age 18+.**
description_web: This class will explore the beauty standards within the pre-1650 Islamic-ruled world, specifically with a focus on cosmetics, hygiene, and haircare. Reviewing beauty standards from the late 7th- to the mid-17th century over a wide-geographical area, we see patterns emerge. In addition to learning similarities in beauty standards, we will discuss how women engaged with both personal hygiene and beautification. We will also explore specific formulas for beauty products, their desired results, and potential consequences associated with their prolonged use. Instructor will bring samples of both foundation and eye makeup for students to test. **Age 18+.**

name: Creating Garb 101
description_book: A lecture on how to begin creating your own medieval wardrobe.
description_web: A lecture on how to begin creating your own medieval wardrobe.

name: Cannabis in the SCA Period
description_book: A survey of cannabis as a drug from ancient times to 1600. **Age 18+**
description_web: A survey of cannabis from ancient times to 1600, with emphasis on its use as a drug. We'll explore what it was like, how it was consumed, and its status in SCA-period societies and the modern SCA. Recipes for several period cannabis edibles will be included. **Age 18+**

name: Beginner Dance: English Country
description_book: Simple English country dances are a great introduction to period dance. All steps and patterns for several dances will be taught; no partner required.

name: Intro to Roman Cooking and Eating for T(w)eens
description_book: Hands-on class for T(w)eens featuring recipes from Ancient Rome. Students will make the food, then dine while learning about Roman dining customs.
description_web: Introductory level, hands-on class for T(w)eens featuring recipes from Ancient Rome. Students will participate in making a number of dishes to then be eaten while discussing Roman dining customs and practices. **Allergy Alert: Some of the recipes featured will contain nuts.**
fee_itemization: hand-outs are free, food materials used/consumed in class total $5

name: Build Your Own Catapult and Target
description_book: Use various provided materials to construct your own model catapult and target, and test how well your model will launch cotton balls.
description_web: Have you ever wanted to build your own catapult? Observe and discuss the function of different models of catapults, then use various materials (straws, spoons, Popsicle sticks, rubber bands, tape, cups, etc.) to construct your own catapult and target, and finally test the distance your catapult will launch cotton balls. You can keep your catapult and target!

name: Beginning Embroidery for the Young Sewer
description_book: An introduction to basic embroidery for young beginners. Learn the basic stitches and tricks to making a simple embroidered design.
description_web: An introduction to basic embroidery for young beginners. Learn the basic stitches and tricks to making a simple embroidered design. Starter kits available for 8 participants. Students should be comfortable handling needles and scissors.

name: SCA Ukulele
description_book: Explore the ways ukuleles may be used for period and filk material. Learn basic chords and a few songs. Bring your ukulele. Handouts provided.
description_web: Explore the ways ukuleles may be used for period and filk material. Learn basic chords and a few songs. Bring your ukulele. Handouts provided.

name: Toddler Playgroup
description_book: Let our toddlers tire each other out! Let the parents and guardians make friends! Meets at Toddler Lounge Shade by playground

instructor: Thl Cynthia Anne of Silver Lakes
name: Pennsic Youth Choir
description_book: The Youth Choir is open to all youth ages 12 to 19 who enjoy singing. No audition is required to participate.
description_web: We will participate in a Dress Rehearsal/Recording Session on Thursday, Aug. 10 at noon, and perform that evening at 6:30 pm, as part of the Pennsic Choirs Concert. Your director will provide you with a media release to sign.

name: *PA Afternoon Series*: Knowne World Harp Expo
description_book: Gathering of all harpers and and lovers of harp music.

name: Beginner Scribal Track: *Book of Durrow*
description_book: Intensive 4-day workshop focusing on the *Book of Durrow*: history, decoration, and calligraphy. Fee covers all supplies, handouts, and starter kit.
description_web: Intensive workshop, focusing on the 7th-century Irish manuscript, the *Book of Durrow*. Topics to be covered include history, interlace decoration, and calligraphy. Plan to attend all 4 days. Materials will be available for 10 students. $15 fee covers supplies for the 4 days, handouts, and take-home starter kit to keep you working after War! To learn more, visit https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1yNJr8gppgqDx1CCQSlmVqrbP9HXC5jEI?usp=sharing
fee_itemization: $15 fee covers supplies for the 4 days (nibs and holders, ink, etc.), handouts, and take-home starter kit to keep you working after War!

name: That Personal Touch
description_book: Using discrete inquiries, social networking, and ethical data mining to better personalize a scroll for a recipient.
description_web: Personalizing a scroll for a recipient is easy when the scribe knows the recipient. But there are ways to add personalizing touches to a scroll when you don't know the recipient. We will look at some methods including using discrete inquiries, social networking, and ethical data mining to better personalize a scroll for a recipient without spilling the beans.

name: Decorated Veils: Part 2, Knot Just Beads
description_book: Learn about decorated veils and choose a method to learn from simple beading to *Oya* (Turkish knot work).
description_web: Learn about decorated veils and choose a method to learn from simple beading to *Oya* (Turkish knot work).
fee_itemization: $10 gets you beads, thread, se wing and beading needles, and a crochet hook.

name: Islamic History
description_book: The history of Islam told as a story. Tales of the Prophet, his companions, the Caliphs, their Wazirs and wives from a 12th-century persona.
description_web: The history of Islam told as a story. Tales of the Prophet, his companions, the Caliphs, their Wazirs and wives from the point of view of a 12th-century persona. Topics will include politics and events of the period and data in regards to its interpretation.

name: Water and More-Period Brewing
description_book: See how water can make your brewing more period based on where it comes from and the style of beer (or other beverage) you are making.
description_web: We will discuss the natural processes of water along with terms used to help identify the type of water. We will learn how to read a water test as well as how to work with the water you have to make your brewing taste more to style.

name: Introduction to Pattern Darning
description_book: A counted technique in which the design is “woven” into the ground fabric with beautiful results! Class includes history, kit, and "how to".
description_web:
Pattern darning is a counted technique in which the design is “woven” into the ground fabric with beautiful results! A few minutes to learn and a lifetime to master, this technique can create works of exquisite simplicity or stunning complexity. It dates back to the 12th century (or possibly further) and can be found in diverse places within our period.

The class will discuss the history of the technique in more detail, and cover the “how to”. The kit will provide all the materials needed to make an approximately 10x10-inch kerchief, documentable to Mumlak-period Egypt. Please bring a hoop (some will be available for purchase at the class) and scissors.
fee_itemization:
Handout is approx 9 pages, including diagrams and color pictures.
Materials include $2 for embroidery thread and $3 for ground fabric.

name: Codes, Ciphers and Cryptography: 600BC to 1600AD
description_book: An introduction of codes, ciphers, cryptography, plus other intelligence tools from the Ancient Greeks to the death of Mary Queen of Scots.
description_web: An introduction of codes, ciphers, cryptography, plus other intelligence tools from the Ancient Greeks to the death of Mary Queen of Scots: a Lochac perspective.

name: Bardic Symposium #2: From Lightbulb to Lyric
description_book: Inspiration is a tricky thing and a blank sheet of paper may be your most implacable foe. How do you put words to ideas?
description_web: Inspiration is a tricky thing and a blank sheet of paper may be your most implacable foe. How do you take that initial flash of an idea and start putting words to it? View the Bardic Symposium website here: https://tilted-windmill.com/pennsic50_symposium.html .

name: Pennsic Memorial Ship: Past and Future
description_book: Learn the history of the Memorial Ship burned on the lake for the past 22 Pennsics (and Armistice). Looking for volunteers to help out.
description_web:
In 1999, Garwig der Waffenschmidt constructed a Viking longship as a memorial to Duke Sir Thorbjorn Osis Brandsson, who died while king of Ealdormere, and burned it on the lake. Since that time, this has grown into a longstanding tradition, where we burn a replica Viking longship on the lake at the end of each Pennsic as a memorial to friends and family who have died in the preceding year. The tradition was broken only once, in 2020, when it was conducted online.

I will review the history of the ships, and hope to recruit additional volunteers to assist at this year’s ceremony. In addition to assisting at the ceremony itself, we would like to have people to tend the ship and assist people who come to paint shields.

Garwig is comfortably retired in northern Ontario, and is quite amazed at how what he began has grown.

name: Estate Planning and the SCA
description_book: How to structure your estate (scrolls, garb, heraldry and accounts) so they work as you wish and how to give to the SCA now and in the future.
description_web:
Work with a Retirement and Estates Specialist to review your heraldry, scrolls, garb, etc., as well as retirement and brokerage accounts so that you can be structured to carry out your wishes when you pass on for your heirs and for the SCA now and in the future. 
Beyond how to leave your goods to others, we will review the various types of beneficiaries, accounts and investments and how they can be used to benefit the SCA once you pass on. 
We will also review what you can and cannot do as well as how to avoid the most common pitfalls. 
(Note: These will be general suggestions and no investment advice will be given. I wish to keep my professional license, too.)

name: Twine Woven Bags
description_book: Learn open-weft twining to make a panel bag. An ancient weaving technique for clothing, bags, and other items. Hands-on, make-and-take class.
description_web: Learn open-weft twining - an ancient weaving technique for clothing, bags, and other items - to make a panel bag. Hands-on, make-and-take class. Strings of twisted cordage are used to twine the structure of the bags, both the warp and weft. Class includes frame and twine to get you started.
fee_itemization:
Frame per person $7
Jute/Hem Twine per person $5

name: Early Medieval Nubia
description_book: Survey of the culture of pre-1000 Nubian kingdoms of East Africa. They had strong ties to the Byzantines and were a major trade route for spices.
description_web: This survey class covers many aspects of Nubian culture before the year 1000 C.E. The artifacts of this fascinating culture were largely lost with the building of the Aswan dam. However, between 400-1000 the Nubian Kingdoms were a major trade route and had treaties with the Byzantines and the Muslim countries to their north. They were not finally conquered until the middle of the 15th century.

name: One-Piece Shoes from the Iron Age to the Roman Era
