description_book: Learn about the shoes of the Iron Age and the Roman Era. Tips, tricks, and patterns for creating your own shoes will be discussed.
description_web: Magistra Agatha Iris and THL Vindiorix Ordovix will share their research and experiments with one-piece shoes of Iron Age Europe and the Roman era. Tips, tricks, and patterns for creating your own shoes will be discussed as well as practical information on wearing these fascinating shoes.
fee_itemization: $2 handout fee

name: East Kingdom Blacksmiths' Guild: Roundtable
description_book: Second Annual Roundtable of the East Kingdom Blacksmiths' Guild.
description_web: The Second Annual Roundtable of the East Kingdom Blacksmiths' Guild. Come out and meet the members. You do not need to be a member to come to the roundtable. Open to all blacksmiths, bladesmiths, and students.

name: Anatomy of a Demo
description_book: What makes a successful demo? What are the types of demos? How can you advertise them for low or no cost?
description_web: What makes a successful demo? What are the types of demos? How can you advertise them for low or no cost, what activities can you include? How can the populace leverage the chatelaine and other resources to run one?
fee_itemization: copies

name: Bardic Coaching
description_book: Participants perform 3 to 5 minutes of material, any performance art, and receive feedback and coaching from the instructor.
description_web: Participants perform 3 to 5 minutes of material, any performance art, and receive feedback and coaching from the instructor.

name: Conversational Russian
description_book: Covers the Russian alphabet and basic modern-day Russian conversational phrases, plus words and phrases more related to the SCA.
description_web: Covers the Russian alphabet and basic modern-day Russian conversational phrases, responses and questions. After that, we will go over words and phrases more related to the SCA which can be used to flavor one’s persona. There will be time reserved at the end of the class for questions.

name: Rune Interpretation
description_book: New to runes? Learn what the runes mean for divination. Covers the *Elder Futharc* and, if there's time, the extra runes on the Anglo-Frisian set.
description_web: New to the runes? Learn what the runes mean for divination. We'll cover the *Elder Futharc* (24) and, if there is time, the extra runes from the Anglo-Frisian *Futhorc*.

name: Beginner Dance: 16th-Century Italian
description_book: Come learn some easy dances from 16th-century Italy! No dance experience required. Dances taught will include *Villanella* and *Contrapasso in due*.

location: Denys the Decadent's Camo  (EO7 off great Eastern Hiughway, Look for 12 Steppe Sign)
name: 12-Step Meeting
description_book: An open meeting for those in recovery or any 12-step programs.
description_web: A daily 12-step meeting I hold in my Camp E07 off Great Eastern Highway. Look for the sign. Held at 4:00 PM, **OPEN MEETING .** Holding a meeting here since 1997.

name: Spinning Top: Make-and-Take
description_book: I will bring 20 wheels and dowels. You bring your enthusiastic kid. Younger kids might need help with sanding and with gluing the parts together.
description_web: I will bring 20 wheels and dowels. You bring your enthusiastic kid. Younger kids might need help with sanding the dowel to fit, and with gluing the parts together.

name: Games of the Mary Rose Shipwreck
description_book: The evidence of the games onboard when the ship sank in 1545; rule sets for these games.
description_web: The evidence of the games onboard when the ship sank in 1545. Be a well-rounded Tudor.
fee_itemization: booklet of evidence of the games and period rules for said games.

name: Late Medieval Glassblowing Demo (Furnace Glass)
description_book: A fully narrated, live, 2000-degree glassblowing demonstration! Learn about the materials, the techniques, and how glass usage changed over time!
description_web: Come and watch a fully narrated, live, 2000-degree glassblowing demonstration! See how we can take this fascinating material and turn it into a never-ending variety of items! Learn about the materials we use, and how glass making techniques, its uses, and value varied throughout time and culture! For this demo you'll see items from Europe to the Middle East from the 11th - 14th centuries! Family-friendly, all ages welcome, open Q&A to follow.

name: Known World Recorder Ensemble
description_book: Recorder players of intermediate and above abilities. We will hold four rehearsals to prepare for a brief concert Thursday of War Week.
description_web: Recorder players of intermediate and above abilities are invited to participate in this ensemble. Join us in having fun and making music together! We will meet for four rehearsals: Sunday - Wednesday in the PARC; Concert, 6 pm, Thursday of War Week in the PA Tent.  Age limit: 12 and up. A limited number of soprano and alto recorders are available for loan. If you play more than one instrument, bring them all. Please bring a music stand if you have one; loaners available. Bring a 1/2 inch black binder. Sheet music (intermediate to advanced) will be provided. $2 for music packet, or free PDFs can be found on the Facebook group: Known World Recorder Ensemble. Email the instructors: THL Jolicia atte Northclyfe (washington.julie@gmail.com), and The Honorable Lady Siri Toivosdotter (JoniSyngs@gmail.com).
fee_itemization: Printed Music

name: Youth Axe-Throwing Instruction
description_book: Teaching youth 5-12 to throw axes. Focus on range rules and technique. Parent must accompany child per Pennsic rules. Tournament later in the week.
description_web: Teach youth, ages 5-12, to throw axes. This class will focus on Pennsic range rules, range etiquette and technique. There will be time for the children to throw and there will be loaner equipment available from the instructor. Parent must accompany the child per Pennsic rules. There will be a youth tournament later in the week.

name: Period Round Singing Part 2
description_book: Learn to sing rounds that were sung during the SCA period. Sheet music provided. Different music will be taught in Part 1 and Part 2.
description_web: Learn to sing rounds that were sung during the SCA period. Sheet music provided. Different music will be taught in Part 1 and Part 2.

name: Leaves in Illumination
description_book: You want to add leaves to scroll borders, but are not sure where to start. This is a hands-on class to try out styles and techniques.
description_web: This hands-on introduction to the variety of styles of leaves that appear in illuminated manuscripts will not only show you leaves from different centuries and different countries, but also will give you some possible construction methods. There will be practice time. Paper and pencils will be available. If you want more elaborate supplies, please bring them.

name: *Kyōgen*: Small Troupe Comic Improv Theatre
description_book: Try out medieval Japanese comic theatre. Stock characters with few sets or props. Short plays with burlesque, farce, satire, and slapstick.
description_web: Try out small troupe medieval Japanese improvisational comic theatre. If you like over-the-top comic acting, then *kyōgen* is for you! Ridicule the powerful. Expose human foibles and social problems. Stock characters with minimal sets and props perform burlesque, farce, satire, and slapstick comedy. Learn about stock characters, theatrical devices, common themes, rhythmic structure, comic theory, and more! *Kyōgen* is an accessible and easy-to-stage genre of Japanese theatre. *Kyōgen* dates to at least the fourteenth century and is a living theatre today. *Kyōgen* frequently lampooned the powerful people who sat in the audience. Learn about stage geography, scripting, types of plays, types of characters, acting conventions, and more. Discover *kyōgen* with as few as two speaking roles, and plays lasting from ten minutes to an hour.
fee_itemization: The multi-page handout contains synopsis of period plays, character descriptions, stage drawing, and more.

name: Law in the Lands of Peace
description_book: A class on *Fiqh*, Muslim law, taught in persona from the point of view of the Maliki school.
description_web: A class on *Fiqh*, Muslim law, taught in persona from the point of view of the Maliki school.

name: Viking Food
description_book: Learn what the Vikings ate or didn't eat and why. Information on foodstuff has been gleaned from archaeological digs and sagas. Try recreated recipes.
description_web: We've all seen those websites or news articles that state what the Scandinavian people in the Viking Era ate. We click on them in excitement to see what information they have and then we find out the website or article includes food like potatoes, cranberries, and other New World foods. And they don't include kelp, shark, rye and other known foods discovered during archaeological digs. This class will include information from archaeological digs and sagas and will include tastings of recipes based on this knowledge. I have a new handout that includes hypothetical recipes.
fee_itemization: food stuff for tasting

name: Teen/Tween Fingerloop Braiding
description_book: Learn how to do a simple 5-bow fingerloop braid and make a bracelet to take home with you!
description_web: Learn how to do a simple 5-bow fingerloop braid and make a bracelet to take home with you!

name: Viking Gender Roles
description_book: Popular culture presents one idea of Vikings' gender, but does it reflect what historical sources tell us? **Age 18+.**
description_web:
The idea of the Viking warrior is a strong cultural idiom that pervades medievalism, especially in the early period. In some ways, this idea of a violent, gruff raider taking riches and assaulting women reflects in our modern society as a symbol of masculinity gone wrong, and medieval Christian writers certainly want us to believe they were savage outsiders with no place in society. But how did Norse society look from the inside? What about women? What do we know about the expected gender roles and how they were enforced? What happened to those who deviated? Class will discuss the evidence we have from a variety of sources, and provide possible interpretations of that evidence.

Please be aware that the class will discuss sex, sexual abuse, and violence, especially violence directed at sexual and gender minorities. Content warnings will be offered around the most sensitive sections. **Age 18+.**

name: Viking Age Furniture: Archeological Evidence
description_book: A survey of the major finds of Viking Age furniture.
description_web: A brief survey of the major finds of Viking Age furniture, with an emphasis on interpreting the finds to make reasonably accurate reproductions. We will cover digs at Norse sites such as Oseberg, Gokstad, Birka, Dublin, Hedeby, etc.
fee_itemization: 43-page handout

name: Make a Travel-Size *Shut the Box* Game
description_book: Learn how to make a travel-sized version of the historic pub game *Shut the Box*. All materials will be included including dice and coin markers.
fee_itemization: $5 includes pouch materials, dice, coin markers, instructions, and documentation.

name: SCA Basics For Newcomers: Q & A
description_book: Welcome to the SCA! You have a lot of questions; I will try and answer them, and give you an overview of our culture.
description_web: I have over 35 years in the SCA, and I spent over a decade as both a branch and Kingdom Chatelaine (Newcomer Coordinator).  I have extensive experience helping newcomers learn about our history, customs, and culture in the SCA. Bring your questions, and I'll give a basic history of the Society.

name: *Or Nué*: A Historical and Practical introduction
description_book: This two-part class will first cover the history of *or nué,* followed by a lesson in stitching technique with a sampler.
description_web: The first half of this class will provide an overview of the history of *or nué*, the famed “shaded gold” embroidery technique that became popular throughout 15th-century Europe. The second half of the class will cover basic concepts to consider when stitching, including stitching techniques, managing multiple colors at once, and basic shading. The class kit will include the materials for a small sampler: multiple colors of cotton embroidery floss, synthetic gold thread, linen backing fabric, and an embroidery hoop. If possible, please bring several fine embroidery needles (app. size 10) and your own scissors.
fee_itemization: Hoop: $1, gold thread: $2, linen fabric: $1.50, colored cotton threads: $1.50

name: Known World Squires' Tourney
description_book: Open only to those armoured fighters who are in fealty to a member of the SCA Order of the Chivalry.
description_web: Open only to those armoured fighters who are in fealty to a member of the SCA Order of the Chivalry.

name: A Game of "Hide the Distaff": The Distaff Gospels
description_book: In the 1460s, a clerk sat down for six nights with local women during their nightly spinning circle and recorded their wisdom. **18+ for ribaldry!**
description_web: In 1460-something France, during the dark period between Christmas and Candlemas, a clerk sat down for six nights with local women during their nightly spinning circle and recorded their wisdom. The intent of the author cannot be said to be wholly feminist, or even kind of feminist, but the collection of folk wisdom contained in this text offers at least a muddled image of common women's discourse and priorities. It is also hysterically funny, and more than a little ribald. Come learn some history, and laugh until you cry, as long as you are **over 18. Age limit.**

name: Palmistry
description_book: Palmistry was practiced throughout period. You can learn to read palms well enough in one hour to start immediately.
description_web: From the Egyptians throughout SCA period, palm reading has been practiced in most cultures. Although years of study add more details, you can quickly learn enough of the basic skills to read (well enough that you'll probably be mobbed with requests). We'll cover a bit of history, but mostly this is "hands-on" learning about hand reading.
fee_itemization: handout optional, free further reading sheet

name: Beginner Dance: 15th-Century Italian
description_book: No experience needed! Come and learn some of the easier (and popular) dances from the 15th-century Italian repertoire. Bring both of your left feet.
description_web: No experience needed! Come and learn some of the easier (and popular) dances from the 15th-century Italian repertoire. Bring both of your left feet or as many as you've got. (P. S. Experienced dancers are also welcome to show up and learn.)

name: Period Card Games: *Tarot*
description_book: Learn to play an old trick taking card game using the 78-card *tarot* deck.

name: Yoga for Anyone and Everyone
description_book: All-level friendly, basic *vinyasa* class, open to complete beginners & seasoned yogis. Bring your own mat, towel & water, prepare to work and relax.

name: Overview of Gold Leafing: Period to Modern
description_book: Sample the field of gold leaf methods for both period and modern gilding. Period fish glue, garlic, glair, gesso, permacol for paper and parchment.
description_web: Understand gold leaf methods for illumination by making a sample page on parchment, paper, and perg of period and modern glue as well as application. Class will focus on period fish glue, garlic, glair, plus modern gesso, permacol and miniatum for paper and parchment. Learn application tricks for glue, and tips for a perfect finish in both period and modern methods. Bring your gilding questions and problems for troubleshooting and analysis! Create small gilded samplers on parchment, pergamenata, and paper. All materials included.
fee_itemization: gold leaf, glues, paper, parchment, pergamenata, tools

instructor: Lady Sionna Chonne de la Ronde
name: Panel: Women+ and Minority Genders in Rapier
description_book: In this interactive panel discussion, we will hear from experienced fencers about challenges and strategies for minority genders.
description_web: While every fencer's experience is different, we know that women and minority genders face a common set of challenges. In this interactive panel discussion, we will hear stories and recommendations from experienced fencers and engage in discussion, networking, and strategizing.

name: *Boudicca* Read-through
description_book: Table read of an original tragedy in the Elizabethan manner.
description_web: Table read of an original tragedy in the Elizabethan manner, based on the description of *Boudicca* ("Voadicea") in *Holinshed's Chronicle*.

name: PA Series: Middle Eastern and World Dance Expo

description_web: The 25th Annual Middle Eastern and World Dance Expo is open to all performers and musicians who wish to participate.

description_web: Discuss the Fools in Shakespeare’s plays and the actors who portrayed them. Look at how each actor’s strengths affected how Shakespeare wrote the characters.

name: Drachenwald Royal Court and PCS Party
description_book: Drachenwald will be hosting a PCS party in the Drachenwald Royal Encampment at Pennsic on Tuesday of War Week (Aug. 8th) between 17:30 and 19:00.
description_web: Drachenwald will be hosting a PCS party in the Drachenwald Royal Encampment at Pennsic on Tuesday of War Week (Aug. 8th) between 17:30 and 19:00. Anyone at Pennsic who is a member of the Popular Company of Sojourners or has any other past, present or future connection with Drachenwald is welcome to join us. Their Majesties Sven and Siobhan will be holding a short court at the beginning of the party.

description_web: Roundtable discussion of the fresh look at the sources and transformation of Central and Eastern European armor in 13-15th C.

description_web: Dai Gerdwr and Líadan Liathán sing of laughter, love, life, and death - in multiple languages!

description_web: Youth fighters and Knights alike, come for a night of instruction, sparring, and fun. An opportunity for the youth fighters of the SCA to learn from those that they aspire to be. Knights, please come out and spread your knowledge. Youth weapons will be provided for sparring and a quick rundown of the rule differences will be given before we begin.

name: Bedtime Stories for Children

description_web: Stories and fables for children, 7 pm nightly. This year's theme will be The Brothers Grimm. All are welcome to attend; children must have adult escort.

name: T(w)een Lounge: Bardic Circle
description_book: AKA Talent Show! Share your favorite song, dance, stories, and skills with everyone! **(Ages 12-17)**

name: Drake Oranwood: Troubadour Next Door

description_web: Drake Oranwood returns with joy to the Pennsic Performing Arts stage with some talented friends to entertain you.

name: Silas & Kokitsu Handfasting
description_book: A handfasting between Silas de mohun and Tsukino Kokitsu of the Barony of Flaming Gryphon. The handfasting will start at 7:00.

name: In a Fool's Garden with John Inchingham
description_book: Master John Inchingham the Fool lampoons literature, mangles mythology and hops haphazardly through history in family-friendly song and poetry.

name: Capturing the Nonce, Unicorn, or What You Will
description_book: Examine the Met Cloisters' tapestries with an eye to the carnage of battle, the rule of law, and transformative power of love.
description_web: A slide show examining the Met Cloisters' tapestries with an eye to the carnage of battle, the rule of law, and transformative power love.

name: Bardic Storm & Friends in Concert!

fee_itemization: n/a

name: Clan Blue Feather Ball Ball
description_book: We'll start dancing in the Dance Tent, and once the fashion show ends, we'll walk downhill to the Great Hall to dance some more!
description_web: Why yes, the Blue Feather Fashion Cotillion and Ball does involve dancing! We'll start dancing in the Dance Tent, and once the fashion show ends, we'll walk downhill and dance in the Great Hall!

name: Clan Blue Feather Ball and Fashion Cotillion
description_book: The annual Ball and Fashion Cotillion: food, dancing, music, raffle, and prizes for outstanding garb. Wear what makes you look your best!
description_web: **All** are welcome to join Clan Blue Feather once again for our annual Ball and Fashion Cotillion! Come for food, fun, dancing, music, costumes, revelry, a free raffle with amazing prizes, and special award prizes for the most outstanding garb. Remember, you don't have to wear your best garb, just wear what makes *you* look your best!

name: Meridian Royal Hafla
description_book: Their Meridian Majesties invite you to a hafla for dance, music and refreshments.
description_web: Their Meridian Majesties Garick von Köpke and Yasamin al-Hadiyya invite you into the Meridian Royal encampment for a grand evening of music, dance, and merriment. Come hear great musicians from all over the Known World play. Dance to the music they make, or just come and enjoy the atmosphere, while you lounge in comfort and enjoy a sampling of treats and beverages. Festivities will commence at 9 pm and continue until everyone is too tired, the musicians run out of music, or 2 am, whichever comes first.

name: *i Genesii*
description_book: *i Genesii*: Love! Greed! Overwhelming beauty! Underwhelming intelligence! The greatest *Commedia del'Arte* troupe in the Known World does it again!
description_web: *i Genesii*: Love! Money! Greed! Sex! Murderation! Overwhelming beauty! Underwhelming intelligence! The greatest *Commedia del'Arte* troupe in the Known World does it again with its usual tasteless but hilarious performance! **18+**

instructor: Lord David Anthony, The Foxy Bard
name: The Foxy Bard
description_book: Musical shenanigans with The Foxy Bard and friends.
description_web: Foxy and his friends have gotten into the booze barrels again, which means it is time for musical shenanigans. Join us for Latin drinking songs, naughty madrigals, and general silliness.

location: University Point (University Point, look for sign)
name: Night Sky over Pennsic
description_book: Come enjoy the night sky over Pennsic and learn to identify some classical constellations, weather permitting.

name: Yoga for Fighters,  Dancers and Everybody
description_book: Yoga for all levels! Bring mat or towel for the floor & strap, scarf, or strip of cloth for class if you can; some loaner gear available.
description_web:
Yoga for all levels! Bring mat or towel for the floor & strap, scarf, or strip of cloth for class if you can; some loaner mats and straps will be available. If you have blocks, please bring them if you can! This class is geared for folks who have never done yoga through seasoned practitioners. Amendments for poses will be offered as we go, and each class will build upon the one before, however, anyone can jump in at anytime. 
Class will begin with a few minutes of breath work followed by approximately 45 minutes of yoga.

name: Archery Champions' Shoot
description_book: Archery Champions will shoot as a team for Points. Tourney starts at 9 a.m.
description_web:
Tourney starts at 9 a.m.
Archery Champions will shoot as a team for points. If you are selected for the team, this is the time to shoot. If you are not, you can come out to the range to watch or help out with the logistics and marshaling.

name: Coffee with Friends of Bill and Dr Bob
description_book: Open agnostic 12-Step meetings.
description_web: Open agnostic 12-Step meetings. From 8:00 am-9:00 am.

name: Known World Players Rehearsal for Romeo & Juliet
description_book: A closed rehearsal for cast and crew for the Pennsic 50 production of Romeo & Juliet by William Shakespeare.
description_web: A closed rehearsal for cast and crew for the Pennsic 50 production of Romeo & Juliet by William Shakespeare.

name: *Études* 2 and 3 for Single Sword (Fencing)
description_book: These drill sequences will focus on form, balance, movement, and coordination. For beginners, intermediates, and teachers alike.
description_web: For beginner and intermediate fencers and those who teach them. These drills will focus on form, balance, movement and coordination. *Étude* 2 is thrust centric. *Étude* 2 adds diversity of cuts. Emphasis will be on learning the *études* for home drill, as well as taking elements out of the drill for more focused work in groups.

name: Youth Heavy List Skills, Games, and Drills
description_book: Daily morning regular practices to be run from 8:30 till 11 am on the Pennsic Battlefield Youth List. Youth aged 6-17. Loaner gear will be available.
description_web: Daily morning regular practices to be run from 8:30 till 11 am on the Pennsic Battlefield Youth List. Youth aged 6-17, all levels of experience on three different list fields. Loaner gear will be available.

location: Æ Battlefield pavillion (White tent with red, next to EK Circus Tent.)
name: How to Feed an Army
description_book: The proper care and feeding of SCA combatants at Pennsic and beyond. Everything you ever wanted to know about waterbearing and martial events.

name: Demystifying Silver and Gold
description_book: Practice different methods of applying gold and silver with a focus on paper.

name: Ask a Scribe
description_book: These drop-in classes are ideal for scribes of all levels to speak one-on-one with an experienced scribe for help and advice.
description_web: These are informal drop-in classes for any scribe who's looking for advice, guidance, or help with any aspect of calligraphy and/or illumination. Several different experienced scribes will be hosting these sessions during Peace Week and War Week.

name: Pennsic Youth *Commedia dell'Arte*
description_book: Hands-on class giving the description and history of *commedia* before having the youth create and eventually perform their own skit. Ages 13-17.
description_web: Young adults will learn the art of *commedia dell'arte* while practicing and creating skits that will be performed at the end of the week. Ages 13-17.

name: Known World Baronial Armored Champions Tournament
description_book: Heavy weapon and interview tournament for Baronial Champions.

name: Card Weaving 101:How to Not Be Afraid of Your Loom
description_book: A hands-on class on the basics of card weaving, including helpful tips, tricks, and tools I have found to make it easier.
description_web: Card weaving can be daunting if you've never done it before. Let me help you get over your fears! This will be a hands-on class on the basics of card weaving, including helpful tips, tricks, and tools I have found to make it easier. Bring your projects and your questions if you'd like, or we can just talk about what to do to get your project started!

name: Ethically Sourced Laurels
description_book: A discussion of the pursuit of peerage in a way that supports the health and growth of the Artisan, the Order, and the Society.
description_web: In many circles, it is considered gauche to be seen as actively pursuing a peerage, but understanding the paths available and some of the common pitfalls can help set expectations and create a more meaningful and satisfying journey. This will be a discussion of the pursuit of peerage, specifically relating to the Laurel but with parts applicable to other peerages, in a way that supports the health and growth of the Artisan, the Order, and the Society.
fee_itemization: Printing costs

instructor: Baroness Aranwen verch Rhys ap Gwalter
name: Lampwork Glass Bead-Making: Safety and Basic Bead
description_book: Intro to lampwork bead-making. Instruction given regarding setting up a work area and making basic shapes. **18+; age 14 up with parent.**
description_web: An introduction to lampwork bead-making. Instruction will be given regarding setting up a work area and making basic shapes. If time allows, demonstration will be given on beads the students are interested in creating. The class handout  will include what will be discussed and give historical background. **18+; age 14 up with parent, due to live fire.**
fee_itemization: 5 for MAPP gas, 5 for cost of glass, 0 for tool usage

name: Beaded Veil Edges
description_book: This class, originally offered at Pennsic in 2006, examines historical examples of beading on veils through the SCA period and ways to recreate them.
description_web: Beads add weight and beauty to your veils. In addition to being pretty, it is a practical way to keep your veils from blowing about in the breeze. This is a hands-on class using tiny needles and tiny beads. Youths 12 and older welcome with an adult. You will learn several techniques and leave with a sampler of beaded edges. Some hand-sewing knowledge is helpful. Please bring reading glasses and thread snips if you have them.
fee_itemization: Handout, kit containing beads, needle, veil edge/sampler material, thread, etc.

name: Making an Italian Renaissance Chemise
description_book: Instructions and walk-through for making an Italian Renaissance chemise. Includes a look at both pleating and gathering.
description_web: Instructions and walk-through for making an Italian Renaissance chemise. Includes a look at both pleating and gathering.
fee_itemization: $2 for printed handout.  20 printouts will be available

instructor: Mistress Beatriz Aluares de la Oya
name: The Spanish Netherlands
description_book: A history of Spain in the Low Countries, 1493-1633.
description_web: A history of Spain in the Low Countries, from the reign of Philip the Handsome and Juana of Castile to the death of Isabella Clara Eugenia.

name: Medicine, Physick, and Surgery
description_book: An overview of medicine as practiced by doctors, surgeons, and apothecaries.
description_web:
An overview of the three "official" branches of healthcare (physicians, surgeons, apothecaries), with a look at other trades such as midwife, herbalist, etc. Handouts for all classes: http://www.3fgburner.net/#info.
****NOTE****
"Pennsic University does not advocate the adoption of any diagnostic method or course of treatment not performed by properly licensed practitioners in accordance with modern world medical (or legal) standard of care. This class will present medically (or legally) significant information for purely informational purposes only. The University strongly recommends that you always inform, and obtain advice from, modern world medical (or legal) professionals before altering or starting any course of diagnosis or treatment (or engaging in any legal practice) based on this class."

name: Dining with the Sultan: A Taste of Ottoman Cuisine
description_book: Cook & eat 2 dishes using actual 15th- and 16th-C. Ottoman sources. Discuss Ottoman cuisine in Constantinople. Not suitable for vegetarians or vegans.
description_web: Using actual 15th- and 16th-century Ottoman recipes, we will cook and eat two dishes: a meat dish and a grain or vegetable dish. As we cook, I will discuss Ottoman cuisine in Constantinople, especially that of the palaces. Information includes street food and market regulations. Also what was served to the Sultans and their pages, to European diplomats at palace feasts, and at circumcision festivals for the Sultans' sons. Please bring kitchen knives and pot holders, if you can. Includes recipe handout. Not suitable for vegetarians or vegans.
fee_itemization: Material fee will cover meat, grain, any fruits and/or vegetables, onions and/or garlic, fresh herbs, canned chickpeas, packaged chicken broth. I will supply spices, sugar, and specialty ingredients from my own kitchen.

name: SCA Board of Directors and Officer Meet-and-Greet
description_book: Come and meet members of the Board of Directors and SCA Officers.
description_web: Come and meet members of the Board of Directors and SCA Officers.

name: So You Want to Bring a Period Tent to Pennsic
description_book: What tent should you get? Tips for easier set-up. Avoid "A river runs through it." Furniture and lighting.
description_web: What tent to get. How many people will it house? Are you camping solo? Tips for easier set-up: shorter tent poles, accordion-pleated walls, mark "tab A" and "slot B" for error-free alignment. Bathtub the edge of the ground cloth to avoid "A river runs through it." Furniture and lighting. Decorative touches like chandeliers, tapestries, and rugs.
fee_itemization: printing costs

description_book: Wild mushroom foraging is sexy these days. Gastrointestinal distress is not. Learn from a Pennsylvania-approved mushroomer how to stay safe! **18+.**
description_web: I will give you the tools you need to forage safely. We will discuss about 10 beginner mushrooms that grow locally. The last half hour of class will include a wild mushroom petting zoo. Mostly dried samples, unless the weather gods are good to us. **Absolutely no one may attend under the age of 18. Not even with parent.**
fee_itemization:
Alys: In descrip, deleted "Come" to add in age limit.

description_book: Make a sunflower in the style of beaded flowers of 16th-century Venice. If you have needles-nose pliers/wire cutters, bring them to class.
description_web: Make a sunflower in the style of beaded flowers of 16th-century Venice. If you have needles-nose pliers/wire cutters, please bring them to class. Not recommended for youth. Take the Rose class first; this is a more advanced technique.
fee_itemization: beads, wire, yarn

name: How Not to Make a 14th-Century Dress
description_book: Learn about some common mistakes in making a 14th-century fitted dress, and how to avoid them.
description_web: Learn about some common mistakes in making a 14th-century fitted dress, and how to avoid them. Students are invited to contribute stories and suggestions from their own experience as well.

name: Dancing with Children: Circles and Chases
description_book: It's never too early to learn to dance! Come learn dances fun for all. All youth in attendance require a responsible adult to be present. Ages 4 & up.
description_web: While open to all ages, the class will be geared towards fun and frolicking rather than perfecting steps and is suitable for ages four and up. All youth in attendance require a responsible adult to be present. After learning some basic steps, the class will cover a variety of circle dances before turning to the controlled chaos of chasing and "follow the leader" dances.

name: Keeping Bees in the Knowne World
description_book: Get an idea of what is involved in keeping bees in the here and now. I'll walk you through a typical year.
description_web: Get an idea of what is involved in keeping bees in the here and now. I'll walk you through a typical year.

name: Intro to "Medieval-Like" Woodworking, Part B
description_book: Intro to woodworking with only hand tools. Includes modern SOPs and safe practices for building medieval-style furniture. **See Web for age limit.**
description_web: **THIS CLASS IS THE SECOND HALF OF A 2-DAY CLASS**, Tuesday and Wednesday mornings; an overview of hand woodwork, with an opportunity to try things out. We will start on Tuesday morning with a chunk of a log and by noon we should have some boards or other furniture parts using wedges, axes, froes, drawknives, spokeshaves and wood planes. On Wednesday we will look at making joints, boring, and maybe a bit of carving. Covers saws, chisels, and planes. Extensive instructions on the selection, use and maintenance of all these tools will be covered. The class will be taught both first week and again second week. Students who cannot attend the whole class are encouraged to drop in or out at their convenience. **Youths may attend if accompanied by a parent.**

name: Card Weaving Basics
description_book: Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and, using cards, you will weave a small strap or trim piece on our mini-card loom.
description_web: Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and weave a small strap or trim piece on our mini-card loom. Classroom loaner looms provided. Class limited to 5 looms. Fee covers string and cards; take your work home with you.
fee_itemization: cards, string, & instructions

name: Youth Rapier Activities
description_book: There will be a variety of youth rapier activities each day including drills, games and one-on-one instruction. Some loaner gear will be available.
description_web: There will be a variety of youth rapier activities each day including drills, games and one-on-one instruction. Some days may include special additional activities. Some loaner gear will be available. Participants do not have to be authorized. Children age 6 and up may participate. Please bring your parent/guardian the first day you attend to learn more about the youth rapier program.

location: The Camp of the Three Bears (N17 along Battle Road)
name: Cooking with Crockery on a Campfire
description_book: Practice and discuss cooking over fire using period crockery pots and skillets.
description_web: A practicum on cooking over fire using period crockery pots and skillets. We'll provide the fire, some food, and a limited supply of crockery, and advice. You'll actually heat the crockery and cook, getting a feel for how to use these tools. Feel free to bring your own pots or pipkins if you want to take them for a run with support.

name: Throwing Tournament for the Physically Challenged
description_book: Tournament for throwers with physical challenges or disabilities.
description_web: Tournament for throwers with physical challenges or disabilities.

description_book: An in-depth class on materials, extant inspirations, how-to's, and guidance on how to make scrolls for Chinese, Korean, and Japanese themes.
description_web: An in-depth class on materials, extant inspirations, how-to's, and guidance on how to make culturally respectful scrolls for Chinese, Korean, and Japanese themes. This is a lecture-style class. Contact Choi Min for hands-on tutoring afterwards.
fee_itemization: Paper Printout of the Class

name: Pennsic Youth Theatre
description_book: Kids ages 5-17, join us in creating & performing, from story book to stage, your very own play! Creative minds + theatrical tools = a fun-filled time!
description_web: For kids ages 5-17 interested in exploring their creative and theatrical sides through storytelling, acting, and producing their very own play! Come join us as we build a theatre show from the ground up, giving younger kids a creative outlet for all that pent-up camping energy! Children 12 and under must have a parent or guardian present.

instructor: Noble Lykania of Stone Hill Keep
name: A Tour of Beads
description_book: A look at beads over time and geography from Ancient Mediterranean to Early Medieval Europe using a collection of reproduction beads.
description_web: A look at beads over time and location from the Baltic to China, from ancient times to 1000 C.E. I will be doing this using a collection of reproduction strands. I will walk you through the changes in beads over time with some limited discussion of markets and technology.

name: Origins of Playing Cards and Tarot
description_book: History of card gaming and its origins; how it migrated west, how it evolved, how cards were made, and how Europe went fanatic for it.
description_web: A discussion of the history of card gaming and its origins, its migration west, and taxonomy. From manufacturing techniques to cultural influences, as well as myth debunking; persona matching included. Examples to examine from throughout period and beyond will be available.

name: Sunk Cost Support
description_book: A short lecture and discussion of how we may be feeling about changing our SCA involvement after pandemic. **Age 18+.**
description_web: Sunk Cost is an economic idea that can be used to evaluate our SCA experiences. Have you found yourself questioning or wishing to change your level of SCA involvement? You're not alone. Sunk Cost Support is a community of people who are reconsidering how, and to what degree they're involved in our hobby. Please join us if any part of this rings true for you. There is also a Facebook group and quarterly calls where we discuss different facets of what goes into our decisions to change our participation. Contact info for these will be shared during the class. **Age 18+.**

name: Henna History
description_book: Learn the history of henna across centuries and cultures.
description_web: We'll discuss the multicultural history of henna as used for hair, cloth dye, and for body art.
fee_itemization: a copy of my current research and bibliography

location: Atlantian Royal Encampment (Block N40, front edge of the Atlantian Royal Encampment, in the Artisans Easement)
name: Learn to Spin
description_book: Introduction to spinning on a spindle, focusing on the park-and-draft method.
description_web: Focusing on the park-and-draft method, we’ll walk through the basics of how to spin wool into yarn. This is intended for people who have never spun before, or people who need a refresher for that spindle they bought three years ago and never quite figured out. We will focus on basic spinning techniques, not necessarily period techniques. Spindle and fiber will be provided, but feel free to bring any spinning implement or fiber you may already possess.

name: Advanced Atlatl
description_book: There will be a quick review of atlatl basics, but the emphasis will be on the use of different types of atlatls, and use of weights.
description_web: There will be a quick review of atlatl basics, but the emphasis will be on the use of different types of atlatls, the use of weights on the atlatls.

name: Be Sinister: Left-handed Tourney Celebrates 50!
description_book: Once again, after a long break, the field is open for left-handed fighting. The tourney will be round-robin, left-handed sword and shield only.
description_web: Once again, the field is open for left-handed fighting. All are welcome, but the tourney will be left-handed sword and shield only. You do not have to be left handed, you just have to fight that way. The format will be a round-robin style, providing plenty of fighting. Come join us for some sinister fun.

name: *Kumihimo* 32-Strand *Kikko Braid on the *Marudai*
description_book: *Kumihimo* on *marudai*. Advanced 32-strand *kikko* braid. Please bring your own equipment. Fiber setups available in advance.
description_web: *Kumihimo* braiding on the round braiding stand is faster and more traditional than braiding on a disc or plate. Join us for this workshop and learn this craft from the novice level, advance your skill by learning a new braid, or share your expert knowledge. Handouts for multiple braids will be available, and I will have a stack of books for reference. Please bring your own equipment. There will only be a few practice stands available due to the number of bobbins. Setups will be available all week for this class. I recommend that you get a setup the day before class because it takes a while to set up 32 strands.

location: Courtesan College (Strawberry Fields B06 (off eLeri Lane between Ankara and Visby Vale))
name: Sex in Western Culture - CCt
description_book: Not marriage, not birth, just sex. It's your Western Civ class with the juicy bits left in. **Age 18+.**
description_web: Not marriage, not birth, just sex. It's your Western Civ class with the juicy bits left in. Encompasses from the illicit frescos of Pompeii to Aretino's invention of modern pornography. This year I will be adding a small section on sex crimes. **Age 18+.**

name: *Gresley Dance Manuscript*: New Interpretations
description_book: The Gresley dances are the earliest known English dances (~1490). New interpretations of the dances suggest monastic origins. Lecture-style class.
description_web: The *Gresley Dance Manuscript* was written circa 1490, antedating previously discovered written records of English dance. Little is known about the *Gresley Dance Manuscript* and the text has gone largely unexamined by historians. My study of the manuscript begins by considering the dances themselves through reconstruction of the dance choreographies recorded in the manuscript. I argue that the dances recorded in the *Gresley Dance Manuscript* are an early example of English dance choreographies which appear to share similarities with European dance forms, similarities which are not identifiable in later English dance choreographies. The Gresley dances share with European dance forms the choreographic elements associated with courtship in continental dance styles. I assert that the Gresley dances may have been recorded in the Gresley Priory, suggesting the presence of complex dance forms which feature choreographic markers of courtship in a monastic setting. This course will be taught in a lecture style and will focus on the conclusion of my research. It accompanies a movement-based class which allows more in-depth experimentation with my reconstructions of the Gresley dances.

name: 24th Annual Knowne World Children's Fête
description_book: Children of the Knowne World are invited to attend the 24th Annual Knowne World Children's Fête at Pennsic L.
description_web:
Pray attend, good gentles all. King Afshin and Queen Jasmine, gracious Monarchs of Atlantia, extend an invitation to the children of the Knowne World to attend the 24th Annual Knowne World Children's Fête at Pennsic L.
The fête will take place in the Great Hall on Wednesday, August 9, from 10 am until 1 pm. This event is designed for children ages four and older.
In keeping with previous years, the morning will be filled with a variety of arts and crafts, ongoing activities, and live performances to amuse and delight. We may have some activities that involve water, so please make sure your young ones are dressed appropriately. There will be a light snack and drinks available for children and their parents.
Parents and Guardians, please note that you must remain with your child at the Fête. Due to the large numbers of children that attend, organizers cannot be responsible for food allergies or other health issues. We ask that children do not bring personal articles with them as the organizers will not be responsible for lost, broken or stolen items and sad faces.
Volunteers needed: volunteers are always needed for the Fête! We have need of gentles that want to sponsor their own activity or help with the activities that need additional people. Gentles are needed to set up and help clean up and also to provide general help (i.e., signing in children, relief staff, etc.). We can never have too many people helping. We ask that volunteers be at the Great Hall at 9 am for setup, and cleanup should be done by 2 pm. Please consider giving your time to ensure the children have a magnificent time! We request that you wear something pink to honor the Fête's founder, Duchess Arielle of Atlantia.
If you would like to help or need additional information, please contact Rebbah Thamira haSopheret at 336-three four one - 1660. This will surely be another fun-filled, festive occasion for the children of the Knowne World. Please remember that without the generous volunteers who give of their time and energy each year, the party would not happen.

name: Storytelling Academy
description_book: Explore genres, tools, styles, and uses of storytelling. Cultural and medieval approaches, applications, performance coaching. New topics each day.
description_web: During this academy, students will gain knowledge about the history and techniques for storytelling both in the SCA and the modern world. Students may attend individual sessions or all of the academy. There may be guest teachers and will be time for students to practice and receive feedback. The academy may culminate in a student performance. No classes are repeated. The focus is on developing comfort, nurturing, and honing skills within the students’ capabilities. All levels are welcome. Students may view a class outline at the academy space, Minerva’s Spindle 158, where classes will also be listed on the message board. Seating is limited; feel free to bring your own chair. Student Performance, date, time, and location will be announced.

name: Known World Choir Rehearsals
description_book: Join the oldest Pennsic Choir as we rehearse in preparation for a concert on Thursday of War Week. Previous KWC Directors have been invited.
description_web: The Known World Choir, along with the Children's and Youth Choirs, and *Chorulus Pennsicus* will present a concert of medieval and Renaissance choral literature. Previous Directors of the KWC have been invited to conduct a selection. Bring a 1/2 inch black binder or plan to purchase one for use during the concert for $5. **Over age 18.** (There is a Youth Choir for those 12-18.)
fee_itemization: Copies of KWC Literature. $5 more if you wish to keep the 1/2 Inch Black Binder

name: Æthelmearc Rapier Novice Tourney
description_book: For novices less than 3 years from first rapier authorization, have never received a Kingdom-level rapier award, or won a published-event tourney.
description_web:
This tournament is open to any authorized rapier combatant with fewer than 3 years from their first rapier authorization, who has never received an award at the Kingdom level for rapier prowess, and who has never won a rapier tourney at a published SCA event. The tourney will be run as a multiple-bearpit tourney. Prizes will be awarded.
Note: This tournament will take place on the main rapier field.

name: Fighting *I.33* on the SCA Fencing Field
description_book: Some insights in making the earliest fencing manual, known as *I.33* or the *Walpurgist Manuscript*, more effective on the SCA fencing field.
description_web: Some insights in making the earliest known fencing manual, known as *I.33* or the *Walpurgist Manuscript*, more effective on the SCA fencing field. Bring your gear and we will go over a number of different strategies and tactics, in keeping with the manual, that can lead to more victories on the fencing field.

name: Beginner Thrown Weapons
description_book: Learn axe throwing, basic care of your weapons, and basic rules. A hands-on session is included. Limit of 25 participants; no experience necessary.
description_web: Learn axe throwing, basic care of your weapons, and basic rules. A hands-on session is included. Limit of 25 participants; no experience necessary.

name: *Commedia* All Stars **Rehearsal**
description_book: Rehearsal for *Commedia* All Stars troupe: Saturday, Aug. 5, through and including Thursday, Aug. 10, daily, from 11:00 am - 1:00 pm.
description_web: Rehearsal for *Commedia* All Stars troupe: Saturday, Aug. 5, through and including Thursday, Aug. 10, daily, from 11:00 am - 1:00 pm.

name: Weed Walk
description_book: Wild plant identification. Wear walking shoes and hat; leave from Univ. Point. Different teachers on different days; walk with us more than once!
description_web: Cooper's Lake abounds with medicinal and food plants that were used by various primitive and medieval cultures. Learn to identify them during a walk around the campsite. The walk will take place rain or shine. Please wear sturdy shoes and a hat. Meet at University Point for the start of the class. We have multiple teachers, so if you attend more than one walk, you will likely learn different things!

name: Known World Adventurers Guild: **Social Day**
description_book: Informal meetup for teen explorers (and youth 10+). Social Days alternate with Walk Days (see separate class info) - KWAGuild.com
description_web: All teens (and youth 10+) are welcome at these informal meetups for the Known World Adventurers Guild. Our Social Days alternate with KWAG Walk Days. See separate class info.

name: The Tadcaster Militia Gauntlet Arcade Extravaganza
description_book: Fencing for **Freezy-Pops!** Run the gauntlet! Fight all the Tads! Win fabulous tickets! Take home prizes! Ridiculous fun for anyone with a sword!
description_web: The Tadcaster Militia presents the Amazing and Wonderful Tadcaster Arcade Gauntlet and Tournament! Win fabulous tickets and also prizes! Fencers will face a gauntlet of bouts against members of the Tadcaster Militia. Victories will earn tickets that can be exchanged for prizes. You might win a freezy-pop, but you'll definitely enjoy it!

name: Introduction to Islamic Bookbinding
description_book: Here's an opportunity to learn about basic and Islamic bookbinding terminology plus the importance of the written word in Muslim cultures.
description_web: Explore the glamorous bindings of the Middle East bindings. Individuals will have an opportunity to learn about basic bookbinding terminology, and the importance of the written word in Muslim cultures. Have hands-on experiences while watching the construction of a book being bound in the fifteenth-century (15th-C) Islamic style.

name: Children's Crusade, Part One: The Pied Piper
description_book: A brief history of the Children's Crusade in 1212 and my rendition of the Grimms' tale, the *Pied Piper of Hamelin*.
description_web: A brief history into the origins of the Children's Crusade in 1212 and the independent crusade-like mobilization of poor and impoverished folk (and/or youth) as led by Stephen of Cloyes and Nicholas of Cologne, in efforts to create a second Latin kingdom in the holy land of Jerusalem; and a personal rendition of Grimms' tale of the *Pied Piper of Hamelin*, by myself, WarDon Necu Hawke.

name: Advancements in Battlefield Medicine & Prosthetics
description_book: Advancements in battlefield medical care and the use of prosthetics during the Middle Ages and how these two things are connected.
description_web: Advancements in battlefield medical care and the use of prosthetics during the Middle Ages and how these two things are connected.

name: Modern Media & the SCA: Making Them Work Together
description_book: How to connect with modern media to share the SCA on a larger scale and provide a good story for the news.
description_web: Reaching people who are interested in the SCA can be difficult; reaching a large number at once even more so. In this class, Æthelmearc Media Liaison and broadcast journalist Baron Arias Beltran del Valle discusses how to reach out to modern media and share activities and events with them, while also adhering to Society media policies. Includes what to do (and not to do!) when the media arrives at an event. Included in the discussion will be suggestions on how to make an event more interesting to news outlets. We'll touch on rights given to the reporters and to participants. We'll also discuss who should be involved in preparations for meeting the media at an event, and how to present the best face for your group!

name: Original Shakespearean Pronunciation
description_book: Learn about Shakespeare’s accent and how The Bard spoke, unlocking hidden puns in his many works.
description_web: Learn about Shakespeare’s accent and how The Bard spoke, unlocking hidden puns in his many works.

name: An Introduction to Sweets in the Medieval Period
description_book: An overview of candies and sweets in cooking and medicinal use. We will look at different cultures and time periods. Recipes and samples included.
fee_itemization: $3 to help cover the cost of copying the handout.

name: Magic as a Performing Art
description_book: Magic in theory and practice. Three period tricks taught by professional magician. Real methods. Class sworn to secrecy.
description_web: Theory and practice of magic as a performance art, taught by a professional magician. We will cover three period tricks from Scot’s *Discoverie of Witchcraft*, 1584, for close-up, parlor, and stage. The class will be sworn to secrecy and real working methods will be taught.

name: Anglo-Saxon Ring Pouch
description_book: Create the only pouch an Anglo-Saxon woman would ever want or need, using period supplies and sewing techniques. Masking requested.
fee_itemization: All of the supplies and materials needed to make a ring pouch.

name: Short Veils and Square Chitons: Carthaginian Dress
description_book: A concise overview of Punic dress and dress accessories. Includes patterns/ instructions, and information on fibers, weaves, dyes, and stitches.
description_web: A concise overview of Punic dress and dress accessories. Includes patterns, instructions, and information on fibers, weaves, dyes, and stitches. Handouts will also be available online.

name: Ships in the SCA Period: A Chronological Overview
description_book: A comprehensive overview of the development of ships in western Europe between 600 and 1600.
description_web: A comprehensive overview of the development of ships in western Europe between 600 and 1600.

location: Atlantian Royal Encampment (Block N40, front edge of the Atlantian Royal Encampment, in the Artisans Easement)
name: Drafting and Distaff
description_book: How you treat your fiber will change what type of yarn you end up with. Come experiment with drafting methods and using a distaff.
description_web: How you treat your fiber will change what type of yarn you end up with. Come experiment with a distaff and discover how silly modern spinners are for not using one. Try out cards vs combs and see the different preparations they make. Try different drafting methods and see how yarns behave differently. Attendees should know how to spin. Spindle and fiber will be provided, but feel free to bring any spinning implement or fiber you may already possess.

name: Atlatls of the World: A Geographical Survey
description_book: A discussion of (and chance to use) the different types of atlatls, where they came from, and how they were used in their various regions.
description_web: A discussion of (and chance to use) the different types of atlatls, where they came from, and how they were used in their various regions.

name: *Gresley Dance Manuscript*: New Reconstructions
description_book: The Gresley dances are the earliest known English dances (~1490). Learn/experiment with new reconstructions of the Gresley dances. Movement class.
description_web: The *Gresley Dance Manuscript* was written circa 1490, antedating previously discovered written records of English dance. Little is known about the *Gresley Dance Manuscript* and the text has gone largely unexamined by historians. My study of the manuscript began by considering the dances themselves through reconstruction of the dance choreographies recorded in the manuscript. This class focuses on my new reconstructions; participants will learn my proposed reconstructed movements of the dances and perform them. Respectful suggestions, troubleshooting, and comments are welcome! This is a largely movement-based dance class, although the class may periodically pause to discuss the dance reconstructions as we learn them. This class is a movement portion of my class on the *Gresley Dance Manuscript*. Registration for both parts is **not** required.

name: EK Blacksmith Guild Meeting and Panel
description_book: The Blacksmiths' Guild will hold a short meeting followed by a panel. This is for Guild members only.
description_web: The Blacksmiths' Guild will hold a short meeting followed by a panel for Guild members only. This is a chance for Guild members to submit their work to the panel for review as part of the ranking process. Non-members are welcome to attend our Blacksmithing Roundtable Q&A scheduled in the afternoon of the same day.

name: Period Card Games: *Tarot*
description_book: Learn to play an old trick taking card game using the 78-card *tarot* deck.

name: Scribing on Parchment
description_book: Interesting in scribing on parchment, but intimidated by the material? This class is a hands-on introduction to tools, materials, and techniques.
fee_itemization: Handmade vellum to experiment on and take with you, 4x6

name: Pelican and Protégé Meet-Up
description_book: This is a time for Pelicans and protégés to meet others from across the Known World! A variety of topics will be discussed. Please join us!
description_web: This is a time for Pelicans and protégés to meet others from across the Known World! A variety of topics will be discussed. This is also a great chance to get to meet with Pelicans and protégés of Pelicans if you are not currently a protégé and are interested in becoming one. We also welcome others who are seriously on the service path because we value what you think as well. We look forward to seeing you all!

name: 3-Weapon Tournament
description_book: Axe, knife, spear: come throw all three. Distances make a difference.
description_web: Axe, knife, spear: come throw all three. Distances make a difference.

name: Fair and Fun Thrown Weapons Tournament: Discussion
description_book: Recommended for MITs or any others likely to find themselves running a TW tournament. People who have run tournaments before are encouraged to come.
description_web: Recommended for Marshals in Training or any others likely to find themselves running a TW tournament. People who have run tournaments before are encouraged to come and share their successes and failures.

name: Beginning Spear
description_book: This is a hands-on class demonstrating beginning spear technique.
description_web: This is a hands-on class demonstrating beginning spear technique.

name: Crimson Certificates: *Joseon* Royal Cert Format
description_book: Add both text & context to your Asian-inspired scrolls. Learn the structure of *Joseon* court documents & hands-on techniques to improve your scrolls.

name: Theater Slam *Auditions*: Pyramus and Thisbe
description_book: Theatrical Variations consisting of 4 (brief) consecutive performances of *Pyramus and Thisbe*, **each** in a different period theatrical style!
description_web: Theatrical Variations consisting of four (brief) consecutive performances of *Pyramus and Thisbe*, **each** in a different period theatrical style! Come for the juxtaposition of dramatic traditions, stay for the hilarity of *Commedia* vs. Greek Chorus and Shakespearean Farce vs. a Morality Play! Four different directors will present their interpretations of the classical tale. A question and answer session will follow.

name: Eat Your Flowers (with Tasting)
description_book: Learn how to use and preserve edible flowers as sweet and savory jellies, butters, and baked goods. For any time period. Enjoy some samples!

name: Introduction to Cloisonné Enameling
description_book: Participants will be able to design and fabricate a cloisonné enameled pendant to take home.
description_web: Cloisonné enameling is the art of creating designs using a ribbon of wire and then fusing powdered glass to a background to create a finished piece of jewelry. In this class, you will learn the process of creating a cloisonné pendant from design considerations, wire manipulation and fusing and finishing. We will be using a MAPP torch to fire the pieces, and participants are encouraged to wear natural fiber clothing without hanging sleeves. No previous experience is needed.
fee_itemization: $5 materials fee, no charge for handouts

name: Bidding the Bedes: Introduction to Paternosters
description_book: The history and development of western European Christian prayer beads as well as information on making your own replica.
description_web: In the 13th-16th centuries in western Europe, prayer beads were a ubiquitous accessory. This class discusses the history and development of the paternoster, as well as information on making your own replica. Kits will be available to make a glass paternoster.
fee_itemization: Beads, silk thread, needle, bead tip

name: Women Pirates
description_book: Women pirates in the Middle Ages -- and beyond.
description_web: Piracy: It’s not just for Jack Sparrow anymore. We will discuss women who chose to take up the profession of piracy. What did it take to be a woman pirate in an occupation dominated by men? What were their motivations? What happened to them? Come and learn about these bold women through their stories and we’ll try to separate fact from fiction. Let's dish out the dirt on these dastardly damsels!

name: Evolution of Black Powder Arms from 1320-1600
description_book: History and development of black powder arms from 1320-1600. This is a **non**-shooting lecture/discussion class covering period firearm technology.
description_web: History and development of black powder arms from 1320-1600. This is a **non**-shooting lecture/discussion class covering period firearm technology. Handouts for all classes: http://www.3fgburner.net/#info.

name: The Dark Art of Memory
description_book: The art and science of memory from Ancient Greek Goddess to modern neuroscience.

name: Beginning Silk Banners
description_book: Learn some history and make a simple banner using permanent dyes. **Age 18+**
fee_itemization: For the silk fabric, dyes

name: Children's Doll Meet
description_book: Open to children ages 1-17 years of age. Please bring your favorite doll to the class, as we will be making something for your doll.
description_web: Open to children ages 1-17 years of age. Please bring your favorite doll to the class, as we will be making something for your doll. All dolls are welcome: ball-jointed, cloth, plastic, porcelain, stuffed, *anime*. Please note: An adult is required to accompany children as per Pennsic handbook, and some crafts may require help.

name: Busking: The Art of Street Performing
description_book: Performers: Take your act to the street! Unlimited audiences! Cash in your hat! Automatic authenticity! Taught by a panel of pro street performers.
description_web: Performers: There’s no venue so challenging, or rewarding, as the street. From the musician’s open instrument case, to the magician’s hat pass; from an intimate one-on-one moment, to a 200-person circle show, our panel of experts will share all the hard-won Precious Candy-Making Secrets of the professional street entertainer.

name: Alchemy in Period
description_book: What, where, when and who of alchemy in history.
description_web: An overview of what transmutational alchemy (both metallurgical and medicinal) was within antiquity, the medieval period and the Renaissance. The course surveys what alchemy was and wasn't, where it was practiced, who its most prominent practitioners were, and what they achieved.

name: Goldwork Embroidery with Bullion
description_book: Learn multiple techniques in working with gold bullion. No prior knowledge of embroidery required.
description_web: This class focuses on techniques in working with gold bullion available in period. We'll go over a few techniques on how to create eye-catching designs in simple steps with smooth purl, rough purl, spangles, pearls, and beads. No prior knowledge of embroidery is required. If you have them, bring manicure scissors and tweezers (some will be available to borrow). The rest of the materials (a variety of gold bullion, needles, thread, wax, fabrics, etc.) come with the kit. Don't forget your glasses, but we will work with larger gauge for ease. Students will create a sampler and take home some extra real gilt bullion to complete the project and practice more.
fee_itemization: Gilt bullion: smooth bore purl, crimp bore purl, spangles, and real and imitation gold thread. Imitation pearls and beads. Fabrics, embroidery hoop, thread, needles, pins, wax, felt.

name: Decoding the Benin Bronzes
description_book: The famous Benin Bronzes contain a wealth of information about the pre-colonial African society from their own perspective.
description_web: The much debated bronze plaques and artworks of the Benin Empire are a wealth of information about the pre-colonial Edo culture, which was located in modern day Nigeria. In this lecture I will interpret the hidden meaning behind the images created by the members of the bronze casting guild. These pieces not only hold a cultural importance to the Nigerian people, but to researchers because they serve to document a pre-colonial African society from their own perspective.

name: Roman Rag Doll Make-and-Take
description_book: Make and take a Roman rag doll based on extant item in the British Museum collection. Animal-free kit provided to make and clothe one doll, no cost.
description_web: Make and take a Roman rag doll based on an extant item in the collection of the British Museum. Kit provided at no cost to make and clothe one doll per participant. Accessibility: needles will be pre-threaded, and dolls can be made completely by hand from scratch or from a pre-sewn body that only needs stuffing. Kit will contain no animal products/fibers. Participants are welcome to drop in and out during the class period. No cost.

name: Introduction to Japanese Syllabic Verse
description_book: Introduction to the forms of medieval Japanese poetry. Class covers typical subject matter as well as practical advice for composing in English.
description_web: An introduction to the various forms of medieval Japanese syllabic poetry. Class will also cover typical subject matter for Japanese poetry as well as practical advice for composing syllabic verse in English.
fee_itemization: Optional donation of $1 for cost of photocopying handouts

location: Atlantian Royal Encampment (Block N40, front edge of the Atlantian Royal Encampment, in the Artisans Easement)
name: Introduction to Fiber Prep
description_book: While you can purchase all sorts of lovely, prepared wool for spinning, there's nothing quite like preparing fiber yourself.
description_web: Focuses on prepping wool fiber (which is easiest for new folks to obtain) plus a walk through various methods to wash and prepare fiber for spinning. Period and modern methods will be discussed. Some tools will be available to experiment with as time permits.

name: Feasting in Southern Britain During the Iron Age
description_book: Examine relevant written and funerary sources, archaeological food evidence, & material culture. There will be tastings and a feast-gear petting zoo.
description_web:
Feasting to build community and feasting to create differences/express social status both occurred in different parts of southeastern Britain during the Iron Age. This class will examine: 
a) cultural sources including classical texts, medieval Irish myths, and Iron Age funerary practices related to feasting; 
b) archaeological food evidence with an emphasis on grains and animal remains; and 
c) material culture, with brief discussions of cauldrons, drinking horns, ceramics, and wood tankards. 
There will be tastings of possible Iron Age foods and a feast-gear petting zoo.

name: *Gracca Amorosa* for Beginners
description_book: Come learn *Gracca Amorosa*, one of the most popular 16th-C *cascarde*. Dancers of all ages welcome. Prior dance experience helpful but not required.

name: Children's Water Battle: Set-Up
description_book: Two-hour set-up time for the Water Battle. Adult and older teen assistance is always welcome. Kids, **don't show up yet**.

name: Middle Eastern Melody and Drumming
description_book: The Middle Eastern Melody and Drumming classes will cover several several different folk songs and drum rhythms from various Middle Eastern countries
description_web:
The Middle Eastern Melody and Drumming classes will cover several several different folk songs and drum rhythms from Turkey, Armenia, Lebanon, and medeval Spain. The following melodies will be covered on the days listed below. Basic instruction for learning the new drum rhythms will be provided for each of the melodies. Bring your favorite melody instrument or a drum or both if you are so inclined. A limited number of handouts including historical notes, drumming notations, melody notations, and sheet music will be available on a first-come basis. A Google docs copy of the handouts and MP3 files of the songs can be obtained by sending an email request to briansbeaman@gmail.com.


Song Name		    Rhythm	Origin		        Class Date
A La Una Yo Nací	    6/8		Sephardic		8/5/2022
La Rosa Enflorece    Bolero	Sephardic		8/5/2022

Yavuz / La Komida   7/8		Sephardic		8/7/2022
Malatya			    Bayou	        Turkish 		8/7/2022

Ha Nina			    D tktkt	Armenian		8/9/2022
Ya Sitti			    Ayoub	        Lebanese		8/9/2022

name: DADGAD  Guitar in Period Music
description_book: Intro to DADGAD guitar tuning & its application to period music. Bring basic skills & a 6- or 12-string guitar. Capo recommended. Tablature provided.
description_web: An introduction to the versatile DADGAD guitar tuning, useful in several forms of period music. Students should possess basic guitar skills and bring their own 6- or 12-string guitar; a capo is strongly recommended, electronic tuners helpful. Basic DADGAD tuning and chord forms to be reviewed. Students will be familiarized with a medieval tune (a *cantiga*), a Renaissance tune, and a Middle Eastern tune. Time permitting, an Irish tune and song accompaniment will be explored. Handouts in tablature provided.

name: *Commedia* All Stars DRESS **Rehearsal** ON STAGE
description_book: *Commedia* All Stars DRESS **Rehearsal** ON STAGE.
description_web: **CLOSED** Rehearsal for *Commedia* All Stars troupe.

name: Concussion and the SCA Fighter (Rattan and Rapier)
description_book: This course will talk about what we know about concussions in SCA fighting: what concussions are, how to identify them, and what to do about them.

instructor: Aule og Amon Amarth The Wizard
name: A Guide to Viking Age Living History
description_book: What it takes to do faithful Viking Age living history/reenactment. Identifying what is accurate and what is not.
description_web: What it takes to do faithful Viking Age living history/reenactment. Identifying what is accurate and what is not. The European festivals are more strict on what's allowed. This class is to help refine what changes you would like to make. You'll get to learn about some of the misinformation surrounding certain finds. About the instructor: The Wizard has been a living Viking Age historian for the past 10 years. He is a professional bladesmith and jeweler, teaching Viking Age combat as well as making the swords. He has spoken at several museums around the world, including Moesgaard Museum, Solothern Armory, Centrum Slowian i Wikingow, Franklin Institute, and the Metropolitan. His presentations have included period clothing and making jewelry. Other topics included the progression of sword types and techniques of using them.

name: Youth Martial: Basic Stretches and Drills
description_book: A basic class on learning good stretching, core building and simple drills to build strength at home with little to no investment.
description_web: A basic, very simple, set of stretches to teach children how to prepare their bodies for martial activities. Some simple drills that can be done at home.

name: The Medieval Palette: Mixing up Your Paint Pt.1
description_book: Students will mix up a take-home palette of 8-10 medieval pigments/paints to use, with notes on safety/usage/protocols.
description_web:
The first hour will be discussing pigments and paint, and how the medieval artist built his palette for use. We'll also discuss safety concerns regarding toxicity, what binder choices you can make, how they affect your painting strategy, and any chemical interactions that the medieval artist had to be careful of. The second hour will be a practical in which the students will mix up their own take-home palette of medieval pigments/paints. Colors will most likely include white lead, yellow ochre, *terre verte*, brown ochre, lamp black, cabbage or leek green, iris green from a clothlet, red lead, *alazarin* (madder), possibly malachite/azurite, or ultramarine.  We'll work with vegetable dye pigments as well as traditionally ground pigments.

Children are welcome, since I will be providing safety gear for everyone.  I will also be providing the take-home palettes, and brushes, so you don't need to bring anything equipment-wise.
fee_itemization: fee will cover nitrile safety gloves, safety mask, palettes, pigments, binders, paper towels, cleaning spray, and mixing solvents (water, wine, vinegar), measuring and mixing equipment, and possibly pH strips.

name: Gothic Calligraphy in Three Strokes
description_book: Gothic might look fancy, but underneath it is only three basic strokes. Beginner calligraphy, no neat handwriting required.
description_web: Just made your first illumination? Messy handwriting? Come learn a simple first calligraphy hand. Gothic might look fancy, but underneath it is only three basic strokes. Beginner calligraphy, no neat handwriting or artistic skill required.

name: Piper Parade
description_book: Parade of children from amphitheater to castle and children’s water battle on battlefield on Wednesday of War Week.

name: Knowne World Baronial Rapier Champions' Tourney
description_book: Open to all baronial adult and youth rapier champions.
description_web: A day to celebrate the Baronial Rapier Champions of the Known World. Landed Barons and Baronesses are encouraged to bring their chairs and portable pavilions to help us choose the Pennsic 50 Baronial Champions' champion. Open to all baronial adult and youth rapier champions.

name: Drop Spinning 101
description_book: Want to learn to drop spin or have had a hard time picking it up? Learn using a high whorl spindle. Spindles and wool will be provided.
description_web: Want to learn to drop spin or have had a hard time picking it up? Come and learn using a high whorl spindle. Spindles and wool will be provided. Spindles can be purchased for $3.00.

name: Make Your Own Roman-Style Brooch (*Fibula*)
description_book: Make your own Roman-style brooch/*fibula* from wire and a package of glass/metal beads. Tools available. Bring yours, if possible. **Age 12+.**
description_web: You will enjoy learning how to make your own Roman-style brooch or *fibula* from wire and a package of glass/metal beads. Jewelry-making tools will be available, but if you have your own, **please** bring them along. **Age 12+.**
fee_itemization: includes wire, beads and use of tools.  If you have your own jewellery tools, please bring them along.

name: Uke Can Do It! Ukulele Class for Teens and Tweens
description_book: Bring your uke and/or your singing voice, and learn some fun period songs and songs of the Current Middle Ages.
description_web: All levels of experience are welcome! Bring your uke and/or your singing voice, and learn some fun period songs and songs of the Current Middle Ages. Chords and lyrics will be provided.

name: The Distaff's Mighty Pen: Women Poets East & West
description_book: In Heian Japan & Moorish Spain, women wielded cultural power, even when held back politically. Look at the poets & their poems. **Adult themes.**
description_web: In Heian Japan and al-Andalus (Moorish Spain), women held diminished political power, but wielded considerable influence in the poetic sphere. This class is about how these women were able to exercise cultural power, including samples from the best known of these poetesses with glimpses into their lives. There will be **some mature themes** presented, but nothing explicit or graphic.
fee_itemization: 15 page handout with some illustrations.

name: Wicked Welsh: the Poetry of Gwerful Mechain
description_book: Come dig into the delightfully bawdy works of Gwerful Mechain, the best known of the female Welsh medieval poets. (Coarse language and sexual topics.)

name: Introduction to Combat Archery
description_book: Covers the basics of combat archery: what equipment you need, the rules, and basic tactics.
description_web: Have you ever wanted to be a part of the action on the battlefield, but didn't want to swing a sword? Have you ever wanted to shoot back at that pesky archer who keeps killing you?
