Give combat archery a try. The class will cover the basics of combat archery: what equipment you need, the rules, and basic tactics.

instructor: Master Dani of the Seven Wells
name: Space Travel
description_book: Focuses on premodern literature on space travel (since the non-literary kind is scarcer).
description_web: Focuses on premodern western literature on space travel (since the non-literary kind is scarcer).

name: Open Knitting Circle
description_book: Stuck on a project? Need help understanding a pattern or just want to knit and chat with others? Come and join a knitter's circle.
description_web: Stuck on a project? Need help understanding a pattern or just want to knit and chat with others? Come and join a knitter's circle.

name: How to Be an Ally
description_book: How to be an ally to queer people, as well as queer history from the time period, and the history of queer people in the SCA.
description_web:
How to be an ally to queer people, as well as queer history from the time period, and the history of queer people in the SCA.

We will discuss common identities and flags, as well as pronouns and basic respect towards queer people. (Feel free to ask questions. This is what the class is for!)
fee_itemization: Printed 6+ page handout, some pages  in color

name: *Il Titolo Provvisorio* Rehearsal
description_book: Closed rehearsal for *Il Titolo Provvisorio*.

name: Beginner Ball Prep for Casa Bardicci!
description_book: Join in this crash course to prepare you for the afternoon ball at Casa Bardicci! Aimed at inexperienced dancers.
description_web: Join in this crash course to prepare you for the afternoon ball at Casa Bardicci! Aimed at inexperienced dancers, we will go through several easy dances to maximize your enjoyment!

name: *Ballo del Fiore*: Dance of the Flower, for Two
description_book: Join us for *Ballo del Fiore*: Dance of the Flower, for Two. We will learn this easy, fun Italian 16th-century dance mixer!
description_web: Happy 50th anniversary, Pennsic! It's time to bring back dances that were once commonly done at War but have since become rare. One of these beautiful, enchanting dances is *Ballo del Fiore*: Dance of the Flower, for Two. It's from the manuscript *Il Ballarino* by Fabritio Caroso, and it's a slow and straightforward 16th-century Italian dance. Participants only need to learn four types of steps, and this fun 16th-century dance mixer will delight your heart! We will dance with real flowers you can take with you at the conclusion of the class! Join us for an incredible time. All experience levels are welcome.

name: Constellations and Crafts
description_book: Learn the constellations by hearing their legends and recreating their patterns in crafts.
description_web: Learn the constellations by hearing their legends and recreating their patterns in crafts.

name: *Daldos*, The Ship Game
description_book: Learn to play in a competition, round-robin style, to get in the most games and the most wins. Winner gets one of the board sets.
description_web: This game existed all the way to Russia and Scandinavia. A board was found on the Mary Rose shipwreck. Come learn to play. This class will be a competition, round-robin style, to get in the most games and the most wins. Winner gets one of the board sets.

name: Roman Glassblowing Demo (Furnace Glass)
description_book: A fully narrated, live, 2000-degree glassblowing demonstration! Learn about the materials, the techniques, and how glass usage changed over time!
description_web: Come and watch a fully narrated, live, 2000-degree glassblowing demonstration! See how we can take this fascinating material and turn it into a never-ending variety of items! Learn about the materials we use, and how glass-making techniques, its uses, and value varied throughout time and culture! For this demo see items from the 1st to the 5th centuries, from across the Roman Empire! Family-friendly, all ages welcome, open Q&A to follow.

name: Frets & Fingers: Intro to Stringed Instruments
description_book: Basic technique and theory for playing stringed instruments. Fundamental exercises as well as tricks and tips to make you a better player.
description_web: Guitar, lute, uke, citole, mandolin... From "How do I hold it" to semi-advanced pro-tips that fool the audience into thinking you're better than you really are, this class is a distillation of nearly a half-century of performing experience on stringed instruments. For all ages and ability levels. Bring your instrument if available, but it's not required.

name: Peg Loom Basics
description_book: The tabletop peg loom is a step up from stick weaving.
description_web: The tabletop peg loom, also known as a rake loom, is a step up from stick weaving. The base allows you to do a wider piece. Class limited to 10 looms.
fee_itemization: loom, yarn & instructions

name: Practical *Destreza*
description_book: Learn to use *Destreza* in practical situations - no circles, no math, just real *Destreza* techniques applied in useful ways to win bouts.
description_web: *La Verdadera Destreza* is often taught as a highly academic discipline due to its history. That's great for the scholars, but does understanding the difference between *Medio de Proporcion* and *Medio Proporcionado* actually help you win fights? This class will cover using *Destreza* in practical situations - no circles, no math, just real *Destreza* techniques applied in useful ways to win bouts. Due to time constraints we'll be looking at single rapier only, but the techniques generalize easily to dagger or most rigid parry objects.

name: Children's Choir
description_book: For children 13 and younger. Sing music in a period style. Meets daily. Performance on Thursday of War Week!
description_web: For children 13 and younger. Sing music in a period style. Meets daily. Performance on Thursday of War Week! Responsible adult needs to be within reach for the younger ones. Bring a folder to hold music. We will teach rounds, songs and melodies from the medieval to Renaissance. Session will be 45 minutes. Dress rehearsal in PA tent on Thursday with a performance at 6 pm.

name: *Ka-Kha-Ga-Gha*
description_book: Written forms and pronunciations of *Devanagari* script used by Sanskrit, Hindi, and other Indic languages. 1st hour basic; 2nd more details.
description_web:
Written forms, pronunciations, and usage of *Devanagari* script used by Hindi and other North Indian languages. While the focus of this class is on Hindi usage, the characters and pronunciation are applicable to others. There will be examples in Hindi and comparisons to spoken English. Students may learn to transliterate their names.
1st hour: Basic characters and pronunciation.
2nd hour: Vowels and half-letters; more if time and student interest allow.

name: Coronation Ceremonies from Period Sources
description_book: Creating "authentic-as-possible" SCA coronations from period services. Methods of converting period liturgies to secular forms. Sources and examples.
description_web: Creating "authentic-as-possible" SCA coronation ceremonies from period *ordines*. Methods and philosophies of secularizing period liturgies. Examples and sources. In the early days of the SCA, our ceremonials were made from sketchy sources such as fantasy and historical novels, but period sources are now relatively widely available. We can present our royalty and people moving experiences that are evocative of real period coronations (of which the recent coronation of King Charles III was a descendant). The presenter has designed several successful "verbatim as possible" ceremonies in several kingdoms for Anglo-Saxon, Holy Roman Empire, English, Danish, and other personas.

name: Intro to Korean Garb
description_book: Covers the history and cultural context basics plus how to look for and narrow in. For more detailed garb questions - come and chat!

name: Teen Basic Chainmaille
description_book: A first introduction to basic chainmail skills for teens.
fee_itemization: 5 - chainmaille

name: 19 Irish Goddesses
description_book: The Irish pantheon is filled with a rich and glorious collection of powerful goddesses. Come learn their stories and songs, and share your own.
description_web: The Irish pantheon is filled with a rich and glorious collection of powerful goddesses. Come learn their stories and songs, and share your own.
fee_itemization: Copying costs

name: Magic and Mysticism in *Commedia* Scenarios
description_book: Haunting by "ghosts," magic tricks, and palmistry... Join us for an engaging discussion about fantastical elements within Flaminio Scala's scenarios.
description_web: Haunting by "ghosts," magic tricks, and palmistry... Did you know that certain *commedia* scenarios by Flaminio Scala incorporate these fantastical elements and more? Join THL Avelina del Dolce for an engaging class about the magic and mysticism found in historical *commedia dell'arte* scenarios.

name: Transgender 101 for SCA Audiences
description_book: (Modern) Trans 101: Discussing vocabulary, myths, manners, and ways we can support our trans friends within the SCA.
description_web: (Modern) Trans 101. This class will discuss what it means to be transgender, some of the associated vocabulary, myths about trans people, a few examples of trans people within the SCA period, and some modern trans "manners" and ways we can support our trans friends within the SCA. Everyone is welcome, and this is a safe space to discuss and ask questions.

name: Peerage Basics and Roundtable
description_book: A discussion-based roundtable for peers and non-peers. What is the peerage about and what can peers do better?
description_web: A discussion-based roundtable for peers and non-peers. What is the peerage about and what can peers do better? During this session, we will talk about the peerages, the highest awards in the SCA, and we will have peers there to talk about what their peerages mean to them and how the peerages have changed their SCA experiences. Given on behalf of the late Liam St Liam.

name: Making the SCA Work on Your Resumé
description_book: Translate your SCA volunteer experience into modern resumé content.
description_web: We will go over SCA terms and translate them into modern job titles, and learn how to use SCA experience to address gaps in employment. The instructor is a senior recruiter, resumé consultant, and paid writer.
fee_itemization: Copies

name: North African Wrapped Dresses
description_book: Learn to wrap yourself like an African woman. Also useful for Celts, Vikings and Romans!
description_web: This class will cover women's *Maghribi* wrapped dresses, and examine the similarities and differences with other people who wore this style, including Romans, Celts, and Vikings. We will also look at accompanying undergarments and accessories. If you want to be wrapped up before you go, bring 5-6 yards of light linen or cotton fabric, 55-60" wide. You will also need a belt or rope, and two very large safety pins, brooches, or kilt pins. Kilt pins and simple penannular brooches will be available as class materials at $3-5/pair.
fee_itemization: $1 handout. Pins for students who did not bring their own: $3/pair for 3" kilt pins, $5/pair for 5" kilt pins or simple penannular brooches.

name: How to Tie a Turban
description_book: Instruction on how to tie a turban, along with some, but not much, information on period turbans.

name: Anatomy of a Basic Weaving Loom
description_book: Come experiment with a small tabletop loom. Learn how fabric weaving was done in period across several cultures.
description_web: Come experiment with a small tabletop loom. Learn how fabric weaving was done in period across several cultures.

name: Advanced Ball Prep for the Casa Bardicci Ball
description_book: Come and review a host of dances to prepare for the afternoon dancing at Casa Bardicci! Aimed at experienced or adventuresome dancers!
description_web: Come and review advanced dances to prepare for the afternoon dancing at Casa Bardicci! Aimed at experienced or adventuresome dancers!

location: Courtesan College (Strawberry Fields B06 (off eLeri Lane between Ankara and Visby Vale))
name: Historic Sex Manuals *Not* Called the Kama...- CCt
description_book: The *i Modi* of Renaissance Bologna to the *Playful Variations* of Master Tung-hsuan of China: intimate instructions from across history. **18+**
description_web: From the *i Modi* of Renaissance Bologna to the *Playful Variations* of Master Tung-hsuan of China, explore intimate instructions from across history. This class will review the particulars but will not have a practicum. **Age 18+.**

name: All in the *Bransle*
description_book: An introduction to *bransles* (pronounced brawl) for new dancers. We'll cover as many *bransles* as we can. Come join us in a *bransle* or four!

name: Children's Water Battle
description_book: Assault the Fort! The Children's Water Battle is open to children 6 - 12. Bring your own water weapons (no catapults). Dress for mess. Water provided.
description_web: Assault the Fort! The Children's Water Battle is open to children 6 - 12. Bring your own water weapons (squirt guns, water balloons, etc. No catapults; they hurt!). Dress for mess and mud. Water and some balloons provided. Each participant must be in the charge of a responsible adult. Treasure provided to each participant. Extra marshals are always wanted; marshals do not necessarily get wet.

name: Lost & Found Auction
description_book: Auction of unclaimed items from Pennsic 48 and 49.
description_web: Auction of unclaimed items from Pennsic 48 and 49.

name: Sharpening Everything for Woodworking
description_book: How to sharpen all of your stuff that needs sharpening!
description_web: How to sharpen everything! This class is an extension of my woodworking class. Thus, I will focus on sharpening woodworking tools, but the principles are the same for all cutting implements. We will cover several concepts and methods but my focus will be on how I do it... without expensive jigs and other do-hickies. We will review, then sharpen, anything you bring - and all of my tools.

name: *Il Titolo Provvisorio* Dress Rehearsal
description_book: ITP Dress Rehearsal.
description_web: ITP Dress Rehearsal.

name: Silent Signals: Ways to Communicate While in Helm
description_book: Explaining set motions for those who cannot hear verbal cues in helm whether rapier or armored & tournament using them.
description_web: Seeing more and more people who cannot understand verbal cues in helm whether rapier or armored, this is a project to help people understand what the other combatant is saying. It was originally designed to help the hard of hearing be able to communicate while in helm. However, it has been shown to be extremely helpful to anyone in a helm or mask. Wanting more and more people to enjoy their respective sport is imperative and hopefully retain those who struggled previously.

name: KW Baronial Champions’ Thrown Weapons Tournament
description_book: The 6th Annual Tournament for baronial (or shire) TW Champions to come out and compete in a series of challenging targets for prizes and more!
description_web: This is the 6th Annual Tournament for baronial (or shire) Thrown Weapons Champions to come out and compete in a series of challenging targets for prizes, and, even more, bragging rights! Expect targets and/or throwing styles to give you something to think about.

instructor: Thl Cynthia Anne of Silver Lakes
name: Pennsic Youth Choir
description_book: The Youth Choir is open to all youth ages 12 to 19 who enjoy singing. No audition is required to participate.
description_web: We will participate in a Dress Rehearsal/Recording Session on Thursday, Aug. 10 at noon, and perform that evening at 6:30 pm, as part of the Pennsic Choirs Concert. Your director will provide you with a media release to sign.

name: West Kingdom Royal Court
description_book: West Kingdom Royal Court.
description_web: West Kingdom Royal Court.

name: Beginner Scribal Track: *Book of Durrow*
description_book: Intensive 4-day workshop focusing on the *Book of Durrow*: history, decoration, and calligraphy. Fee covers all supplies, handouts, and starter kit.
description_web: Intensive workshop, focusing on the 7th-century Irish manuscript, the *Book of Durrow*. Topics to be covered include history, interlace decoration, and calligraphy. Plan to attend all 4 days. Materials will be available for 10 students. $15 fee covers supplies for the 4 days, handouts, and take-home starter kit to keep you working after War! To learn more, visit https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1yNJr8gppgqDx1CCQSlmVqrbP9HXC5jEI?usp=sharing
fee_itemization: $15 fee covers supplies for the 4 days (nibs and holders, ink, etc.), handouts, and take-home starter kit to keep you working after War!

name: Nalbinding for Lefties
description_book: Nalbinding isn't difficult, but can be confusing if you are left-handed. Learn the Oslo stitch specifically for lefties. Bring needle if you have one.
description_web: Nalbinding isn't difficult, but directions can be confusing if you are left-handed. In this class I will teach the Oslo stitch specifically from the left-handed perspective. Bring a nalbinding or darning needle if you have one. Feel free to bring your own yarn. Some yarn and needles will be available for student use.

name: Viking Penannular Brooches Make-and-Take
description_book: Brief history of the Viking penannular brooch. Construction based on historical finds using hand tools and fixtures. Class may run over.
description_web: A brief history of the Viking penannular brooch. Construction based on historical finds using hand tools and fixtures. Class may run over. Earplugs provided.
fee_itemization:
Materials 3
Abrasives 1
handout 1

name: Being Your Persona
description_book: How to maintain the illusion at an event that you are a period person interacting with other period people.
description_web: How to maintain the illusion at an event that you are a period person interacting with other period people.

name: The Oxburgh Hangings
description_book: An overview of embroidered wall hangings associated with Mary, Queen of Scots, including the glimpse they offer into Elizabethan history and culture.
description_web: The Oxburgh Hangings, embroidered by two of the most exciting women in Elizabethan-era England, provide a rich and detailed glimpse into their lives and the culture of the day. But they also offer an enigmatic mystery regarding their creation. Whether you are interested in embroidery, Elizabethan culture, or doing historical detective work, this class has something for you!

name: Bardic Symposium #3: Practice & Performance
description_book: Your audience never sees all the advance work that goes into making a good performance. What techniques/rituals help you in rehearsal and performance?
description_web: Your audience never sees all the advance work that goes into making a good performance. My squire brother's ROTC instructor once told him of the 7 P's: "Prior Proper Preparation Prevents Piss Poor Performance." That applies equally well to us. What techniques/rituals help you in rehearsal or right before you go on? View the Bardic Symposium website here: https://tilted-windmill.com/pennsic50_symposium.html.

name: Honey Tasting: The Finest Honeys of the World!
description_book: This is a honey tasting and story telling. The finest world honeys will be sampled from Yemen to Crete, USA to Croatia.
description_web: This is a honey tasting and story telling brought to you by a world traveling beekeeper. The finest honeys of the world will be sampled... from Yemen to Crete, USA to Croatia. We'll cover the honey mentioned by Pliny the Elder to be the finest in the Roman world, to the world's most expensive honey. You will get to explore your palate and write down your thoughts on each.  Bring water to cleanse your palate.
fee_itemization: Handouts, tasting spoons, and these honey's are expensive, especially Sidr at $600/bottle. I'm just trying to break even.

name: Making the Magic: Court Prep for a Memorable Court
description_book: Doing a good court is not hard, but making it look effortless takes much more! Learn what goes into a great court with a former Æ voice of the crown!
description_web: Court can be a magical moment for people in the SCA, and can be a memorable experience for those who take part and who are recognized. However, like anything else, a little preparation goes a long way to making such magic happen. We'll discuss what goes into preparation before the event, on the day, and what should be done after for official and unofficial tasks.

name: With These Knots I Bind My Camp
description_book: You will learn to master a very few knots that will meet almost every need you may have in camp - or double your money back!
description_web: Before cordless drills and screws, before plentiful cheap nails, even before glue, there was knotted cord holding our lives together. Sadly, most of us barely know how to tie even two or three knots. My guarantee: You will learn to master a small handful of knots that will meet almost every need you may have in camp - or double your money back!

name: Ukrainian Peasant Garb and Roundtable
description_book: We will focus on the late period Ukrainian peasant garb, perfect for Pennsic weather.
description_web: We will go over Ukrainian peasant garb, which is very different from what princely class wore. As a resident of Trimaris, I find it great for a hot and humid climate. First hour is focused on research and show and tell. The second hour can serve as a more general Slavic roundtable. Come see my stuff and show off yours!

name: Consent in the Arts and Sciences
description_book: We'll discuss how to give and receive feedback using communication techniques aimed at promoting positive interactions.
description_web: While members of the arts and sciences community aim to create a positive, supportive environment, the unfortunate reality is that this is not always the case. When feedback is not properly given or received, hurt feelings can easily result. In this class, we'll examine the issue, and figure out if we can help change the culture of how feedback is given and received in the SCA so that everyone can work together to create a better and more supportive Arts and Sciences community.
fee_itemization: N/A

name: Cordial Making in the SCA vs Medieval Medicinals
description_book: Sharing what I have learned on making vodka-based cordials, includes medicinal properties of herbs in the Middle Ages. **Age limit 21+.**
description_web:
Sharing what I have learned on making vodka-based cordials, with an understanding of the medicinal properties of herbs in the Middle Ages.
A very strong emphasis on safe practices is essential for cordial making and dispensing, and is included in the class.
Alcohol will be present and may be consumed during the class. **In PA, you must be 21 in order to drink alcohol**.

name: Introduction to Distilled Spirits
description_book: An introduction to whisk(e)y enjoyment. We'll talk about its history, what makes a whisky, and how it's made. **Age 21+.**
description_web: This course is an introduction to whisk(e)y enjoyment. We'll talk about its history, what makes a whisky, and how it's made. Afterward, you'll learn tasting techniques and how to get the most out of the tasting experience, so make sure you bring a glass! **Age 18+.**

name: Dancing in the Villa
description_book: Join us for a magical afternoon ball in the ambiance of Casa Bardicci, accompanied by live music! All levels welcome!
description_web: Join us for a magical afternoon ball surrounded by the ambiance of Casa Bardicci. Live music shall be provided by Musica Tramontana. Some dances will be walked through -- all levels welcome!

location: Courtesan College (Strawberry Fields B06 (off eLeri Lane between Ankara and Visby Vale))
name: Courtesan Patron Roundtable - CCt
description_book: This roundtable will be a discussion on what it means to be a Patron and what one can expect as a sponsor of a Courtesan(s) in the SCA. **Age 18+.**
description_web: This roundtable will be a discussion on what it means to be a Patron and what one can expect as a sponsor of a Courtesan (or Courtesans) in the SCA. **Age 18+.**

name: Beginner Dance: *Inns of Court*
description_book: *Inns of Court* repertoire features pleasant, easy dances such as *Black Alman, the Lorayne Alman*, and the *Queen's Alman*. Come learn them with us!
description_web: The *Inns of Court*, where lawyers trained, required their students to learn social graces such as a specific set of dances. Come learn some of the highlights from that set. Very easy; these were intended for law students - but pleasant, relaxing dances, often with lovely music, and excellent for talking to your partner. We will teach *Black Alman*, the *Lorayne Alman*, and the *Queen's Alman*.

location: Denys the Decadent's Camo  (EO7 off great Eastern Hiughway, Look for 12 Steppe Sign)
name: 12-Step Meeting
description_book: An open meeting for those in recovery or any 12-step programs.
description_web: A daily 12-step meeting I hold in my Camp E07 off Great Eastern Highway. Look for the sign. Held at 4:00 PM, **OPEN MEETING .** Holding a meeting here since 1997.

name: Children's Water Battle: Clean-Up
description_book: After the battle, the clean-up begins. Adult or older teen assistance always welcome.

name: Ancient Games: *Senet*
description_book: Learn some history and learn to play a reconstruction of one of the oldest known board games.

location: Gunnery Point on Mt Eislinn (Top of Mt Eislinn)
name: Period Black Powder Firearms: Safety and Handling
description_book: Firearm safety, handling, and shooting procedures for small arms and artillery, 1320-1600. Powder and match supplied by teacher. **Ages 18+.**
description_web: Firearm safety, handling, and shooting procedures for small arms and artillery, 1320-1600. Owners of period arms are requested/encouraged to bring them and help with coaching newer shooters. Powder and match are supplied by instructor. **Ages 18+.** Handouts for all classes: http://www.3fgburner.net/#info. Under 18 may watch, but cannot handle arms or powder.

name: German Renaissance Glass Demo (Furnace Glass)
description_book: A fully narrated, live, 2000-degree glassblowing demonstration! Learn about the materials, the techniques, and how glass usage changed over time!
description_web: Come and watch a fully narrated, live, 2000-degree glassblowing demonstration! See how we can take this fascinating material and turn it into a never-ending variety of items! Learn about the materials we use, and how glass making techniques, its uses, and value varied throughout time and culture! For this demo, see items from the 14th -16th centuries in the Dutch German style! Family-friendly, all ages welcome, open Q&A to follow.

name: Known World Recorder Ensemble
description_book: Recorder players of intermediate and above abilities. We will hold four rehearsals to prepare for a brief concert Thursday of War Week.
description_web: Recorder players of intermediate and above abilities are invited to participate in this ensemble. Join us in having fun and making music together! We will meet for four rehearsals: Sunday - Wednesday in the PARC; Concert, 6 pm, Thursday of War Week in the PA Tent.  Age limit: 12 and up. A limited number of soprano and alto recorders are available for loan. If you play more than one instrument, bring them all. Please bring a music stand if you have one; loaners available. Bring a 1/2 inch black binder. Sheet music (intermediate to advanced) will be provided. $2 for music packet, or free PDFs can be found on the Facebook group: Known World Recorder Ensemble. Email the instructors: THL Jolicia atte Northclyfe (washington.julie@gmail.com), and The Honorable Lady Siri Toivosdotter (JoniSyngs@gmail.com).
fee_itemization: Printed Music

name: *PA Afternoon Series*:  Commedia Experience
description_book: Come experience *Commedia dell'Arte*! Meet the characters and the actors behind them and learn to act in comic masked style.
description_web: Come experience *Commedia dell'Arte*! Meet the characters and the actors behind them and learn to act in comic masked style (movement, vocalization, express funny ideas). Experienced actors/directors from several well-known *Commedia dell'Arte* troupes will guide you if you're new, or give you free advice that's definitely worth the price to veteran performers!

name: The Knights Templar: An Overview
description_book: A synopsis of the history and everyday life of the Knights Templar.

name: Calligraphy Basics
description_book: Calligraphy basics: hand movement, strong and accurate strokes, basic terms and exercises for beginners.
description_web: Calligraphy basics: hand movement, strong and accurate strokes, basic terms and exercises for beginners.

name: Rose Happy Hour
description_book: Æ is hosting Rose Happy Hour on Wednesday of War Week from 4 to 6 pm in Æ Royal.
description_web: Æ is hosting Rose Happy Hour on Wednesday of War week from 4 to 6 pm in Æ Royal.

name: Throw Away Your Wristwatch
description_book: Learn period methods of timekeeping to tell time day and night at Pennsic. Discussion of scientific principles so you can tell time anywhere, anytime.
fee_itemization: 30 page color booklet. Cardboard nocturnal. A stick.

name: *RúnValdr*
description_book: In period, runes were very rarely used for divination, but there are many examples of runes being used for magic. A modern system for rune magic.
description_web: In period, runes were very rarely used for divination, but there are many examples of runes being used for magic. This is a system that shows, for example, how to use Norse or Anglo-Saxon runes to hear even at distance, or to awaken inanimate objects. This is a system of energy manipulation using runes and another set of symbols. This workshop introduces the symbols and what each of them is used for, and includes the attunement. It does *not* include introduction to runes. You may take this workshop without knowing the runes, but you will need to learn them to be able to use this system. You will be able to use this technique immediately.
fee_itemization: optional handout

name: Making Couscous by Hand
description_book: Learn to make couscous by hand following a 13th-century North African recipe, using a method that hasn't changed in 8 centuries.
description_web: Fresh, hand-made couscous is very different from the instant stuff available at most grocery stores. The earliest documented couscous recipe dates from the 13th century and describes a process that is still followed in North Africa with very little change. We'll be following that recipe to make couscous from scratch. If all goes well, attendees will have some hand-made couscous to take with them at the end of the class. Limited to 10 hands-on participants, but others may come to watch.
fee_itemization: Pays for raw ingredients.

name: Heavy Weapons Graybeard Tournament
description_book: Open to heavy weapons authorized fighters age 50 years and above. Over 60 or over 70 divisions based on the turnout. Format is pooled Round Robin.
description_web: Open to heavy weapons authorized fighters age 50 years and above. Over 60 and over 70 divisions may be formed depending on the turnout. Format is pooled Round Robin but may vary based on number of entrants. Sponsored by the Kingdom of Æthelmearc.

name: Beginning Irish Language for SCAdians
description_book: The Irish language: pronunciation, basic grammar, introductions, counting, ask and answer questions, how to be polite.
description_web: A basic introduction to the Irish language (modern, not ancient). Learn pronunciation and grammar, pronouns and SCA-related vocabulary, how to introduce yourself and tell someone where you are from, how to count, how to ask and answer simple questions, and some easy conversations.
fee_itemization: $2 for handouts

name: Fun, Flirty Beginner Italian Dances
description_book: Do you like dancing? Do you like flirting? Try these fun Italian dances that combine the two activities: *Rostiboli Gioioso, Gelosia*, and *Anello*.

name: Yoga for Anyone and Everyone
description_book: All-level friendly, basic *vinyasa* class, open to complete beginners & seasoned yogis. Bring your own mat, towel & water, prepare to work and relax.

location: Courtesan College (Strawberry Fields B06 (off eLeri Lane between Ankara and Visby Vale))
name: My Hair Is So Extra and So Am I - CCt
description_book: Be a little more extra in your SCA look! We'll be demonstrating the making and wearing of false braids/hairpieces using modern materials. **18+.**
description_web: Let's be even more fabulous! We will be learning how to make and wear false braids and hair pieces to accessorize our garb in period-appropriate styles using modern materials. This class is a demonstration but will have time for hands-on learning and/or assistance with constructing braid extensions to those who bring their own materials. Materials required are one bag of *kanekelon* jumbo braid hair in a color matching your own (can be found online); a few hair ties; strong thread in the color of the hair; needle; and wide tooth comb. **No materials will be provided. **Age 18+.**

name: Kingdom of Ealdormere Court
description_book: Kingdom of Ealdormere Court.
description_web:
Kingdom of Ealdormere Court.

(Back-up location if needed due to weather: 
Middle Kingdom battlefield shade)

name: Song Byrds
description_book: Join a group of bards from across the SCA singing beautiful period music together in full harmony!
description_web: Join a group of bards from across the SCA singing beautiful period music together in full harmony!

name: PG+ Heckler's Tournament
description_book: **Over 18 years old**. Can you throw while being distracted by the tournament spectators? Come throw in this tournament to heckle and be heckled.
description_web: **Limited to over 18 years old.** Can you throw while being distracted by the tournament spectators? Come throw in this tournament to heckle and be heckled.

name: Reaper Meet and Beat!
description_book: For those who have completed the 100-day pell challenge and earned their Reaper Patch. Come meet and fight/fence your fellow reapers on the field!
description_web: For those who have completed the 100-day pell challenge and earned their Reaper Patch. Come meet and fight/fence your fellow reapers on the field!

name: Known World Helgaball Tournament
description_book: Helga Ball: a **ladies-only** sport based on a Viking game. It's also known as "Cabbage Ball", played with teams of 5 or 6 players. **Age 18+.**
description_web:
Helga Ball is a **ladies-only** sport based on a Viking game. The game, also known as "Cabbage Ball", is played with teams of 5 or 6 players. The game itself is played with a head of cabbage as the ball. This event at Pennsic will be a benefit for Paladin's Pantry. We will be accepting donations of paper and hygiene products for poor and food-insecure families in the Portersville area (the town where Pennsic take place). Games will take place on the Battlefield (exact location will be posted soon). **Age 18+.**
The Organizers for the Tournament are Baroness Constance Gly Dwr, Maighstir Liam MacantSaoir, and Clan Crann Bethadh.
To Play:
- Organize a team of 5-10 women. (Having substitutions is a good thing.)
- Each player must be **over 18**.
- Each team member should bring one or more paper or hygiene product for donation. (No monetary donations.)
- Points are scored by getting a cabbage through/past your opponent's goalposts. Two members of the Chivalry (or squires) shall serve as stationary goal posts for each goal.
- All players must wear a dress. (Viking garb encouraged, but not required.)
- Players are encouraged to wear do-rags, heavy shoes/boots.
- Players may kick or dribble the cabbage with their feet, but may not touch the cabbage with their hands or use hands to pick up the cabbage.
- Players may scoop the cabbage up in a skirt, apron, or do-rag, and move the cabbage on the field.
- Tackling is not allowed; however, "Group Hugs" are legal.
- Goalposts shall signal a "score" by raising one arm and yelling either "Helga Ball!!" or "Olga ball!" to identify the scoring team.

name: Atlantia Royal Court
description_book: The Court of Their Royal Majesties Afshin and Yasmin, 6:00 pm EDT in the Great Hall.
description_web: The Court of Their Royal Majesties Afshin and Yasmin, 6:00 pm EDT in the Great Hall.

name: *Trio Tramontana*: Music for a Medieval Garden
description_book: Join us in the garden for music of nature: birds, bugs and flowering things. A concert of 14th and 15th C music.
description_web: *Trio Tramontana* presents "Music for a Medieval Garden.” Rufina Cambrensis, John Elys and Deonna von Aachen present music of the 14th and 15th century on period instruments such as shawms, recorders and strings. Join us for music of nature: birds, bugs, beasties and flowering things.

name: Trimaris Royal Court
description_book: Trimaris Royal Court.
description_web: Trimaris Royal Court.

name: Æthelmearc Tag Team Tournament
description_book: Heavy List and Youth team up for a round robin tournament.
description_web: Heavy List and Youth team up for a round robin tournament.

name: Choi Min’s *Jeongyo*
description_book: All those interested in Asia are welcome. The core of our attendance are members of Choi Min’s teahouse Asian Research group. **Adult only.**
description_web: All those interested in Asia are welcome to come. The core of our attendance will be made up of members of Choi Min’s teahouse Asian Research group. We plan to socialize to discuss our research, then go for a group tour of Midnight Madness. Tea time may also feature during the initial meet-up. **Adult only.**

name: Bedtime Stories for Children
description_book: Nightly telling of stories for children. This year's theme will be The Brothers Grimm!
description_web: Stories and fables for children, 7 pm nightly. This year's theme will be The Brothers Grimm. All are welcome to attend; children must have adult escort.

name: T(w)een Lounge: Midnight Madness Break
description_book: **Age 12-17.** Take a break from the Madness; hang out at Family Point for low-key conversation, snacks and device charging.
description_web: **Age 12-17.** Take a break from the Madness; hang out at Family Point for low-key conversation, snacks and device charging.

name: Colette the Bard Presents "Song Calls to Song"
description_book: Join Colette on a musical evening filled with songs from both of their albums!
description_web: Join Colette on a musical evening filled with songs from both of their albums!

name: Darkyard Tree Ceremony
description_book: Annual Tree Ceremony held by House Darkyard.
description_web: Annual Tree Ceremony held by House Darkyard.

name: Midnight Madness Glassblowing Demos
description_book: We're heating up the place with our live glassblowing demos where we share our craziest pieces and techniques!
description_web: Historical Glassworks is heating up the place with our live glassblowing demonstrations all evening from 8 pm to midnight, where we share our craziest pieces and techniques! From Renaissance German crackle glass with a modern mojito twist to intricate Italian canework designs, or even the cup of Heroes and Kings: the Viking Age Claw Beaker! You never know what we'll come up with, manipulating 2000 degrees of molten glass right before your very eyes!

name: Nutmegs & Ginger's Quaff-tide: Songs for Good Ale
description_book: Nutmegs & Ginger bring to life period and near-period songs for a rowdy evening of camaraderie!
description_web: Nutmegs & Ginger bring period and near-period music to life using voices and instruments. Join us for an evening of fun and rowdy songs about beer, ale, and wine! Some material may not be suitable for children under 12.

name: Pennsic Grand Masked Ball
description_book: It's time to bring back the Pennsic Grand Ball! Wear your masks and costumes! Come as a character and dance with *commedia dell'arte* characters!
description_web:
It's time to bring back the Pennsic Grand Ball as a masked ball! Wear your masks and costumes! Come as a character!
*Commedia dell' Arte* will be in full swing at the Pennsic Grand Ball. Pantalone will announce which lucky suitor will marry his daughter Isabella this evening!
So many suitors, yet only one will be chosen. Do you wish to court Isabella? Do you have a suitor you want to be betrothed to Isabella?
Wait... which one is Isabella? Who can tell with so many beautiful maidens dancing at the ball?
Dances will be a mix of difficulty levels and use music arrangements from the new Pennsic Pile for Pennsic 50.
All musicians are welcome and will be given water and foot rubs as needed from Arlecchino (don't tell him we signed him up for this!).

name: Bardic Concert: Marian of Heatherdale and Friends
description_book: Marian of Heatherdale (Heather Dale) is joined on stage by bards from around the Known World for a lively evening of song & story. Great for all ages.
description_web: Marian of Heatherdale (Heather Dale) is joined on stage by bards from around the Known World for a lively evening of song & story. Great for all ages.

name: A&S War Point
description_book: Judging from 10:00 am to 3:00 pm (results around 4:00 pm). General populace invited to see displays and talk to artisans (when not being judged)!
description_web: The A&S War Point event is where some of the finest artisan talent from around the Knowne World come to display their prowess and knowledge in an effort to earn War Points for the Kingdoms from whom they hail or are allied with. There will be judging going on throughout the day from 10:00 am to 3:00 pm, with the announcement of the results tentatively scheduled for 4:00 pm. While there will be judging going on, we do invite the general populace to come see the delightful entries for themselves and, while the artisans are not being actively judged, (you can usually tell because they're surrounded by four people taking notes), you are welcome to engage the artisans and ask questions. Please do not touch any of the exhibited items unless explicitly invited to do so by the entrant themselves.

name: Yoga for Fighters,  Dancers and Everybody
description_book: Yoga for all levels! Bring mat or towel for the floor & strap, scarf, or strip of cloth for class if you can; some loaner gear available.
description_web:
Yoga for all levels! Bring mat or towel for the floor & strap, scarf, or strip of cloth for class if you can; some loaner mats and straps will be available. If you have blocks, please bring them if you can! This class is geared for folks who have never done yoga through seasoned practitioners. Amendments for poses will be offered as we go, and each class will build upon the one before, however, anyone can jump in at anytime. 
Class will begin with a few minutes of breath work followed by approximately 45 minutes of yoga.

name: Youth Combat Castle Battle
description_book: Youth Heavy List march from Youth List to the Castle, where they fight battle simulations and participate in end of Pennsic awards ceremony at close.
description_web: Youth Heavy List muster at Youth List and then march together on the Castle. There they will fight in battle simulations on both defense and offense in their respective lists, and then participate in end of Pennsic awards ceremony at close of session.

name: Coffee with Friends of Bill and Dr Bob
description_book: Open agnostic 12-Step meetings.
description_web: Open agnostic 12-Step meetings. From 8:00 am-9:00 am.

name: Known World Players Rehearsal for Romeo & Juliet
description_book: A closed rehearsal for cast and crew for the Pennsic 50 production of Romeo & Juliet by William Shakespeare.
description_web: A closed rehearsal for cast and crew for the Pennsic 50 production of Romeo & Juliet by William Shakespeare.

name: *Études* 2 and 3 for Single Sword (Fencing)
description_book: These drill sequences will focus on form, balance, movement, and coordination. For beginners, intermediates, and teachers alike.
description_web: For beginner and intermediate fencers and those who teach them. These drills will focus on form, balance, movement and coordination. *Étude* 2 is thrust centric. *Étude* 2 adds diversity of cuts. Emphasis will be on learning the *études* for home drill, as well as taking elements out of the drill for more focused work in groups.

name: Youth Heavy List Skills, Games, and Drills
description_book: Daily morning regular practices to be run from 8:30 till 11 am on the Pennsic Battlefield Youth List. Youth aged 6-17. Loaner gear will be available.
description_web: Daily morning regular practices to be run from 8:30 till 11 am on the Pennsic Battlefield Youth List. Youth aged 6-17, all levels of experience on three different list fields. Loaner gear will be available.

name: Ask a Scribe
description_book: These drop-in classes are ideal for scribes of all levels to speak one-on-one with an experienced scribe for help and advice.
description_web: These are informal drop-in classes for any scribe who's looking for advice, guidance, or help with any aspect of calligraphy and/or illumination. Several different experienced scribes will be hosting these sessions during Peace Week and War Week.

name: Pennsic Youth *Commedia dell'Arte*
description_book: Hands-on class giving the description and history of *commedia* before having the youth create and eventually perform their own skit. Ages 13-17.
description_web: Young adults will learn the art of *commedia dell'arte* while practicing and creating skits that will be performed at the end of the week. Ages 13-17.

name: Archery Practice
description_book: Warm up, practice shoot, and have fun on the Archery Range.
description_web: Warm up, practice shoot, and have fun on the Archery Range.

name: *Meigaku*: Design and Document Japanese Names
description_book: Learn how to design, document, and register with the College of Arms a Japanese name which is appropriate for a particular time and social role.
description_web: Do you want to design a Japanese personal name which is appropriate for a particular time and social role? Do you want to design a Japanese group name for your war band or theater troupe? Are you a herald who wants to increase your repertoire of culture-specific naming practices? Would you like to know how rank, title, and office relate to all of this and how to include them in people's names? Would you like to learn how to pronounce Japanese names and summon people into court? Then this class is for you! Learn how the structure of Japanese personal and group names varied by time, period, and social status. Learn to design pre-modern names and attach titles.
fee_itemization: There will be a multi-page handout.

name: Beginning Tatting, Part 2
description_book: Tatting is a type of lacemaking. Supplies can be found at craft stores. Learn a craft that fits in a Ziploc bag. Do it in the car or at court!
description_web: Part 2 will review the double stitch. You'll learn how to use the picot as decorative element and as a way to join rings. Time and energy permitting, we'll advance on to making chains between rings. Attendees from previous years are always welcome to come and refresh their memory.
fee_itemization: I provide a prewound shuttle, a handout with directions & projects.

name: The History and Development of the Houppelande
description_book: A discussion of the history and development of the houppelande, the last universal style in Europe for men and women. Pattern discussion included.
description_web: A discussion of the history and development of the houppelande, the last universal style in Europe for men and women. Pattern discussion included. From pictorial sources, we will look at the way the houppelande developed and where it headed in each region of Europe. We will look at two different pattern ideas and what makes them each work.
fee_itemization: $7 for a full-color thick handout.  15 handouts available.

name: Veneto in the 16th Century
description_book: Focusing on fashions in Veneto (Republic of Venice) in the 16th century with some architecture.
description_web: Looking at fashions from 1490-1590s, mostly of Veneto, and some of the architecture of the period. Come see some photos of various places in Veneto outside of Venice proper!
fee_itemization: $3 for paper print outs with directions and additional information

name: Wood Block Stamping and Stenciling on Fabric
description_book: Using woodblock stamps to print on fabric is hundreds of years old and is period for the SCA time frame. Come give it a try!
description_web: Using woodblock stamps to print on fabric is hundreds of years old and is period for the SCA time frame. The class will have a discussion on the history of the craft and the handout will include a timeline and detailed instructions on how to print on fabric. This is a hands-on class. Come on out and learn how to enhance anything that is fabric.
fee_itemization: Each kit will include a woodblock stamp, a stencil, a piece of fabric, a felt base to work on, and plates as palettes. All of these are for the students to keep. Paint and other supplies to share will be provided in class.

name: History of Food and Eating
description_book: The shocking secret history of food and eating. A radical feast of information for anyone with a mouth!

name: The Everyday Tudor
description_book: Clothing of the common Tudor man or woman. Will cover daily wear, sumptuary laws, sources of secondhand clothing, and clothing as an asset.
description_web: Takes a look at wills and inventories to examine what clothing and domestic items were owned by the average Tudor/Elizabethan person. Plus, how to use basics and accessories to create a "capsule wardrobe" to take you from the marketplace to feast.

name: Modern Gaming: War Week
description_book: A place, with power, to play modern games from 9 am to 10:30 pm every day.

name: A History and Analysis of Woad Throughout the Ages
description_book: A brief history on the provenance of woad and other indigo-producing plants throughout history.
description_web: A lecture class on the importance of woad in history. We will talk about provenance, cultural impact, production and how chemical analysis can be used to determine dye composition in ancient textiles.
fee_itemization: 15 full page color handout.  Digital copy also available.

name: So You Want to Have a Jewish Persona
description_book: Advice on creating and enacting a period Jewish persona.
description_web: This is an overview class on creating and enacting a Jewish persona: how to pick a name; what garb is appropriate; what professions could your persona engage in; are there Jewish arts and sciences; and would-be Jewish armory. There'll be a discussion of Jews’ badges and why they **shouldn't** be worn; period Jewish fighters; and names and opportunities for female Jewish personas.
fee_itemization: The cost is for my printing the multi-page handouts.

name: Anglo-Saxon Magick
description_book: Covers the spells, chants, amulets, runes, and other techniques used by Anglo-Saxons as they changed over the six centuries of AS England.
description_web: The Anglo-Saxons used spells, chants, amulets, runes, and other sorts of magickal techniques well after they were nominally converted to Christianity. This workshop gives an overview of the material that has survived, as what was acceptable changed from year to year and place to place in the first millennium as well as in the second.

name: Tapestry Frame Weaving Basics
description_book: A simple introduction to frame weaving such as tapestry, etc.
description_web: A simple introduction to frame weaving such as tapestry, etc. Class limited to 10 looms. Fee covers loom, accessories, yarn and instructions.
fee_itemization: loom, accessories, yarn & instructions

name: Basic Painting for Scribes
description_book: For beginners: How to lay down gouache in a flat, matte finish and add whitework atop those paints.
description_web: A class for beginners on how to lay down gouache in a flat, matte finish and add whitework atop those paints. If you are already have paints and other equipment, you are encouraged to bring them for an evaluation. This class is style independent as it is the general painting techniques that will be taught.

name: Pennsic Youth Theatre
description_book: Kids ages 5-17, join us in creating & performing, from story book to stage, your very own play! Creative minds + theatrical tools = a fun-filled time!
description_web: For kids ages 5-17 interested in exploring their creative and theatrical sides through storytelling, acting, and producing their very own play! Come join us as we build a theatre show from the ground up, giving younger kids a creative outlet for all that pent-up camping energy! Children 12 and under must have a parent or guardian present.

name: Heraldry for the Newcomer
description_book: An unconfusing (hopefully) guide on how to find a name and device. How to research and then submit. Want to be a herald...stop by!
description_web: Choosing a Society/persona name and device is both personal and fulfilling. In this class we will begin with the basics to get you started. Learn how and where to begin your research, who to contact, and the rules governing submissions. If you are interested in becoming a herald, we will be talking about that towards the end of the class.

name: Life of William Marshal
description_book: A class on the life of William Marshal, tournament champion and knight (1146-1219); his biography was written just a few years after his death.
description_web: A class on the life of William Marshal, the 1st Earl of Pembroke, tournament champion, and knight (1146-1219); his biography was written just a few years after his death.

name: Stitching *Temari*, Japanese Embroidery Balls
description_book: Learn a traditional Japanese embroidery art that's centuries old, but perfect for a modern crafter. We'll start one ball that you finish on your own.
description_web: *Temari* is a terrific craft for the modern stitcher, but it can be documented back to around 600 CE. In this class, we will start with a premade and marked ball, and use wrapping and stitching techniques to create a piece that is impressive far out of proportion with the effort involved.
fee_itemization: materials to stitch one ball, plus enough to begin several more

name: Putting a Leash on Performance Anxiety
description_book: Stage fright plagues many performers. How does it work? How do you deal with it? Learn some simple strategies to help you overcome your fears.
description_web: Stage fright plagues many performers. How does it work? How do you deal with it? Learn some simple strategies to help you overcome your fears and give you the freedom to enjoy what you already love to do!

name: Tailoring a Supportive Kirtle for 1500's Europe
description_book: A step-by-step overview of how to construct a women's kirtle using tailoring techniques, suitable for multiple regions of 15th-C. Europe.
description_web: A step-by-step exploration of how to construct a basic 16th-century women's kirtle using tailoring techniques to achieve a supportive and structured fit. We will discuss materials, stitches, padstitching, interlining, patterns, and more. Examples of kirtles (and their inner structures) will be available to inspect. These techniques can be applied to garments worn by female-presenting individuals throughout Europe in the late-period.

name: Garb From Simple Shapes
description_book: We'll discuss how clothing can be constructed from simple geometric shapes, based on extant garments from various parts of SCA period.
description_web: This class will discuss how clothing can be constructed from simple geometric shapes, based on extant garments from various parts of SCA period. We will look at how the extant pieces use rectangles and triangles to create clothing to fit the human body. Strategies for fitting and sizing to the individual will be discussed.

instructor: Mistress Beatriz Aluares de la Oya
name: Ceuta: Iberian Stronghold in Northern Africa
description_book: A short overview of the history of Spain and Portugal in the port city of Ceuta.

location: Atlantian Royal (Fiber Arts Pavilion) (Block N40, front edge of the Atlantian Royal Encampment, in the Artisans Easement)
name: Inkle Weaving: Pattern Design
description_book: Learn common motifs used in complex inkle patterns and how to pattern those motifs. Will also touch on how to reverse engineer a pattern.
description_web: Inkle weaving is used to craft bands of trim or tapes which can be used for a variety of purposes. This class will focus on common motifs used in complex inkle patterns and how to pattern those motifs. We will also touch on how to reverse engineer a pattern from an existing piece of inkle trim.

name: Intermediate Irish Language for SCAdians
description_book: Conversational Irish based on SCA scenarios.
description_web: Already speak *a cupla focal* (a few words) in Irish? Or have you attended the Beginning Irish Language class? Brush up your basics and keep the momentum going. Learn more SCA-related phrases to start conversations, and some Irish blessings and curses.
fee_itemization: copying costs

name: *Seishin-ryū Chadō Okeiko*: Tea Ceremony Workshop
description_book: Learn the rudiments of *wabi*-style tea including both the role of the host and the role of the guest. This is a multi-part workshop for beginners.
description_web:
Learn the rudiments of *wabi*-style tea including both the role of the host and the role of the guest. This is a multi-part workshop for beginners. Please come to as many classes as possible. 
*Okeiko* means "honorable practice". Both the role of the guest and the role of the host will be introduced. You will learn something new in each workshop. We will begin with walking and bowing and progress to the rudiments of preparing and consuming a bowl of *matcha*. Limited materials will be available for student use during the workshop. 
If you are interested in purchasing materials for long-term personal use, then you should acquire a guest kit and a *fukusa*: 
A guest kit for men can be acquired at http://www.teadogu.com/guest-starter-kit-man339.html
A guest kit for women can be acquired at http://www.teadogu.com/guest-starter-kit-woman339.html
A *fukusa* for men can be acquired at http://www.teadogu.com/fumepunu9si.html
A *fukusa* for women can be acquired at http://www.teadogu.com/fuworenu9si.html
While it is possible to save money by ordering directly from Japan, doing so requires dealing with Japanese online storefronts. A note about *fukusa*. A number #9 *fukusa* is much easier to manipulate than *fukusa* with lower numbers. Paying extra is worth the price. A *fukusa* and a fan are what  you need to practice during class. I have an extremely limited number of loaner *fukusa*. You can substitute a number of items  for a fan. Please read the online descriptions of the fans carefully if you choose to provide a substitute or acquire a fan from another source.
There are a number of ways to acquire a 袱紗 *fukusa*. You can even try to make one, but please don't until you know what they are supposed to be like. There is some controversy over just how old they are. Today, men use slightly larger *fukusa* than women do. Further, men always use purple *fukusa* and women typically only use purple *fukusa* after they have become senior instructors. Regardless, here are purchase options. (1) You can always try ebay. (2) You can order online from any of several tea supply stores in Japan through rakuten.co.jp. (3) You can order one from a fellow in Portland http://www.teadogu.com/fukusa.html. (Yes, they really are that expensive.) I will try to pick up a couple of loaners (I currently have one) between now and Pennsic. Regardless, the fan is the symbol of the guest, and the *fukusa* is the symbol of the host in the world of tea.
fee_itemization: This class will include a multi-page printed handout.

name: *Kute-uchi*: Japanese Hand Loop Braiding
description_book: Learn the basic techniques of this period Japanese loop-manipulation braiding technique to create a sampler with three five-loop braids.
description_web: This period Japanese braiding technique was "lost" to the general population as a closely-held secret until modern research "re-discovered" it. *Kute-uchi* is similar to other methods of loop braiding, except the loops are lined up on the hands instead of held by the fingers. This enables experienced braiders to create braids using more than ten elements, with no additional equipment. Learn the basic techniques of *kute-uchi* to create a sampler with three five-loop braids. If time allows, you may be able to learn some more complex braids.

name: Rarely-Taught English Country Dances
description_book: Learn English Country Dances less-frequently taught at SCA events. Dances taught may include *Old Mole, Chestnut, Dargason*, or others.

name: Storytelling Academy
description_book: Explore genres, tools, styles, and uses of storytelling. Cultural and medieval approaches, applications, performance coaching. New topics each day.
description_web: During this academy, students will gain knowledge about the history and techniques for storytelling both in the SCA and the modern world. Students may attend individual sessions or all of the academy. There may be guest teachers and will be time for students to practice and receive feedback. The academy may culminate in a student performance. No classes are repeated. The focus is on developing comfort, nurturing, and honing skills within the students’ capabilities. All levels are welcome. Students may view a class outline at the academy space, Minerva’s Spindle 158, where classes will also be listed on the message board. Seating is limited; feel free to bring your own chair. Student Performance, date, time, and location will be announced.

name: Pre-School  Playgroup
description_book: Let our preschoolers tire each other out! Let the parents and guardians make friends! Meets at Toddler Lounge Shade by playground

name: Æthelmearc's Ladies' Rapier Tourney
description_book: Ladies' Rapier Tourney, sponsored by the Kingdom of Æthelmearc.
description_web: Ladies' Rapier Tourney, sponsored by the Kingdom of Æthelmearc. All women, non-binary, and gender minorities are welcome at our tourney. Format to be determined depending on size but lots of fighting.

name: Master Magnus' Mystery Tournament
description_book: What will this tournament entail? Show up and find out! For advanced throwers only!
description_web: What will this tournament entail? Show up and find out! For advanced throwers only!

name: The Da Vinci Atlatls
description_book: A discussion/presentation of the various types of atlatls that appeared in Leonardo Da Vinci’s manuscripts.
description_web: This class will be a discussion/presentation of the various types of atlatls that appeared in Leonardo Da Vinci’s manuscripts

name: Weed Walk
description_book: Wild plant identification. Wear walking shoes and hat; leave from Univ. Point. Different teachers on different days; walk with us more than once!
description_web: Cooper's Lake abounds with medicinal and food plants that were used by various primitive and medieval cultures. Learn to identify them during a walk around the campsite. The walk will take place rain or shine. Please wear sturdy shoes and a hat. Meet at University Point for the start of the class. We have multiple teachers, so if you attend more than one walk, you will likely learn different things!

location: Heralds Point (Herald's Point, behind the playground. )
name: Heralds' Mentoring Meet-Up at Heralds' Point
description_book: A heraldic staff member will discuss your mentoring needs (armory or names). We will find you someone to shadow.
description_web: A heraldic staff member will discuss your mentoring needs (armory or names). We will find you someone to shadow.

name: Known World Adventurers Guild: **Walk Day**
description_book: Teen explorers (and youth 10+) will gather information via supervised Pennsic site walks. All activities begin and end at Family Point. KWAGuild.com.
description_web:
**WANTED**: Teen adventurers (and youth 10+) with a thirst for exploration, cultural exchange, and making friends within the SCA. Guildmistress Marian of Heatherdale invites you to join KWAG (the Known World Adventurers Guild) here at Pennsic 50. Her noble company of young explorers will gather information through supervised in-person walks around the Pennsic site. Who knows who you'll meet... Visiting royalty? One of the SCA's Founders? Someone from the esteemed Cooper Family? Come and find out. KWAG activities run throughout both weeks, and alternate between KWAG Walk Days and KWAG Social Days. All activities begin and end at Family Point. Everyone is welcome! Please note: this is an active class. The group will be walking to various public locations on the Pennsic site (no private camps). All participants should wear sturdy shoes, a hat and sunscreen, and bring water. More info at KWAGuild.com.
     **INFO FOR PARENTS/CAREGIVERS:**  KWAG classes are designed for teens and older children (10+). All activities will be supervised by a warranted and background-checked youth officer plus at least one other responsible adult. All abilities are happily welcomed. Please email heather@heatherdale.com if we can help provide any special accommodations in advance. Parents and caregivers are very welcome to join the walks, and are encouraged to accompany their kids if any special needs might affect the child's enjoyment of the classes.

name: That Personal Touch
description_book: Using discrete inquiries, social networking, and ethical data mining to better personalize a scroll for a recipient.
description_web: Personalizing a scroll for a recipient is easy when the scribe knows the recipient. But there are ways to add personalizing touches to a scroll when you don't know the recipient. We will look at some methods including using discrete inquiries, social networking, and ethical data mining to better personalize a scroll for a recipient without spilling the beans.

name: Archery Populace Point Shoot
description_book: Shoot the Castle Window, Soldier Shoot, and Clout for Points.
description_web:
Format: The Pennsic Populace Archery War Point consists of three separate shoots; each shoot is worth 1 War Point for a total of 3 War Points. The winner of each shoot is determined by total number of points tallied by archers over the course of the War. Scores will be tallied each day and posted in the Marshals' Tent. Any member of the populace may participate.
Multiple individuals may share a bow; however, it must be inspected with each user to ensure safety.

Description: There are 3 parts to the populace shoot.
Castle Clout Shoot (1 War Point): The target is a simulated castle turret. Archers will be shooting at about 100 yards into a square of approximately 27 feet by 27 feet giving an approximate area of 729 square feet. There will be a moat monster protecting the castle in front at about 50 yards. This is an untimed shoot; archers are allowed 6 arrows or bolts. Scoring for this shoot is as follows:
1 point for inside the moat.
2 points for hitting the moat monster.
3 points for inside the castle.
4 points for hitting objects inside the castle.

Soldier Shoot (1 War Point): The archers will shoot 6 arrows or bolts, untimed, at the soldiers that are invading. These targets will be set at approximately 15 yards, 35 yards, 45 yards, and 55 yards. Any arrow or bolt hitting the painted portion of the target scores as follows:
1 point for the 15-yard target.
2 points for the 35-yard target.
3 points for the 45-yard target.
4 points for the 55-yard target.

Castle Window Shoot (1 War Point): Archers will shoot 6 arrows or bolts, untimed, at a castle window located between 25 and 35 yards. The castle window will be at least 8 inches wide and 36 inches tall. There will be an object inside the castle window. Scoring will be as follows: 1 point for each arrow or bolt inside the castle window, 2 points for each arrow or bolt inside the object in the castle window.

name: Four-Color Flat Lucet Cord
description_book: We will make a flat cord on the lucet that will have up to 4 colors using bobbins.
description_web: Cord from a lucet can be quite flexible in color and structure. We will be making a flat cord with up to four colors. The threads hang below the lucet on bobbins to keep from getting tangled. Bring your own lucet and bobbins which can be made out of cardboard or foam, or we will have kits for $25 containing both a lucet, fiber and four bobbins.
fee_itemization:
Lucet $20
thread and bobbins $5

name: You Are What You Eat: Humoural Doctrine
description_book: An overview of the theory of balancing the human condition thru food.
description_web: An overview of the theory of balancing the human condition thru food.

name: Anglo-Saxon Alliterative Poetry Workshop
description_book: Brief intro to the Anglo-Saxon Alliterative Tradition (think "Beowulf"); most of the class is guided group-work to produce some actual poetry.
description_web: The Anglo-Saxon Alliterative Tradition (for example: "Beowulf") is poetry meant not to be read to oneself, but to be listened to: the rough rhythm of the beats, threaded together by alliteration forms the groundwork; kennings are the bright jewels embedded in it; and the tapestry ideas should capture the imagination with vivid imagery of high deeds or fell; of heroes and villains larger than life; of sentiments that mark the soul. We will look briefly at the metrical forms, the alliteration rules, and examples of kennings; but the bulk of the learning comes in the workshop: constructing lines that ring in the air, telling a story that needs hearing. We will work together to create a product.

name: Divination: Advanced Topics
description_book: Practical issues for scryers, diviners, fortune tellers.
description_web: Real talk for would-be scryers, diviners, fortune tellers. Starting out advice. Choosing your oracular system. Training and use of intuition. Resources. Ethics. Duty of care. Emergency situations. My previous divination classes are recommended but not required.

name: Needle-Lace Class 2: "Stitches in the Air"
description_book: We will continue our adventure in learning needle-lace by jumping off the fabric and taking stitches in the air.
description_web: We will continue our adventure in learning needle-lace by jumping off the fabric and taking stitches in the air... the actual lace part of needle-lace. You will learn how to prep the foundation pattern, how to create the structural framework and several of the stitches used to create the lace. This is the second class in the series. (First one is "preparing the window"). NOTE: You may take Class 2 if you have not had Class 1, but you will be constructing your lace apart from the fabric (Punto en aria.) You will need to purchase the kit, if any remain, from Class 1 ($4 total: handout, needles, thread, linen, loan of embroidery hoop, loan of 6.0 magnification.) Priority will be given to students from Class 1. New students may also just observe.

name: Two-Color Lucet Cord
description_book: Come learn to make beautiful, two-colored, square cordage on a lucet. Includes takeaway materials to make one of your own!
fee_itemization: Fee covers the cost of a 3D printed lucet and enough of each color string to make a medallion cord wrapped on a bobbin

name: Mythbusting Period Piracy
description_book: The differences between period and non-period piratical portrayals will be outlined.
description_web: The differences between period and non-period piratical portrayals will be outlined. Common myths and mistakes about piracy in the SCA period will be highlighted.

location: Atlantian Royal (Fiber Arts Pavilion) (Block N40, front edge of the Atlantian Royal Encampment)
name: Inkle Weaving: Warping Your Loom
description_book: We'll focus on modern inkle loom anatomy, pattern reading, loom setup, and how to weave an inkle band. Looms not provided.
description_web: Inkle weaving is used to craft bands of trim or tapes which can be used for a variety of purposes. This class will focus on modern inkle loom anatomy, pattern reading, loom setup, and how to weave an inkle band. Looms will not be provided. Please bring a loom if you want to set up a warp during the class. Crochet cotton will be available on a first-come, first-served basis.

name: Fire Pit Cooking Play Date
description_book: Safety, techniques and tools of fire pit cooking. Hands-on, clay pots and cast iron. Bring your own toys or see how mine are used!
description_web: This is a hands-on class for those interested in fire pit cooking. If you have equipment you'd like to try or demonstrate, bring it! Share my fire while I cook dinner for my camp. There will be some taste testing, and we can experiment with different techniques. We can also discuss things general to feast preparation, such as planning and accommodating allergies.

name: Drafting and Distaff
description_book: How you treat your fiber will change what type of yarn you end up with. Come experiment with drafting methods and using a distaff.
description_web: How you treat your fiber will change what type of yarn you end up with. Come experiment with a distaff and discover how silly modern spinners are for not using one. Try different drafting methods and see how yarns behave differently. Attendees should know how to spin. Spindle and fiber will be provided, but feel free to bring any spinning implement or fiber you may already possess.

name: The Wild Hunt
description_book: The Wild Hunt is a folk myth with many variations involving interaction between humans and a group of supernatural, other-world riders.
description_web: The Wild Hunt is a folk myth with many variations involving interaction between humans and a group of supernatural riders. Sometimes *fae*, sometimes dead, sometimes associated with leaders from Odin to Mother Holle. We'll explore many aspects of this phenomenon.
fee_itemization: optional $5 booklet

location: Courtesan College (Strawberry Fields B06 (off eLeri Lane between Ankara and Visby Vale))
name: Courtesan Persona 101 - CCt
description_book: This is an **adults only** class for those interested in portraying a courtesan persona in the SCA. **Age 18+**
description_web: This is an **adults only** class for those interested in portraying a courtesan persona in the SCA. People of all ages **over 18** and all genders welcome. We will be discussing how to speak and act like an elite sex worker and how to handle a number of situations you might find yourself in while in persona at events. For a list of content warnings or any further information, please contact Ginevra at ginevrafiammettadisilvestri@gmail.com.

name: Advanced Italian: *Fortunosa*
description_book: *Fortunosa* is an advanced 15th-century Italian *Bassa Danza* for four dancers. Slow and flirtatious, it's a great dance for showing off your skills.

name: Morris Games
description_book: Come learn to play a classic! *Nine Man's Morris* and other games of that family (which include the modern tic-tac-toe) will be taught.
description_web: Come learn to play a classic! *Nine Man's Morris* and other games of that family (which include the modern tic-tac-toe) will be taught.

name: *Commedia* All Stars **Rehearsal**
description_book: Rehearsal for *Commedia* All Stars troupe: Saturday, Aug. 5, through and including Thursday, Aug. 10, daily, from 11:00 am - 1:00 pm.
description_web: Rehearsal for *Commedia* All Stars troupe: Saturday, Aug. 5, through and including Thursday, Aug. 10, daily, from 11:00 am - 1:00 pm.

name: Indigo *Sutras*: Illuminated Buddhist Manuscripts
description_book: Black Hours have nothing on these! Learn how the need for preservation resulted in one of the most visually arresting forms of Buddhist art.

name: Iron *Commedia*
description_book: Learn *commedia* in a fully immersive experience! This class culminates in a performance.
description_web: Learn *commedia dell'arte* in this fully immersive experience. This class will educate students about the basics of *commedia*. After the introduction to the art form, the class will then work together to write a scenario, rehearse it, and perform it later in the day.

name: Supporting the 16th-Century Silhouette
description_book: We'll examine different types of skirt, collar, and sleeve supports used to create the distinct silhouettes found in the 16th century.
description_web: This class examines the historical and cultural significance of the increasingly distinct silhouettes that emerged in 16th-century Europe and the support structures used to create them. I will have examples of support garments for skirts, collars, and sleeves plus materials for students to examine and discuss construction and techniques used. Please note: **THIS IS NOT A CORSET CLASS.**

name: Viking Wire Weave Roundtable
description_book: Woven some wire but now need help finishing it? Want to show off your beautiful projects? Come chat!
description_web: Calling all Viking Wire Weave Enthusiasts!!! Want to take your wire weaving skill to the next level? Come see more advanced techniques and projects. It's stitch-and-bitch, but with wire!

name: Alliteration in Period
description_book: Alliteration is more than just tongue twisters. We will explore alliteration in period like Beowulf, Shakespeare, and poetry.
description_web: Alliteration is more than just tongue twisters. Look at some of the great writers in period like Shakespeare, Anglo-Saxon poetry, or even songs. Alliteration is a useful sound device that adds calm to a poem or draws attention to a phrase spoken or enhances the catchy cadence of a song. In this course, we will look at the many forms of alliteration and even write some of our own. May we join together merrily to explore some of the aspects of alliteration.

name: Introduction to Goldwork
description_book: This is a historical overview of types of gold threads and bullion used in period, with some show-and-tell and advice on how to get started.
description_web: This is a historical overview of types of gold threads and bullion used in period, with some show-and-tell and advice on how to get started and where to find the materials.

name: The Assassin Pennsic Game Get-Together
description_book: Are you playing in the Assassins Game? We would like all players to meet up with the Referee and go through all the rules and concepts of the game.
description_web: Are you playing in the Assassins Game? The Chartered Assassins Guilds of the East and Æthelmearc would like to meet up with the people participating and go through all the rules and concepts of the game during either of two scheduled times during the first week. On August 10th, we'll have a check-in just in case anyone has any complaints, suggestions, or wants to ask questions about where things were.

name: Exploring Names from West Africa
description_book: We'll explore names from multiple West African linguistic traditions from period Portuguese records, as well as West African Arabic texts.
description_web: Portuguese records have information about West African culture, including documents written in Portuguese by Kongolese rulers. This class explores names from multiple West African linguistic traditions from period Portuguese and Spanish records. We'll also briefly discuss names recorded in West African Arabic texts.
