name: Learn to Spin
description_book: Introduction to spinning on a spindle, focusing on the park-and-draft method.
description_web: Focusing on the park-and-draft method, we’ll walk through the basics of how to spin wool into yarn. This is intended for people who have never spun before, or people who need a refresher for that spindle they bought three years ago and never quite figured out. We will focus on basic spinning techniques, not necessarily period techniques. Spindle and fiber will be provided, but feel free to bring any spinning implement or fiber you may already possess.

name: Weaving the Dance: *Tesara*
description_book: An advanced 15th-century performance dance for ten people mimicking the weaving of brocade. A visually stunning and exciting routine!
description_web: An advanced 15th-century performance dance for ten people mimicking the weaving of brocade. A visually stunning and exciting routine!

name: Savory Cabbage, Meat Pottage, Soused Fish
description_book: Savory cabbage, chicken and salt pork pottage, and a soused fish from the 1549 *Banchetti*.
description_web: Savoy cabbage cooked in water with a crust of hard cheese, butter and salt and when nearly done more butter is added with Italian parsley and then cooked a bit more. Served for the feast with grated hard cheese and black pepper on top. Pottage of chicken breast with salt pork with true cinnamon, crushed ginger, and eggs. This is layered over a low pastry crust and baked cooked and when done served with a garnish of true cinnamon and candied pine nuts. A whole cleaned fish with a small amount of salt, floured, and fried in olive oil till done and then drained. Next a sousing mixture of vinegar, pepper, true cinnamon, ginger, cloves, salt, and saffron is brought to the boil and the fish is soused for a minute in the mixture and then wrapped in dried bay leaves and dried in a 150 F oven for several hours for preservation purposes.

name: How to Be Heard: Vocal Techniques to get **LOUD**
description_book: Modern theatrical vocal techniques to be heard loudly and distinctly on the field or in Court. Drop-in, take one session or multiple.
description_web: Modern theatrical vocal techniques for the Creative Anachronist to help you be heard loudly and distinctly on the field or in Court. We will learn and practice a vocal warm-up designed to enhance breath, resonance, and diction. Class is led by a professional actor and teaching artist. Attend any or all sessions, you do **NOT** need to be at all classes to fully participate.

name: Known World Choirs Recording and Rehearsal
description_book: Children, Youth, *Chorulus Pennsicus* and KWC will record and rehearse in this order.
description_web: Children, Youth, *Chorulus Pennsicus* and KWC will record and rehearse in this order in preparation for their concert on Thursday, August 11.

name: Methods of Learning for Martial Students
description_book: Psychology and the Fencing Woman series: Learn how to identify and lean into the natural ways your students learn best.
description_web: Taken from Master Gwynn's *Psychology and the Fencing Woman* manual. In this part of the series, come away with what the professional teachers already know: each student learns differently and how to best leverage their natural abilities for faster, happier progress.

name: Sino-Scribal Playtime
description_book: An opportunity for those who took any of the classes in the Sino-Scribal Workshop to practice the techniques they learned earlier in the week.

name: The Medieval Palette: Using Your Paint, Pt. 2
description_book: Attendees of Medieval Palette Pt.1 practice using their pigments effectively, with discussions on mixing, opacity, and application.
description_web: This class is intended to follow The Medieval Palette: Pt. 1. We will use the paints we created in the first class to paint with, to work with getting the consistency right, discussing how to use the properties of opacity and transparency correctly. We'll work on painting a couple of provided scroll blanks. There will also be some color theory discussion regarding shading and highlighting during the class, with discussion regarding various artistic styles throughout the SCA time period.
fee_itemization: Fee will cover pre-made scribal blanks on pergamenata. Each student will also be provided paper towels, gloves, brushes, water dishes, water, pencils, erasers, and any extra binder they may need for their paint to work properly.

name: Handmade Veil Pins
description_book: Learn how to make handmade veil pins, both plain and beaded versions. If you have needle nose pliers/wire cutters, please bring them to class.
description_web: Veil pins are useful to hold your veil to your head/coif/wimple and add a little bling. I will be teaching how to make two versions of veil pins, one with beads and one without. If you have jewelry pliers (needle nose, or flat), wire cutters, small hammer, and/or files, please bring them to class. I will have a small assortment of tools needed, however, not enough for a full class. You will leave with 2 sets of 3 veil pins.
fee_itemization: enough wire for 6 pins and beads for 3 pins

name: *Contrafacta*: Yes, Filking is Period
description_book: We will discuss the history and impact of *contrafacta* (period filks), and give some tips on how to write them.
description_web:
*Musica Contrafacta* means reworked or recycled music. In French, it is *contrefait*, which is the root of our word counterfeit. In other words, you make new music by copying a popular tune, to which you set new lyrics. A *contrafactum* (Latin singular; *contrafacta* is plural) is a period filk. 
 
Lady Melanie de la Tour will discuss the history and impact of *contrafacta*/filks, and gives some tips on how to write them. Active participation is encouraged.

name: East Kingdom Brewers' Panels
description_book: **Age 21+**. Gentles interested in Paneling beverages for rankings within the East Kingdom Brewer's Guild. Bring your beverage and documentation.
description_web: This is an opportunity for ranking within the East Kingdom Brewer's Guild.  Individuals are encouraged to enter their beverages (alcoholic/non-alcoholic) with documentation to be paneled by members of the Guild. We attempt to create period beverages and are looking for accuracy and research skills. Most of the beverage weighs more towards the documentation than taste/smell/color/clarity. **Age 21+**.

name: East Kingdom Brewers' Roundtable
description_book: Opportunity for brewers from both East and others to get together and discuss our beverages. We'll also talk about future guild events. **Age 21+.**
description_web: This is an opportunity for brewers to share their beverages and talk about their research in a relaxed atmosphere. We encourage input on what the guild is doing and where we're headed. Please come and enjoy beverages while and meet others who share your interest. **Age 21.**

name: *Romani*: An Introduction to "Gypsy" Persona
description_book: Want a *Romani* persona, but don't know how/where to start? Learn about the *Rom*, their history, and the fun of this fascinating persona.
description_web: Want a *Romani* persona, but don't know how/where to start? Learn about the *Rom*, their history, common pitfalls, and the fun of this fascinating persona. We will be covering their history, migration routes, clothing, and how to portray this persona within the SCA.

name: What's in Your Roman Pantry?
description_book: Find out what ingredients were common in Roman cooking, and how they were used.
description_web: We will discuss and sample some of the most common ingredients featured in recipes from Apicius, learn their many uses, and how we can bring Roman flavors into our everyday cooking. **Tasting samples may contain allergens.**
fee_itemization: fee for handout and food samples

name: Identifying and Addressing Cultural Appropriation
description_book: We’ll identify ways cultures interact, including appreciation, exchange, assimilation, and appropriation, and how we can avoid problematic behavior.
description_web: We’ll identify some of the different ways that cultures interact, including cultural appreciation, exchange, assimilation, and the problematic appropriation. We’ll talk about why cultural appropriation is so harmful, in both a modern and SCA context, and explore some ways of self-evaluating and addressing our own behavior to avoid it. There will also be a discussion portion, so please bring your questions and we can explore them as a group.

name: Honey Tasting: The Finest Honeys of the World!
description_book: This is a honey tasting and story telling. The finest world honeys will be sampled from Yemen to Crete, USA to Croatia.
description_web: This is a honey tasting and story telling brought to you by a world traveling beekeeper. The finest honeys of the world will be sampled... from Yemen to Crete, USA to Croatia. We'll cover the honey mentioned by Pliny the Elder to be the finest in the Roman world, to the world's most expensive honey. You will get to explore your palate and write down your thoughts on each.  Bring water to cleanse your palate.
fee_itemization: Handouts, tasting spoons, and these honey's are expensive, especially Sidr at $600/bottle. I'm just trying to break even.

name: Amber: Northern Gold
description_book: Make-and-take class. Learn how to take a piece of raw amber and begin to shape and polish it while we have casual discussion on historical relevance.
description_web: Amber has played an important part in history. It was sought after not only for decoration, but also used as a talisman or amulet, used medicinally to treat a variety of ailments, and used as currency for trade. Participants will be taught how to take a piece of raw amber and begin to shape and polish it to bring out the natural unique qualities of each piece of history. While you are busy shaping away, there will be a casual discussion on historical and mythical relevance.
fee_itemization:
raw amber
polishing materials

name: *Il Titolo Provvisorio* Rehearsal
description_book: Closed rehearsal for *Il Titolo Provvisorio*.

name: Women Can't Read, Debunk'd: A Sleeping Pen Awake'd
description_book: Women's literacy between 1400-1600 was a much contested (and complicated) concept. This class examines how women interacted with texts.
description_web: Literacy does not mean the same thing today that it meant 500 years ago, and this change is more complicated when the question of gender enters the picture. We will examine women's literacy between 1400-1600, and will examine women who wrote, men and women who wrote about women writing, and the distinction between women reading and women writing.

name: *Ludus duodecim scriptorum* or *XII Scripta*
description_book: A Roman game as important as chess is today. Learn to play the game, then stay to play round-robin competition. Winner takes home a game set.
description_web: A Roman game as important as chess is today. Come learn to play the game, then stay to play round-robin competition. Winner takes home a game set.

name: Intro to Period Pigments and Paints
description_book: Malachite and ochre! Glair and gum arabic! Learn about period pigments and binders.
description_web: Learn about pigments and binders such as glair and gum arabic, malachite and ochre.
fee_itemization: covers pigments, binders, palette, tools

name: Inkle Weaving Basics
description_book: Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and weave an inkle strip on our mini inkle loom.
description_web: Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and weave an inkle strip on our mini inkle loom. Classroom loaner looms provided. Class limited to 10 looms.
fee_itemization: weaving materials, string, & instructions

name: Youth Thrown Weapons Tournament
description_book: Youth Thrown Weapons Tournament for ages 5 - 17. There will be scoring in two age groups: 5 - 11, and 12 - 17.
description_web: Youth Thrown Weapons Tournament for ages 5 - 17. There will be scoring in two age groups: 5 - 11, and 12 - 17. This is an annual contest and only axes are used in scoring.

name: Children's Choir
description_book: For children 13 and younger. Sing music in a period style. Meets daily. Performance on Thursday of War Week!
description_web: For children 13 and younger. Sing music in a period style. Meets daily. Performance on Thursday of War Week! Responsible adult needs to be within reach for the younger ones. Bring a folder to hold music. We will teach rounds, songs and melodies from the medieval to Renaissance. Session will be 45 minutes. Dress rehearsal in PA tent on Thursday with a performance at 6 pm.

name: Henry VIII: Victim or Tyrant?
description_book: Was Henry VIII a victim of genetics, circumstance, and repetitive injury, or simply a tyrant? Let's discuss.

name: Viking Age Textile Tools: Archeological Evidence
description_book: A survey of textile tools found in Norse and neighboring sites, including spinning, weaving, and cutting tools.
description_web: A survey of textile tools found in Norse and neighboring sites. We will look at cards, combs, looms, loom weights, shears, shuttles, skein-winders, smoothing stones, spindles and spindle whorls from Birka, Coppergate, Dublin, Hedeby, Lund, Novgorod, Oseberg and Ribe.
fee_itemization: 50-page handout

location: Atlantian Royal (Fiber Arts Pavilion) (N40, front edge of the Atlantian Royal Encampment, in the Artisans Easement)
name: Retrieving Retted Flax at Pennsic
description_book: We will be retrieving the bundle of flax we put in to rett in the creek near the Fiber Arts Pavilion.
description_web: Flax is one of the oldest fibers used by man to create thread for weaving, but how do they get the fibers *out* of the flax plants? Retting is the term used for the process of "rotting" the plant fiber enough to release the bast fibers within the plants so they can be separated from the other plant material and used for spinning and weaving. We will be retrieving the bundle of flax we put in to rett in the creek near the Fiber Arts Pavilion.

name: Frame Drumming 101
description_book: *Tar, bendir, lag-na, Patayani thappu* . . . Frame drums are built and played every where/when we study. A hands-on introduction to hand drumming.
description_web: *Tar, bendir, lag-na, Patayani thappu* . . . Frame drums are built and played every where/when we study. We'll introduce some of the more common varieties of hand drums as well as their fundamental techniques. Some discussion of stick-played drums is included, but this is not the emphasis. *Bodhrans* are allowed but not recommended. A limited number of loaner drums will be available.

name: Advanced English Country Dance
description_book: From first edition Playford comes three challenging dances: *Saint Martins, Parson's Farewell*, and *Picking of Sticks*.

name: Toddler Playgroup
description_book: Let our toddlers tire each other out! Let the parents and guardians make friends! Meets at Toddler Lounge Shade by playground

name: Knitting in the 16th Century: An Overview
description_book: Not only is hand-knitting period, the 16th century has a wealth of items to choose from. We'll look at a wide range of caps, gloves, and hosen.
description_web: Not only is hand-knitting period, the 16th century has a wealth of items to choose from. We'll look at a wide range of caps, gloves, and hosen. Interested in Eleanora of Toledo's stockings? I was the first to publish the pattern!
fee_itemization: I have a handout with extensive bibliography.

name: Bardic Symposium #4: Creating Bardic Events
description_book: There have been a number of bardic-centric events. Discuss what we've learned from previous and current ones. What should we try next?
description_web: There have been a number of bardic-centric events. Discuss what we've learned from previous and current ones. How might existing events be improved? What new ones should we try to create? View the Bardic Symposium website here: https://tilted-windmill.com/pennsic50_symposium.html.

instructor: Mistress Dorigen of the Grey Gate
name: Rhyme (or Rime) Royal
description_book: A description and history of the verse form called Rhyme Royal, and an attempt by those present to write in that form.
description_web: A description and history of the verse form called Rhyme Royal, and an attempt by those present to write in that form.

name: Painting Your Period Canvas Tent
description_book: Want to paint your tent? Have you painted it already and want to commiserate with others? Come talk tent decoration and share your experiences!
description_web: Want to paint your tent? Have you painted it already and want to commiserate with others? Come talk tent decoration and share your experiences! The instructor has suffered through the joy of painting three period tents and will share all her trials and tribulations so you can avoid her mistakes!

name: Food Safety for SCA Cooks
description_book: Preparing an SCA feast is different from preparing a family dinner. Learn about the food safety practices needed to ensure a safe event.
description_web:
Preparing an SCA feast is different from preparing a family dinner. Learn about the food safety practices needed to ensure a safe event. Students will learn the causes of food-borne illness as well as safe food handling practices related to these:
Preventing Cross Contamination
Controlling Time and Temperature
Good Personal Hygiene
Cleaning and Sanitizing
Planning a Successful Food Event

Whether you are a new event cook, or you and your kitchen staff have been doing this for years, it is important to be up-to-date and knowledgeable about food safety.
fee_itemization: $2 for class handout

location: Atlantian Royal Encampment (Block N40, front edge of the Atlantian Royal Encampment, in the Artisans Easement)
name: Tablet Weavers' Tea
description_book: Join your fellow tablet weavers at our Annual Tea. Compare projects, discuss new techniques, and make new friends! We're at the Fiber Arts Pavilion.
description_web: Come join your fellow tablet weavers at our Annual Tea. Compare projects, discuss new techniques, and make new friends! We're at the Pennsic Fiber Arts Pavilion, at Block N40, in the Atlantian Royal Encampment. Please bring your own mug (and drink, if possible). **PLEASE** bring your own chair -- chairs are *always* at a premium. We're looking forward to seeing you this year!
fee_itemization: N/A

name: Iron *Commedia* Performance
description_book: Learn *commedia* in a fully immersive experience! This class culminates in a performance.
description_web: Learn *commedia dell'arte* in this fully immersive experience. This class will educate students about the basics of *commedia*. After the introduction to the art form, the class will then work together to write a scenario, rehearse it, and then perform it later in the day.

name: Bronze Age Meet-Up
description_book: Part meetup, part roundtable, part interactive display. Meet others focused on ancient research, share resources/projects, try writing on clay, etc.
description_web: Part meet-up, part roundtable, part interactive display. Meet and chat with other folks focused on ancient research, share resources and projects, try making and writing on clay tablets, etc. Bring your WiPs! Please contact Suphunibal (suphunibal @ gmail.com) for more information or to arrange an activity or reserve display space.

name: Rise of Grand Duchy of Lithuania: 13th C - 14th C
description_book: Discuss impact of Mongolian invasion into Eastern Europe and how it led to rise of Grand Duchy of Lithuania. Class 2 of 3.
description_web: Discuss impact of Mongolian invasion into Eastern Europe and how it led to rise of Grand Duchy of Lithuania. Class 2 of 3.

name: Pillbox *Tarboush* Hat Make-and-Take
description_book: *Tarboosh, fez*, sugarloaf, pillbox: pattern and sew this simple, broadly-attested hat to fit your head and persona. Novice-friendly.
description_web: *Tarboosh, fez*, sugarloaf, pillbox: pattern and sew this simple, broadly-attested hat to fit your head and persona. Hat kits include instruction sheets, aluminum foil and painter’s tape for patterning, two pieces of contrasting fabric, three needles, pins, a small spool of thread, a pair of shears, and a piece of soap or a pencil stub for fabric marking. Novice sewer-friendly.
fee_itemization: aluminum foil and painter’s tape for patterning, two pieces of contrasting fabric, three needles, pins, a small spool of thread, a pair of shears, and a piece of soap or a pencil stub for fabric marking

name: Irish Frame Drum: Introduction to the *Bodhrán*
description_book: Learn session etiquette and how to play jig, reel, slip-jig, polka, and hornpipe rhythms. Bring a drum; some loaners available.
description_web: The acclaimed *bodhránista* from Three Weird Sisters teaches how to choose and care for the *bodhrán*: what makes a good tipper; tune and set structure; how to identify and play jig, reel, hornpipe, slip jig, polka rhythms; session etiquette; *bodhrán* jokes. Learn secret arcane hand gestures to amaze and stun your listeners. Demonstration of how to adapt *bodhrán* drumming to period music. Bring a *bodhrán* if you have one. A few loaner drums will be available. Teens and older welcomed.

description_web:

Also, if you'd like to bid on KWMDS, please attend.

The format of the tourney will be determined on site by the number of participants, but our goal is to offer everyone the chance to fight as much as their heart desires. Combatants can play by cut-and-thrust rules, as long as both agree in advance. **18+**

name: *Commedia* All Stars Performance "SCAllion Stew!"
description_book: *Commedia* All Stars performance of hilarious plays based on 16th-century Italian *Commedia dell' Arte*! Show title is "SCAllion Stew!"
description_web: *Commedia* All Stars performance of hilarious plays based on 16th-century Italian *Commedia dell' Arte*! Rating is approximately PG-13. Most of the *Commedia* All Stars troupe members are teachers of *Commedia* and other Performing Arts. Enjoy our classes through the week, then come see our show! This year's show is inspired by the excellent satire of The SCAllion!  Title is "SCAllion Stew!"

name: Yoga for Fighters,  Dancers and Everybody
description_book: Yoga for all levels! Bring mat or towel for the floor & strap, scarf, or strip of cloth for class if you can; some loaner gear available.
description_web:
Yoga for all levels! Bring mat or towel for the floor & strap, scarf, or strip of cloth for class if you can; some loaner mats and straps will be available. If you have blocks, please bring them if you can! This class is geared for folks who have never done yoga through seasoned practitioners. Amendments for poses will be offered as we go, and each class will build upon the one before, however, anyone can jump in at anytime. 
Class will begin with a few minutes of breath work followed by approximately 45 minutes of yoga.

name: Archery Populace Point Shoot
description_book: Shoot the Castle Window, Soldier Shoot, and Clout for Points.
description_web:
Format: The Pennsic Populace Archery War Point consists of three separate shoots; each shoot is worth 1 War Point for a total of 3 War Points. The winner of each shoot is determined by total number of points tallied by archers over the course of the War. Scores will be tallied each day and posted in the Marshals' Tent. Any member of the populace may participate.
Multiple individuals may share a bow; however, it must be inspected with each user to ensure safety.

description_web: Ask any final questions and take the MIT test.

Come join us as we build a theatre show from the ground up, giving younger kids a creative outlet for all that pent-up camping energy! Children 12 and under must have a parent or guardian present.

name: KWP Audition Notice Pennsic 51: *The Reckoning*
description_book: KWP Auditions for Pennsic 51: *The Reckoning*, a new play about Shakespeare & Marlowe by Master Lorcan Dracontius. Roles for adults of all ages.
description_web: London, 1593. A young Marlowe and Shakespeare must collaborate on a new script. The Known World Players presents *The Reckoning*, a new play by Master Lorcan Dracontius about the creation of Shakespeare’s classic *The Tempest*. The show asks the question, “What if the production in 1611 was not the first time *The Tempest* was penned?" Roles available for adult cast members of all ages. Rehearsals are held War Week: Sat. evening and mornings Sun-Fri, with one performance Friday evening.

name: Bardic Symposium #5: Bardic History in the SCA
description_book: The more things change the more they stay the same. Bardic has played many different parts in the SCA. Reflect on what it's been and where it's going.
description_web: The more things change the more they stay the same. Over the years, bardic has played many different parts in the SCA. Reflect on what it's been, how it's changed, and where it might be going. What should we be doing to help it get there?  View the Bardic Symposium website here: https://tilted-windmill.com/pennsic50_symposium.html.
